1034.quote: You can tell more about a person by what he says about others than you can by what others say about him.

1035.author: Ayn Rand
1035.quote: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.

1036.author: Ayn Rand
1036.quote: To say 'I love you' one must first be able to say the 'I.'

1037.author: Ayn Rand
1037.quote: The truth is not for all men, but only for those who seek it.

1038.author: Ayn Rand
1038.quote: Achievement of your happiness is the only moral purpose of your life, and that happiness, not pain or mindless self-indulgence, is the proof of your moral integrity, since it is the proof and the result of your loyalty to the achievement of your values.

1039.author: Ayn Rand
1039.quote: Force and mind are opposites; morality ends where a gun begins.

1040.author: Ayn Rand
1040.quote: The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.

1041.author: Ayn Rand
1041.quote: The ladder of success is best climbed by stepping on the rungs of opportunity.

1042.author: Ayn Rand
1042.quote: Individual rights are not subject to a public vote; a majority has no right to vote away the rights of a minority; the political function of rights is precisely to protect minorities from oppression by majorities (and the smallest minority on earth is the individual).

1043.author: Ayn Rand
1043.quote: I don't build in order to have clients. I have clients in order to build.

1044.author: Ayn Rand
1044.quote: Ask yourself whether the dream of heaven and greatness should be waiting for us in our graves - or whether it should be ours here and now and on this earth.

1045.author: Ayn Rand
1045.quote: Civilization is the progress toward a society of privacy. The savage's whole existence is public, ruled by the laws of his tribe. Civilization is the process of setting man free from men.

1046.author: Ayn Rand
1046.quote: Love is the expression of one's values, the greatest reward you can earn for the moral qualities you have achieved in your character and person, the emotional price paid by one man for the joy he receives from the virtues of another.

1047.author: Ayn Rand
1047.quote: Potentially, a government is the most dangerous threat to man's rights: it holds a legal monopoly on the use of physical force against legally disarmed victims.

1048.author: Ayn Rand
1048.quote: We are fast approaching the stage of the ultimate inversion: the stage where the government is free to do anything it pleases, while the citizens may act only by permission; which is the stage of the darkest periods of human history, the stage of rule by brute force.

1049.author: Ayn Rand
1049.quote: Throughout the centuries there were men who took first steps, down new roads, armed with nothing but their own vision.

1050.author: Ayn Rand
1050.quote: The smallest minority on earth is the individual. Those who deny individual rights cannot claim to be defenders of minorities.

1051.author: Ayn Rand
1051.quote: Wealth is the product of man's capacity to think.

1052.author: Ayn Rand
1052.quote: Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.

1053.author: Ayn Rand
1053.quote: If any civilization is to survive, it is the morality of altruism that men have to reject.

1054.author: Ayn Rand
1054.quote: To arrive at a contradiction is to confess an error in one's thinking; to maintain a contradiction is to abdicate one's mind and to evict oneself from the realm of reality.

1055.author: Ayn Rand
1055.quote: Man's unique reward, however, is that while animals survive by adjusting themselves to their background, man survives by adjusting his background to himself.

1056.author: Ayn Rand
1056.quote: The worst guilt is to accept an unearned guilt.

1057.author: Ayn Rand
1057.quote: Individual rights are the means of subordinating society to moral law.

1058.author: Ayn Rand
1058.quote: The only power any government has is the power to crack down on criminals. Well, when there aren't enough criminals, one makes them. One declares so many things to be a crime that it becomes impossible for men to live without breaking laws.

1059.author: Ayn Rand
1059.quote: When I die, I hope to go to Heaven, whatever the Hell that is.

1060.author: Ayn Rand
1060.quote: I swear, by my life and my love of it, that I will never live for the sake of another man, nor ask another man to live for mine.

1061.author: B. F. Skinner
1061.quote: A failure is not always a mistake, it may simply be the best one can do under the circumstances. The real mistake is to stop trying.

1062.author: B. F. Skinner
1062.quote: The real problem is not whether machines think but whether men do.

1063.author: B. F. Skinner
1063.quote: The ideal of behaviorism is to eliminate coercion: to apply controls by changing the environment in such a way as to reinforce the kind of behavior that benefits everyone.

1064.author: B. F. Skinner
1064.quote: The environment will continue to deteriorate until pollution practices are abandoned.

1065.author: B. F. Skinner
1065.quote: A person who has been punished is not less inclined to behave in a given way; at best, he learns how to avoid punishment.

1066.author: B. F. Skinner
1066.quote: The consequences of an act affect the probability of its occurring again.

1067.author: B. F. Skinner
1067.quote: Education is what survives when what has been learned has been forgotten.

1068.author: B. F. Skinner
1068.quote: Behavior used to be reinforced by great deprivation; if people weren't hungry, they wouldn't work. Now we are committed to feeding people whether they work or not. Nor is money as great a reinforcer as it once was. People no longer work for punitive reasons, yet our culture offers no new satisfactions.

1069.author: B. F. Skinner
1069.quote: Give me a child and I'll shape him into anything.

1071.author: B. F. Skinner
1071.quote: Properly used, positive reinforcement is extremely powerful.

1072.author: B. F. Skinner
1072.quote: I did not direct my life. I didn't design it. I never made decisions. Things always came up and made them for me. That's what life is.

1073.author: B. F. Skinner
1073.quote: Must we wait for selection to solve the problems of overpopulation, exhaustion of resources, pollution of the environment and a nuclear holocaust, or can we take explicit steps to make our future more secure? In the latter case, must we not transcend selection?

1074.author: B. F. Skinner
1074.quote: I don't deny the importance of genetics. However, the fact that I might be altruistic isn't because I have a gene for altruism; the fact that I do something for my children at some cost to myself comes from a history that has operated on me.

1075.author: B. F. Skinner
1075.quote: The way positive reinforcement is carried out is more important than the amount.

1076.author: B. F. Skinner
1076.quote: We shouldn't teach great books; we should teach a love of reading.

1077.author: B. F. Skinner
1077.quote: I won't say that I'm an agnostic, since agnosticism maintains that one cannot know... but I'm not averse to the idea of some intelligence or some organizing force that set up the initial conditions of the universe in such a way that ultimately generated stars, planets and life.

1078.author: B. F. Skinner
1078.quote: If you insist that individual rights are the summum bonum, then the whole structure of society falls down.

1079.author: B. F. Skinner
1079.quote: I believe that I have been basically anarchistic, anti-religion and anti-industry and business. In other words, anti-bureaucracy. I would like to see people behave well without having to have priests stand by, politicians stand by, or people collecting bills.

1080.author: B. F. Skinner
1080.quote: I would be opposed to any kind of totalitarian control.

1081.author: B. F. Skinner
1081.quote: I am opposed to the military use of animals. I am also opposed to the military use of men.

1082.author: B. F. Skinner
1082.quote: If you're old, don't try to change yourself, change your environment.

1083.author: B. F. Skinner
1083.quote: I have to tell people that they are not responsible for their behavior. They're not creating it; they're not initiating anything. It's all found somewhere else. That's an awful lot to relinquish.

1084.author: B. F. Skinner
1084.quote: I remember when I was a freshman in college, I was still somewhat bothered by... worried... about religion. I remember going to this professor of philosophy and telling him that I had lost my faith.

1085.author: B. F. Skinner
1085.quote: The feeling of being interested can act as a kind of neurological signal, directing us to fruitful areas of inquiry.

1086.author: B. F. Skinner
1086.quote: When you run into something interesting, drop everything else and study it.

1087.author: Barack Obama
1087.quote: Change will not come if we wait for some other person or some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.

1088.author: Barack Obama
1088.quote: If you're walking down the right path and you're willing to keep walking, eventually you'll make progress.

1089.author: Barack Obama
1089.quote: I see Americans of every party, every background, every faith who believe that we are stronger together: black, white, Latino, Asian, Native American; young, old; gay, straight; men, women, folks with disabilities, all pledging allegiance under the same proud flag to this big, bold country that we love. That's what I see. That's the America I know!

1090.author: Barack Obama
1090.quote: We need to reject any politics that targets people because of race or religion. This isn't a matter of political correctness. It's a matter of understanding what makes us strong. The world respects us not just for our arsenal; it respects us for our diversity and our openness and the way we respect every faith.

1091.author: Barack Obama
1091.quote: Money is not the only answer, but it makes a difference.

1092.author: Barack Obama
1092.quote: We, the People, recognize that we have responsibilities as well as rights; that our destinies are bound together; that a freedom which only asks what's in it for me, a freedom without a commitment to others, a freedom without love or charity or duty or patriotism, is unworthy of our founding ideals, and those who died in their defense.

1093.author: Barack Obama
1093.quote: If the people cannot trust their government to do the job for which it exists - to protect them and to promote their common welfare - all else is lost.

1094.author: Barack Obama
1094.quote: My fellow Americans, we are and always will be a nation of immigrants. We were strangers once, too.

1095.author: Barack Obama
1095.quote: I believe marriage is between a man and a woman. I am not in favor of gay marriage. But when you start playing around with constitutions, just to prohibit somebody who cares about another person, it just seems to me that's not what America's about. Usually, our constitutions expand liberties, they don't contract them.

1096.author: Barack Obama
1096.quote: The future rewards those who press on. I don't have time to feel sorry for myself. I don't have time to complain. I'm going to press on.

1097.author: Barack Obama
1097.quote: Let us remember we are all part of one American family. We are united in common values, and that includes belief in equality under the law, basic respect for public order, and the right of peaceful protest.

1098.author: Barack Obama
1098.quote: Now, as a nation, we don't promise equal outcomes, but we were founded on the idea everybody should have an equal opportunity to succeed. No matter who you are, what you look like, where you come from, you can make it. That's an essential promise of America. Where you start should not determine where you end up.

1099.author: Barack Obama
1099.quote: Understand, our police officers put their lives on the line for us every single day. They've got a tough job to do to maintain public safety and hold accountable those who break the law.

1100.author: Barack Obama
1100.quote: We need to keep making our streets safer and our criminal justice system fairer - our homeland more secure, our world more peaceful and sustainable for the next generation.

1101.author: Barack Obama
1101.quote: Focusing your life solely on making a buck shows a certain poverty of ambition. It asks too little of yourself. Because it's only when you hitch your wagon to something larger than yourself that you realize your true potential.

1102.author: Barack Obama
1102.quote: America isn't Congress. America isn't Washington. America is the striving immigrant who starts a business, or the mom who works two low-wage jobs to give her kid a better life. America is the union leader and the CEO who put aside their differences to make the economy stronger.

1103.author: Barack Obama
1103.quote: Fixing a broken immigration system. Protecting our kids from gun violence. Equal pay for equal work, paid leave, raising the minimum wage. All these things still matter to hardworking families; they are still the right thing to do; and I will not let up until they get done.

1104.author: Barack Obama
1104.quote: Our brand of democracy is hard. But I can promise that a year from now, when I no longer hold this office, I'll be right there with you as a citizen - inspired by those voices of fairness and vision, of grit and good humor and kindness that have helped America travel so far.

1105.author: Barack Obama
1105.quote: Why can't I just eat my waffle?

1106.author: Barack Obama
1106.quote: I think what you're seeing is a profound recognition on the part of the American people that gays and lesbians and transgender persons are our brothers, our sisters, our children, our cousins, our friends, our co-workers, and that they've got to be treated like every other American. And I think that principle will win out.

1107.author: Barack Obama
1107.quote: The thing about hip-hop today is it's smart, it's insightful. The way they can communicate a complex message in a very short space is remarkable.

1108.author: Barack Obama
1108.quote: We need to internalize this idea of excellence. Not many folks spend a lot of time trying to be excellent.

1109.author: Barack Obama
1109.quote: Our higher education system is one of the things that makes America exceptional. There's no place else that has the assets we do when it comes to higher education. People from all over the world aspire to come here and study here. And that is a good thing.

1110.author: Barack Obama
1110.quote: It was the labor movement that helped secure so much of what we take for granted today. The 40-hour work week, the minimum wage, family leave, health insurance, Social Security, Medicare, retirement plans. The cornerstones of the middle-class security all bear the union label.

1111.author: Barack Obama
1111.quote: We cannot continue to rely only on our military in order to achieve the national security objectives that we've set. We've got to have a civilian national security force that's just as powerful, just as strong, just as well-funded.

1112.author: Barack Obama
1112.quote: It took a lot of blood, sweat and tears to get to where we are today, but we have just begun. Today we begin in earnest the work of making sure that the world we leave our children is just a little bit better than the one we inhabit today.

1113.author: Barbara Bush
1113.quote: To us, family means putting your arms around each other and being there.

1114.author: Barbara Bush
1114.quote: I think togetherness is a very important ingredient to family life.

1115.author: Barbara Bush
1115.quote: Cherish your human connections - your relationships with friends and family.

1116.author: Barbara Bush
1116.quote: Never lose sight of the fact that the most important yardstick of your success will be how you treat other people - your family, friends, and coworkers, and even strangers you meet along the way.

1117.author: Barbara Bush
1117.quote: At the end of your life, you will never regret not having passed one more test, not winning one more verdict or not closing one more deal. You will regret time not spent with a husband, a friend, a child, or a parent.

1118.author: Barbara Bush
1118.quote: And who knows? Somewhere out there in this audience may even be someone who will one day follow my footsteps, and preside over the White House as the president's spouse. I wish him well!

1119.author: Barbara Bush
1119.quote: Nobody likes a child to die or losing an election.

1120.author: Barbara Bush
1120.quote: I hate the fact that people think 'compromise' is a dirty word.

1121.author: Barbara Bush
1121.quote: I'm not going to jump out of airplanes or anything like someone else I know.

1122.author: Barbara Bush
1122.quote: Family and friends and faith are the most important things in your life and you should be building friendships.

1123.author: Barbara Bush
1123.quote: Value your friendship. Value your relationships.

1124.author: Barbara Bush
1124.quote: Bias has to be taught. If you hear your parents downgrading women or people of different backgrounds, why, you are going to do that.

1125.author: Barbara Bush
1125.quote: I married the first man I ever kissed. When I tell this to my children, they just about throw up.

1126.author: Barbara Bush
1126.quote: My son, George, has been a bad, bad boy! Right, George?

1127.author: Barbara Bush
1127.quote: I'm worried about parents who aren't parenting.

1128.author: Barbara Bush
1128.quote: When you come to a roadblock, take a detour.

1129.author: Barbara Bush
1129.quote: You just don't luck into things as much as you'd like to think you do. You build step by step, whether it's friendships or opportunities.

1130.author: Barbara Bush
1130.quote: You can't tell a 6-year-old your sister is going to die.

1131.author: Barbara Bush
1131.quote: If human beings are perceived as potentials rather than problems, as possessing strengths instead of weaknesses, as unlimited rather that dull and unresponsive, then they thrive and grow to their capabilities.

1132.author: Barbara Bush
1132.quote: Well, look at what people are doing for returned veterans now. The wounded warriors. They're working hard to make the wounded veterans feel that they are loved and welcomed home, unlike Vietnam. It was not a very kind, gentle world then. I think we are kinder and gentler.

1133.author: Barbara Bush
1133.quote: You don't just luck into things as much as you would like to think you do. You build step by step, whether it is friendships or opportunities.

1134.author: Barbara Bush
1134.quote: I'm a great believer that the most important years are the sort of early years but the preschool years and then into the first and second grades. If you get a good base in the first and second grade and you can read, you can do anything.

1135.author: Barbara Bush
1135.quote: You have to love your children unselfishly. That's hard. But it's the only way.

1136.author: Barbara Bush
1136.quote: Believe in something larger than yourself... get involved in the big ideas of your time.

1137.author: Barbara Bush
1137.quote: I hate abortions, but just could not make that choice for someone else.

1138.author: Barbara Bush
1138.quote: I may be the only mother in America who knows exactly what their child is up to all the time.

1139.author: Ben Shapiro
1139.quote: Socialism has no moral justification whatsoever; poor people are not morally superior to rich people, nor are they owed anything by rich people simply because of their lack of success. Charity is not a socialist concept - it is a religious one, an acknowledgment of God's sovereignty over property, a sovereignty the Left utterly rejects.

1140.author: Ben Shapiro
1140.quote: Socialism states that you owe me something simply because I exist. Capitalism, by contrast, results in a sort of reality-forced altruism: I may not want to help you, I may dislike you, but if I don't give you a product or service you want, I will starve. Voluntary exchange is more moral than forced redistribution.

1141.author: Ben Shapiro
1141.quote: The story of Detroit's bankruptcy was simple enough: Allow capitalism to grow the city, campaign against income inequality, tax the job creators until they flee, increase government spending in order to boost employment, promise generous pension plans to keep people voting for failure. Rinse, wash and repeat.

1142.author: Ben Shapiro
1142.quote: During the Great Depression, levels of crime actually dropped. During the 1920s, when life was free and easy, so was crime. During the 1930s, when the entire American economy fell into a government-owned alligator moat, crime was nearly non-existent. During the 1950s and 1960s, when the economy was excellent, crime rose again.

1143.author: Ben Shapiro
1143.quote: Socialism violates at least three of the Ten Commandments: It turns government into God, it legalizes thievery and it elevates covetousness. Discussions of income inequality, after all, aren't about prosperity but about petty spite. Why should you care how much money I make, so long as you are happy?

1144.author: Ben Shapiro
1144.quote: Every so often, we all gaze into the abyss. It's a depressing fact of life that eventually the clock expires; eventually the sand in the hourglass runs out. It's the leaving behind of everything that matters to us that hurts the most.

1145.author: Ben Shapiro
1145.quote: The argument that gay marriage doesn't affect straight marriages is a ridiculous red herring: Gay marriage affects society and law in dramatic ways. Religious groups will come under direct assault as federal and state governments move to strip them of their non-profit statuses if they refuse to perform gay marriages.

1146.author: Ben Shapiro
1146.quote: During the Cold War, America undertook serious military cuts only once: after the election of Richard Nixon, during the Vietnam War. The result: Vietnam fell to the Communists, the Russians moved into Afghanistan, and American influence around the globe waned dramatically.

1147.author: Ben Shapiro
1147.quote: Putin himself is a character out of fiction, an uber-macho former Soviet thug running a massive, expansionist kleptocracy. The man stages photographs riding horses barechested and hunting tigers. His enemies find themselves on the wrong end of radioactive poisoning.

1148.author: Ben Shapiro
1148.quote: Capitalism requires individual responsibility and accountability. People are seen as atomized units in a capitalist system - they are either useful, or they are not. They are not seen racially or ethnically or religiously. They consume and they produce, and those are their only relevant characteristics.

1149.author: Ben Shapiro
1149.quote: Freedom of speech and thought matters, especially when it is speech and thought with which we disagree. The moment the majority decides to destroy people for engaging in thought it dislikes, thought crime becomes a reality.

1150.author: Ben Shapiro
1150.quote: It took capitalism half a century to come back from the Great Depression.

1151.author: Ben Shapiro
1151.quote: Distrust of government isn't baseless cynicism. It's realism.

1152.author: Ben Shapiro
1152.quote: Selective Biblical quotation is a favorite of leftists who interpret the Bible the same way they do the Constitution: as a Chinese menu designed to allow picking and choosing. That's because when many Democrats take the Bible as a whole, they realize how much they despise it.

1153.author: Ben Shapiro
1153.quote: In actuality, California could be a wonderful place to live. In fact, if you're highly educated and ambitious, you can do quite well here while enjoying the sun and the fun. The only problem: California will then blame you for your success and recommend that all your cash be removed from you.

1154.author: Ben Shapiro
1154.quote: Obama's entire foreign policy was predicated on the notion that by existing, he would bridge all gaps and bury all hatchets. Instead, the Muslim world burns his picture even as he tells them he respects their radicalism. It turns out that diversity is a one-way street for the devotees of global Islam.

1155.author: Ben Shapiro
1155.quote: A West Virginia 10 is a California 4. Or at least that's what legend tells us: The Legend of Dr. Feelgood. Plastic surgery has a permanent home here, which is why Nancy Pelosi loves our Botoxed beaches. Beverly Hills looks like a moving Madame Tussauds.

1156.author: Ben Shapiro
1156.quote: 2013 was a year of myths falling apart. The myth of President Obama - a myth in which Obama was a messianic figure descending to bequeath health care, equality, and brotherhood on mankind - imploded. The myth of an America embracing the leftist social agenda collapsed.

1157.author: Ben Shapiro
1157.quote: If Republicans triumph in 2014, it will undoubtedly be as a result of Obamacare. In 2010, Republicans soared to historic victory because the much-maligned Tea Party spearheaded mass resistance to Obama's takeover of the healthcare industry.

1158.author: Ben Shapiro
1158.quote: Kids are fat because of lack of parenting.

1159.author: Ben Shapiro
1159.quote: Vice President Joe Biden believes that illegal immigrants are citizens. Obama believes that some Americans who join Islamist groups are citizens, while others are not. Who is an American? Whomever the executive branch deems an American. Who isn't? It depends on whether Obama ate his Wheaties or not.

1160.author: Ben Shapiro
1160.quote: In many cases, Obama's exercise of authoritarian power is criminal. His executive branch is responsible for violations of the Arms Export Control Act in shipping weapons to Syria, the Espionage Act in Libya, and IRS law with regard to the targeting of conservative groups.

1161.author: Ben Shapiro
1161.quote: President Obama is a gifted politician. He is gifted with rhetoric virtuosity. He is gifted with the ability to lie directly to camera without blinking. And he is gifted with some of the most incompetent conservative opposition in the history of the country.

1162.author: Ben Shapiro
1162.quote: Few Americans have ever met their Congresspeople. They don't see them at the grocery store; they don't meet them at the bowling alley. They're more likely to see their representatives in photographs from the Daily Grill in Washington, D.C., than at a local town hall.

1163.author: Ben Shapiro
1163.quote: The Left masks its distaste for the Bible's condemnation of homosexuality in a straw man argument that Bible believers are violent bigots. They are not. Citing the Bible doesn't make you a bigot against human beings - it makes you a bigot against sin, which is a good thing.

1164.author: Ben Shapiro
1164.quote: The Fourth Amendment is quite clear on the notion that search and seizure must not be unreasonable. It is difficult to think of something more unreasonable than searching the private phone records and digital information of citizens who are suspected of nothing.

1165.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1165.quote: Courage is fire, and bullying is smoke.

1166.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1166.quote: The secret of success is to be ready when your opportunity comes.

1168.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1168.quote: Youth is a blunder; Manhood a struggle, Old Age a regret.

1170.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1170.quote: Nurture your minds with great thoughts. To believe in the heroic makes heroes.

1171.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1171.quote: A great city, whose image dwells in the memory of man, is the type of some great idea. Rome represents conquest; Faith hovers over the towers of Jerusalem; and Athens embodies the pre-eminent quality of the antique world, Art.

1172.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1172.quote: Everyone likes flattery; and when you come to Royalty you should lay it on with a trowel.

1173.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1173.quote: Power has only one duty - to secure the social welfare of the People.

1174.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1174.quote: The fool wonders, the wise man asks.

1175.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1175.quote: A University should be a place of light, of liberty, and of learning.

1176.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1176.quote: There are three kinds of lies: lies, damned lies, and statistics.

1178.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1178.quote: Nowadays, manners are easy and life is hard.

1179.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1179.quote: Through perseverance many people win success out of what seemed destined to be certain failure.

1180.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1180.quote: Colonies do not cease to be colonies because they are independent.

1181.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1181.quote: The view of Jerusalem is the history of the world; it is more, it is the history of earth and of heaven.

1182.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1182.quote: The choicest pleasures of life lie within the ring of moderation.

1183.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1183.quote: The greatest good you can do for another is not just to share your riches but to reveal to him his own.

1184.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1184.quote: London is a roost for every bird.

1185.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1185.quote: Life is too short to be little. Man is never so manly as when he feels deeply, acts boldly, and expresses himself with frankness and with fervor.

1186.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1186.quote: The secret of success is constancy to purpose.

1187.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1187.quote: As a general rule, the most successful man in life is the man who has the best information.

1189.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1189.quote: William Gladstone has not a single redeeming defect.

1190.author: Benjamin Disraeli
1190.quote: One secret of success in life is for a man to be ready for his opportunity when it comes.

1191.author: Benjamin Franklin
1191.quote: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.

1192.author: Benjamin Franklin
1192.quote: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.

1193.author: Benjamin Franklin
1193.quote: Without continual growth and progress, such words as improvement, achievement, and success have no meaning.

1194.author: Benjamin Franklin
1194.quote: Well done is better than well said.

1195.author: Benjamin Franklin
1195.quote: We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.

1196.author: Benjamin Franklin
1196.quote: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.

1197.author: Benjamin Franklin
1197.quote: Half a truth is often a great lie.

1198.author: Benjamin Franklin
1198.quote: Beware of little expenses. A small leak will sink a great ship.

1199.author: Benjamin Franklin
1199.quote: It takes many good deeds to build a good reputation, and only one bad one to lose it.

1200.author: Benjamin Franklin
1200.quote: Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise.

1201.author: Benjamin Franklin
1201.quote: Any fool can criticize, condemn and complain - and most fools do.

1202.author: Benjamin Franklin
1202.quote: Energy and persistence conquer all things.

1204.author: Benjamin Franklin
1204.quote: A house is not a home unless it contains food and fire for the mind as well as the body.

1205.author: Benjamin Franklin
1205.quote: In this world nothing can be said to be certain, except death and taxes.

1206.author: Benjamin Franklin
1206.quote: Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing.

1207.author: Benjamin Franklin
1207.quote: The doorstep to the temple of wisdom is a knowledge of our own ignorance.

1208.author: Benjamin Franklin
1208.quote: Life's tragedy is that we get old too soon and wise too late.

1209.author: Benjamin Franklin
1209.quote: To succeed, jump as quickly at opportunities as you do at conclusions.

1210.author: Benjamin Franklin
1210.quote: There are three faithful friends - an old wife, an old dog, and ready money.

1211.author: Benjamin Franklin
1211.quote: A false friend and a shadow attend only while the sun shines.

1212.author: Benjamin Franklin
1212.quote: Wine is constant proof that God loves us and loves to see us happy.

1213.author: Benjamin Franklin
1213.quote: Wise men don't need advice. Fools won't take it.

1214.author: Benjamin Franklin
1214.quote: Diligence is the mother of good luck.

1215.author: Benjamin Franklin
1215.quote: Without freedom of thought, there can be no such thing as wisdom - and no such thing as public liberty without freedom of speech.

1216.author: Benjamin Franklin
1216.quote: The Constitution only gives people the right to pursue happiness. You have to catch it yourself.

1217.author: Bertrand Russell
1217.quote: The good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge.

1218.author: Bertrand Russell
1218.quote: War does not determine who is right - only who is left.

1219.author: Bertrand Russell
1219.quote: The trouble with the world is that the stupid are cocksure and the intelligent are full of doubt.

1220.author: Bertrand Russell
1220.quote: Men are born ignorant, not stupid. They are made stupid by education.

1221.author: Bertrand Russell
1221.quote: The world is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.

1222.author: Bertrand Russell
1222.quote: The only thing that will redeem mankind is cooperation.

1223.author: Bertrand Russell
1223.quote: The secret to happiness is to face the fact that the world is horrible.

1224.author: Bertrand Russell
1224.quote: Science is what you know, philosophy is what you don't know.

1225.author: Bertrand Russell
1225.quote: Love is something far more than desire for sexual intercourse; it is the principal means of escape from the loneliness which afflicts most men and women throughout the greater part of their lives.

1226.author: Bertrand Russell
1226.quote: To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.

1227.author: Bertrand Russell
1227.quote: Life is nothing but a competition to be the criminal rather than the victim.

1228.author: Bertrand Russell
1228.quote: Fear is the main source of superstition, and one of the main sources of cruelty. To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.

1229.author: Bertrand Russell
1229.quote: Ethics is in origin the art of recommending to others the sacrifices required for cooperation with oneself.

1230.author: Bertrand Russell
1230.quote: To be without some of the things you want is an indispensable part of happiness.

1231.author: Bertrand Russell
1231.quote: The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, and wiser people so full of doubts.

1232.author: Bertrand Russell
1232.quote: The secret of happiness is this: let your interests be as wide as possible, and let your reactions to the things and persons that interest you be as far as possible friendly rather than hostile.

1233.author: Bertrand Russell
1233.quote: Man is a credulous animal, and must believe something; in the absence of good grounds for belief, he will be satisfied with bad ones.

1234.author: Bertrand Russell
1234.quote: Why is propaganda so much more successful when it stirs up hatred than when it tries to stir up friendly feeling?

1235.author: Bertrand Russell
1235.quote: One should respect public opinion insofar as is necessary to avoid starvation and keep out of prison, but anything that goes beyond this is voluntary submission to an unnecessary tyranny.

1236.author: Bertrand Russell
1236.quote: The slave is doomed to worship time and fate and death, because they are greater than anything he finds in himself, and because all his thoughts are of things which they devour.

1237.author: Bertrand Russell
1237.quote: The time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time.

1238.author: Bertrand Russell
1238.quote: Those who have never known the deep intimacy and the intense companionship of mutual love have missed the best thing that life has to give.

1239.author: Bertrand Russell
1239.quote: I say quite deliberately that the Christian religion, as organized in its Churches, has been and still is the principal enemy of moral progress in the world.

1240.author: Bertrand Russell
1240.quote: Do not fear to be eccentric in opinion, for every opinion now accepted was once eccentric.

1241.author: Bertrand Russell
1241.quote: Much that passes as idealism is disguised hatred or disguised love of power.

1242.author: Bertrand Russell
1242.quote: Religion is something left over from the infancy of our intelligence, it will fade away as we adopt reason and science as our guidelines.

1243.author: Bill Gates
1243.quote: Success is a lousy teacher. It seduces smart people into thinking they can't lose.

1244.author: Bill Gates
1244.quote: The first rule of any technology used in a business is that automation applied to an efficient operation will magnify the efficiency. The second is that automation applied to an inefficient operation will magnify the inefficiency.

1245.author: Bill Gates
1245.quote: It's fine to celebrate success but it is more important to heed the lessons of failure.

1246.author: Bill Gates
1246.quote: The Internet is becoming the town square for the global village of tomorrow.

1247.author: Bill Gates
1247.quote: Technology is just a tool. In terms of getting the kids working together and motivating them, the teacher is the most important.

1248.author: Bill Gates
1248.quote: We all need people who will give us feedback. That's how we improve.

1249.author: Bill Gates
1249.quote: Information technology and business are becoming inextricably interwoven. I don't think anybody can talk meaningfully about one without the talking about the other.

1250.author: Bill Gates
1250.quote: Your most unhappy customers are your greatest source of learning.

1251.author: Bill Gates
1251.quote: The advance of technology is based on making it fit in so that you don't really even notice it, so it's part of everyday life.

1252.author: Bill Gates
1252.quote: If you go back to 1800, everybody was poor. I mean everybody. The Industrial Revolution kicked in, and a lot of countries benefited, but by no means everyone.

1253.author: Bill Gates
1253.quote: You may have heard of Black Friday and Cyber Monday. There's another day you might want to know about: Giving Tuesday. The idea is pretty straightforward. On the Tuesday after Thanksgiving, shoppers take a break from their gift-buying and donate what they can to charity.

1254.author: Bill Gates
1254.quote: Discrimination has a lot of layers that make it tough for minorities to get a leg up.

1255.author: Bill Gates
1255.quote: Software is a great combination between artistry and engineering.

1256.author: Bill Gates
1256.quote: Treatment without prevention is simply unsustainable.

1257.author: Bill Gates
1257.quote: Drones overall will be more impactful than I think people recognize, in positive ways to help society.

1258.author: Bill Gates
1258.quote: Research shows that there is only half as much variation in student achievement between schools as there is among classrooms in the same school. If you want your child to get the best education possible, it is actually more important to get him assigned to a great teacher than to a great school.

1259.author: Bill Gates
1259.quote: The PC has improved the world in just about every area you can think of. Amazing developments in communications, collaboration and efficiencies. New kinds of entertainment and social media. Access to information and the ability to give a voice people who would never have been heard.

1260.author: Bill Gates
1260.quote: I think it's fair to say that personal computers have become the most empowering tool we've ever created. They're tools of communication, they're tools of creativity, and they can be shaped by their user.

1261.author: Bill Gates
1261.quote: As we look ahead into the next century, leaders will be those who empower others.

1262.author: Bill Gates
1262.quote: Governments will always play a huge part in solving big problems. They set public policy and are uniquely able to provide the resources to make sure solutions reach everyone who needs them. They also fund basic research, which is a crucial component of the innovation that improves life for everyone.

1263.author: Bill Gates
1263.quote: Innovation is moving at a scarily fast pace.

1264.author: Bill Gates
1264.quote: Capitalism has worked very well. Anyone who wants to move to North Korea is welcome.

1265.author: Bill Gates
1265.quote: Everyone needs a coach. It doesn't matter whether you're a basketball player, a tennis player, a gymnast or a bridge player.

1266.author: Bill Gates
1266.quote: Intellectual property has the shelf life of a banana.

1267.author: Bill Gates
1267.quote: Historically, privacy was almost implicit, because it was hard to find and gather information. But in the digital world, whether it's digital cameras or satellites or just what you click on, we need to have more explicit rules - not just for governments but for private companies.

1268.author: Bill Gates
1268.quote: This whole phenomenon of the computer in a library is an amazing thing.

1269.author: Bill Maher
1269.quote: Suicide is man's way of telling God, 'You can't fire me - I quit.'

1270.author: Bill Maher
1270.quote: Curious people are interesting people; I wonder why that is.

1271.author: Bill Maher
1271.quote: We need more people speaking out. This country is not overrun with rebels and free thinkers. It's overrun with sheep and conformists.

1272.author: Bill Maher
1272.quote: Hi, I'm Bill. I'm a birth survivor.

1273.author: Bill Maher
1273.quote: Religion is dangerous because it allows human beings who don't have all the answers to think that they do.

1274.author: Bill Maher
1274.quote: We are a nation that is unenlightened because of religion. I do believe that. I think religion stops people from thinking. I think it justified crazies.

1275.author: Bill Maher
1275.quote: I think capital punishment works great. Every killer you kill never kills again.

1276.author: Bill Maher
1276.quote: It's all been satirized for your protection.

1277.author: Bill Maher
1277.quote: Let's make a law that gay people can have birthdays, but straight people get more cake - you know, to send the right message to kids.

1278.author: Bill Maher
1278.quote: Women cannot complain about men anymore until they start getting better taste in them.

1279.author: Bill Maher
1279.quote: We have been the cowards lobbing cruise missiles from 2,000 miles away. That's cowardly. Staying in the airplane when it hits the building, say what you want about it, it's not cowardly.

1280.author: Bill Maher
1280.quote: The Bible looks like it started out as a game of Mad Libs.

1281.author: Bill Maher
1281.quote: Let's face it; God has a big ego problem. Why do we always have to worship him?

1282.author: Bill Maher
1282.quote: The tea baggers. The one thing they hate is when you call them racist. The other thing they hate is black people. But they won't say it.

1283.author: Bill Maher
1283.quote: Maybe every other American movie shouldn't be based on a comic book. Other countries will think Americans live in an infantile fantasy land where reality is whatever we say it is and every problem can be solved with violence.

1284.author: Bill Maher
1284.quote: Freedom isn't free. It shouldn't be a bragging point that 'Oh, I don't get involved in politics,' as if that makes someone cleaner. No, that makes you derelict of duty in a republic. Liars and panderers in government would have a much harder time of it if so many people didn't insist on their right to remain ignorant and blindly agreeable.

1285.author: Bill Maher
1285.quote: Religion, to me, is a bureaucracy between man and God that I don't need.

1286.author: Bill Maher
1286.quote: We have the Bill of Rights. What we need is a Bill of Responsibilities.

1287.author: Bill Maher
1287.quote: To me a real patriot is like a real friend. Who's your real friend? It's the person who tells you the truth. That's who my real friends are. So, you know, I think as far as our country goes, we need more people who will do that.

1288.author: Bill Maher
1288.quote: If you think you have it tough, read history books.

1289.author: Bill Maher
1289.quote: When you want to make it clear to the rest of the world that you are not an imperialist, the best countries to have with you are Britain and Spain.

1290.author: Bill Maher
1290.quote: Iraq now says that it will, after all, destroy its missiles. President Bush said, 'Please, I used to pull the same trick. There'd be an intervention, I'd make a big show of pouring out the liquor and then there was a case under the floorboards.'

1291.author: Bill Maher
1291.quote: If you belonged to a political party or a social club that was tied to as much bigotry, misogyny, homophobia, violence, and sheer ignorance as religion is, you'd resign in protest.

1292.author: Bill Maher
1292.quote: Things aren't right. If a burglar breaks into your home and you shoot him, he can sue you. For what, restraint of trade?

1293.author: Bill Maher
1293.quote: The Clinton White House today said they would start to give national security and intelligence briefings to George Bush. I don't know how well this is working out. Today after the first one Bush said, 'I've got one question: What color is the red phone?'

1294.author: Bill Maher
1294.quote: They're talking about banning cigarette smoking now in any place that's used by ten or more people in a week, which, I guess, means that Madonna can't even smoke in bed.

1295.author: Billie Eilish
1295.quote: I really wanted to be a model when I was little. I loved photography, and I loved being on camera. But I was short and chubby, so I couldn't. Anyway, being an artist is way more interesting than just being a model because it's about you and what you want to be. You're not being treated like a clothes hanger.

1296.author: Billie Eilish
1296.quote: Time is kind of an amazing thing because you can do so much with it. I think people underestimate time... I don't want to just sit on my phone for hours.

1297.author: Billie Eilish
1297.quote: In real life, I'm a really smiley person. I smile when I talk and I laugh.

1298.author: Billie Eilish
1298.quote: You can write a song about being in love with someone, but you don't have to be in love with anyone.

1299.author: Billie Eilish
1299.quote: Words are more powerful than some noises. Noises won't last long. Lyrics are so important, and people don't realise that.

1300.author: Billie Eilish
1300.quote: I hate smiling. It makes me feel weak and powerless and small. I've always been like that; I don't smile in any pictures.

1301.author: Billie Eilish
1301.quote: If I make music and people hate it, you know, whatever. I'll die someday, and one day, they will too.

1302.author: Billie Eilish
1302.quote: Lyrics are so important, but they're really underrated.

1303.author: Billie Eilish
1303.quote: It's rare for anyone to value the opinions of a teenage girl.

1304.author: Billie Eilish
1304.quote: I don't really get nervous that much, or if I do, only I know. It's all inside me. I am good at hiding everything.

1305.author: Billie Eilish
1305.quote: I'm not going to say I'm cool, because I don't really feel that. I just don't care at all, and I guess that's what people think is cool.

1306.author: Billie Eilish
1306.quote: Sometimes it's flattering when people copy you, but sometimes it gets to a breaking point.

1307.author: Billie Eilish
1307.quote: I'm super self-critical, which I think is good, because then I get exactly what I want. I'm critical of other people, too - I try not to be, though.

1308.author: Billie Eilish
1308.quote: People are terrified of me, and I want them to be.

1309.author: Billie Eilish
1309.quote: I feel like I write so that people can think of it as theirs. If my song is exactly about your life right now, then it is - I don't even want to say that it's mine, because it's yours.

1310.author: Billie Eilish
1310.quote: I had a period in my life where I decided that I would never be bored again and that, if I had any free time at all, I would make plans, and I would always be doing things. It actually was great for a year or so, but then I lost all of my friends.

1311.author: Billie Eilish
1311.quote: I don't even call them fans. I don't like that. They're literally just a part of my life; they're a part of my family. I don't think of them as on a lower level than me. I don't think I'm anything but equal to all of them. So yeah, they're basically all of my siblings.

1312.author: Billie Eilish
1312.quote: Sexism is everywhere, bro. I don't know if it's ever not somewhere.

1313.author: Billie Eilish
1313.quote: I've always liked being busy. If I have nothing to do for a week, it just makes me mad.

1314.author: Billie Eilish
1314.quote: Me and my brother get along super well. We're, like, best friends. So we'll stay up until, like, five just talking because we get along and, you know, it's cool. And he respects my opinions, and I respect his, even if we don't have the same opinions, but a lot of the time we do.

1315.author: Billie Eilish
1315.quote: I listen to music all day every day. I can't not listen to music. It's kind of scary how much I listen to music, but it's what I love, and it's all I care about, so I'm good with it.

1316.author: Billie Eilish
1316.quote: I don't know how to function without music. When I'm not making it, I'm listening to it. It gives me courage and takes care of my mind.

1317.author: Billie Eilish
1317.quote: In the public eye, girls and women with strong perspectives are hated. If you're a girl with an opinion, people just hate you. There are still people who are afraid of successful women, and that's so lame.

1318.author: Billie Eilish
1318.quote: I'm gonna make what I want to make, and other people are gonna like what they're gonna like. It doesn't really matter.

1319.author: Billie Eilish
1319.quote: Nothing really scares me, to be honest.

1320.author: Billie Eilish
1320.quote: All of the Vines that were acted & setup & had nice cameras, those weren't the good Vines. The good Vines were, like, a random little kid in the middle of a forest, like, yelling.

1321.author: Billy Graham
1321.quote: A child who is allowed to be disrespectful to his parents will not have true respect for anyone.

1322.author: Billy Graham
1322.quote: Each life is made up of mistakes and learning, waiting and growing, practicing patience and being persistent.

1323.author: Billy Graham
1323.quote: The greatest legacy one can pass on to one's children and grandchildren is not money or other material things accumulated in one's life, but rather a legacy of character and faith.

1324.author: Billy Graham
1324.quote: Courage is contagious. When a brave man takes a stand, the spines of others are often stiffened.

1325.author: Billy Graham
1325.quote: Nothing can bring a real sense of security into the home except true love.

1326.author: Billy Graham
1326.quote: God has given us two hands, one to receive with and the other to give with.

1327.author: Billy Graham
1327.quote: Once you've lost your privacy, you realize you've lost an extremely valuable thing.

1328.author: Billy Graham
1328.quote: When wealth is lost, nothing is lost; when health is lost, something is lost; when character is lost, all is lost.

1329.author: Billy Graham
1329.quote: The Christian life is not a constant high. I have my moments of deep discouragement. I have to go to God in prayer with tears in my eyes, and say, 'O God, forgive me,' or 'Help me.'

1330.author: Billy Graham
1330.quote: Being a Christian is more than just an instantaneous conversion - it is a daily process whereby you grow to be more and more like Christ.

1331.author: Billy Graham
1331.quote: My home is in Heaven. I'm just traveling through this world.

1332.author: Billy Graham
1332.quote: Auschwitz stands as a tragic reminder of the terrible potential man has for violence and inhumanity.

1333.author: Billy Graham
1333.quote: I think that the Bible teaches that homosexuality is a sin, but the Bible also teaches that pride is a sin, jealousy is a sin, and hate is a sin, evil thoughts are a sin. So I don't think that homosexuality should be chosen as the overwhelming sin that we are doing today.

1334.author: Billy Graham
1334.quote: God will prepare everything for our perfect happiness in heaven, and if it takes my dog being there, I believe he'll be there.

1335.author: Billy Graham
1335.quote: Communism is a religion that is inspired, directed and motivated by the Devil himself who has declared war against Almighty God.

1336.author: Billy Graham
1336.quote: The highest form of worship is the worship of unselfish Christian service. The greatest form of praise is the sound of consecrated feet seeking out the lost and helpless.

1337.author: Billy Graham
1337.quote: God's mercy and grace give me hope - for myself, and for our world.

1338.author: Billy Graham
1338.quote: Every human being is under construction from conception to death.

1339.author: Billy Graham
1339.quote: Racial prejudice, anti-Semitism, or hatred of anyone with different beliefs has no place in the human mind or heart.

1340.author: Billy Graham
1340.quote: The influence of a mother upon the lives of her children cannot be measured. They know and absorb her example and attitudes when it comes to questions of honesty, temperance, kindness, and industry.

1341.author: Billy Graham
1341.quote: Prayer is simply a two-way conversation between you and God.

1342.author: Billy Graham
1342.quote: Our society strives to avoid any possibility of offending anyone - except God.

1343.author: Billy Graham
1343.quote: There is no scriptural basis for segregation.

1344.author: Billy Graham
1344.quote: Make sure of your commitment to Jesus Christ, and seek to follow Him every day. Don't be swayed by the false values and goals of this world, but put Christ and His will first in everything you do.

1345.author: Billy Graham
1345.quote: Scripture is filled with examples of men and women whom God used late in life, often with great impact - men and women who refused to use old age as an excuse to ignore what God wanted them to do.

1346.author: Billy Graham
1346.quote: We're all sinners. Everybody you meet all over the world is a sinner.

1347.author: Blaise Pascal
1347.quote: You always admire what you really don't understand.

1348.author: Blaise Pascal
1348.quote: Kind words do not cost much. Yet they accomplish much.

1349.author: Blaise Pascal
1349.quote: All men's miseries derive from not being able to sit in a quiet room alone.

1350.author: Blaise Pascal
1350.quote: Small minds are concerned with the extraordinary, great minds with the ordinary.

1351.author: Blaise Pascal
1351.quote: Eloquence is a painting of the thoughts.

1352.author: Blaise Pascal
1352.quote: Truth is so obscure in these times, and falsehood so established, that, unless we love the truth, we cannot know it.

1353.author: Blaise Pascal
1353.quote: The heart has its reasons of which reason knows nothing.

1354.author: Blaise Pascal
1354.quote: In faith there is enough light for those who want to believe and enough shadows to blind those who don't.

1355.author: Blaise Pascal
1355.quote: Justice without force is powerless; force without justice is tyrannical.

1356.author: Blaise Pascal
1356.quote: Man's greatness lies in his power of thought.

1357.author: Blaise Pascal
1357.quote: Belief is a wise wager. Granted that faith cannot be proved, what harm will come to you if you gamble on its truth and it proves false? If you gain, you gain all; if you lose, you lose nothing. Wager, then, without hesitation, that He exists.

1358.author: Blaise Pascal
1358.quote: Men never do evil so completely and cheerfully as when they do it from religious conviction.

1359.author: Blaise Pascal
1359.quote: We view things not only from different sides, but with different eyes; we have no wish to find them alike.

1360.author: Blaise Pascal
1360.quote: It is good to be tired and wearied by the futile search after the true good, that we may stretch out our arms to the Redeemer.

1361.author: Blaise Pascal
1361.quote: There are only two kinds of men: the righteous who think they are sinners and the sinners who think they are righteous.

1362.author: Blaise Pascal
1362.quote: We sail within a vast sphere, ever drifting in uncertainty, driven from end to end.

1363.author: Blaise Pascal
1363.quote: Nature is an infinite sphere of which the center is everywhere and the circumference nowhere.

1364.author: Blaise Pascal
1364.quote: Noble deeds that are concealed are most esteemed.

1365.author: Blaise Pascal
1365.quote: Little things console us because little things afflict us.

1366.author: Blaise Pascal
1366.quote: I have discovered that all human evil comes from this, man's being unable to sit still in a room.

1367.author: Blaise Pascal
1367.quote: Love has reasons which reason cannot understand.

1368.author: Blaise Pascal
1368.quote: Time heals griefs and quarrels, for we change and are no longer the same persons. Neither the offender nor the offended are any more themselves.

1369.author: Blaise Pascal
1369.quote: The strength of a man's virtue should not be measured by his special exertions, but by his habitual acts.

1371.author: Blaise Pascal
1371.quote: Can anything be stupider than that a man has the right to kill me because he lives on the other side of a river and his ruler has a quarrel with mine, though I have not quarrelled with him?

1372.author: Blaise Pascal
1372.quote: People are usually more convinced by reasons they discovered themselves than by those found by others.

1373.author: Bo Jackson
1373.quote: Set your goals high, and don't stop till you get there.

1374.author: Bo Jackson
1374.quote: I would say my greatest achievement in life right now - my greatest achievement period is - and I'm still trying to achieve it - is to be a wonderful father to my kids.

1375.author: Bo Jackson
1375.quote: My workout was running down fly balls, stealing a base, or running for my life on the football field.

1376.author: Bo Jackson
1376.quote: If you have four years to complete your college education, do it.

1377.author: Bo Jackson
1377.quote: First of all, I really never imagined myself being a professional athlete.

1378.author: Bo Jackson
1378.quote: I also tell them that your education can take you way farther than a football, baseball, track, or basketball will - that's just the bottom line.

1379.author: Bo Jackson
1379.quote: Don't sell yourself short because without that you can't go far in life because after sports the only thing you know is sports and you can't do anything else with that.

1380.author: Bo Jackson
1380.quote: I was the type of guy that used to get up in the morning and go out and just out run everybody on the field without stretching or warming up or anything.

1381.author: Bo Jackson
1381.quote: Back before I injured my hip, I thought going to the gym was for wimps.

1382.author: Bo Jackson
1382.quote: If I miss anything about the sport, it's the camaraderie of old teammates.

1383.author: Bo Jackson
1383.quote: But now in this day and age, people are more prone to go out to try new things to enhance their performance on the field - to enhance their physical appearance.

1384.author: Bo Jackson
1384.quote: My favorite driver is always either the bad guy or the underdog.

1385.author: Bo Jackson
1385.quote: I love going out and doing new things.

1386.author: Bo Jackson
1386.quote: I am a firm believer in if you can't get it the old fashioned way, you don't need it.

1387.author: Bo Jackson
1387.quote: I was a pitcher, shortstop and outfielder, and the Yankees tried to sign me out of high school as a first-round draft pick in 1981. I turned them down to go to college.

1388.author: Bo Jackson
1388.quote: I guarantee you that's what Jeff Gordon does. He uses everything the fans throw at him to stoke his fire and it drives him to be better at what he does.

1389.author: Bo Jackson
1389.quote: I hate to blow my own horn, but I gave a lot of people fits.

1390.author: Bo Jackson
1390.quote: As a 9th grader, I competed with the high school kids and out of 600 people, I finished 10th.

1391.author: Bo Jackson
1391.quote: I have been a fan all my life, but now I have been out of football for over 10 years, and out of baseball for a little over six years and I don't go to games.

1392.author: Bo Jackson
1392.quote: I've taken up golf in the past five or six years, and most of the time there aren't too many people out there that can drive a ball further than I can.

1393.author: Bo Jackson
1393.quote: So, baseball is probably more physical of the two mentally.

1394.author: Bo Jackson
1394.quote: Being the 8th out of 10 kids, and being the one that stayed in trouble, I sort of became a momma's boy.

1395.author: Bo Jackson
1395.quote: I always wanted to be a pilot.

1396.author: Bo Jackson
1396.quote: I have no problem with my hips - I can still do the things that I used to do. I can run, I'm just not the fastest person on the field anymore.

1397.author: Bo Jackson
1397.quote: I was always active - I went from baseball to football. I didn't have time to work out.

1398.author: Bo Jackson
1398.quote: I've always played with kids that were five, six, seven years older than me.

1399.author: Bob Dylan
1399.quote: A hero is someone who understands the responsibility that comes with his freedom.

1400.author: Bob Dylan
1400.quote: Take care of all your memories. For you cannot relive them.

1401.author: Bob Dylan
1401.quote: No one is free, even the birds are chained to the sky.

1402.author: Bob Dylan
1402.quote: A mistake is to commit a misunderstanding.

1403.author: Bob Dylan
1403.quote: I'll let you be in my dreams if I can be in yours.

1404.author: Bob Dylan
1404.quote: There is nothing so stable as change.

1405.author: Bob Dylan
1405.quote: What's money? A man is a success if he gets up in the morning and goes to bed at night and in between does what he wants to do.

1406.author: Bob Dylan
1406.quote: All I can do is be me, whoever that is.

1407.author: Bob Dylan
1407.quote: People seldom do what they believe in. They do what is convenient, then repent.

1408.author: Bob Dylan
1408.quote: All the truth in the world adds up to one big lie.

1409.author: Bob Dylan
1409.quote: He not busy being born is busy dying.

1410.author: Bob Dylan
1410.quote: A poem is a naked person... Some people say that I am a poet.

1411.author: Bob Dylan
1411.quote: Yesterday's just a memory, tomorrow is never what it's supposed to be.

1412.author: Bob Dylan
1412.quote: It's hard to speculate what tomorrow may bring.

1413.author: Bob Dylan
1413.quote: Being noticed can be a burden. Jesus got himself crucified because he got himself noticed. So I disappear a lot.

1414.author: Bob Dylan
1414.quote: Basically you have to suppress your own ambitions in order to be who you need to be.

1415.author: Bob Dylan
1415.quote: You're going to die. You're going to be dead. It could be 20 years, it could be tomorrow, anytime. So am I. I mean, we're just going to be gone. The world's going to go on without us. All right now. You do your job in the face of that, and how seriously you take yourself you decide for yourself.

1416.author: Bob Dylan
1416.quote: I kinda live where I find myself.

1417.author: Bob Dylan
1417.quote: Democracy don't rule the world, You'd better get that in your head; This world is ruled by violence, But I guess that's better left unsaid.

1418.author: Bob Dylan
1418.quote: I say there're no depressed words just depressed minds.

1419.author: Bob Dylan
1419.quote: People today are still living off the table scraps of the sixties. They are still being passed around - the music and the ideas.

1420.author: Bob Dylan
1420.quote: You can't be happy by doing something groovy.

1421.author: Bob Dylan
1421.quote: Chaos is a friend of mine.

1422.author: Bob Dylan
1422.quote: Some people seem to fade away but then when they are truly gone, it's like they didn't fade away at all.

1423.author: Bob Dylan
1423.quote: I stopped smoking. When I stopped smoking, my voice changed... so drastically, I couldn't believe it myself.

1424.author: Bob Dylan
1424.quote: When you cease to exist, then who will you blame?

1425.author: Bob Marley
1425.quote: Truth is everybody is going to hurt you: you just gotta find the ones worth suffering for.

1426.author: Bob Marley
1426.quote: The good times of today, are the sad thoughts of tomorrow.

1427.author: Bob Marley
1427.quote: One good thing about music, when it hits you, you feel no pain.

1428.author: Bob Marley
1428.quote: Life is one big road with lots of signs. So when you riding through the ruts, don't complicate your mind. Flee from hate, mischief and jealousy. Don't bury your thoughts, put your vision to reality. Wake Up and Live!

1429.author: Bob Marley
1429.quote: The greatness of a man is not in how much wealth he acquires, but in his integrity and his ability to affect those around him positively.

1430.author: Bob Marley
1430.quote: Don't gain the world and lose your soul; wisdom is better than silver or gold.

1431.author: Bob Marley
1431.quote: Herb is the healing of a nation, alcohol is the destruction.

1432.author: Bob Marley
1432.quote: Open your eyes, look within. Are you satisfied with the life you're living?

1433.author: Bob Marley
1433.quote: Get up, stand up, Stand up for your rights. Get up, stand up, Don't give up the fight.

1434.author: Bob Marley
1434.quote: If you're white and you're wrong, then you're wrong; if you're black and you're wrong, you're wrong. People are people. Black, blue, pink, green - God make no rules about color; only society make rules where my people suffer, and that why we must have redemption and redemption now.

1435.author: Bob Marley
1435.quote: When you smoke the herb, it reveals you to yourself.

1436.author: Bob Marley
1436.quote: I no have education. I have inspiration. If I was educated, I would be a damn fool.

1438.author: Bob Marley
1438.quote: When one door is closed, don't you know, another is open.

1439.author: Bob Marley
1439.quote: In this bright future you can't forget your past.

1440.author: Bob Marley
1440.quote: If something can corrupt you, you're corrupted already.

1441.author: Bob Marley
1441.quote: None but ourselves can free our minds.

1442.author: Bob Marley
1442.quote: The more people smoke herb, the more Babylon fall.

1443.author: Bob Marley
1443.quote: God sent me on earth. He send me to do something, and nobody can stop me. If God want to stop me, then I stop. Man never can.

1444.author: Bob Marley
1444.quote: My music will go on forever. Maybe it's a fool say that, but when me know facts me can say facts. My music will go on forever.

1445.author: Bob Marley
1445.quote: You not supposed to feel down over whatever happen to you. I mean, you're supposed to use whatever happen to you as some type of upper, not a downer.

1446.author: Bob Marley
1446.quote: Every man gotta right to decide his own destiny.

1448.author: Bob Marley
1448.quote: I don't know how to live good. I only know how to suffer.

1449.author: Bob Marley
1449.quote: As a man sow, shall he reap. and I know that talk is cheap. But the heat of the battle is as sweet as the victory.

1450.author: Bob Marley
1450.quote: My music fights against the system that teaches to live and die.

1451.author: Booker T. Washington
1451.quote: I shall allow no man to belittle my soul by making me hate him.

1452.author: Booker T. Washington
1452.quote: Nothing ever comes to one, that is worth having, except as a result of hard work.

1453.author: Booker T. Washington
1453.quote: I have learned that success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has had to overcome while trying to succeed.

1454.author: Booker T. Washington
1454.quote: Success in life is founded upon attention to the small things rather than to the large things; to the every day things nearest to us rather than to the things that are remote and uncommon.

1455.author: Booker T. Washington
1455.quote: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.

1456.author: Booker T. Washington
1456.quote: Associate yourself with people of good quality, for it is better to be alone than in bad company.

1457.author: Booker T. Washington
1457.quote: Excellence is to do a common thing in an uncommon way.

1458.author: Booker T. Washington
1458.quote: Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome.

1459.author: Booker T. Washington
1459.quote: One man cannot hold another man down in the ditch without remaining down in the ditch with him.

1460.author: Booker T. Washington
1460.quote: Character, not circumstances, makes the man.

1461.author: Booker T. Washington
1461.quote: At the bottom of education, at the bottom of politics, even at the bottom of religion, there must be for our race economic independence.

1463.author: Booker T. Washington
1463.quote: No greater injury can be done to any youth than to let him feel that because he belongs to this or that race he will be advanced in life regardless of his own merits or efforts.

1464.author: Booker T. Washington
1464.quote: No race can prosper till it learns that there is as much dignity in tilling a field as in writing a poem.

1465.author: Booker T. Washington
1465.quote: There are two ways of exerting one's strength: one is pushing down, the other is pulling up.

1466.author: Booker T. Washington
1466.quote: You can't hold a man down without staying down with him.

1467.author: Booker T. Washington
1467.quote: We do not want the men of another color for our brothers-in-law, but we do want them for our brothers.

1468.author: Booker T. Washington
1468.quote: The individual who can do something that the world wants done will, in the end, make his way regardless of his race.

1469.author: Booker T. Washington
1469.quote: We must reinforce argument with results.

1470.author: Booker T. Washington
1470.quote: Dignify and glorify common labor. It is at the bottom of life that we must begin, not at the top.

1471.author: Booker T. Washington
1471.quote: Few things can help an individual more than to place responsibility on him, and to let him know that you trust him.

1472.author: Booker T. Washington
1472.quote: There is no power on earth that can neutralize the influence of a high, simple and useful life.

1473.author: Booker T. Washington
1473.quote: No man, who continues to add something to the material, intellectual and moral well-being of the place in which he lives, is left long without proper reward.

1474.author: Booker T. Washington
1474.quote: To hold a man down, you have to stay down with him.

1475.author: Booker T. Washington
1475.quote: If you can't read, it's going to be hard to realize dreams.

1476.author: Brad Henry
1476.quote: A good teacher can inspire hope, ignite the imagination, and instill a love of learning.

1477.author: Brad Henry
1477.quote: Believe in yourself, and the rest will fall into place. Have faith in your own abilities, work hard, and there is nothing you cannot accomplish.

1478.author: Brad Henry
1478.quote: No one should have to choose between medicine and other necessities. No one should have to use the emergency room every time a child gets sick. And no one should have to live in constant fear that a medical problem will become a financial crisis.

1479.author: Brad Henry
1479.quote: Education is not solely about earning a great living. It means living a great life.

1480.author: Brad Henry
1480.quote: It is only through raising expectations and striving for excellence that our children can reach their full potential.

1481.author: Brad Henry
1481.quote: Let us be bold. Let us be brave. Let us be together.

1482.author: Brad Henry
1482.quote: Families are the compass that guide us. They are the inspiration to reach great heights, and our comfort when we occasionally falter.

1483.author: Brad Henry
1483.quote: No other investment yields as great a return as the investment in education. An educated workforce is the foundation of every community and the future of every economy.

1484.author: Brad Henry
1484.quote: For only by nurturing the minds and strengthening the values of our children can we give them an opportunity to be full, productive citizens, to reach their God-given potential, and to have good jobs right here in Oklahoma.

1485.author: Brad Henry
1485.quote: The only thing holding us back is ourselves.

1486.author: Brad Henry
1486.quote: Resilience is woven deeply into the fabric of Oklahoma. Throw us an obstacle, and we grow stronger.

1487.author: Brad Henry
1487.quote: No matter where you stand politically - even if you're unsure of what your political ideology is - it is important to take part in the process of shaping our government.

1488.author: Brad Henry
1488.quote: Something called 'the Oklahoma Standard' became known throughout the world. It means resilience in the face of adversity. It means a strength and compassion that will not be defeated.

1489.author: Brad Henry
1489.quote: It is a paradox that far too few Americans participate in the wonderful ritual of democracy that we call Election Day.

1490.author: Brad Henry
1490.quote: What unites Oklahomans today is what has always united us: Our unshakable faith. Our love of family and compassion for others. The unlimited promise of a hopeful future.

1491.author: Brad Henry
1491.quote: The worst thing we can do is to do nothing.

1492.author: Brad Henry
1492.quote: We must give Oklahoma families the opportunity to thrive and prosper. We must give all Oklahomans the tools necessary to pursue the American dream. And then, we must get out of the way.

1493.author: Brad Henry
1493.quote: A fundamental duty of government is to protect its people.

1494.author: Brad Henry
1494.quote: There is too much at stake for us to surrender to the politics of polarization.

1495.author: Brad Henry
1495.quote: In charting our course to the future, we are mindful of our path from the past.

1496.author: Brad Henry
1496.quote: If ever there was a time for true bipartisanship, it is today.

1497.author: Brad Henry
1497.quote: This is not the time for partisan bickering. This is not the time for politics as usual. Some of us are Democrats. Some of us are Republicans. Some of us are Independents. Above all, we must be Oklahomans first.

1498.author: Brad Henry
1498.quote: Reading builds the educated and informed electorate so vital to our democracy.

1499.author: Brad Henry
1499.quote: The status quo is simply unacceptable.

1500.author: Brad Henry
1500.quote: Oklahomans value our children and our seniors. Oklahomans value traditions of faith. Oklahomans value our heroes, our veterans. Oklahomans value innovation and the creative arts.

1501.author: Bradley Whitford
1501.quote: Infuse your life with action. Don't wait for it to happen. Make it happen. Make your own future. Make your own hope. Make your own love. And whatever your beliefs, honor your creator, not by passively waiting for grace to come down from upon high, but by doing what you can to make grace happen... yourself, right now, right down here on Earth.

1502.author: Bradley Whitford
1502.quote: I have to think that I think it's always been a horse race between this administration's temporary political acumen and their completely, utterly, totally bankrupt policies. And they're coming home to roost. It was always a question of time. These guys aren't conservative. These guys are radicals.

1503.author: Bradley Whitford
1503.quote: You need to be real enough to be believable, but you don't necessarily have to be real enough to be real. There is a distinction.

1504.author: Bradley Whitford
1504.quote: When you act, you're always playing a version of yourself. You can't bring more to the role than what you are.

1505.author: Bradley Whitford
1505.quote: I heard an Israeli speaking on Palestinian human rights issues, an interesting guy, and he said 'There's no military solution to terrorism. If there were, Israel would be the safest place in the world. But there's no military solution.'

1506.author: Bradley Whitford
1506.quote: Whatever you do, make sure you want to write more than you want to be a writer. Make sure you want to act more than you want to be an actor. That is what will sustain you.

1507.author: Bradley Whitford
1507.quote: I was at the vice president's Christmas party. I thought that his speech was spectacular, and I knew that it was a very emotional and difficult thing for him to do, but I admonished him for not waiting just one more stinking day.

1508.author: Bradley Whitford
1508.quote: You don't want your credibility banana to turn brown, but you do want to speak out about what you believe in.

1509.author: Bradley Whitford
1509.quote: Love means never having to say you're a zero.

1510.author: Bradley Whitford
1510.quote: The issue for my character, and the issue of the show is, how dirty do your feet have to get without suffocating yourself in the mud in order to get an inch of what you really want done?

1511.author: Bradley Whitford
1511.quote: We're telling a story. And the demands of that are different from the demands of a documentary. The audience must believe in order to keep faith in the story.

1512.author: Bradley Whitford
1512.quote: One of the most surreal moments in this election was after the third debate, when I heard a talking head say, Al Gore won on substance, on the issues. But you have to give the victory to Bush because he seems presidential.

1513.author: Bradley Whitford
1513.quote: I can't believe George Bush might be president.

1514.author: Bradley Whitford
1514.quote: John Wells let me write a couple of West Wings, which was an incredible gift. I loved it once I got past the brain injury part of it, and so I'm working on a couple of things that are far from fruition, but what I want to pursue.

1515.author: Bradley Whitford
1515.quote: With the success of a show, you get an opportunity to call attention to things that you believe in.

1516.author: Bradley Whitford
1516.quote: You don't want to become one of those Hollywood idiots who is just blathering about anything.

1517.author: Bradley Whitford
1517.quote: Having an affair with an intern is just an incredibly stupid thing to do.

1518.author: Bradley Whitford
1518.quote: Richard Schiff is a really good baseball player. It's surprising because he looks exhausted.

1519.author: Bradley Whitford
1519.quote: Anybody who can dial a telephone can master tennis scoring in about 15 minutes.

1520.author: Bradley Whitford
1520.quote: I want to see Bob Dylan do sketch comedy. I'm a huge Bob Dylan fan.

1521.author: Bradley Whitford
1521.quote: This election ain't no stinkin' TV show.

1522.author: Bradley Whitford
1522.quote: Cal Ripken is steady, he focuses on his job, and he's a good guy.

1523.author: Bradley Whitford
1523.quote: I identify with this guy's frustration and inability to control his fury at moments. I even identify with the way that this guy covers up a lot with humour. So yeah, it's interesting.

1524.author: Brene Brown
1524.quote: I don't have to chase extraordinary moments to find happiness - it's right in front of me if I'm paying attention and practicing gratitude.

1525.author: Brene Brown
1525.quote: I spent a lot of years trying to outrun or outsmart vulnerability by making things certain and definite, black and white, good and bad. My inability to lean into the discomfort of vulnerability limited the fullness of those important experiences that are wrought with uncertainty: Love, belonging, trust, joy, and creativity to name a few.

1526.author: Brene Brown
1526.quote: There is no innovation and creativity without failure. Period.

1527.author: Brene Brown
