2505.quote: Women, can't live with them, can't live without them.

2506.author: Desiderius Erasmus
2506.quote: The desire to write grows with writing.

2508.author: Desiderius Erasmus
2508.quote: To know nothing is the happiest life.

2509.author: Desiderius Erasmus
2509.quote: Don't give your advice before you are called upon.

2510.author: Desiderius Erasmus
2510.quote: In the country of the blind the one eyed man is king.

2511.author: Desmond Tutu
2511.quote: You don't choose your family. They are God's gift to you, as you are to them.

2512.author: Desmond Tutu
2512.quote: Hope is being able to see that there is light despite all of the darkness.

2513.author: Desmond Tutu
2513.quote: Forgiveness says you are given another chance to make a new beginning.

2514.author: Desmond Tutu
2514.quote: If you are neutral in situations of injustice, you have chosen the side of the oppressor. If an elephant has its foot on the tail of a mouse and you say that you are neutral, the mouse will not appreciate your neutrality.

2515.author: Desmond Tutu
2515.quote: God's dream is that you and I and all of us will realize that we are family, that we are made for togetherness, for goodness, and for compassion.

2516.author: Desmond Tutu
2516.quote: When the missionaries came to Africa they had the Bible and we had the land. They said 'Let us pray.' We closed our eyes. When we opened them we had the Bible and they had the land.

2517.author: Desmond Tutu
2517.quote: Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.

2518.author: Desmond Tutu
2518.quote: I wish I could shut up, but I can't, and I won't.

2519.author: Desmond Tutu
2519.quote: My humanity is bound up in yours, for we can only be human together.

2520.author: Desmond Tutu
2520.quote: If you want peace, you don't talk to your friends. You talk to your enemies.

2521.author: Desmond Tutu
2521.quote: Because forgiveness is like this: a room can be dank because you have closed the windows, you've closed the curtains. But the sun is shining outside, and the air is fresh outside. In order to get that fresh air, you have to get up and open the window and draw the curtains apart.

2522.author: Desmond Tutu
2522.quote: But God can only smile because only God can know what is coming next.

2523.author: Desmond Tutu
2523.quote: Inclusive, good-quality education is a foundation for dynamic and equitable societies.

2524.author: Desmond Tutu
2524.quote: Racism, xenophobia and unfair discrimination have spawned slavery, when human beings have bought and sold and owned and branded fellow human beings as if they were so many beasts of burden.

2525.author: Desmond Tutu
2525.quote: We inhabit a universe that is characterized by diversity.

2526.author: Desmond Tutu
2526.quote: In my country of South Africa, we struggled for years against the evil system of apartheid that divided human beings, children of the same God, by racial classification and then denied many of them fundamental human rights.

2527.author: Desmond Tutu
2527.quote: The price of freedom is eternal vigilance.

2528.author: Desmond Tutu
2528.quote: We are each made for goodness, love and compassion. Our lives are transformed as much as the world is when we live with these truths.

2529.author: Desmond Tutu
2529.quote: Exclusion is never the way forward on our shared paths to freedom and justice.

2530.author: Desmond Tutu
2530.quote: Many people would be surprised that, in fact, I'm quite shy.

2531.author: Desmond Tutu
2531.quote: Isn't it amazing that we are all made in God's image, and yet there is so much diversity among his people?

2533.author: Desmond Tutu
2533.quote: You stand out in the crowd only because you have these many, many carrying you on their shoulders.

2534.author: Desmond Tutu
2534.quote: I have been to the Occupied Palestinian Territory, and I have witnessed the racially segregated roads and housing that reminded me so much of the conditions we experienced in South Africa under the racist system of Apartheid.

2535.author: Desmond Tutu
2535.quote: God is not upset that Gandhi was not a Christian, because God is not a Christian! All of God's children and their different faiths help us to realize the immensity of God.

2536.author: Desmond Tutu
2536.quote: Before Nelson Mandela was arrested in 1962, he was an angry, relatively young man. He founded the ANC's military wing. When he was released, he surprised everyone because he was talking about reconciliation and forgiveness and not about revenge.

2537.author: Diogenes
2537.quote: The foundation of every state is the education of its youth.

2538.author: Diogenes
2538.quote: We have two ears and one tongue so that we would listen more and talk less.

2539.author: Diogenes
2539.quote: The great thieves lead away the little thief.

2540.author: Diogenes
2540.quote: Of what use is a philosopher who doesn't hurt anybody's feelings?

2541.author: Diogenes
2541.quote: Stand a little less between me and the sun.

2542.author: Diogenes
2542.quote: He has the most who is most content with the least.

2543.author: Diogenes
2543.quote: I threw my cup away when I saw a child drinking from his hands at the trough.

2544.author: Diogenes
2544.quote: It takes a wise man to discover a wise man.

2545.author: Diogenes
2545.quote: Modesty is the color of virtue.

2546.author: Diogenes
2546.quote: Calumny is only the noise of madmen.

2547.author: Diogenes
2547.quote: A friend is one soul abiding in two bodies.

2548.author: Diogenes
2548.quote: No man is hurt but by himself.

2549.author: Diogenes
2549.quote: What I like to drink most is wine that belongs to others.

2550.author: Diogenes
2550.quote: The mob is the mother of tyrants.

2551.author: Diogenes
2551.quote: Those who have virtue always in their mouths, and neglect it in practice, are like a harp, which emits a sound pleasing to others, while itself is insensible of the music.

2552.author: Diogenes
2552.quote: In a rich man's house there is no place to spit but his face.

2553.author: Diogenes
2553.quote: The art of being a slave is to rule one's master.

2554.author: Diogenes
2554.quote: The vine bears three kinds of grapes: the first of pleasure, the second of intoxication, the third of disgust.

2555.author: Diogenes
2555.quote: Most men are within a finger's breadth of being mad.

2556.author: Diogenes
2556.quote: I know nothing, except the fact of my ignorance.

2557.author: Diogenes
2557.quote: When I look upon seamen, men of science and philosophers, man is the wisest of all beings; when I look upon priests and prophets nothing is as contemptible as man.

2558.author: Diogenes
2558.quote: Man is the most intelligent of the animals - and the most silly.

2559.author: Diogenes
2559.quote: I have nothing to ask but that you would remove to the other side, that you may not, by intercepting the sunshine, take from me what you cannot give.

2560.author: Diogenes
2560.quote: Dogs and philosophers do the greatest good and get the fewest rewards.

2561.author: Diogenes
2561.quote: Blushing is the color of virtue.

2562.author: Diogenes
2562.quote: Wise leaders generally have wise counselors because it takes a wise person themselves to distinguish them.

2563.author: Dolly Parton
2563.quote: The way I see it, if you want the rainbow, you gotta put up with the rain.

2564.author: Dolly Parton
2564.quote: We cannot direct the wind, but we can adjust the sails.

2565.author: Dolly Parton
2565.quote: If you don't like the road you're walking, start paving another one.

2566.author: Dolly Parton
2566.quote: It's a good thing I was born a girl, otherwise I'd be a drag queen.

2567.author: Dolly Parton
2567.quote: Find out who you are. And do it on purpose.

2568.author: Dolly Parton
2568.quote: You can be rich in spirit, kindness, love and all those things that you can't put a dollar sign on.

2569.author: Dolly Parton
2569.quote: Storms make trees take deeper roots.

2570.author: Dolly Parton
2570.quote: I thank God for my failures. Maybe not at the time but after some reflection. I never feel like a failure just because something I tried has failed.

2571.author: Dolly Parton
2571.quote: There's nothing like white trash at the White House.

2572.author: Dolly Parton
2572.quote: I walk tall; I got a tall attitude.

2573.author: Dolly Parton
2573.quote: No matter what, I always make it home for Christmas. I love to go to my Tennessee Mountain Home and invite all of my nieces and nephews and their spouses and kids and do what we all like to do - eat, laugh, trade presents and just enjoy each other... and sometimes I even dress up like Santa Claus!

2574.author: Dolly Parton
2574.quote: You'll never do a whole lot unless you're brave enough to try.

2575.author: Dolly Parton
2575.quote: Being a star just means that you just find your own special place, and that you shine where you are. To me, that's what being a star means.

2576.author: Dolly Parton
2576.quote: I'm not offended by all the dumb blonde jokes because I know I'm not dumb... and I also know that I'm not blonde.

2577.author: Dolly Parton
2577.quote: I wanted to write a book that talked about the emotions of children, which is the rainbow. We all have moods. We talk about being blue when we're sad, and being yellow when we're cowards, and when we're mad, we're red.

2578.author: Dolly Parton
2578.quote: Adjusting to the passage of time, I think, is a key to success and to life: just being able to roll with the punches.

2579.author: Dolly Parton
2579.quote: I'm no natural beauty. If I'm gonna have any looks at all, I'm gonna have to create them.

2580.author: Dolly Parton
2580.quote: I have surrounded myself with very smart people.

2581.author: Dolly Parton
2581.quote: I've always been fascinated by everything with wings.

2582.author: Dolly Parton
2582.quote: It costs a lot of money to look this cheap.

2583.author: Dolly Parton
2583.quote: A lot of people don't realise I came out of the Smoky Mountains with a load of songs.

2584.author: Dolly Parton
2584.quote: I think I became more productive through not having children. I never really had the desire to have them. My husband didn't want them either, so it worked out well.

2585.author: Dolly Parton
2585.quote: The only way I'd be caught without makeup is if my radio fell in the bathtub while I was taking a bath and electrocuted me and I was in between makeup at home. I hope my husband would slap a little lipstick on me before he took me to the morgue.

2586.author: Dolly Parton
2586.quote: People say I look so happy - and I say, 'That's the Botox.'

2587.author: Dolly Parton
2587.quote: I love traveling all over the world; but it's true: there's nothing like home.

2588.author: Dolly Parton
2588.quote: I was the first woman to burn my bra - it took the fire department four days to put it out.

2589.author: Donald Trump
2589.quote: Sometimes by losing a battle you find a new way to win the war.

2590.author: Donald Trump
2590.quote: No dream is too big. No challenge is too great. Nothing we want for our future is beyond our reach.

2591.author: Donald Trump
2591.quote: When somebody challenges you, fight back. Be brutal, be tough.

2592.author: Donald Trump
2592.quote: You have to think anyway, so why not think big?

2593.author: Donald Trump
2593.quote: When you open your heart to patriotism, there is no room for prejudice. The Bible tells us, 'How good and pleasant it is when God's people live together in unity.'

2594.author: Donald Trump
2594.quote: It is time to remember that old wisdom our soldiers will never forget: that whether we are black or brown or white, we all bleed the same red blood of patriots, we all enjoy the same glorious freedoms, and we all salute the same great American Flag.

2595.author: Donald Trump
2595.quote: Part of being a winner is knowing when enough is enough. Sometimes you have to give up the fight and walk away, and move on to something that's more productive.

2596.author: Donald Trump
2596.quote: Without passion you don't have energy, with out energy you have nothing.

2597.author: Donald Trump
2597.quote: My whole life is about winning. I don't lose often. I almost never lose.

2598.author: Donald Trump
2598.quote: I actually don't have a bad hairline.

2599.author: Donald Trump
2599.quote: Come November, the American people will have the chance to re-declare their independence. Americans will have a chance to vote for trade, immigration and foreign policies that put our citizens first. They will have the chance to reject today's rule by the global elite, and to embrace real change that delivers a government of, by and for the people.

2600.author: Donald Trump
2600.quote: I have a great relationship with the Mexican people.

2601.author: Donald Trump
2601.quote: We must speak our minds openly, debate our disagreements honestly, but always pursue solidarity.

2602.author: Donald Trump
2602.quote: I judge people based on their capability, honesty, and merit.

2603.author: Donald Trump
2603.quote: Every decision on trade, on taxes, on immigration, on foreign affairs, will be made to benefit American workers and American families. We must protect our borders from the ravages of other countries making our products, stealing our companies, and destroying our jobs. Protection will lead to great prosperity and strength.

2604.author: Donald Trump
2604.quote: I have embraced crying mothers who have lost their children because our politicians put their personal agendas before the national good. I have no patience for injustice, no tolerance for government incompetence, no sympathy for leaders who fail their citizens.

2605.author: Donald Trump
2605.quote: So to all Americans, in every city near and far, small and large, from mountain to mountain, and from ocean to ocean, hear these words: You will never be ignored again. Your voice, your hopes, and your dreams will define our American destiny. And your courage and goodness and love will forever guide us along the way.

2606.author: Donald Trump
2606.quote: I've always won, and I'm going to continue to win. And that's the way it is.

2607.author: Donald Trump
2607.quote: Money was never a big motivation for me, except as a way to keep score. The real excitement is playing the game.

2608.author: Donald Trump
2608.quote: What separates the winners from the losers is how a person reacts to each new twist of fate.

2609.author: Donald Trump
2609.quote: Do you mind if I sit back a little? Because your breath is very bad.

2610.author: Donald Trump
2610.quote: Every day, I wake up determined to deliver a better life for the people all across this nation that have been neglected, ignored, and abandoned. I have visited the laid-off factory workers and the communities crushed by our horrible and unfair trade deals. These are the forgotten men and women of our country.

2613.author: Donald Trump
2613.quote: The most basic duty of government is to defend the lives of its own citizens. Any government that fails to do so is a government unworthy to lead.

2614.author: Donald Trump
2614.quote: You know the funny thing, I don't get along with rich people. I get along with the middle class and the poor people better than I get along with the rich people.

2615.author: Dorothy Dix
2615.quote: It is a queer thing, but imaginary troubles are harder to bear than actual ones.

2616.author: Dorothy Dix
2616.quote: Confession is always weakness. The grave soul keeps its own secrets, and takes its own punishment in silence.

2617.author: Dorothy Dix
2617.quote: I have learned to live each day as it comes, and not to borrow trouble by dreading tomorrow. It is the dark menace of the future that makes cowards of us.

2618.author: Dorothy Dix
2618.quote: There isn't a single human being who hasn't plenty to cry over, and the trick is to make the laughs outweigh the tears.

2619.author: Dorothy Dix
2619.quote: We are never happy until we learn to laugh at ourselves.

2620.author: Dorothy Dix
2620.quote: The price of indulging yourself in your youth in the things you cannot afford is poverty and dependence in your old age.

2621.author: Dorothy Dix
2621.quote: Nobody wants to kiss when they are hungry.

2622.author: Dorothy Dix
2622.quote: You never saw a very busy person who was unhappy.

2623.author: Douglas Adams
2623.quote: To give real service you must add something which cannot be bought or measured with money, and that is sincerity and integrity.

2624.author: Douglas Adams
2624.quote: Flying is learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss.

2625.author: Douglas Adams
2625.quote: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.

2626.author: Douglas Adams
2626.quote: I may not have gone where I intended to go, but I think I have ended up where I intended to be.

2627.author: Douglas Adams
2627.quote: He was a dreamer, a thinker, a speculative philosopher... or, as his wife would have it, an idiot.

2628.author: Douglas Adams
2628.quote: This must be Thursday. I never could get the hang of Thursdays.

2629.author: Douglas Adams
2629.quote: It is a well-known fact that those people who must want to rule people are, ipso facto, those least suited to do it... anyone who is capable of getting themselves made President should on no account be allowed to do the job.

2630.author: Douglas Adams
2630.quote: A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools.

2631.author: Douglas Adams
2631.quote: You live and learn. At any rate, you live.

2632.author: Douglas Adams
2632.quote: The impossible often has a kind of integrity which the merely improbable lacks.

2633.author: Douglas Adams
2633.quote: It is a mistake to think you can solve any major problems just with potatoes.

2634.author: Douglas Adams
2634.quote: Every country is like a particular type of person. America is like a belligerent, adolescent boy; Canada is like an intelligent, 35-year-old woman. Australia is like Jack Nicholson. It comes right up to you and laughs very hard in your face in a highly threatening and engaging manner.

2635.author: Douglas Adams
2635.quote: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move.

2636.author: Douglas Adams
2636.quote: If it looks like a duck, and quacks like a duck, we have at least to consider the possibility that we have a small aquatic bird of the family anatidae on our hands.

2637.author: Douglas Adams
2637.quote: I seldom end up where I wanted to go, but almost always end up where I need to be.

2638.author: Douglas Adams
2638.quote: I think fish is nice, but then I think that rain is wet, so who am I to judge?

2639.author: Douglas Adams
2639.quote: We no longer think of chairs as technology; we just think of them as chairs. But there was a time when we hadn't worked out how many legs chairs should have, how tall they should be, and they would often 'crash' when we tried to use them.

2640.author: Douglas Adams
2640.quote: See first, think later, then test. But always see first. Otherwise, you will only see what you were expecting. Most scientists forget that.

2641.author: Douglas Adams
2641.quote: Space is big. You just won't believe how vastly, hugely, mind-bogglingly big it is. I mean, you may think it's a long way down the road to the drug store, but that's just peanuts to space.

2642.author: Douglas Adams
2642.quote: My absolute favourite piece of information is the fact that young sloths are so inept that they frequently grab their own arms and legs instead of tree limbs, and fall out of trees.

2643.author: Douglas Adams
2643.quote: I don't believe it. Prove it to me and I still won't believe it.

2644.author: Douglas Adams
2644.quote: Look at a book. A book is the right size to be a book. They're solar-powered. If you drop them, they keep on being a book. You can find your place in microseconds. Books are really good at being books, and no matter what happens, books will survive.

2645.author: Douglas Adams
2645.quote: We think that the world is a solid, vivid place, full of shape and colour and solid objects like this table and this microphone and so on, but we actually create that in our heads out of the bits of information that hit the back of our eyeballs or hit our eardrums or hit our tongues or whatever.

2646.author: Douglas Adams
2646.quote: The knack of flying is learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss.

2647.author: Douglas Adams
2647.quote: Isn't it enough to see that a garden is beautiful without having to believe that there are fairies at the bottom of it too?

2649.author: Douglas MacArthur
2649.quote: The soldier above all others prays for peace, for it is the soldier who must suffer and bear the deepest wounds and scars of war.

2650.author: Douglas MacArthur
2650.quote: Build me a son, O Lord, who will be strong enough to know when he is weak, and brave enough to face himself when he is afraid, one who will be proud and unbending in honest defeat, and humble and gentle in victory.

2651.author: Douglas MacArthur
2651.quote: Duty, Honor, Country. Those three hallowed words reverently dictate what you ought to be, what you can be, what you will be.

2652.author: Douglas MacArthur
2652.quote: Age wrinkles the body. Quitting wrinkles the soul.

2653.author: Douglas MacArthur
2653.quote: The best luck of all is the luck you make for yourself.

2654.author: Douglas MacArthur
2654.quote: I am concerned for the security of our great Nation; not so much because of any threat from without, but because of the insidious forces working from within.

2655.author: Douglas MacArthur
2655.quote: Old soldiers never die; they just fade away.

2656.author: Douglas MacArthur
2656.quote: Our country is now geared to an arms economy bred in an artificially induced psychosis of war hysteria and an incessant propaganda of fear.

2657.author: Douglas MacArthur
2657.quote: We are not retreating - we are advancing in another direction.

2658.author: Douglas MacArthur
2658.quote: You are remembered for the rules you break.

2659.author: Douglas MacArthur
2659.quote: The world is in a constant conspiracy against the brave. It's the age-old struggle: the roar of the crowd on the one side, and the voice of your conscience on the other.

2660.author: Douglas MacArthur
2660.quote: There is no security on this earth; there is only opportunity.

2661.author: Douglas MacArthur
2661.quote: It is fatal to enter any war without the will to win it.

2662.author: Douglas MacArthur
2662.quote: One cannot wage war under present conditions without the support of public opinion, which is tremendously molded by the press and other forms of propaganda.

2663.author: Douglas MacArthur
2663.quote: I suppose, in a way, this has become part of my soul. It is a symbol of my life. Whatever I have done that really matters, I've done wearing it. When the time comes, it will be in this that I journey forth. What greater honor could come to an American, and a soldier?

2664.author: Douglas MacArthur
2664.quote: They died hard, those savage men - like wounded wolves at bay. They were filthy, and they were lousy, and they stunk. And I loved them.

2665.author: Douglas MacArthur
2665.quote: It is part of the general pattern of misguided policy that our country is now geared to an arms economy which was bred in an artificially induced psychosis of war hysteria and nurtured upon an incessant propaganda of fear.

2666.author: Douglas MacArthur
2666.quote: Like the old soldier of the ballad, I now close my military career and just fade away, an old soldier who tried to do his duty as God gave him the light to see that duty. Goodbye.

2667.author: Douglas MacArthur
2667.quote: I have just returned from visiting the Marines at the front, and there is not a finer fighting organization in the world!

2668.author: Douglas MacArthur
2668.quote: Life is a lively process of becoming.

2670.author: Douglas MacArthur
2670.quote: In my dreams I hear again the crash of guns, the rattle of musketry, the strange, mournful mutter of the battlefield.

2671.author: Douglas MacArthur
2671.quote: A better world shall emerge based on faith and understanding.

2672.author: Douglas MacArthur
2672.quote: Never give an order that can't be obeyed.

2673.author: Douglas MacArthur
2673.quote: In war there is no substitute for victory.

2674.author: Douglas MacArthur
2674.quote: Only those are fit to live who are not afraid to die.

2675.author: Dr. Seuss
2675.quote: Today you are you! That is truer than true! There is no one alive who is you-er than you!

2676.author: Dr. Seuss
2676.quote: Don't cry because it's over. Smile because it happened.

2677.author: Dr. Seuss
2677.quote: You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself in any direction you choose. You're on your own, and you know what you know. And you are the guy who'll decide where to go.

2678.author: Dr. Seuss
2678.quote: From there to here, and here to there, funny things are everywhere.

2679.author: Dr. Seuss
2679.quote: I like nonsense; it wakes up the brain cells.

2680.author: Dr. Seuss
2680.quote: Maybe Christmas, the Grinch thought, doesn't come from a store.

2681.author: Dr. Seuss
2681.quote: Step with care and great tact, and remember that Life's a Great Balancing Act.

2682.author: Dr. Seuss
2682.quote: How did it get so late so soon? Its night before its afternoon. December is here before its June. My goodness how the time has flewn. How did it get so late so soon?

2683.author: Dr. Seuss
2683.quote: You're never too old, too wacky, too wild, to pick up a book and read to a child.

2684.author: Dr. Seuss
2684.quote: Only you can control your future.

2685.author: Dr. Seuss
2685.quote: Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot, nothing is going to get better. It's not.

2686.author: Dr. Seuss
2686.quote: Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living, it's a way of looking at life through the wrong end of a telescope, and that enables you to laugh at life's realities.

2687.author: Dr. Seuss
2687.quote: The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go.

2688.author: Dr. Seuss
2688.quote: A person's a person, no matter how small.

2689.author: Dr. Seuss
2689.quote: Today was good. Today was fun. Tomorrow is another one.

2690.author: Dr. Seuss
2690.quote: Think left and think right and think low and think high. Oh, the thinks you can think up if only you try!

2692.author: Dr. Seuss
2692.quote: I've heard there are troubles of more than one kind; some come from ahead, and some come from behind. But I've brought a big bat. I'm all ready, you see; now my troubles are going to have troubles with me!

2693.author: Dr. Seuss
2693.quote: You're in pretty good shape for the shape you are in.

2694.author: Dr. Seuss
2694.quote: 'The Lorax' book was intended to be propaganda.

2695.author: Dr. Seuss
2695.quote: Sometimes, when I see my granddaughters make small discoveries of their own, I wish I were a child.

2696.author: Dr. Seuss
2696.quote: When at last we are sure, You've been properly pilled, Then a few paper forms, Must be properly filled. So that you and your heirs, May be properly billed.

2697.author: Dr. Seuss
2697.quote: You can get help from teachers, but you are going to have to learn a lot by yourself, sitting alone in a room.

2699.author: Dr. Seuss
2699.quote: Whenever things go a bit sour in a job I'm doing, I always tell myself, 'You can do better than this.'

2700.author: Dr. Seuss
2700.quote: I am not a consecutive writer.

2701.author: Drake
2701.quote: Sometimes it's the journey that teaches you a lot about your destination.

2702.author: Drake
2702.quote: Jealousy is just love and hate at the same time.

2703.author: Drake
2703.quote: I've never been reckless - it's always calculated. I'm mischievous, but I'm calculated.

2704.author: Drake
2704.quote: There will be days when I walk in an arena and people will cheer and then there might be days when I walk in an arena and people might boo, but it all sounds the same to me because it's all just noise that lets me know that I'm relevant.

2705.author: Drake
2705.quote: 'Perfection' to me is, I walk away from a situation and say, 'I did everything I could do right there. There was nothing more that I could do.' I was a hundred percent, like the meter was at the top. There was nothing else I could have done. You know? Like, I worked as hard as I possibly could have. That's perfection.

2706.author: Drake
2706.quote: I'd rather tell you how I really feel.

2707.author: Drake
2707.quote: My life is mine to remember.

2708.author: Drake
2708.quote: I'm not confrontational, but if someone challenges, I'm not going to back down.

2709.author: Drake
2709.quote: When it comes to knowing what to say, to charm, I always had it.

2711.author: Drake
2711.quote: I like sweaters. I have a sweater obsession, I guess.

2712.author: Drake
2712.quote: I'm actually a very honest person, and sometimes I end up like, 'Man, I said too much.' It's hard for me not to tell the truth when you ask me.

2713.author: Drake
2713.quote: When I think of myself, I think of Toronto. My music would never sound the way it does if it weren't for Toronto.

2714.author: Drake
2714.quote: I feel that when you care about your music, taking risks is something you should do to keep things exciting.

2715.author: Drake
2715.quote: When I'm writing, I'm thinking about how the songs are going to play live. Fifty bars of rap don't translate onstage. No matter how potent the music, you lose the crowd. They want a hook; they want to sing your stuff back to you.

2716.author: Drake
2716.quote: I'm not going to lie; listen, I'm nice at basketball.

2717.author: Drake
2717.quote: People like to build their own story about my life. I don't know if it makes them feel better, or if it makes it okay for them to not like me, but the last thing I grew up as was rich.

2718.author: Drake
2718.quote: I wake up in the morning and my heart is light, man. It's not heavy. I don't have skeletons in the closet on their way out.

2719.author: Drake
2719.quote: You know, there are artists who are 35 and up that still make rap and that still works for them. I don't know if I want to be that guy.

2720.author: Drake
2720.quote: When you're on the road and moving city to city, when someone isn't there at the end of the night, you feel empty.

2721.author: Drake
2721.quote: Reviews condition people. At the end of the day, a lot of human minds are malleable. They can be easily shaped with strong words.

2722.author: Drake
2722.quote: I like Ryan Gosling as an actor. I watch all of his movies, and he's Canadian and I just like his swag. I read his interviews and I'm a big fan of his.

2723.author: Drake
2723.quote: I try to really capitalize off of what other rappers really can't do. There are opportunities that rappers I love simply can't get, because... you know... I don't have the tattoos; I have a different image.

2724.author: Drake
2724.quote: I just have a thing in my brain that when I'm about to do something that's genuine or authentic, I think of it in song form. I'll be like, 'Yo, this is a human emotion that no one talks about.'

2725.author: Drake
2725.quote: Rappers aren't the really rich ones. We all have nice houses with studios and cars, but you need a piece of someone's business to be super wealthy.

2726.author: Drake
2726.quote: Patience is key for getting over a breakup. That, and trailing off your interaction after the breakup.

2727.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2727.quote: The supreme quality for leadership is unquestionably integrity. Without it, no real success is possible, no matter whether it is on a section gang, a football field, in an army, or in an office.

2728.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2728.quote: Motivation is the art of getting people to do what you want them to do because they want to do it.

2729.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2729.quote: This world of ours... must avoid becoming a community of dreadful fear and hate, and be, instead, a proud confederation of mutual trust and respect.

2730.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2730.quote: A people that values its privileges above its principles soon loses both.

2731.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2731.quote: I hate war as only a soldier who has lived it can, only as one who has seen its brutality, its futility, its stupidity.

2732.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2732.quote: When you put on a uniform, there are certain inhibitions that you accept.

2733.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2733.quote: Peace and justice are two sides of the same coin.

2734.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2734.quote: In preparing for battle I have always found that plans are useless, but planning is indispensable.

2735.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2735.quote: You don't lead by hitting people over the head - that's assault, not leadership.

2736.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2736.quote: Farming looks mighty easy when your plow is a pencil and you're a thousand miles from the corn field.

2737.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2737.quote: Every gun that is made, every warship launched, every rocket fired, signifies in the final sense a theft from those who hunger and are not fed, those who are cold and are not clothed.

2738.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2738.quote: Plans are nothing; planning is everything.

2739.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2739.quote: Some people wanted champagne and caviar when they should have had beer and hot dogs.

2740.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2740.quote: Should any political party attempt to abolish social security, unemployment insurance, and eliminate labor laws and farm programs, you would not hear of that party again in our political history.

2741.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2741.quote: What counts is not necessarily the size of the dog in the fight - it's the size of the fight in the dog.

2742.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2742.quote: Leadership is the art of getting someone else to do something you want done because he wants to do it.

2743.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2743.quote: May we never confuse honest dissent with disloyal subversion.

2744.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2744.quote: 'Worry' is a word that I don't allow myself to use.

2745.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2745.quote: There's no tragedy in life like the death of a child. Things never get back to the way they were.

2746.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2746.quote: If you want total security, go to prison. There you're fed, clothed, given medical care and so on. The only thing lacking... is freedom.

2747.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2747.quote: History does not long entrust the care of freedom to the weak or the timid.

2748.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2748.quote: An intellectual is a man who takes more words than necessary to tell more than he knows.

2750.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2750.quote: If a problem cannot be solved, enlarge it.

2751.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2751.quote: Together we must learn how to compose differences, not with arms, but with intellect and decent purpose.

2752.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
2752.quote: I despise people who go to the gutter on either the right or the left and hurl rocks at those in the center.

2753.author: e. e. cummings
2753.quote: The most wasted of all days is one without laughter.

2754.author: e. e. cummings
2754.quote: A wind has blown the rain away and blown the sky away and all the leaves away, and the trees stand. I think, I too, have known autumn too long.

2755.author: e. e. cummings
2755.quote: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.

2756.author: e. e. cummings
2756.quote: I thank you God for this most amazing day, for the leaping greenly spirits of trees, and for the blue dream of sky and for everything which is natural, which is infinite, which is yes.

2757.author: e. e. cummings
2757.quote: To be nobody but yourself in a world which is doing its best, night and day, to make you everybody else - means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight; and never stop fighting.

2758.author: e. e. cummings
2758.quote: Once we believe in ourselves, we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight, or any experience that reveals the human spirit.

2759.author: e. e. cummings
2759.quote: America makes prodigious mistakes, America has colossal faults, but one thing cannot be denied: America is always on the move. She may be going to Hell, of course, but at least she isn't standing still.

2760.author: e. e. cummings
2760.quote: Kisses are a better fate than wisdom.

2761.author: e. e. cummings
2761.quote: Unless you love someone, nothing else makes any sense.

2762.author: e. e. cummings
2762.quote: The world is mud-luscious and puddle-wonderful.

2763.author: e. e. cummings
2763.quote: Always the beautiful answer who asks a more beautiful question.

2764.author: e. e. cummings
2764.quote: To destroy is always the first step in any creation.

2765.author: e. e. cummings
2765.quote: I like my body when it is with your body. It is so quite new a thing. Muscles better and nerves more.

2766.author: e. e. cummings
2766.quote: I imagine that yes is the only living thing.

2767.author: e. e. cummings
2767.quote: A politician is an arse upon which everyone has sat except a man.

2768.author: e. e. cummings
2768.quote: Knowledge is a polite word for dead but not buried imagination.

2769.author: e. e. cummings
2769.quote: Humanity I love you because when you're hard up you pawn your intelligence to buy a drink.

2770.author: e. e. cummings
2770.quote: Private property began the instant somebody had a mind of his own.

2771.author: e. e. cummings
2771.quote: Listen; there's a hell of a good universe next door: let's go.

2772.author: e. e. cummings
2772.quote: Be of love a little more careful than of anything.

2773.author: e. e. cummings
2773.quote: I'd rather learn from one bird how to sing than teach ten thousand stars how not to dance.

2774.author: e. e. cummings
2774.quote: I'm living so far beyond my income that we may almost be said to be living apart.

2775.author: e. e. cummings
2775.quote: I'd rather learn from one bird how to sing than teach 10,000 stars how not to dance.

2778.author: e. e. cummings
2778.quote: It takes three to make a child.

2779.author: Earl Nightingale
2779.quote: Learn to enjoy every minute of your life. Be happy now. Don't wait for something outside of yourself to make you happy in the future. Think how really precious is the time you have to spend, whether it's at work or with your family. Every minute should be enjoyed and savored.

2780.author: Earl Nightingale
2780.quote: All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.

2781.author: Earl Nightingale
2781.quote: People with goals succeed because they know where they're going.

2782.author: Earl Nightingale
2782.quote: Our attitude towards others determines their attitude towards us.

2783.author: Earl Nightingale
2783.quote: Always keep that happy attitude. Pretend that you are holding a beautiful fragrant bouquet.

2784.author: Earl Nightingale
2784.quote: Whatever we plant in our subconscious mind and nourish with repetition and emotion will one day become a reality.

2785.author: Earl Nightingale
2785.quote: Your problem is to bridge the gap which exists between where you are now and the goal you intend to reach.

2786.author: Earl Nightingale
2786.quote: A great attitude does much more than turn on the lights in our worlds; it seems to magically connect us to all sorts of serendipitous opportunities that were somehow absent before the change.

2787.author: Earl Nightingale
2787.quote: The mind moves in the direction of our currently dominant thoughts.

2788.author: Earl Nightingale
2788.quote: We are at our very best, and we are happiest, when we are fully engaged in work we enjoy on the journey toward the goal we've established for ourselves. It gives meaning to our time off and comfort to our sleep. It makes everything else in life so wonderful, so worthwhile.

2789.author: Earl Nightingale
2789.quote: The biggest mistake that you can make is to believe that you are working for somebody else. Job security is gone. The driving force of a career must come from the individual. Remember: Jobs are owned by the company, you own your career!

2790.author: Earl Nightingale
2790.quote: Don't let the fear of the time it will take to accomplish something stand in the way of your doing it. The time will pass anyway; we might just as well put that passing time to the best possible use.

2791.author: Earl Nightingale
2791.quote: Our environment, the world in which we live and work, is a mirror of our attitudes and expectations.

2792.author: Earl Nightingale
2792.quote: We all walk in the dark and each of us must learn to turn on his or her own light.

2793.author: Earl Nightingale
2793.quote: Success is the progressive realization of a worthy goal or ideal.

2794.author: Earl Nightingale
2794.quote: We will receive not what we idly wish for but what we justly earn. Our rewards will always be in exact proportion to our service.

2795.author: Earl Nightingale
2795.quote: The big thing is that you know what you want.

2796.author: Earl Nightingale
2796.quote: People are where they are because that is exactly where they really want to be - whether they will admit that or not.

2797.author: Earl Nightingale
2797.quote: All you have to do is know where you're going. The answers will come to you of their own accord.

2799.author: Earl Nightingale
2799.quote: Whenever we're afraid, it's because we don't know enough. If we understood enough, we would never be afraid.

2800.author: Earl Nightingale
2800.quote: Ideas are elusive, slippery things. Best to keep a pad of paper and a pencil at your bedside, so you can stab them during the night before they get away.

2801.author: Earl Nightingale
2801.quote: What's going on in the inside shows on the outside.

2802.author: Earl Nightingale
2802.quote: We can let circumstances rule us, or we can take charge and rule our lives from within.

2803.author: Earl Nightingale
2803.quote: Picture yourself in your minds eye as having already achieved this goal. See yourself doing the things you'll be doing when you've reached your goal.

2804.author: Earl Nightingale
2804.quote: Creativity is a natural extension of our enthusiasm.

2805.author: Eartha Kitt
2805.quote: Innocence is one of the most exciting things in the world.

2806.author: Eartha Kitt
2806.quote: The river is constantly turning and bending and you never know where it's going to go and where you'll wind up. Following the bend in the river and staying on your own path means that you are on the right track. Don't let anyone deter you from that.

2807.author: Eartha Kitt
2807.quote: Don't depend on other people to be responsible for you. Don't make yourself stressed out over nonsensical things like material things.

2808.author: Eartha Kitt
2808.quote: Greed is so destructive. It destroys everything.

2809.author: Eartha Kitt
2809.quote: I'm a dirt person. I trust the dirt. I don't trust diamonds and gold.

2810.author: Eartha Kitt
2810.quote: Aging has a wonderful beauty and we should have respect for that.

2811.author: Eartha Kitt
2811.quote: In essence, I'm a sophisticated cotton picker.

2812.author: Eartha Kitt
2812.quote: People in general are used to seeing me as the naughty girl because that's what they've always cast me as.

2813.author: Eartha Kitt
2813.quote: I stayed on my own path and did not follow the herd. I made a way for myself.

2814.author: Eartha Kitt
2814.quote: My recipe for life is not being afraid of myself, afraid of what I think or of my opinions.

2815.author: Eartha Kitt
2815.quote: Just because you are different does not mean that you have to be rejected.

2816.author: Eartha Kitt
2816.quote: Whenever I walk out on a stage, I'm begging for affection.

2817.author: Eartha Kitt
2817.quote: I fight for other people better than I fight for myself.

2818.author: Eartha Kitt
2818.quote: When the people who are responsible for our country ask you a direct question, I expect them to accept a direct answer, not to be blackballed because you are telling the truth.

2819.author: Eartha Kitt
2819.quote: I wouldn't bother to describe me. I'm Eartha Kitt.

2820.author: Eartha Kitt
2820.quote: I was an illegitimate, well, I still am an illegitimate child.

2821.author: Eartha Kitt
2821.quote: I don't carry myself as a black person but as a woman that belongs to everybody. After all, it's the general public that made me - not any one particular group. So I don't think of myself as belonging to any particular group and never have.

2822.author: Eartha Kitt
2822.quote: Eartha Mae is very shy. She's scared to be seen, scared of rejection and even afraid of affection. Relationships can be rather uncomfortable for her. But, as Eartha Kitt, it's fine. I can accept and reject any time I want to. Do I ever reject? Not really. Although people think I do!

2823.author: Eartha Kitt
2823.quote: I punish myself more than anybody else does if I am stupid about my actions, and I suffer, really suffer.

2824.author: Eartha Kitt
2824.quote: I am learning all the time. The tombstone will be my diploma.

2825.author: Eartha Kitt
2825.quote: I never take anything for granted. I may slip any minute.

2826.author: Eartha Kitt
2826.quote: I've always been multi-cultural myself. I'm not black and I'm not white and I'm not pink and I'm not green. Eartha Kitt has no color, and that is how barriers are broken.

2827.author: Eartha Kitt
2827.quote: Jewelry, to me, is a pain in the derriere, because you have to be watching it all the time.

2828.author: Eartha Kitt
2828.quote: If you're looking for immediate rewards, you're only looking for the money.

2829.author: Eartha Kitt
2829.quote: This is where you see the truth of entertainment, because it is not edited. You see it on stage as it is happening. Even if we fall down or forget our words, it's a part of live entertainment.

2830.author: Eartha Kitt
2830.quote: I do think that same gender partners should be able to be married. Why not? If you share a life together than who in the world should have anything to say about it?

2831.author: Eckhart Tolle
2831.quote: When the dog looks at you, the dog is not thinking what kind of a person you are. The dog is not judging you.

2832.author: Eckhart Tolle
2832.quote: Wherever you are, be there totally. If you find your here and now intolerable and it makes you unhappy, you have three options: remove yourself from the situation, change it, or accept it totally. If you want to take responsibility for your life, you must choose one of those three options, and you must choose now. Then accept the consequences.

2833.author: Eckhart Tolle
2833.quote: The power for creating a better future is contained in the present moment: You create a good future by creating a good present.

2834.author: Eckhart Tolle
2834.quote: It is through gratitude for the present moment that the spiritual dimension of life opens up.

2835.author: Eckhart Tolle
2835.quote: To know yourself as the Being underneath the thinker, the stillness underneath the mental noise, the love and joy underneath the pain, is freedom, salvation, enlightenment.

2836.author: Eckhart Tolle
2836.quote: Always say 'yes' to the present moment... Surrender to what is. Say 'yes' to life - and see how life starts suddenly to start working for you rather than against you.

2837.author: Eckhart Tolle
2837.quote: There is a fine balance between honoring the past and losing yourself in it. For example, you can acknowledge and learn from mistakes you made, and then move on and refocus on the now. It is called forgiving yourself.

2838.author: Eckhart Tolle
2838.quote: In the egoic state, your sense of self, your identity, is derived from your thinking mind - in other words, what your mind tells you about yourself: the storyline of you, the memories, the expectations, all the thoughts that go through your head continuously and the emotions that reflect those thoughts. All those things make up your sense of self.

2839.author: Eckhart Tolle
2839.quote: Life is an adventure, it's not a package tour.

2840.author: Eckhart Tolle
2840.quote: Boredom, anger, sadness, or fear are not 'yours,' not personal. They are conditions of the human mind. They come and go. Nothing that comes and goes is you.

2841.author: Eckhart Tolle
2841.quote: I'm grateful for always this moment, the now, no matter what form it takes.

2842.author: Eckhart Tolle
2842.quote: Realize deeply that the present moment is all you ever have. Make the Now the primary focus of your life.

2843.author: Eckhart Tolle
2843.quote: In the stillness of your presence, you can feel your own formless and timeless reality as the unmanifested life that animates your physical form. You can then feel the same life deep within every other human and every other creature. You look beyond the veil of form and separation. This is the realization of oneness. This is love.

2844.author: Eckhart Tolle
2844.quote: What a liberation to realize that the 'voice in my head' is not who I am. 'Who am I, then?' The one who sees that.

2845.author: Eckhart Tolle
2845.quote: Don't wait to be successful at some future point. Have a successful relationship with the present moment and be fully present in whatever you are doing. That is success.

2846.author: Eckhart Tolle
2846.quote: When people get taken over by the ego to such an extent, there is nothing else in their mind except the ego. They can no longer feel or sense their humanity - what they share with other human beings, or even with other life forms on the planet. They are so identified with concepts in their minds that other human beings become concepts as well.

2847.author: Eckhart Tolle
2847.quote: Your entire life only happens in this moment. The present moment is life itself. Yet, people live as if the opposite were true and treat the present moment as a stepping stone to the next moment - a means to an end.

2848.author: Eckhart Tolle
2848.quote: To realize that you are not your thoughts is when you begin to awaken spiritually.

2849.author: Eckhart Tolle
2849.quote: Power over others is weakness disguised as strength.

2850.author: Eckhart Tolle
2850.quote: Acceptance looks like a passive state, but in reality it brings something entirely new into this world. That peace, a subtle energy vibration, is consciousness.

2851.author: Eckhart Tolle
2851.quote: To complain is always nonacceptance of what is. It invariably carries an unconscious negative charge. When you complain, you make yourself into a victim. When you speak out, you are in your power. So change the situation by taking action or by speaking out if necessary or possible; leave the situation or accept it. All else is madness.

2852.author: Eckhart Tolle
2852.quote: Most humans are never fully present in the now, because unconsciously they believe that the next moment must be more important than this one. But then you miss your whole life, which is never not now.

2853.author: Eckhart Tolle
2853.quote: Being at ease with not knowing is crucial for answers to come to you.

2854.author: Eckhart Tolle
2854.quote: The answer is, who you are cannot be defined through thinking or mental labels or definitions, because it's beyond that. It is the very sense of being, or presence, that is there when you become conscious of the present moment. In essence, you and what we call the present moment are, at the deepest level, one.

2855.author: Eckhart Tolle
2855.quote: The personal ego already has a strong element of dysfunction, but the collective ego is, frequently, even more dysfunctional, to the point of absolute insanity.

2856.author: Eckhart Tolle
2856.quote: Thoughts are fine when you don't confuse them with who you are, and then thoughts are not a problem. Thinking is a wonderful tool to create things in this world. It only becomes problematic and a source of suffering when you confuse thinking with who you are.

2857.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2857.quote: Words have no power to impress the mind without the exquisite horror of their reality.

2858.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2858.quote: Deep into that darkness peering, long I stood there, wondering, fearing, doubting, dreaming dreams no mortal ever dared to dream before.

2859.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2859.quote: All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream.

2860.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2860.quote: They who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night.

2861.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2861.quote: We loved with a love that was more than love.

2862.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2862.quote: I became insane, with long intervals of horrible sanity.

2863.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2863.quote: All religion, my friend, is simply evolved out of fraud, fear, greed, imagination, and poetry.

2864.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2864.quote: I would define, in brief, the poetry of words as the rhythmical creation of Beauty.

2865.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2865.quote: The boundaries which divide Life from Death are at best shadowy and vague. Who shall say where the one ends, and where the other begins?

2866.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2866.quote: Science has not yet taught us if madness is or is not the sublimity of the intelligence.

2867.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2867.quote: Stupidity is a talent for misconception.

2868.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2868.quote: Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered weak and weary.

2869.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2869.quote: I have great faith in fools; self-confidence my friends call it.

2870.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2870.quote: Were I called on to define, very briefly, the term Art, I should call it 'the reproduction of what the Senses perceive in Nature through the veil of the soul.' The mere imitation, however accurate, of what is in Nature, entitles no man to the sacred name of 'Artist.'

2871.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2871.quote: The true genius shudders at incompleteness - and usually prefers silence to saying something which is not everything it should be.

2873.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2873.quote: With me poetry has not been a purpose, but a passion.

2874.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2874.quote: Beauty of whatever kind, in its supreme development, invariably excites the sensitive soul to tears.

2875.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2875.quote: That pleasure which is at once the most pure, the most elevating and the most intense, is derived, I maintain, from the contemplation of the beautiful.

2876.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2876.quote: To vilify a great man is the readiest way in which a little man can himself attain greatness.

2877.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2877.quote: Experience has shown, and a true philosophy will always show, that a vast, perhaps the larger portion of the truth arises from the seemingly irrelevant.

2878.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2878.quote: The death of a beautiful woman, is unquestionably the most poetical topic in the world.

2879.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2879.quote: That man is not truly brave who is afraid either to seem or to be, when it suits him, a coward.

2880.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2880.quote: It is by no means an irrational fancy that, in a future existence, we shall look upon what we think our present existence, as a dream.

2881.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2881.quote: I have, indeed, no abhorrence of danger, except in its absolute effect - in terror.

2882.author: Edgar Allan Poe
2882.quote: If you wish to forget anything on the spot, make a note that this thing is to be remembered.

2883.author: Edmund Burke
2883.quote: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.

2884.author: Edmund Burke
2884.quote: All tyranny needs to gain a foothold is for people of good conscience to remain silent.

2885.author: Edmund Burke
2885.quote: Nobody made a greater mistake than he who did nothing because he could do only a little.

2886.author: Edmund Burke
2886.quote: Our patience will achieve more than our force.

2887.author: Edmund Burke
2887.quote: It is not what a lawyer tells me I may do; but what humanity, reason, and justice tell me I ought to do.

2888.author: Edmund Burke
2888.quote: Slavery is a weed that grows on every soil.

2889.author: Edmund Burke
2889.quote: Flattery corrupts both the receiver and the giver.

2890.author: Edmund Burke
2890.quote: Your representative owes you, not his industry only, but his judgment; and he betrays instead of serving you if he sacrifices it to your opinion.

2891.author: Edmund Burke
2891.quote: When the leaders choose to make themselves bidders at an auction of popularity, their talents, in the construction of the state, will be of no service. They will become flatterers instead of legislators; the instruments, not the guides, of the people.

2892.author: Edmund Burke
2892.quote: But what is liberty without wisdom, and without virtue? It is the greatest of all possible evils; for it is folly, vice, and madness, without tuition or restraint.

2893.author: Edmund Burke
2893.quote: Nothing turns out to be so oppressive and unjust as a feeble government.

2894.author: Edmund Burke
2894.quote: He that struggles with us strengthens our nerves, and sharpens our skill. Our antagonist is our helper.

2895.author: Edmund Burke
2895.quote: Hypocrisy can afford to be magnificent in its promises, for never intending to go beyond promise, it costs nothing.

2896.author: Edmund Burke
2896.quote: The greater the power, the more dangerous the abuse.

2897.author: Edmund Burke
2897.quote: The traveller has reached the end of the journey!

2898.author: Edmund Burke
2898.quote: The effect of liberty to individuals is that they may do what they please: we ought to see what it will please them to do, before we risk congratulations.

2899.author: Edmund Burke
2899.quote: To read without reflecting is like eating without digesting.

2900.author: Edmund Burke
2900.quote: By gnawing through a dike, even a rat may drown a nation.

2901.author: Edmund Burke
2901.quote: People crushed by laws, have no hope but to evade power. If the laws are their enemies, they will be enemies to the law; and those who have most to hope and nothing to lose will always be dangerous.

2902.author: Edmund Burke
2902.quote: Justice is itself the great standing policy of civil society; and any eminent departure from it, under any circumstances, lies under the suspicion of being no policy at all.

2903.author: Edmund Burke
2903.quote: Superstition is the religion of feeble minds.

2904.author: Edmund Burke
2904.quote: Free trade is not based on utility but on justice.

2905.author: Edmund Burke
2905.quote: Ambition can creep as well as soar.

2906.author: Edmund Burke
2906.quote: The tyranny of a multitude is a multiplied tyranny.

2907.author: Edmund Burke
2907.quote: A State without the means of some change is without the means of its conservation.

2908.author: Edmund Burke
2908.quote: The people never give up their liberties but under some delusion.

2909.author: Edward Abbey
2909.quote: Wilderness is not a luxury but a necessity of the human spirit.

2910.author: Edward Abbey
2910.quote: May your trails be crooked, winding, lonesome, dangerous, leading to the most amazing view. May your mountains rise into and above the clouds.

2911.author: Edward Abbey
2911.quote: When a man's best friend is his dog, that dog has a problem.

2912.author: Edward Abbey
2912.quote: A patriot must always be ready to defend his country against his government.

2913.author: Edward Abbey
2913.quote: One man alone can be pretty dumb sometimes, but for real bona fide stupidity, there ain't nothin' can beat teamwork.

2914.author: Edward Abbey
2914.quote: There is science, logic, reason; there is thought verified by experience. And then there is California.

2915.author: Edward Abbey
2915.quote: Power is always dangerous. Power attracts the worst and corrupts the best.

2916.author: Edward Abbey
2916.quote: The idea of wilderness needs no defense, it only needs defenders.

2917.author: Edward Abbey
2917.quote: Growth for the sake of growth is the ideology of the cancer cell.

2918.author: Edward Abbey
2918.quote: You can't study the darkness by flooding it with light.

2919.author: Edward Abbey
2919.quote: For myself I hold no preferences among flowers, so long as they are wild, free, spontaneous. Bricks to all greenhouses! Black thumb and cutworm to the potted plant!

2920.author: Edward Abbey
2920.quote: Society is like a stew. If you don't stir it up every once in a while then a layer of scum floats to the top.

2921.author: Edward Abbey
2921.quote: Love implies anger. The man who is angered by nothing cares about nothing.

2922.author: Edward Abbey
2922.quote: Our culture runs on coffee and gasoline, the first often tasting like the second.

2923.author: Edward Abbey
2923.quote: Grown men do not need leaders.

2924.author: Edward Abbey
2924.quote: The tragedy of modern war is that the young men die fighting each other - instead of their real enemies back home in the capitals.

2925.author: Edward Abbey
2925.quote: Climbing K2 or floating the Grand Canyon in an inner tube; there are some things one would rather have done than do.

2926.author: Edward Abbey
2926.quote: The missionaries go forth to Christianize the savages - as if the savages weren't dangerous enough already.

2927.author: Edward Abbey
2927.quote: Say what you like about my bloody murderous government,' I says, 'but don't insult me poor bleedin' country.

2928.author: Edward Abbey
2928.quote: Anarchism is founded on the observation that since few men are wise enough to rule themselves, even fewer are wise enough to rule others.

2929.author: Edward Abbey
2929.quote: Belief in the supernatural reflects a failure of the imagination.

2930.author: Edward Abbey
2930.quote: That which today calls itself science gives us more and more information, and indigestible glut of information, and less and less understanding.

2931.author: Edward Abbey
2931.quote: What is the purpose of the giant sequoia tree? The purpose of the giant sequoia tree is to provide shade for the tiny titmouse.

2932.author: Edward Abbey
2932.quote: Our 'neoconservatives' are neither new nor conservative, but old as Bablyon and evil as Hell.

2933.author: Edward Abbey
2933.quote: Taxation: how the sheep are shorn.

2934.author: Edward Abbey
2934.quote: A drink a day keeps the shrink away.

2935.author: Elbert Hubbard
2935.quote: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.

2936.author: Elbert Hubbard
2936.quote: The best preparation for good work tomorrow is to do good work today.

2937.author: Elbert Hubbard
2937.quote: Do your work with your whole heart, and you will succeed - there's so little competition.

2938.author: Elbert Hubbard
2938.quote: He who does not understand your silence will probably not understand your words.

2939.author: Elbert Hubbard
2939.quote: A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.

2940.author: Elbert Hubbard
2940.quote: Positive anything is better than negative nothing.

2941.author: Elbert Hubbard
2941.quote: Be pleasant until ten o'clock in the morning and the rest of the day will take care of itself.

2942.author: Elbert Hubbard
2942.quote: If you suffer, thank God! It is a sure sign that you are alive.

2943.author: Elbert Hubbard
2943.quote: Know what you want to do, hold the thought firmly, and do every day what should be done, and every sunset will see you that much nearer to your goal.

2944.author: Elbert Hubbard
2944.quote: Never explain - your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.

2945.author: Elbert Hubbard
2945.quote: A little more persistence, a little more effort, and what seemed hopeless failure may turn to glorious success.

2946.author: Elbert Hubbard
2946.quote: To avoid criticism, do nothing, say nothing, and be nothing.

2947.author: Elbert Hubbard
2947.quote: The highest reward that God gives us for good work is the ability to do better work.

2948.author: Elbert Hubbard
2948.quote: God will not look you over for medals degrees or diplomas, but for scars.

2949.author: Elbert Hubbard
2949.quote: One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.

2950.author: Elbert Hubbard
2950.quote: The greatest mistake you can make in life is continually fearing that you'll make one.

2951.author: Elbert Hubbard
2951.quote: Art is not a thing; it is a way.

2952.author: Elbert Hubbard
2952.quote: The final proof of greatness lies in being able to endure criticism without resentment.

2953.author: Elbert Hubbard
2953.quote: Responsibility is the price of freedom.

2954.author: Elbert Hubbard
2954.quote: The sculptor produces the beautiful statue by chipping away such parts of the marble block as are not needed - it is a process of elimination.

2955.author: Elbert Hubbard
2955.quote: Friendship, like credit, is highest when it is not used.

2956.author: Elbert Hubbard
2956.quote: There is no failure except in no longer trying.

2957.author: Elbert Hubbard
2957.quote: Little minds are interested in the extraordinary; great minds in the commonplace.

2958.author: Elbert Hubbard
2958.quote: Fear is the thought of admitted inferiority.

2959.author: Elbert Hubbard
2959.quote: Life in abundance comes only through great love.

2960.author: Elbert Hubbard
2960.quote: It's pretty hard to be efficient without being obnoxious.

2961.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2961.quote: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.

2962.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2962.quote: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

2963.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2963.quote: You gain strength, courage, and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.'

2964.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2964.quote: A woman is like a tea bag - you can't tell how strong she is until you put her in hot water.

2965.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2965.quote: Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people.

2966.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2966.quote: We are afraid to care too much, for fear that the other person does not care at all.

2967.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2967.quote: You must do the things you think you cannot do.

2968.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2968.quote: In the long run, we shape our lives, and we shape ourselves. The process never ends until we die. And the choices we make are ultimately our own responsibility.

2969.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2969.quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.

2970.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2970.quote: Justice cannot be for one side alone, but must be for both.

2972.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2972.quote: The giving of love is an education in itself.

2973.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2973.quote: It is not fair to ask of others what you are not willing to do yourself.

2974.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2974.quote: People grow through experience if they meet life honestly and courageously. This is how character is built.

2975.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2975.quote: I think, at a child's birth, if a mother could ask a fairy godmother to endow it with the most useful gift, that gift should be curiosity.

2976.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2976.quote: One's philosophy is not best expressed in words; it is expressed in the choices one makes... and the choices we make are ultimately our responsibility.

2977.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2977.quote: If life were predictable it would cease to be life, and be without flavor.

2978.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2978.quote: It is not more vacation we need - it is more vocation.

2979.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2979.quote: Happiness is not a goal; it is a by-product.

2980.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2980.quote: Do what you feel in your heart to be right- for you'll be criticized anyway. You'll be damned if you do, and damned if you don't.

2981.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2981.quote: When you cease to make a contribution, you begin to die.

2982.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2982.quote: I once had a rose named after me and I was very flattered. But I was not pleased to read the description in the catalogue: no good in a bed, but fine up against a wall.

2983.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2983.quote: Never allow a person to tell you no who doesn't have the power to say yes.

2984.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2984.quote: You can never really live anyone else's life, not even your child's. The influence you exert is through your own life, and what you've become yourself.

2985.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2985.quote: It takes as much energy to wish as it does to plan.

2986.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
2986.quote: A little simplification would be the first step toward rational living, I think.

2987.author: Elie Wiesel
2987.quote: We must take sides. Neutrality helps the oppressor, never the victim. Silence encourages the tormentor, never the tormented.

2988.author: Elie Wiesel
2988.quote: Without memory, there is no culture. Without memory, there would be no civilization, no society, no future.

2989.author: Elie Wiesel
2989.quote: For me, every hour is grace. And I feel gratitude in my heart each time I can meet someone and look at his or her smile.

2990.author: Elie Wiesel
2990.quote: When a person doesn't have gratitude, something is missing in his or her humanity.

2991.author: Elie Wiesel
2991.quote: There may be times when we are powerless to prevent injustice, but there must never be a time when we fail to protest.

2992.author: Elie Wiesel
2992.quote: In the concentration camps, we discovered this whole universe where everyone had his place. The killer came to kill, and the victims came to die.

2993.author: Elie Wiesel
2993.quote: The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference.

2994.author: Elie Wiesel
2994.quote: Wherever men and women are persecuted because of their race, religion, or political views, that place must - at that moment - become the center of the universe.

2995.author: Elie Wiesel
2995.quote: It all happened so fast. The ghetto. The deportation. The sealed cattle car. The fiery altar upon which the history of our people and the future of mankind were meant to be sacrificed.

2996.author: Elie Wiesel
2996.quote: I decided to devote my life to telling the story because I felt that having survived I owe something to the dead. and anyone who does not remember betrays them again.

2997.author: Elie Wiesel
2997.quote: Someone who hates one group will end up hating everyone - and, ultimately, hating himself or herself.

2998.author: Elie Wiesel
2998.quote: No human race is superior; no religious faith is inferior. All collective judgments are wrong. Only racists make them.

2999.author: Elie Wiesel
2999.quote: Mankind must remember that peace is not God's gift to his creatures; peace is our gift to each other.

3000.author: Elie Wiesel
3000.quote: Words can sometimes, in moments of grace, attain the quality of deeds.

3001.author: Elie Wiesel
3001.quote: Look, if I were alone in the world, I would have the right to choose despair, solitude and self-fulfillment. But I am not alone.

3002.author: Elie Wiesel
3002.quote: Most people think that shadows follow, precede or surround beings or objects. The truth is that they also surround words, ideas, desires, deeds, impulses and memories.

3003.author: Elie Wiesel
3003.quote: Because I remember, I despair. Because I remember, I have the duty to reject despair.

3004.author: Elie Wiesel
3004.quote: When a person doesn't have gratitude, something is missing in his or her humanity. A person can almost be defined by his or her attitude toward gratitude.

3005.author: Elie Wiesel
3005.quote: Hope is like peace. It is not a gift from God. It is a gift only we can give one another.

3006.author: Elie Wiesel
3006.quote: My greatest disappointment is that I believe that those of us who went through the war and tried to write about it, about their experience, became messengers. We have given the message, and nothing changed.

3007.author: Elie Wiesel
3007.quote: Religion is not man's relationship to God, it is man's relationship to man.

3008.author: Elie Wiesel
3008.quote: Indifference, to me, is the epitome of evil.

3009.author: Elie Wiesel
3009.quote: Peace is our gift to each other.

3010.author: Elie Wiesel
3010.quote: Now, when I hear that Christians are getting together in order to defend the people of Israel, of course it brings joy to my heart. And it simply says, look, people have learned from history.

3011.author: Elie Wiesel
3011.quote: I remember, May 1944: I was 15-and-a-half, and I was thrown into a haunted universe where the story of the human adventure seemed to swing irrevocably between horror and malediction.

3012.author: Elie Wiesel
3012.quote: It used to be said that when the Baal Shem Tov came into a town, his impact was so strong, he didn't have to speak. His disciples had to dance or to sing or to preach to have the same effect. I think a real messenger, myself or anyone, by the very fact that he is there as a person, as a symbol, could have the same impact.

3013.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3013.quote: People are like stained - glass windows. They sparkle and shine when the sun is out, but when the darkness sets in, their true beauty is revealed only if there is a light from within.

3014.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3014.quote: The most beautiful people we have known are those who have known defeat, known suffering, known struggle, known loss, and have found their way out of those depths.

3015.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3015.quote: Learning lessons is a little like reaching maturity. You're not suddenly more happy, wealthy, or powerful, but you understand the world around you better, and you're at peace with yourself. Learning life's lessons is not about making your life perfect, but about seeing life as it was meant to be.

3016.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3016.quote: Learn to get in touch with the silence within yourself, and know that everything in life has purpose. There are no mistakes, no coincidences, all events are blessings given to us to learn from.

3017.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3017.quote: The ultimate lesson all of us have to learn is unconditional love, which includes not only others but ourselves as well.

3018.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3018.quote: The five stages - denial, anger, bargaining, depression, and acceptance - are a part of the framework that makes up our learning to live with the one we lost. They are tools to help us frame and identify what we may be feeling. But they are not stops on some linear timeline in grief.

3019.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3019.quote: It is important to feel the anger without judging it, without attempting to find meaning in it. It may take many forms: anger at the health-care system, at life, at your loved one for leaving. Life is unfair. Death is unfair. Anger is a natural reaction to the unfairness of loss.

3020.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3020.quote: It's only when we truly know and understand that we have a limited time on earth - and that we have no way of knowing when our time is up, we will then begin to live each day to the fullest, as if it was the only one we had.

3021.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3021.quote: Denial helps us to pace our feelings of grief. There is a grace in denial. It is nature's way of letting in only as much as we can handle.

3022.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3022.quote: Should you shield the canyons from the windstorms you would never see the true beauty of their carvings.

3023.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3023.quote: Those who learned to know death, rather than to fear and fight it, become our teachers about life.

3024.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3024.quote: It is inconceivable for our unconscious to imagine an actual ending of our own life here on Earth, and if this life of ours has to end, the ending is always attributed to a malicious intervention from the outside by someone else.

3025.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3025.quote: Live, so you do not have to look back and say: 'God, how I have wasted my life.'

3026.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3026.quote: Those who have the strength and the love to sit with a dying patient in the silence that goes beyond words will know that this moment is neither frightening nor painful, but a peaceful cessation of the functioning of the body.

3027.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3027.quote: The simple life on the farm was everything to me. Nothing was more relaxing after a long plane flight than to reach the winding driveway that led up to my house. The quiet of the night was more soothing than a sleeping pill.

3028.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3028.quote: When we grow older and begin to realize that our omnipotence is really not so omnipotent, that our strongest wishes are not powerful enough to make the impossible possible, the fear that we have contributed to the death of a loved one diminishes - and with it, the guilt.

3029.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3029.quote: It is not the end of the physical body that should worry us. Rather, our concern must be to live while we're alive - to release our inner selves from the spiritual death that comes with living behind a facade designed to conform to external definitions of who and what we are.

3030.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3030.quote: The opinion which other people have of you is their problem, not yours.

3031.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3031.quote: Consciously or not, we are all on a quest for answers, trying to learn the lessons of life. We grapple with fear and guilt. We search for meaning, love, and power. We try to understand fear, loss, and time. We seek to discover who we are and how we can become truly happy.

3032.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3032.quote: We're put here on Earth to learn our own lessons. No one can tell you what your lessons are; it is part of your personal journey to discover them. On these journeys we may be given a lot, or just a little bit, of the things we must grapple with, but never more than we can handle.

3033.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3033.quote: It's only when we truly know and understand that we have a limited time on Earth - and that we have no way of knowing when our time is up - that we will begin to live each day to the fullest, as if it was the only one we had.

3034.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3034.quote: Watching a peaceful death of a human being reminds us of a falling star; one of a million lights in a vast sky that flares up for a brief moment only to disappear into the endless night forever.

3035.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3035.quote: I say to people who care for people who are dying, if you really love that person and want to help them, be with them when their end comes close. Sit with them - you don't even have to talk. You don't have to do anything but really be there with them.

3036.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3036.quote: My work with AIDS patients started right at the beginning of the epidemic, totally unplanned and spontaneous, as all my work had proceeded in the previous two decades, if it were not already my whole life-style! In the early eighties, we knew very little about this peculiar disease.

3037.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
3037.quote: As far as service goes, it can take the form of a million things. To do service, you don't have to be a doctor working in the slums for free, or become a social worker. Your position in life and what you do doesn't matter as much as how you do what you do.

3038.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
