4112.quote: The real lover of cats is one who demands a clearer adjustment to the universe than ordinary household platitudes provide; one who refuses to swallow the sentimental notion that all good people love dogs, children, and horses while all bad people dislike and are disliked by such.

4113.author: H. P. Lovecraft
4113.quote: I am essentially a recluse who will have very little to do with people wherever he may be. I think that most people only make me nervous - that only by accident, and in extremely small quantities, would I ever be likely to come across people who wouldn't.

4114.author: H. P. Lovecraft
4114.quote: One can never produce anything as terrible and impressive as one can awesomely hint about.

4115.author: H. P. Lovecraft
4115.quote: Ocean is more ancient than the mountains, and freighted with the memories and the dreams of Time.

4116.author: H. P. Lovecraft
4116.quote: Searchers after horror haunt strange, far places.

4117.author: H. P. Lovecraft
4117.quote: From even the greatest of horrors, irony is seldom absent.

4118.author: H. P. Lovecraft
4118.quote: Science, already oppressive with its shocking revelations, will perhaps be the ultimate exterminator of our human species - if separate species we be - for its reserve of unguessed horrors could never be borne by mortal brains if loosed upon the world.

4119.author: H. P. Lovecraft
4119.quote: In theory I am an agnostic, but pending the appearance of rational evidence, I must be classed, practically and provisionally, as an atheist.

4120.author: H. P. Lovecraft
4120.quote: Denied anything ardently desired, the individual or state will argue and parley just so long - then, if the impelling motive be sufficiently great, will cast aside every rule and break down every acquired inhibition, plunging viciously after the object wished; all the more fantastically savage because of previous repression.

4121.author: Hans Christian Andersen
4121.quote: Just living is not enough... one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower.

4123.author: Hans Christian Andersen
4123.quote: Life itself is the most wonderful fairy tale.

4124.author: Hans Christian Andersen
4124.quote: Every man's life is a fairy tale written by God's fingers.

4125.author: Hans Christian Andersen
4125.quote: Being born in a duck yard does not matter, if only you are hatched from a swan's egg.

4126.author: Hans Christian Andersen
4126.quote: Most of the people who will walk after me will be children, so make the beat keep time with short steps.

4128.author: Hans Christian Andersen
4128.quote: My life is a lovely story, happy and full of incident.

4129.author: Harriet Tubman
4129.quote: Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.

4130.author: Harriet Tubman
4130.quote: Now I've been free, I know what a dreadful condition slavery is. I have seen hundreds of escaped slaves, but I never saw one who was willing to go back and be a slave.

4131.author: Harriet Tubman
4131.quote: I think slavery is the next thing to hell. If a person would send another into bondage, he would, it appears to me, be bad enough to send him into hell if he could.

4132.author: Harriet Tubman
4132.quote: I was the conductor of the Underground Railroad for eight years, and I can say what most conductors can't say; I never ran my train off the track and I never lost a passenger.

4133.author: Harriet Tubman
4133.quote: I had crossed the line. I was free; but there was no one to welcome me to the land of freedom. I was a stranger in a strange land.

4134.author: Harriet Tubman
4134.quote: Twasn't me, 'twas the Lord! I always told Him, 'I trust to you. I don't know where to go or what to do, but I expect You to lead me,' an' He always did.

4135.author: Harriet Tubman
4135.quote: I grew up like a neglected weed - ignorant of liberty, having no experience of it.

4136.author: Harriet Tubman
4136.quote: In my dreams and visions, I seemed to see a line, and on the other side of that line were green fields, and lovely flowers, and beautiful white ladies, who stretched out their arms to me over the line, but I couldn't reach them no-how. I always fell before I got to the line.

4137.author: Harriet Tubman
4137.quote: I would fight for my liberty so long as my strength lasted, and if the time came for me to go, the Lord would let them take me.

4138.author: Harriet Tubman
4138.quote: I looked at my hands to see if I was the same person. There was such a glory over everything. The sun came up like gold through the trees, and I felt like I was in heaven.

4139.author: Harriet Tubman
4139.quote: Never wound a snake; kill it.

4140.author: Harriet Tubman
4140.quote: I never had anything good, no sweet, no sugar; and that sugar, right by me, did look so nice, and my mistress's back was turned to me while she was fighting with her husband, so I just put my fingers in the sugar bowl to take one lump, and maybe she heard me, for she turned and saw me. The next minute, she had the rawhide down.

4141.author: Harriet Tubman
4141.quote: I've heard 'Uncle Tom's Cabin' read, and I tell you Mrs. Stowe's pen hasn't begun to paint what slavery is as I have seen it at the far South. I've seen de real thing, and I don't want to see it on no stage or in no theater.

4142.author: Harriet Tubman
4142.quote: I had reasoned this out in my mind, there was one of two things I had a right to, liberty or death; if I could not have one, I would have the other.

4143.author: Harriet Tubman
4143.quote: I said to de Lord, 'I'm goin' to hold steady on to you, an' I know you'll see me through.'

4145.author: Harriet Tubman
4145.quote: As I lay so sick on my bed, from Christmas till March, I was always praying for poor ole master. 'Pears like I didn't do nothing but pray for ole master. 'Oh, Lord, convert ole master;' 'Oh, dear Lord, change dat man's heart, and make him a Christian.'

4146.author: Harriet Tubman
4146.quote: I think there's many a slaveholder'll get to Heaven. They don't know better. They acts up to the light they have.

4147.author: Harriet Tubman
4147.quote: Lord, I'm going to hold steady on to You and You've got to see me through.

4148.author: Harriet Tubman
4148.quote: Quakers almost as good as colored. They call themselves friends and you can trust them every time.

4149.author: Harriet Tubman
4149.quote: Most of those coming from the mainland are very destitute, almost naked. I am trying to find places for those able to work, and provide for them as best I can, so as to lighten the burden on the Government as much as possible, while at the same time they learn to respect themselves by earning their own living.

4151.author: Harriet Tubman
4151.quote: I had two sisters carried away in a chain-gang - one of them left two children. We were always uneasy.

4152.author: Harriet Tubman
4152.quote: 'Pears like my heart go flutter, flutter, and then they may say, 'Peace, Peace,' as much as they likes - I know it's goin' to be war!

4153.author: Harriet Tubman
4153.quote: Read my letter to the old folks, and give my love to them, and tell my brothers to be always watching unto prayer, and when the good old ship of Zion comes along, to be ready to step aboard.

4154.author: Harriet Tubman
4154.quote: Why, der language down dar in de far South is jus' as different from ours in Maryland, as you can think. Dey laughed when dey heard me talk, an' I could not understand 'dem, no how.

4155.author: Harry S Truman
4155.quote: America was not built on fear. America was built on courage, on imagination and an unbeatable determination to do the job at hand.

4156.author: Harry S Truman
4156.quote: It is amazing what you can accomplish if you do not care who gets the credit.

4157.author: Harry S Truman
4157.quote: Men make history and not the other way around. In periods where there is no leadership, society stands still. Progress occurs when courageous, skillful leaders seize the opportunity to change things for the better.

4158.author: Harry S Truman
4158.quote: There is nothing new in the world except the history you do not know.

4159.author: Harry S Truman
4159.quote: I never did give anybody hell. I just told the truth and they thought it was hell.

4160.author: Harry S Truman
4160.quote: Actions are the seed of fate deeds grow into destiny.

4161.author: Harry S Truman
4161.quote: You want a friend in Washington? Get a dog.

4162.author: Harry S Truman
4162.quote: A leader in the Democratic Party is a boss, in the Republican Party he is a leader.

4163.author: Harry S Truman
4163.quote: If you can't convince them, confuse them.

4164.author: Harry S Truman
4164.quote: If you can't stand the heat, get out of the kitchen.

4165.author: Harry S Truman
4165.quote: In reading the lives of great men, I found that the first victory they won was over themselves... self-discipline with all of them came first.

4166.author: Harry S Truman
4166.quote: You can never get all the facts from just one newspaper, and unless you have all the facts, you cannot make proper judgements about what is going on.

4167.author: Harry S Truman
4167.quote: When you have an efficient government, you have a dictatorship.

4168.author: Harry S Truman
4168.quote: A pessimist is one who makes difficulties of his opportunities and an optimist is one who makes opportunities of his difficulties.

4169.author: Harry S Truman
4169.quote: When even one American - who has done nothing wrong - is forced by fear to shut his mind and close his mouth - then all Americans are in peril.

4170.author: Harry S Truman
4170.quote: The atom bomb was no 'great decision.' It was merely another powerful weapon in the arsenal of righteousness.

4171.author: Harry S Truman
4171.quote: The United Nations is designed to make possible lasting freedom and independence for all its members.

4172.author: Harry S Truman
4172.quote: Those who want the Government to regulate matters of the mind and spirit are like men who are so afraid of being murdered that they commit suicide to avoid assassination.

4173.author: Harry S Truman
4173.quote: It is understanding that gives us an ability to have peace. When we understand the other fellow's viewpoint, and he understands ours, then we can sit down and work out our differences.

4174.author: Harry S Truman
4174.quote: Intense feeling too often obscures the truth.

4175.author: Harry S Truman
4175.quote: Whenever you put a man on the Supreme Court he ceases to be your friend.

4176.author: Harry S Truman
4176.quote: My father was not a failure. After all, he was the father of a president of the United States.

4177.author: Harry S Truman
4177.quote: The reward of suffering is experience.

4178.author: Harry S Truman
4178.quote: The Marine Corps is the Navy's police force and as long as I am President that is what it will remain. They have a propaganda machine that is almost equal to Stalin's.

4179.author: Harry S Truman
4179.quote: I remember when I first came to Washington. For the first six months you wonder how the hell you ever got here. For the next six months you wonder how the hell the rest of them ever got here.

4180.author: Harry S Truman
4180.quote: Any man who has had the job I've had and didn't have a sense of humor wouldn't still be here.

4181.author: Hedy Lamarr
4181.quote: Any girl can be glamorous. All you have to do is stand still and look stupid.

4182.author: Hedy Lamarr
4182.quote: All creative people want to do the unexpected.

4183.author: Hedy Lamarr
4183.quote: A good painting to me has always been like a friend. It keeps me company, comforts and inspires.

4184.author: Hedy Lamarr
4184.quote: Because you don't live near a bakery doesn't mean you have to go without cheesecake.

4185.author: Hedy Lamarr
4185.quote: I am not ashamed to say that no man I ever met was my father's equal, and I never loved any other man as much.

4186.author: Hedy Lamarr
4186.quote: Perhaps my problem in marriage - and it is the problem of many women - was to want both intimacy and independence. It is a difficult line to walk, yet both needs are important to a marriage.

4187.author: Hedy Lamarr
4187.quote: I don't believe in life after death. But I do believe in some grinding destiny that watches over us on earth. If I didn't, the safety valve would give and the boiler would explode.

4188.author: Hedy Lamarr
4188.quote: I must quit marrying men who feel inferior to me. Somewhere there must be a man who could be my husband and not feel inferior.

4189.author: Hedy Lamarr
4189.quote: To be a star is to own the world and all the people in it. After a taste of stardom, everything else is poverty.

4190.author: Hedy Lamarr
4190.quote: I can excuse everything but boredom. Boring people don't have to stay that way.

4191.author: Hedy Lamarr
4191.quote: I don't fear death because I don't fear anything I don't understand. When I start to think about it, I order a massage and it goes away.

4192.author: Hedy Lamarr
4192.quote: I have never seen a wrestling match or a prize fight, and I don't want to. When I find out a man is interested in these sports, I drop him.

4193.author: Hedy Lamarr
4193.quote: I advise everybody not to save: spend your money. Most people save all their lives and leave it to somebody else. Money is to be enjoyed.

4194.author: Hedy Lamarr
4194.quote: I know why most people never get rich. They put the money ahead of the job. If you just think of the job, the money will automatically follow. This never fails.

4195.author: Hedy Lamarr
4195.quote: I have not been that wise. Health I have taken for granted. Love I have demanded, perhaps too much and too often. As for money, I have only realized its true worth when I didn't have it.

4196.author: Hedy Lamarr
4196.quote: I've been an important star and lived a full life, yet I only hve three close friends. I guess that's all anyone can expect.

4197.author: Hedy Lamarr
4197.quote: It's funny about men and women. Men pay in cash to get them and pay in cash to get rid of them. Women pay emotionally coming and going. Neither has it easy.

4198.author: Hedy Lamarr
4198.quote: When I attained a certain advanced intimacy with a man, and I don't just mean sex, I married him.

4199.author: Hedy Lamarr
4199.quote: I'm a sworn enemy of convention. I despise the conventional in anything, even the arts.

4200.author: Hedy Lamarr
4200.quote: I was in constant demand, in my professional life and my personal life.

4201.author: Hedy Lamarr
4201.quote: Jack Kennedy always said to me, Hedy, get involved. That's the secret of life. Try everything. Join everything. Meet everybody.

4202.author: Hedy Lamarr
4202.quote: Compromise and tolerance are magic words. It took me 40 years to become philosophical.

4203.author: Hedy Lamarr
4203.quote: One of my favorite people is Gypsy Rose Lee. She bears out the Biblical promise that he who has, gets. And I hope she gets a lot more.

4204.author: Hedy Lamarr
4204.quote: All my six husbands married me for different reasons.

4205.author: Hedy Lamarr
4205.quote: I have always felt that if a man gives you a solid gold key to his door he is entitled to the courtesy of a visit.

4206.author: Hedy Lamarr
4206.quote: The ceremony took six minutes. The marriage lasted about the same amount of time though we didn't get a divorce for almost a year.

4207.author: Helen Keller
4207.quote: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.

4208.author: Helen Keller
4208.quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.

4209.author: Helen Keller
4209.quote: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.

4210.author: Helen Keller
4210.quote: Faith is the strength by which a shattered world shall emerge into the light.

4211.author: Helen Keller
4211.quote: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.

4212.author: Helen Keller
4212.quote: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, ambition inspired, and success achieved.

4213.author: Helen Keller
4213.quote: Never bend your head. Always hold it high. Look the world straight in the eye.

4214.author: Helen Keller
4214.quote: The highest result of education is tolerance.

4215.author: Helen Keller
4215.quote: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much.

4216.author: Helen Keller
4216.quote: The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.

4217.author: Helen Keller
4217.quote: So long as the memory of certain beloved friends lives in my heart, I shall say that life is good.

4218.author: Helen Keller
4218.quote: What I am looking for is not out there, it is in me.

4219.author: Helen Keller
4219.quote: Life is either a great adventure or nothing.

4220.author: Helen Keller
4220.quote: Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.

4221.author: Helen Keller
4221.quote: We could never learn to be brave and patient, if there were only joy in the world.

4222.author: Helen Keller
4222.quote: Love is like a beautiful flower which I may not touch, but whose fragrance makes the garden a place of delight just the same.

4223.author: Helen Keller
4223.quote: Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of men as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure, or nothing.

4224.author: Helen Keller
4224.quote: Your success and happiness lies in you. Resolve to keep happy, and your joy and you shall form an invincible host against difficulties.

4225.author: Helen Keller
4225.quote: While they were saying among themselves it cannot be done, it was done.

4226.author: Helen Keller
4226.quote: The most pathetic person in the world is someone who has sight, but has no vision.

4227.author: Helen Keller
4227.quote: Once I knew only darkness and stillness... my life was without past or future... but a little word from the fingers of another fell into my hand that clutched at emptiness, and my heart leaped to the rapture of living.

4228.author: Helen Keller
4228.quote: We can do anything we want to if we stick to it long enough.

4229.author: Helen Keller
4229.quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task, but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.

4230.author: Helen Keller
4230.quote: Everything has its wonders, even darkness and silence, and I learn, whatever state I may be in, therein to be content.

4231.author: Helen Keller
4231.quote: Until the great mass of the people shall be filled with the sense of responsibility for each other's welfare, social justice can never be attained.

4232.author: Helen Keller
4232.quote: It is a terrible thing to see and have no vision.

4233.author: Henny Youngman
4233.quote: If you're going to do something tonight that you'll be sorry for tomorrow morning, sleep late.

4234.author: Henny Youngman
4234.quote: The secret of a happy marriage remains a secret.

4235.author: Henny Youngman
4235.quote: Some people ask the secret of our long marriage. We take time to go to a restaurant two times a week. A little candlelight, dinner, soft music and dancing. She goes Tuesdays, I go Fridays.

4236.author: Henny Youngman
4236.quote: If at first you don't succeed... so much for skydiving.

4237.author: Henny Youngman
4237.quote: I told the doctor I broke my leg in two places. He told me to quit going to those places.

4238.author: Henny Youngman
4238.quote: A Jewish woman had two chickens. One got sick, so the woman made chicken soup out of the other one to help the sick one get well.

4239.author: Henny Youngman
4239.quote: While playing golf today I hit two good balls. I stepped on a rake.

4240.author: Henny Youngman
4240.quote: When I read about the evils of drinking, I gave up reading.

4241.author: Henny Youngman
4241.quote: Just got back from a pleasure trip: I took my mother-in-law to the airport.

4242.author: Henny Youngman
4242.quote: The horse I bet on was so slow, the jockey kept a diary of the trip.

4243.author: Henny Youngman
4243.quote: When I told my doctor I couldn't afford an operation, he offered to touch-up my X-rays.

4244.author: Henny Youngman
4244.quote: When God sneezed, I didn't know what to say.

4245.author: Henny Youngman
4245.quote: A doctor gave a man six months to live. The man couldn't pay his bill, so he gave him another six months.

4246.author: Henny Youngman
4246.quote: My wife dresses to kill. She cooks the same way.

4247.author: Henny Youngman
4247.quote: My other brother-in-law died. He was a karate expert, then joined the army. The first time he saluted, he killed himself.

4248.author: Henny Youngman
4248.quote: If my mother knew I did this for a living, she'd kill me. She thinks I'm selling dope.

4249.author: Henny Youngman
4249.quote: I know a man who doesn't pay to have his trash taken out. How does he get rid of his trash? He gift wraps it, and puts in into an unlocked car.

4250.author: Henny Youngman
4250.quote: This is an elegant hotel! Room service has an unlisted number.

4251.author: Henny Youngman
4251.quote: I've been in love with the same woman for forty-one years. If my wife finds out, she'll kill me.

4252.author: Henny Youngman
4252.quote: You look like a talent scout for a cemetery.

4253.author: Henny Youngman
4253.quote: I once wanted to become an atheist, but I gave up - they have no holidays.

4254.author: Henny Youngman
4254.quote: Do you know what it means to come home at night to a woman who'll give you a little love, a little affection, a little tenderness? It means you're in the wrong house, that's what it means.

4255.author: Henny Youngman
4255.quote: How to drive a guy crazy: send him a telegram and on the top put 'page 2.'

4256.author: Henny Youngman
4256.quote: My son complains about headaches. I tell him all the time, when you get out of bed, it's feet first!

4257.author: Henny Youngman
4257.quote: My grandmother is over eighty and still doesn't need glasses. Drinks right out of the bottle.

4258.author: Henny Youngman
4258.quote: I've got all the money I'll ever need, if I die by four o'clock.

4259.author: Henri Nouwen
4259.quote: Did I offer peace today? Did I bring a smile to someone's face? Did I say words of healing? Did I let go of my anger and resentment? Did I forgive? Did I love? These are the real questions. I must trust that the little bit of love that I sow now will bear many fruits, here in this world and the life to come.

4260.author: Henri Nouwen
4260.quote: Each day holds a surprise. But only if we expect it can we see, hear, or feel it when it comes to us. Let's not be afraid to receive each day's surprise, whether it comes to us as sorrow or as joy It will open a new place in our hearts, a place where we can welcome new friends and celebrate more fully our shared humanity.

4261.author: Henri Nouwen
4261.quote: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.

4262.author: Henri Nouwen
4262.quote: Friendship has always belonged to the core of my spiritual journey.

4263.author: Henri Nouwen
4263.quote: When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives means the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand.

4264.author: Henri Nouwen
4264.quote: The discipline of gratitude is the explicit effort to acknowledge that all I am and have is given to me as a gift of love, a gift to be celebrated with joy.

4265.author: Henri Nouwen
4265.quote: Perhaps nothing helps us make the movement from our little selves to a larger world than remembering God in gratitude. Such a perspective puts God in view in all of life, not just in the moments we set aside for worship or spiritual disciplines. Not just in the moments when life seems easy.

4266.author: Henri Nouwen
4266.quote: To learn patience is not to rebel against every hardship.

4267.author: Henri Nouwen
4267.quote: If fear is the great enemy of intimacy, love is its true friend.

4268.author: Henri Nouwen
4268.quote: Prayer is the beginning and the end, the source and the fruit, the core and the content, the basis and the goal of all peacemaking.

4269.author: Henri Nouwen
4269.quote: The spiritual life is not a life before, after, or beyond our everyday existence. No, the spiritual life can only be real when it is lived in the midst of the pains and joys of the here and now.

4270.author: Henri Nouwen
4270.quote: To be a Christian who is willing to travel with Christ on his downward road requires being willing to detach oneself constantly from any need to be relevant, and to trust ever more deeply the Word of God.

4271.author: Henri Nouwen
4271.quote: Somewhere we know that without silence words lose their meaning, that without listening speaking no longer heals, that without distance closeness cannot cure.

4272.author: Henri Nouwen
4272.quote: Our first responsibility in the midst of violence is to prevent it from destroying us.

4273.author: Henri Nouwen
4273.quote: When you recognize the festive and the still moments as moments of prayer, then you gradually realize that to pray is to live.

4274.author: Henri Nouwen
4274.quote: The greatest trap in our life is not success, popularity or power, but self-rejection.

4275.author: Henri Nouwen
4275.quote: A life without a lonely place, that is, without a quiet center, becomes destructive.

4276.author: Henri Nouwen
4276.quote: One of the main tasks of theology is to find words that do not divide but unite, that do not create conflict but unity, that do not hurt but heal.

4277.author: Henri Nouwen
4277.quote: To give someone a blessing is the most significant affirmation we can offer.

4278.author: Henri Nouwen
4278.quote: God is a God of the present. God is always in the moment, be that moment hard or easy, joyful and painful.

4279.author: Henri Nouwen
4279.quote: Prayer is the most concrete way to make our home in God.

4280.author: Henri Nouwen
4280.quote: Living in a community with very wounded people, I came to see that I had lived most of my life as a tightrope artist trying to walk on a high, thin cable from one tower to the other, always waiting for the applause when I had not fallen off and broken my leg.

4281.author: Henri Nouwen
4281.quote: Our glory is hidden in our pain, if we allow God to bring the gift of himself in our experience of it.

4282.author: Henri Nouwen
4282.quote: One of the most beautiful ways for spiritual formation to take place is to let your insecurity lead you closer to the Lord. Natural hypersensitivity can become an asset; it makes you aware of your need to be with people and it allows you to be more willing to look at their needs.

4283.author: Henri Nouwen
4283.quote: Solitude is very different from a 'time-out' from our busy lives. Solitude is the very ground from which community grows. Whenever we pray alone, study, read, write, or simply spend quiet time away from the places where we interact with each other directly, we are potentially opened for a deeper intimacy with each other.

4284.author: Henri Nouwen
4284.quote: Intimacy is not a happy medium. It is a way of being in which the tension between distance and closeness is dissolved and a new horizon appears. Intimacy is beyond fear.

4285.author: Henry David Thoreau
4285.quote: I am grateful for what I am and have. My thanksgiving is perpetual.

4286.author: Henry David Thoreau
4286.quote: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.

4287.author: Henry David Thoreau
4287.quote: True friendship can afford true knowledge. It does not depend on darkness and ignorance.

4288.author: Henry David Thoreau
4288.quote: An early-morning walk is a blessing for the whole day.

4289.author: Henry David Thoreau
4289.quote: It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.

4290.author: Henry David Thoreau
4290.quote: Friends... they cherish one another's hopes. They are kind to one another's dreams.

4291.author: Henry David Thoreau
4291.quote: Many men go fishing all of their lives without knowing that it is not fish they are after.

4292.author: Henry David Thoreau
4292.quote: Pursue some path, however narrow and crooked, in which you can walk with love and reverence.

4293.author: Henry David Thoreau
4293.quote: Thank God men cannot fly, and lay waste the sky as well as the earth.

4294.author: Henry David Thoreau
4294.quote: Nature will bear the closest inspection. She invites us to lay our eye level with her smallest leaf, and take an insect view of its plain.

4295.author: Henry David Thoreau
4295.quote: This world is but a canvas to our imagination.

4296.author: Henry David Thoreau
4296.quote: You must live in the present, launch yourself on every wave, find your eternity in each moment.

4297.author: Henry David Thoreau
4297.quote: Never look back unless you are planning to go that way.

4298.author: Henry David Thoreau
4298.quote: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.

4299.author: Henry David Thoreau
4299.quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.

4300.author: Henry David Thoreau
4300.quote: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.

4301.author: Henry David Thoreau
4301.quote: If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music which he hears, however measured or far away.

4302.author: Henry David Thoreau
4302.quote: Truths and roses have thorns about them.

4303.author: Henry David Thoreau
4303.quote: Do what you love. Know your own bone; gnaw at it, bury it, unearth it, and gnaw it still.

4304.author: Henry David Thoreau
4304.quote: It is better to have your head in the clouds, and know where you are... than to breathe the clearer atmosphere below them, and think that you are in paradise.

4305.author: Henry David Thoreau
4305.quote: What lies behind us and what lies ahead of us are tiny matters compared to what lives within us.

4306.author: Henry David Thoreau
4306.quote: I would rather sit on a pumpkin and have it all to myself, than be crowded on a velvet cushion.

4307.author: Henry David Thoreau
4307.quote: Goodness is the only investment that never fails.

4308.author: Henry David Thoreau
4308.quote: The price of anything is the amount of life you exchange for it.

4309.author: Henry David Thoreau
4309.quote: Live your life, do your work, then take your hat.

4310.author: Henry David Thoreau
4310.quote: I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived.

4311.author: Henry Ford
4311.quote: My best friend is the one who brings out the best in me.

4312.author: Henry Ford
4312.quote: Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.

4313.author: Henry Ford
4313.quote: If everyone is moving forward together, then success takes care of itself.

4314.author: Henry Ford
4314.quote: Quality means doing it right when no one is looking.

4315.author: Henry Ford
4315.quote: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.

4316.author: Henry Ford
4316.quote: If you think you can do a thing or think you can't do a thing, you're right.

4317.author: Henry Ford
4317.quote: Thinking is the hardest work there is, which is probably the reason why so few engage in it.

4318.author: Henry Ford
4318.quote: Even a mistake may turn out to be the one thing necessary to a worthwhile achievement.

4319.author: Henry Ford
4319.quote: Don't find fault, find a remedy.

4320.author: Henry Ford
4320.quote: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.

4321.author: Henry Ford
4321.quote: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.

4322.author: Henry Ford
4322.quote: A business that makes nothing but money is a poor business.

4323.author: Henry Ford
4323.quote: Life is a series of experiences, each one of which makes us bigger, even though sometimes it is hard to realize this. For the world was built to develop character, and we must learn that the setbacks and grieves which we endure help us in our marching onward.

4324.author: Henry Ford
4324.quote: Enthusiasm is the yeast that makes your hopes shine to the stars. Enthusiasm is the sparkle in your eyes, the swing in your gait. The grip of your hand, the irresistible surge of will and energy to execute your ideas.

4325.author: Henry Ford
4325.quote: If there is any one secret of success, it lies in the ability to get the other person's point of view and see things from that person's angle as well as from your own.

4326.author: Henry Ford
4326.quote: Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.

4327.author: Henry Ford
4327.quote: Whether you think that you can, or that you can't, you are usually right.

4328.author: Henry Ford
4328.quote: Most people spend more time and energy going around problems than in trying to solve them.

4329.author: Henry Ford
4329.quote: Before everything else, getting ready is the secret of success.

4330.author: Henry Ford
4330.quote: The highest use of capital is not to make more money, but to make money do more for the betterment of life.

4331.author: Henry Ford
4331.quote: You can't learn in school what the world is going to do next year.

4332.author: Henry Ford
4332.quote: A business absolutely devoted to service will have only one worry about profits. They will be embarrassingly large.

4333.author: Henry Ford
4333.quote: Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young. The greatest thing in life is to keep your mind young.

4334.author: Henry Ford
4334.quote: There is no man living that can not do more than he thinks he can.

4335.author: Henry Ford
4335.quote: Any colour - so long as it's black.

4336.author: Henry Ford
4336.quote: There is one rule for the industrialist and that is: Make the best quality of goods possible at the lowest cost possible, paying the highest wages possible.

4337.author: Henry Rollins
4337.quote: Loneliness adds beauty to life. It puts a special burn on sunsets and makes night air smell better.

4338.author: Henry Rollins
4338.quote: It's sad when someone you know becomes someone you knew.

4339.author: Henry Rollins
4339.quote: I have come to regard November as the older, harder man's October. I appreciate the early darkness and cooler temperatures. It puts my mind in a different place than October. It is a month for a quieter, slightly more subdued celebration of summer's death as winter tightens its grip.

4340.author: Henry Rollins
4340.quote: The month of November makes me feel that life is passing more quickly. In an effort to slow it down, I try to fill the hours more meaningfully.

4341.author: Henry Rollins
4341.quote: Pizza makes me think that anything is possible.

4342.author: Henry Rollins
4342.quote: Scar tissue is stronger than regular tissue. Realize the strength, move on.

4343.author: Henry Rollins
4343.quote: Don't do anything by half. If you love someone, love them with all your soul. When you go to work, work your ass off. When you hate someone, hate them until it hurts.

4344.author: Henry Rollins
4344.quote: Weakness is what brings ignorance, cheapness, racism, homophobia, desperation, cruelty, brutality, all these things that will keep a society chained to the ground, one foot nailed to the floor.

4345.author: Henry Rollins
4345.quote: We all learn lessons in life. Some stick, some don't. I have always learned more from rejection and failure than from acceptance and success.

4346.author: Henry Rollins
4346.quote: My optimism wears heavy boots and is loud.

4347.author: Henry Rollins
4347.quote: You need a little bit of insanity to do great things.

4348.author: Henry Rollins
4348.quote: Yes, I guess you could say I am a loner, but I feel more lonely in a crowed room with boring people than I feel on my own.

4349.author: Henry Rollins
4349.quote: I spend several days at a time without enough sleep. At first, normal activities become annoying. When you are too tired to eat, you really need some sleep. A few days later, things become strange. Loud noises become louder and more startling, familiar sounds become unfamiliar, and life reinvents itself as a surrealist dream.

4350.author: Henry Rollins
4350.quote: I am on until I am dead, like a light bulb.

4351.author: Henry Rollins
4351.quote: I think that humans have a huge capacity to carry pain and sadness. There are things that haunt us our entire lives; we are unable to let them go. The good times seem almost effervescent and dreamlike in comparison with the times that didn't go so well.

4353.author: Henry Rollins
4353.quote: The blues is losing someone you love and not having enough money to immerse yourself in drink.

4354.author: Henry Rollins
4354.quote: Now and then, someone is able to look at an empty space, conclude it would be a great place to start a revolution, and bravely go forward.

4355.author: Henry Rollins
4355.quote: It took me until my teenage years to realize that I was medicating with music. I was pushing back against my stupid school uniform, instructors who called me by my last name and my classmates, who, while friendly enough, were not at all inspiring.

4356.author: Henry Rollins
4356.quote: I would like to become a better photographer. I'm working on that.

4357.author: Henry Rollins
4357.quote: I believe that one defines oneself by reinvention. To not be like your parents. To not be like your friends. To be yourself. To cut yourself out of stone.

4358.author: Henry Rollins
4358.quote: I don't believe in fate or destiny. I believe in various degrees of hatred, paranoia, and abandonment. However much of that gets heaped upon you doesn't matter - it's only a matter of how much you can take and what it does to you.

4359.author: Henry Rollins
4359.quote: If the Constitution was a movie, the Preamble would be the trailer, the First Amendment the establishing shot, the 13th the crowd pleaser and the 14th the ultimate hero scene.

4360.author: Henry Rollins
4360.quote: It's easy for me to play bad guys because it's a very linear acting. Bad guys aren't empathetic. Being a bad guy is great because you're not friendly and you don't have to do much with your face.

4361.author: Henry Rollins
4361.quote: Consumerism is at once the engine of America and simultaneously one of the most revealing indicators of our collective shallowness.

4362.author: Henry Rollins
4362.quote: 'SMiLE' is perhaps the Beach Boys' most legendary album. It was recorded in 1966 and 1967 but only saw a formal release in 2011. That's a long time to wait for what was said to be Brian Wilson's masterpiece.

4363.author: Henry Van Dyke
4363.quote: A friend is what the heart needs all the time.

4364.author: Henry Van Dyke
4364.quote: Gratitude is the inward feeling of kindness received. Thankfulness is the natural impulse to express that feeling. Thanksgiving is the following of that impulse.

4365.author: Henry Van Dyke
4365.quote: Use what talents you possess; the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.

4366.author: Henry Van Dyke
4366.quote: There is no personal charm so great as the charm of a cheerful temperament.

4367.author: Henry Van Dyke
4367.quote: Time is too slow for those who wait, too swift for those who fear, too long for those who grieve, too short for those who rejoice, but for those who love, time is eternity.

4368.author: Henry Van Dyke
4368.quote: Be glad of life because it gives you the chance to love, to work, to play, and to look up at the stars.

4369.author: Henry Van Dyke
4369.quote: In the progress of personality, first comes a declaration of independence, then a recognition of interdependence.

4370.author: Henry Van Dyke
4370.quote: Love is the best thing in the world, and the thing that lives the longest.

4371.author: Henry Van Dyke
4371.quote: Happiness is inward, and not outward; and so, it does not depend on what we have, but on what we are.

4372.author: Henry Van Dyke
4372.quote: There is a loftier ambition than merely to stand high in the world. It is to stoop down and lift mankind a little higher.

4373.author: Henry Van Dyke
4373.quote: Genius is talent set on fire by courage.

4374.author: Henry Van Dyke
4374.quote: Look around for a place to sow a few seeds.

4375.author: Henry Van Dyke
4375.quote: As long as habit and routine dictate the pattern of living, new dimensions of the soul will not emerge.

4376.author: Henry Van Dyke
4376.quote: What we do belongs to what we are; and what we are is what becomes of us.

4377.author: Henry Van Dyke
4377.quote: To desire and strive to be of some service to the world, to aim at doing something which shall really increase the happiness and welfare and virtue of mankind - this is a choice which is possible for all of us; and surely it is a good haven to sail for.

4378.author: Henry Van Dyke
4378.quote: Half of the secular unrest and dismal, profane sadness of modern society comes from the vain ideas that every man is bound to be a critic for life.

4379.author: Henry Van Dyke
4379.quote: A peace that depends on fear is nothing but a suppressed war.

4380.author: Henry Van Dyke
4380.quote: It is with rivers as it is with people: the greatest are not always the most agreeable nor the best to live with.

4381.author: Henry Van Dyke
4381.quote: Some people are so afraid to die that they never begin to live.

4382.author: Henry Van Dyke
4382.quote: There are two good rules which ought to be written on every heart - never to believe anything bad about anybody unless you positively know it to be true; never to tell even that unless you feel that it is absolutely necessary, and that God is listening.

4383.author: Henry Van Dyke
4383.quote: The first day of spring is one thing, and the first spring day is another. The difference between them is sometimes as great as a month.

4384.author: Henry Van Dyke
4384.quote: There is only one way to get ready for immortality, and that is to love this life and live it as bravely and faithfully and cheerfully as we can.

4385.author: Henry Van Dyke
4385.quote: Many a treasure besides Ali Baba's is unlocked with a verbal key.

4386.author: Henry Van Dyke
4386.quote: Culture is the habit of being pleased with the best and knowing why.

4387.author: Henry Van Dyke
4387.quote: What you possess in the world will be found at the day of your death to belong to someone else. But what you are will be yours forever.

4388.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4388.quote: Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.

4389.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4389.quote: We never know the love of a parent till we become parents ourselves.

4390.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4390.quote: It's easier to go down a hill than up it but the view is much better at the top.

4391.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4391.quote: There is no friendship, no love, like that of the parent for the child.

4392.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4392.quote: A library is not a luxury but one of the necessities of life.

4393.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4393.quote: Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.

4394.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4394.quote: The mother's heart is the child's schoolroom.

4395.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4395.quote: Hold yourself responsible for a higher standard than anybody expects of you. Never excuse yourself.

4396.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4396.quote: Pride slays thanksgiving, but a humble mind is the soil out of which thanks naturally grow. A proud man is seldom a grateful man, for he never thinks he gets as much as he deserves.

4397.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4397.quote: The art of being happy lies in the power of extracting happiness from common things.

4398.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4398.quote: Flowers are the sweetest things God ever made and forgot to put a soul into.

4399.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4399.quote: The real man is one who always finds excuses for others, but never excuses himself.

4400.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4400.quote: A person without a sense of humor is like a wagon without springs. It's jolted by every pebble on the road.

4401.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4401.quote: The sun does not shine for a few trees and flowers, but for the wide world's joy.

4402.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4402.quote: Love is the river of life in the world.

4403.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4403.quote: Love cannot endure indifference. It needs to be wanted. Like a lamp, it needs to be fed out of the oil of another's heart, or its flame burns low.

4404.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4404.quote: Every tomorrow has two handles. We can take hold of it with the handle of anxiety or the handle of faith.

4405.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4405.quote: Of all the music that reached farthest into heaven, it is the beating of a loving heart.

4406.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4406.quote: Young love is a flame; very pretty, often very hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. The love of the older and disciplined heart is as coals, deep-burning, unquenchable.

4407.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4407.quote: Greatness lies, not in being strong, but in the right using of strength; and strength is not used rightly when it serves only to carry a man above his fellows for his own solitary glory. He is the greatest whose strength carries up the most hearts by the attraction of his own.

4408.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4408.quote: It is not the going out of port, but the coming in, that determines the success of a voyage.

4409.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4409.quote: We should not judge people by their peak of excellence; but by the distance they have traveled from the point where they started.

4410.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4410.quote: We sleep, but the loom of life never stops, and the pattern which was weaving when the sun went down is weaving when it comes up in the morning.

4411.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4411.quote: The worst thing in this world, next to anarchy, is government.

4412.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4412.quote: I can forgive, but I cannot forget, is only another way of saying, I will not forgive. Forgiveness ought to be like a cancelled note - torn in two, and burned up, so that it never can be shown against one.

4413.author: Henry Ward Beecher
4413.quote: The soul without imagination is what an observatory would be without a telescope.

4414.author: Heraclitus
4414.quote: There is nothing permanent except change.

4415.author: Heraclitus
4415.quote: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.

4416.author: Heraclitus
4416.quote: The sun is new each day.

4417.author: Heraclitus
4417.quote: Good character is not formed in a week or a month. It is created little by little, day by day. Protracted and patient effort is needed to develop good character.

4419.author: Heraclitus
4419.quote: You cannot step into the same river twice.

4420.author: Heraclitus
4420.quote: If you do not expect the unexpected you will not find it, for it is not to be reached by search or trail.

4421.author: Heraclitus
4421.quote: The hidden harmony is better than the obvious.

4422.author: Heraclitus
4422.quote: A man's character is his guardian divinity.

4423.author: Heraclitus
4423.quote: A man's character is his fate.

4424.author: Heraclitus
4424.quote: Man is most nearly himself when he achieves the seriousness of a child at play.

4426.author: Heraclitus
4426.quote: God is day and night, winter and summer, war and peace, surfeit and hunger.

4427.author: Heraclitus
4427.quote: Much learning does not teach understanding.

4428.author: Heraclitus
4428.quote: To do the same thing over and over again is not only boredom: it is to be controlled by rather than to control what you do.

4429.author: Heraclitus
4429.quote: The eyes are more exact witnesses than the ears.

4430.author: Heraclitus
4430.quote: Our envy always lasts longer than the happiness of those we envy.

4431.author: Heraclitus
4431.quote: You could not step twice into the same rivers; for other waters are ever flowing on to you.

4432.author: Heraclitus
4432.quote: Opposition brings concord. Out of discord comes the fairest harmony.

4433.author: Heraclitus
4433.quote: I am what libraries and librarians have made me, with little assistance from a professor of Greek and poets.

4434.author: Heraclitus
4434.quote: Men who wish to know about the world must learn about it in its particular details.

4435.author: Heraclitus
4435.quote: Hide our ignorance as we will, an evening of wine soon reveals it.

4436.author: Heraclitus
4436.quote: Justice will overtake fabricators of lies and false witnesses.

4437.author: Heraclitus
4437.quote: Eyes and ears are poor witnesses to people if they have uncultured souls.

4438.author: Heraclitus
4438.quote: It is hard to contend against one's heart's desire; for whatever it wishes to have it buys at the cost of soul.

4439.author: Heraclitus
4439.quote: The chain of wedlock is so heavy that it takes two to carry it - and sometimes three.

4440.author: Herman Melville
4440.quote: I am, as I am; whether hideous, or handsome, depends upon who is made judge.

4441.author: Herman Melville
4441.quote: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.

4442.author: Herman Melville
4442.quote: To produce a mighty book, you must choose a mighty theme. No great and enduring volume can ever be written on the flea, though many there be that have tried it.

4443.author: Herman Melville
4443.quote: A smile is the chosen vehicle of all ambiguities.

4444.author: Herman Melville
4444.quote: We cannot live only for ourselves. A thousand fibers connect us with our fellow men.

4445.author: Herman Melville
4445.quote: To the last, I grapple with thee; From Hell's heart, I stab at thee; For hate's sake, I spit my last breath at thee.

4446.author: Herman Melville
4446.quote: Truth is the silliest thing under the sun. Try to get a living by the Truth and go to the Soup Societies. Heavens! Let any clergyman try to preach the Truth from its very stronghold, the pulpit, and they would ride him out of his church on his own pulpit bannister.

4447.author: Herman Melville
4447.quote: Friendship at first sight, like love at first sight, is said to be the only truth.

4448.author: Herman Melville
4448.quote: It is not down in any map; true places never are.

4449.author: Herman Melville
4449.quote: There are some persons in this world, who, unable to give better proof of being wise, take a strange delight in showing what they think they have sagaciously read in mankind by uncharitable suspicions of them.

4450.author: Herman Melville
4450.quote: Truth uncompromisingly told will always have its ragged edges.

4451.author: Herman Melville
4451.quote: There is no dignity in wickedness, whether in purple or rags; and hell is a democracy of devils, where all are equals.

4452.author: Herman Melville
4452.quote: There is one knows not what sweet mystery about this sea, whose gently awful stirrings seem to speak of some hidden soul beneath.

4453.author: Herman Melville
4453.quote: Heaven have mercy on us all - Presbyterians and Pagans alike - for we are all somehow dreadfully cracked about the head, and sadly need mending.

4454.author: Herman Melville
4454.quote: He piled upon the whale's white hump the sum of all the general rage and hate felt by his whole race from Adam down; and then, as if his chest had been a mortar, he burst his hot heart's shell upon it.

4455.author: Herman Melville
4455.quote: There are some enterprises in which a careful disorderliness is the true method.

4456.author: Herman Melville
4456.quote: Is there some principal of nature which states that we never know the quality of what we have until it is gone?

4457.author: Herman Melville
4457.quote: He who has never failed somewhere, that man can not be great.

4458.author: Herman Melville
4458.quote: There is no quality in this world that is not what it is merely by contrast. Nothing exists in itself.

4459.author: Herman Melville
4459.quote: Truth is in things, and not in words.

4460.author: Herman Melville
4460.quote: There are certain queer times and occasions in this strange mixed affair we call life when a man takes his whole universe for a vast practical joke.

4461.author: Herman Melville
4461.quote: They talk of the dignity of work. The dignity is in leisure.

4462.author: Herman Melville
4462.quote: To be hated cordially, is only a left-handed compliment.

4463.author: Herman Melville
4463.quote: A whale ship was my Yale College and my Harvard.

4464.author: Herman Melville
4464.quote: Better sleep with a sober cannibal than a drunken Christian.

4465.author: Herman Melville
4465.quote: A man thinks that by mouthing hard words he understands hard things.

4466.author: Hillary Clinton
4466.quote: We are a country where people of all backgrounds, all nations of origin, all languages, all religions, all races, can make a home. America was built by immigrants.

4467.author: Hillary Clinton
4467.quote: I feel very blessed to have a partner in life who supports me, who is enthusiastic about what I want to do, who has been a great father, and who will be a fabulous grandfather.

4468.author: Hillary Clinton
4468.quote: We're always going to argue about abortion. It's a hard choice and it's controversial, and that's why I'm pro-choice, because I want people to make their own choices.

4469.author: Hillary Clinton
4469.quote: Women are the largest untapped reservoir of talent in the world.

4470.author: Hillary Clinton
4470.quote: Voting is the most precious right of every citizen, and we have a moral obligation to ensure the integrity of our voting process.

4471.author: Hillary Clinton
4471.quote: In almost every profession - whether it's law or journalism, finance or medicine or academia or running a small business - people rely on confidential communications to do their jobs. We count on the space of trust that confidentiality provides. When someone breaches that trust, we are all worse off for it.

4472.author: Hillary Clinton
4472.quote: You don't walk away if you love someone. You help the person.

4473.author: Hillary Clinton
4473.quote: You cannot have maternal health without reproductive health. And reproductive health includes contraception and family planning and access to legal, safe abortion.

4474.author: Hillary Clinton
4474.quote: If I want to knock a story off the front page, I just change my hairstyle.

4475.author: Hillary Clinton
4475.quote: There's a difference between fair game and playing games.

4476.author: Hillary Clinton
4476.quote: I am, you know, adamantly against illegal immigration.

4477.author: Hillary Clinton
4477.quote: It's impossible to know what happens in the fog of war.

4478.author: Hillary Clinton
4478.quote: Human rights are women's rights, and women's rights are human rights.

4479.author: Hillary Clinton
4479.quote: No matter what you think about the Iraq war, there is one thing we can all agree on for the next days - we have to salute the courage and bravery of those who are risking their lives to vote and those brave Iraqi and American soldiers fighting to protect their right to vote.

4480.author: Hillary Clinton
4480.quote: People can judge me for what I've done. And I think when somebody's out in the public eye, that's what they do. So I'm fully comfortable with who I am, what I stand for, and what I've always stood for.

4481.author: Hillary Clinton
4481.quote: It should never be a crime to be gay.

4482.author: Hillary Clinton
4482.quote: The challenge is to practice politics as the art of making what appears to be impossible, possible.

4483.author: Hillary Clinton
4483.quote: Let's continue to stand up for those who are vulnerable to being left out or marginalized.

4484.author: Hillary Clinton
4484.quote: You know, just to be grossly generalistic, you could put half of Trump's supporters into what I call the basket of deplorables. They're racist, sexist, homophobic, xenophobic, Islamaphobic - you name it.

4485.author: Hillary Clinton
4485.quote: If you believe you can make a difference, not just in politics, in public service, in advocacy around all these important issues, then you have to be prepared to accept that you are not going to get 100 percent approval.

4486.author: Hillary Clinton
4486.quote: For centuries, New York has served as the gateway for millions of people from all over the world in search of the American dream. It only makes sense that it would now serve as a gateway for the world's greatest athletes.

4487.author: Hillary Clinton
4487.quote: There are 4 billion cell phones in use today. Many of them are in the hands of market vendors, rickshaw drivers, and others who've historically lacked access to education and opportunity. Information networks have become a great leveler, and we should use them together to help lift people out of poverty and give them a freedom from want.

4488.author: Hillary Clinton
4488.quote: The family I'm from, well, no one had their name on big buildings. My family were builders of a different kind. Builders in the way most American families are. They used whatever tools they had - whatever God gave them - and whatever life in America provided - and built better lives and better futures for their kids.

4489.author: Hillary Clinton
4489.quote: In every country today, there is politics. It may be authoritarian politics, but there is politics.

4490.author: Hillary Clinton
4490.quote: Remember, before they called it Obamacare, they called it Hillarycare.

4491.author: Hillary Clinton
4491.quote: I don't think feminism, as I understand the definition, implies the rejection of maternal values, nurturing children, caring about the men in your life. That is just nonsense to me.

4492.author: Hippocrates
4492.quote: Whenever a doctor cannot do good, he must be kept from doing harm.

4493.author: Hippocrates
4493.quote: Everything in excess is opposed to nature.

4494.author: Hippocrates
4494.quote: Healing is a matter of time, but it is sometimes also a matter of opportunity.

4495.author: Hippocrates
4495.quote: Wherever the art of medicine is loved, there is also a love of humanity.

4497.author: Hippocrates
4497.quote: Let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food.

4498.author: Hippocrates
4498.quote: Natural forces within us are the true healers of disease.

4499.author: Hippocrates
4499.quote: Cure sometimes, treat often, comfort always.

4500.author: Hippocrates
4500.quote: Make a habit of two things: to help; or at least to do no harm.

4501.author: Hippocrates
4501.quote: If we could give every individual the right amount of nourishment and exercise, not too little and not too much, we would have found the safest way to health.

4502.author: Hippocrates
4502.quote: It is more important to know what sort of person has a disease than to know what sort of disease a person has.

4503.author: Hippocrates
4503.quote: The life so short, the craft so long to learn.

4504.author: Hippocrates
4504.quote: There are in fact two things, science and opinion; the former begets knowledge, the later ignorance.

4505.author: Hippocrates
4505.quote: To do nothing is also a good remedy.

4506.author: Hippocrates
4506.quote: It's far more important to know what person the disease has than what disease the person has.

4507.author: Hippocrates
4507.quote: Prayer indeed is good, but while calling on the gods a man should himself lend a hand.

4508.author: Hippocrates
4508.quote: Science is the father of knowledge, but opinion breeds ignorance.

4509.author: Hippocrates
4509.quote: A physician without a knowledge of Astrology has no right to call himself a physician.

4510.author: Hippocrates
4510.quote: A wise man should consider that health is the greatest of human blessings, and learn how by his own thought to derive benefit from his illnesses.

4511.author: Hippocrates
4511.quote: Extreme remedies are very appropriate for extreme diseases.

4512.author: Hippocrates
4512.quote: Keep a watch also on the faults of the patients, which often make them lie about the taking of things prescribed.

4513.author: Hippocrates
4513.quote: Life is short, the art long.

4515.author: Hippocrates
4515.quote: What medicines do not heal, the lance will; what the lance does not heal, fire will.

4516.author: Hippocrates
4516.quote: The art is long, life is short.

4517.author: Hippocrates
4517.quote: The chief virtue that language can have is clearness, and nothing detracts from it so much as the use of unfamiliar words.

4518.author: Honore de Balzac
4518.quote: The heart of a mother is a deep abyss at the bottom of which you will always find forgiveness.

4519.author: Honore de Balzac
4519.quote: True love is eternal, infinite, and always like itself. It is equal and pure, without violent demonstrations: it is seen with white hairs and is always young in the heart.

4520.author: Honore de Balzac
4520.quote: A mother's happiness is like a beacon, lighting up the future but reflected also on the past in the guise of fond memories.

4521.author: Honore de Balzac
4521.quote: Clouds symbolize the veils that shroud God.

4522.author: Honore de Balzac
4522.quote: Laws are spider webs through which the big flies pass and the little ones get caught.

4523.author: Honore de Balzac
4523.quote: Nobody loves a woman because she is handsome or ugly, stupid or intelligent. We love because we love.

4524.author: Honore de Balzac
4524.quote: A woman knows the face of the man she loves as a sailor knows the open sea.

4525.author: Honore de Balzac
4525.quote: A young bride is like a plucked flower; but a guilty wife is like a flower that had been walked over.

4526.author: Honore de Balzac
4526.quote: The motto of chivalry is also the motto of wisdom; to serve all, but love only one.

4527.author: Honore de Balzac
4527.quote: One should believe in marriage as in the immortality of the soul.

4528.author: Honore de Balzac
4528.quote: The art of motherhood involves much silent, unobtrusive self-denial, an hourly devotion which finds no detail too minute.

4529.author: Honore de Balzac
4529.quote: The man as he converses is the lover; silent, he is the husband.

4530.author: Honore de Balzac
4530.quote: Great love affairs start with Champagne and end with tisane.

4531.author: Honore de Balzac
4531.quote: Love has its own instinct, finding the way to the heart, as the feeblest insect finds the way to its flower, with a will which nothing can dismay nor turn aside.

4532.author: Honore de Balzac
4532.quote: Bureaucracy is a giant mechanism operated by pygmies.

4533.author: Honore de Balzac
4533.quote: A good husband is never the first to go to sleep at night or the last to awake in the morning.

4534.author: Honore de Balzac
4534.quote: Society bristles with enigmas which look hard to solve. It is a perfect maze of intrigue.

4535.author: Honore de Balzac
4535.quote: A husband who submits to his wife's yoke is justly held an object of ridicule. A woman's influence ought to be entirely concealed.

4536.author: Honore de Balzac
4536.quote: Men die in despair, while spirits die in ecstasy.

4537.author: Honore de Balzac
4537.quote: It is easy to sit up and take notice, What is difficult is getting up and taking action.

4538.author: Honore de Balzac
4538.quote: Courtesy is only a thin veneer on the general selfishness.

4539.author: Honore de Balzac
4539.quote: When women love us, they forgive us everything, even our crimes; when they do not love us, they give us credit for nothing, not even our virtues.

4540.author: Honore de Balzac
4540.quote: An unfulfilled vocation drains the color from a man's entire existence.

4541.author: Honore de Balzac
4541.quote: Love is a game in which one always cheats.

4542.author: Honore de Balzac
4542.quote: The duration of passion is proportionate with the original resistance of the woman.

4543.author: Honore de Balzac
4543.quote: Virtue, perhaps, is nothing more than politeness of soul.

4544.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4544.quote: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.

4545.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4545.quote: The greatest healing therapy is friendship and love.

4546.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4546.quote: Never give in and never give up.

4547.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4547.quote: To err is human. To blame someone else is politics.

4548.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4548.quote: Behind every successful man is a proud wife and a surprised mother-in-law.

4549.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4549.quote: Freedom is hammered out on the anvil of discussion, dissent, and debate.

4550.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4550.quote: To be realistic today is to be visionary. To be realistic is to be starry-eyed.

4551.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4551.quote: Compassion is not weakness, and concern for the unfortunate is not socialism.

4552.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4552.quote: It was once said that the moral test of government is how that government treats those who are in the dawn of life, the children; those who are in the twilight of life, the elderly; and those who are in the shadows of life, the sick, the needy and the handicapped.

4553.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4553.quote: Behind every successful man stands a surprised mother-in-law.

4554.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4554.quote: It is not what they take away from you that counts. It's what you do with what you have left.

4555.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4555.quote: In real life, unlike in Shakespeare, the sweetness of the rose depends upon the name it bears. Things are not only what they are. They are, in very important respects, what they seem to be.

4556.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4556.quote: Propaganda, to be effective, must be believed. To be believed, it must be credible. To be credible, it must be true.

4557.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4557.quote: If there is dissatisfaction with the status quo, good. If there is ferment, so much the better. If there is restlessness, I am pleased. Then let there be ideas, and hard thought, and hard work. If man feels small, let man make himself bigger.

4558.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4558.quote: Anyone who thinks that the vice-president can take a position independent of the president of his administration simply has no knowledge of politics or government. You are his choice in a political marriage, and he expects your absolute loyalty.

4559.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4559.quote: Never answer a question from a farmer.

4560.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4560.quote: Liberalism, above all, means emancipation - emancipation from one's fears, his inadequacies, from prejudice, from discrimination, from poverty.

4561.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4561.quote: Each child is an adventure into a better life - an opportunity to change the old pattern and make it new.

4562.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4562.quote: Today we know that World War II began not in 1939 or 1941 but in the 1920's and 1930's when those who should have known better persuaded themselves that they were not their brother's keeper.

4563.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4563.quote: There is in every American, I think, something of the old Daniel Boone - who, when he could see the smoke from another chimney, felt himself too crowded and moved further out into the wilderness.

4564.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4564.quote: Foreign policy is really domestic policy with its hat on.

4565.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4565.quote: The right to be heard does not automatically include the right to be taken seriously.

4566.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4566.quote: It is not enough to merely defend democracy. To defend it may be to lose it; to extend it is to strengthen it. Democracy is not property; it is an idea.

4567.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4567.quote: The impersonal hand of government can never replace the helping hand of a neighbor.

4568.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4568.quote: Asia is rich in people, rich in culture and rich in resources. It is also rich in trouble.

4569.author: Hubert H. Humphrey
4569.quote: The essence of statesmanship is not a rigid adherence to the past, but a prudent and probing concern for the future.

4570.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4570.quote: There is no such thing as paranoia. Your worst fears can come true at any moment.

4571.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4571.quote: When the going gets weird, the weird turn pro.

4572.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4572.quote: I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me.

4573.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4573.quote: In a closed society where everybody's guilty, the only crime is getting caught. In a world of thieves, the only final sin is stupidity.

4574.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4574.quote: Luck is a very thin wire between survival and disaster, and not many people can keep their balance on it.

4575.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4575.quote: Buy the ticket, take the ride.

4576.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4576.quote: Some may never live, but the crazy never die.

4577.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4577.quote: There are many harsh lessons to be learned from the gambling experience, but the harshest one of all is the difference between having Fun and being Smart.

4578.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4578.quote: If Sunday is the Lord's day, then Saturday belongs to the Devil. It is the only night of the week when he gives out Free passes to the Late show at the Too Much Fun Club.

4579.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4579.quote: I learned a long time ago that reality was much weirder than anyone's imagination.

4580.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4580.quote: The person who doesn't scatter the morning dew will not comb gray hairs.

4581.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4581.quote: Victory is a fleeting thing in the gambling business. Today's winners are tomorrow's blinking toads, dumb beasts with no hope.

4582.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4582.quote: I am not a yachting person, by nature, but I have just enough experience on the sea under sail to feel a certain nostalgia for it when I see a big white racing yacht heeled over at cruising speed on the ocean, and I can still tie a mean bowline knot on just about anything in less than 10 seconds.

4583.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4583.quote: I have long understood that losing always comes with the territory when you wander into the gambling business, just as getting crippled for life is an acceptable risk in the linebacker business. They both are extremely violent sports, and pain is part of the bargain. Buy the ticket, take the ride.

4584.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4584.quote: The Edge... there is no honest way to explain it because the only people who really know where it is are the ones who have gone over.

4585.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4585.quote: Good news is rare these days, and every glittering ounce of it should be cherished and hoarded and worshipped and fondled like a priceless diamond.

4586.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4586.quote: Objective journalism is one of the main reasons that American politics has been allowed to be so corrupt for so long.

4587.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4587.quote: Paranoia is just another word for ignorance.

4588.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4588.quote: As long as I'm learning something, I figure I'm OK - it's a decent day.

4589.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4589.quote: Marathon running, like golf, is a game for players, not winners. That is why Callaway sells golf clubs and Nike sells running shoes. But running is unique in that the world's best racers are on the same course, at the same time, as amateurs, who have as much chance of winning as your average weekend warrior would scoring a touchdown in the NFL.

4590.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4590.quote: Yesterday's weirdness is tomorrow's reason why.

4591.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4591.quote: Freedom is something that dies unless it's used.

4592.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4592.quote: I am a generous man, by nature, and far more trusting than I should be. Indeed. The real world is risky territory for people with generosity of spirit. Beware.

4593.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4593.quote: Yes sir, I am a tortured man for all seasons, as they say, and I have powerful friends in high places. Birds sing where I walk, and children smile when they see me coming.

4594.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4594.quote: The mind of America is seized by a fatal dry rot - and it's only a question of time before all that the mind controls will run amuck in a frenzy of stupid, impotent fear.

4595.author: Hunter S. Thompson
4595.quote: All the blood is drained out of democracy - it dies - when only half the population votes.

4596.author: Immanuel Kant
4596.quote: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.

4597.author: Immanuel Kant
4597.quote: In law a man is guilty when he violates the rights of others. In ethics he is guilty if he only thinks of doing so.

4598.author: Immanuel Kant
4598.quote: Two things awe me most, the starry sky above me and the moral law within me.

4599.author: Immanuel Kant
4599.quote: Morality is not the doctrine of how we may make ourselves happy, but how we may make ourselves worthy of happiness.

4600.author: Immanuel Kant
4600.quote: Thoughts without content are empty, intuitions without concepts are blind.

4601.author: Immanuel Kant
4601.quote: Live your life as though your every act were to become a universal law.

4602.author: Immanuel Kant
4602.quote: Always recognize that human individuals are ends, and do not use them as means to your end.

4603.author: Immanuel Kant
4603.quote: He who is cruel to animals becomes hard also in his dealings with men. We can judge the heart of a man by his treatment of animals.

4604.author: Immanuel Kant
4604.quote: Happiness is not an ideal of reason, but of imagination.

4605.author: Immanuel Kant
4605.quote: All our knowledge begins with the senses, proceeds then to the understanding, and ends with reason. There is nothing higher than reason.

4606.author: Immanuel Kant
4606.quote: By a lie, a man... annihilates his dignity as a man.

4607.author: Immanuel Kant
4607.quote: It is beyond a doubt that all our knowledge begins with experience.

4608.author: Immanuel Kant
4608.quote: Experience without theory is blind, but theory without experience is mere intellectual play.

4609.author: Immanuel Kant
4609.quote: Religion is the recognition of all our duties as divine commands.

4611.author: Immanuel Kant
4611.quote: Seek not the favor of the multitude; it is seldom got by honest and lawful means. But seek the testimony of few; and number not voices, but weigh them.

4612.author: Immanuel Kant
4612.quote: Immaturity is the incapacity to use one's intelligence without the guidance of another.

4613.author: Immanuel Kant
4613.quote: If man makes himself a worm he must not complain when he is trodden on.

4614.author: Immanuel Kant
4614.quote: Metaphysics is a dark ocean without shores or lighthouse, strewn with many a philosophic wreck.

4615.author: Immanuel Kant
4615.quote: The only objects of practical reason are therefore those of good and evil. For by the former is meant an object necessarily desired according to a principle of reason; by the latter one necessarily shunned, also according to a principle of reason.

4616.author: Immanuel Kant
4616.quote: It is not necessary that whilst I live I live happily; but it is necessary that so long as I live I should live honourably.

4617.author: Immanuel Kant
4617.quote: I had therefore to remove knowledge, in order to make room for belief.

4618.author: Immanuel Kant
4618.quote: A categorical imperative would be one which represented an action as objectively necessary in itself, without reference to any other purpose.

4619.author: Immanuel Kant
4619.quote: Nothing is divine but what is agreeable to reason.

4620.author: Immanuel Kant
4620.quote: Ingratitude is the essence of vileness.

4621.author: Immanuel Kant
4621.quote: What can I know? What ought I to do? What can I hope?

4622.author: Indira Gandhi
4622.quote: There are two kinds of people, those who do the work and those who take the credit. Try to be in the first group; there is less competition there.

4623.author: Indira Gandhi
4623.quote: People tend to forget their duties but remember their rights.

4624.author: Indira Gandhi
4624.quote: Forgiveness is a virtue of the brave.

4625.author: Indira Gandhi
4625.quote: Winning or losing of the election is less important than strengthening the country.

4626.author: Indira Gandhi
4626.quote: You cannot shake hands with a clenched fist.

4627.author: Indira Gandhi
4627.quote: I have lived a long life, and I am proud that I spend the whole of my life in the service of my people. I am only proud of this and nothing else. I shall continue to serve until my last breath, and when I die, I can say, that every drop of my blood will invigorate India and strengthen it.

4628.author: Indira Gandhi
4628.quote: The power to question is the basis of all human progress.

4629.author: Indira Gandhi
4629.quote: Even if I died in the service of the nation, I would be proud of it. Every drop of my blood... will contribute to the growth of this nation and to make it strong and dynamic.

4630.author: Indira Gandhi
4630.quote: You must learn to be still in the midst of activity and to be vibrantly alive in repose.

4631.author: Indira Gandhi
4631.quote: Have a bias toward action - let's see something happen now. You can break that big plan into small steps and take the first step right away.

4632.author: Indira Gandhi
4632.quote: A nation' s strength ultimately consists in what it can do on its own, and not in what it can borrow from others.

4633.author: Indira Gandhi
4633.quote: Happiness is a state of mind, you know. I don't think you are permanently happy. One is happy about certain things and not so happy about others.

4634.author: Indira Gandhi
4634.quote: I do not like carving the world into segments; we are one world.

4635.author: Indira Gandhi
4635.quote: I think basically I'm lazy, but I have a housewife's mentality when I go about my job.

4636.author: Indira Gandhi
4636.quote: Martyrdom does not end something, it only a beginning.

4637.author: Indira Gandhi
4637.quote: My father was a statesman, I am a political woman. My father was a saint. I am not.

4638.author: Indira Gandhi
4638.quote: I've never turned to anybody for advice and counsel. Even when I was a very small child, I had to stand on my feet because of the circumstances of those times, and somehow, the circumstances have remained more or less the same. I have to take my own decisions.

4639.author: Indira Gandhi
4639.quote: I have already reached out to the janata, and I am only trying to acquaint myself with people's problems.

4640.author: Indira Gandhi
4640.quote: One must beware of ministers who can do nothing without money, and those who want to do everything with money.

4641.author: Indira Gandhi
4641.quote: There exists no politician in India daring enough to attempt to explain to the masses that cows can be eaten.

4642.author: Indira Gandhi
