5145.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
5145.quote: Have you not noticed that love is silence? It may be while holding the hand of another, or looking lovingly at a child, or taking in the beauty of an evening. Love has no past or future, and so it is with this extraordinary state of silence.

5146.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
5146.quote: What religion a man holds, to what race he belongs, these things are not important; the really important thing is this knowledge: the knowledge of God's plan for men. For God has a plan, and that plan is evolution.

5147.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
5147.quote: We all want to be famous people, and the moment we want to be something we are no longer free.

5148.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
5148.quote: Die to everything of yesterday so that your mind is always fresh, always young, innocent, full of vigor and passion.

5149.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
5149.quote: For most of us, relationship with another is based on dependence, either economic or psychological. This dependence creates fear, breeds in us possessiveness, results in friction, suspicion, frustration.

5150.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
5150.quote: The end is the beginning of all things, Suppressed and hidden, Awaiting to be released through the rhythm Of pain and pleasure.

5151.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
5151.quote: Life is relationship, living is relationship. We cannot live if you and I have built a wall around ourselves and just peep over that wall occasionally. Unconsciously, deeply, under the wall, we are related.

5152.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
5152.quote: We are domesticated animals, revolving in a cage which we have built for ourselves - with its contentions, wranglings, its impossible political leaders, its gurus who exploit our self-conceit and their own with great refinement or rather crudely.

5153.author: Jim Carrey
5153.quote: Behind every great man is a woman rolling her eyes.

5154.author: Jim Carrey
5154.quote: If you aren't in the moment, you are either looking forward to uncertainty, or back to pain and regret.

5155.author: Jim Carrey
5155.quote: I'm very serious about no alcohol, no drugs. Life is too beautiful.

5156.author: Jim Carrey
5156.quote: Life opens up opportunities to you, and you either take them or you stay afraid of taking them.

5157.author: Jim Carrey
5157.quote: A lot of good love can happen in ten years.

5158.author: Jim Carrey
5158.quote: I love playing ego and insecurity combined.

5159.author: Jim Carrey
5159.quote: It is better to risk starving to death then surrender. If you give up on your dreams, what's left?

5160.author: Jim Carrey
5160.quote: I wake up some mornings and sit and have my coffee and look out at my beautiful garden, and I go, 'Remember how good this is. Because you can lose it.'

5161.author: Jim Carrey
5161.quote: For some reason I did something where I realized I could get a reaction. That was when I broke out of my shell at school, because I really didn't have any friends or anything like that and I just kind of was going along, and then finally I did this zany thing, and all of a sudden I had tons of friends.

5162.author: Jim Carrey
5162.quote: Maybe other people will try to limit me but I don't limit myself.

5163.author: Jim Carrey
5163.quote: What I have in common with the character in 'Truman' is this incredible need to please people. I feel like I want to take care of everyone and I also feel this terrible guilt if I am unable to. And I have felt this way ever since all this success started.

5164.author: Jim Carrey
5164.quote: Maybe there is no actual place called hell. Maybe hell is just having to listen to our grandparents breathe through their noses when they're eating sandwiches.

5165.author: Jim Carrey
5165.quote: Life is an ordeal, albeit an exciting one, but I wouldn't trade it for the good old days of poverty and obscurity.

5166.author: Jim Carrey
5166.quote: My focus is to forget the pain of life. Forget the pain, mock the pain, reduce it. And laugh.

5167.author: Jim Carrey
5167.quote: If you've got a talent, protect it.

5168.author: Jim Carrey
5168.quote: People need motivation to do anything. I don't think human beings learn anything without desperation.

5169.author: Jim Carrey
5169.quote: I don't think human beings learn anything without desperation. Desperation is a necessary ingredient to learning anything or creating anything. Period. If you ain't desperate at some point, you ain't interesting.

5170.author: Jim Carrey
5170.quote: Either you're the one erasing or you're the one being erased.

5172.author: Jim Carrey
5172.quote: I haven't been as wild with my money as somebody like me might have been. I've been very safe, very conservative with investments. I don't blow money. I don't have a ton of houses. I know things can go away. I've already had that experience.

5173.author: Jim Carrey
5173.quote: If I had never ventured beyond being a stand-up comic, then I would be sitting in my house today working on my Leonardo DiCaprio impression.

5174.author: Jim Carrey
5174.quote: My family kinda hit the skids. We were experiencing poverty at that point. We all got a job, where the whole family had to work as security guards and janitors. And I just got angry.

5175.author: Jim Carrey
5175.quote: That's the trouble with being me. At this point, nobody gives a damn what my problem is. I could literally have a tumor on the side of my head and they'd be like, 'Yeah, big deal. I'd eat a tumor every morning for the kinda money you're pulling down.'

5176.author: Jim Carrey
5176.quote: My upbringing in Canada made me the person I am. I will always be proud to be a Canadian.

5177.author: Jim Carrey
5177.quote: I tend to stay up late, not because I'm partying but because it's the only time of the day when I'm alone and don't have to be performing.

5178.author: Jim Carrey
5178.quote: I really believe in the philosophy that you create your own universe. I'm just trying to create a good one for myself.

5179.author: Jim Elliot
5179.quote: He is no fool who gives what he cannot keep to gain what he cannot lose.

5180.author: Jim Elliot
5180.quote: God always gives His best to those who leave the choice with him.

5181.author: Jim Elliot
5181.quote: Grieve not, then, if your sons seem to desert you, but rejoice, rather, seeing the will of God done gladly.

5182.author: Jim Elliot
5182.quote: Wherever you are - be all there.

5183.author: Jim Elliot
5183.quote: The sound of 'gentle stillness' after all the thunder and wind have passed will the ultimate Word from God.

5184.author: Jim Elliot
5184.quote: I dare not stay home while Quichuas perish. What if the well-filled church in the homeland needs stirring? They have the Scriptures, Moses, and the prophets, and a whole lot more. Their condemnation is written on their bank books and in the dust on their Bible covers.

5185.author: Jim Elliot
5185.quote: I wanted to sail when I was in grammar school and well remember memorizing the names of the sails from the Merriam-Webster's ponderous dictionary in the library. Now I am actually at sea - as a passenger, of course, but at sea nevertheless - and bound for Ecuador.

5186.author: Jim Elliot
5186.quote: How wonderful to know that Christianity is more than a padded pew or a dim cathedral, but that it is a real, living, daily experience which goes on from grace to grace.

5187.author: Jim Elliot
5187.quote: Lord, make my way prosperous, not that I achieve high station, but that my life may be an exhibit to the value of knowing God.

5188.author: Jim Elliot
5188.quote: Missionaries are very human folks, just doing what they are asked. Simply a bunch of nobodies trying to exalt Somebody.

5189.author: Jim Elliot
5189.quote: Most laws condemn the soul and pronounce sentence. The result of the law of my God is perfect. It condemns but forgives. It restores - more than abundantly - what it takes away.

5190.author: Jim Elliot
5190.quote: Domesticated males aren't much use for adventure.

5191.author: Jim Elliot
5191.quote: I only hope that He will let me preach to those who have never heard that name Jesus. What else is worthwhile in this life? I have heard of nothing better. 'Lord, send me!'

5192.author: Jim Elliot
5192.quote: Coming home, we stopped for a bite to eat and ran into a confused waitress. Had a heart-rending time trying to speak the Words of Life to her, and as I think of all this country now, many just as confused, and more so, I realized that the 39th Street bus is as much a mission field as Africa ever was.

5193.author: Jim Elliot
5193.quote: What a brutish master sin is, taking the joy from one's life, stealing money and health, giving promise of tomorrow's pleasures, and finally leading one onto the rotten planking that overlies the mouth of the pit.

5194.author: Jim Elliot
5194.quote: Ninety-five percent of our wool is going to China.

5195.author: Jim Elliot
5195.quote: Begin each day with private reading of the Word and prayer.

5196.author: Jim Elliot
5196.quote: Live to the hilt every situation you believe to be the will of God.

5197.author: Jim Elliot
5197.quote: No one warns young people to follow Adam's example. He waited till God saw his need. Then God made Adam sleep, prepared for his mate, and brought her to him. We need more of this 'being asleep' in the will of God.

5198.author: Jim Elliot
5198.quote: Systematic theology - be careful how you tie down the Word to fit your set and final creeds, systems, dogmas, and organized theistic philosophies! The Word of God is not bound! It's free to say what it will to the individual, and no one can outline it into dispensations which cannot be broken.

5199.author: Jim Elliot
5199.quote: Feast of Stephen, Deacon, First Martyr, the man who will not act until he knows all will never act at all.

5200.author: Jim Elliot
5200.quote: I many no longer depend on pleasant impulses to bring me before the Lord. I must rather response to principles I know to be right, whether I feel them to be enjoyable or not.

5201.author: Jim Elliot
5201.quote: It is true that a fellow cannot ignore women - but he can think of them as he ought - as sisters, not as sparring partners.

5202.author: Jim Elliot
5202.quote: We wouldn't think of rising in the morning without a face-wash, but we often neglect that purgative cleansing of the Word of the Lord. It wakes us up to our responsibility.

5203.author: Jim Elliot
5203.quote: The Lord has done what I wanted Him to do this week. I wanted, primarily, peace about going into pioneer Indian work. And as I analyze my feelings now, I feel quite at ease about saying that tribal work in South American jungles is the general direction of my missionary purpose.

5204.author: Jim Morrison
5204.quote: A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself.

5205.author: Jim Morrison
5205.quote: Friends can help each other. A true friend is someone who lets you have total freedom to be yourself - and especially to feel. Or, not feel. Whatever you happen to be feeling at the moment is fine with them. That's what real love amounts to - letting a person be what he really is.

5206.author: Jim Morrison
5206.quote: There are things known and things unknown and in between are the doors.

5207.author: Jim Morrison
5207.quote: The most important kind of freedom is to be what you really are. You trade in your reality for a role. You give up your ability to feel, and in exchange, put on a mask.

5208.author: Jim Morrison
5208.quote: Listen, real poetry doesn't say anything; it just ticks off the possibilities. Opens all doors. You can walk through any one that suits you.

5209.author: Jim Morrison
5209.quote: Whoever controls the media, controls the mind.

5210.author: Jim Morrison
5210.quote: People fear death even more than pain. It's strange that they fear death. Life hurts a lot more than death. At the point of death, the pain is over. Yeah, I guess it is a friend.

5211.author: Jim Morrison
5211.quote: Each generation wants new symbols, new people, new names. They want to divorce themselves from their predecessors.

5212.author: Jim Morrison
5212.quote: Sex is full of lies. The body tries to tell the truth. But, it's usually too battered with rules to be heard, and bound with pretenses so it can hardly move. We cripple ourselves with lies.

5213.author: Jim Morrison
5213.quote: I like people who shake other people up and make them feel uncomfortable.

5214.author: Jim Morrison
5214.quote: Expose yourself to your deepest fear; after that, fear has no power, and the fear of freedom shrinks and vanishes. You are free.

5215.author: Jim Morrison
5215.quote: Where's your will to be weird?

5216.author: Jim Morrison
5216.quote: Drugs are a bet with your mind.

5217.author: Jim Morrison
5217.quote: I am interested in anything about revolt, disorder, chaos-especially activity that seems to have no meaning. It seems to me to be the road toward freedom... Rather than starting inside, I start outside and reach the mental through the physical.

5218.author: Jim Morrison
5218.quote: I see myself as an intelligent, sensitive human, with the soul of a clown which forces me to blow it at the most important moments.

5219.author: Jim Morrison
5219.quote: Love cannot save you from your own fate.

5220.author: Jim Morrison
5220.quote: Hatred is a very underestimated emotion.

5222.author: Jim Morrison
5222.quote: The most loving parents and relatives commit murder with smiles on their faces. They force us to destroy the person we really are: a subtle kind of murder.

5223.author: Jim Morrison
5223.quote: Some of the worst mistakes of my life have been haircuts.

5224.author: Jim Morrison
5224.quote: This is the strangest life I've ever known.

5225.author: Jim Morrison
5225.quote: We fear violence less than our own feelings. Personal, private, solitary pain is more terrifying than what anyone else can inflict.

5226.author: Jim Morrison
5226.quote: It's like gambling somehow. You go out for a night of drinking and you don't know where your going to end up the next day. It could work out good or it could be disastrous. It's like the throw of the dice.

5227.author: Jim Morrison
5227.quote: If my poetry aims to achieve anything, it's to deliver people from the limited ways in which they see and feel.

5228.author: Jim Morrison
5228.quote: When you make your peace with authority, you become authority.

5229.author: Jim Morrison
5229.quote: Actually I don't remember being born, it must have happened during one of my black outs.

5230.author: Jim Rohn
5230.quote: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.

5231.author: Jim Rohn
5231.quote: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.

5232.author: Jim Rohn
5232.quote: Either you run the day or the day runs you.

5233.author: Jim Rohn
5233.quote: Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.

5234.author: Jim Rohn
5234.quote: If you don't like how things are, change it! You're not a tree.

5235.author: Jim Rohn
5235.quote: Whatever good things we build end up building us.

5236.author: Jim Rohn
5236.quote: Time is more value than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time.

5237.author: Jim Rohn
5237.quote: You cannot change your destination overnight, but you can change your direction overnight.

5238.author: Jim Rohn
5238.quote: Take advantage of every opportunity to practice your communication skills so that when important occasions arise, you will have the gift, the style, the sharpness, the clarity, and the emotions to affect other people.

5239.author: Jim Rohn
5239.quote: The walls we build around us to keep sadness out also keeps out the joy.

5240.author: Jim Rohn
5240.quote: We must all suffer one of two things: the pain of discipline or the pain of regret or disappointment.

5241.author: Jim Rohn
5241.quote: You must take personal responsibility. You cannot change the circumstances, the seasons, or the wind, but you can change yourself. That is something you have charge of.

5242.author: Jim Rohn
5242.quote: If you are not willing to risk the unusual, you will have to settle for the ordinary.

5243.author: Jim Rohn
5243.quote: Success is steady progress toward one's personal goals.

5244.author: Jim Rohn
5244.quote: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.

5245.author: Jim Rohn
5245.quote: Formal education will make you a living; self-education will make you a fortune.

5246.author: Jim Rohn
5246.quote: Learning is the beginning of wealth. Learning is the beginning of health. Learning is the beginning of spirituality. Searching and learning is where the miracle process all begins.

5247.author: Jim Rohn
5247.quote: The few who do are the envy of the many who only watch.

5248.author: Jim Rohn
5248.quote: It is the set of the sails, not the direction of the wind that determines which way we will go.

5249.author: Jim Rohn
5249.quote: Without a sense of urgency, desire loses its value.

5250.author: Jim Rohn
5250.quote: Effective communication is 20% what you know and 80% how you feel about what you know.

5251.author: Jim Rohn
5251.quote: Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines, practiced every day.

5252.author: Jim Rohn
5252.quote: Work harder on yourself than you do on your job.

5253.author: Jim Rohn
5253.quote: Success is neither magical nor mysterious. Success is the natural consequence of consistently applying the basic fundamentals.

5254.author: Jim Rohn
5254.quote: Maturity is the ability to reap without apology and not complain when things don't go well.

5255.author: Jim Rohn
5255.quote: For every disciplined effort there is a multiple reward.

5256.author: Jim Valvano
5256.quote: My father gave me the greatest gift anyone could give another person, he believed in me.

5257.author: Jim Valvano
5257.quote: I will thank God for the day and the moment I have.

5258.author: Jim Valvano
5258.quote: If you laugh, you think, and you cry, that's a full day. That's a heck of a day. You do that seven days a week, you're going to have something special.

5259.author: Jim Valvano
5259.quote: Don't give up. Don't ever give up.

5260.author: Jim Valvano
5260.quote: Be a dreamer. If you don't know how to dream, you're dead.

5261.author: Jim Valvano
5261.quote: Cancer can take away all of my physical abilities. It cannot touch my mind, it cannot touch my heart, and it cannot touch my soul.

5262.author: Jim Valvano
5262.quote: And if you see me, smile and maybe give me a hug. That's important to me too.

5263.author: Jim Valvano
5263.quote: What enables us to achieve our greatness contains the seeds of our destruction.

5264.author: Jim Valvano
5264.quote: But try if you can to support, whether it's AIDS or the cancer foundation, so that someone else might survive, might prosper, and might actually be cured of this dreaded disease.

5265.author: Jim Valvano
5265.quote: How do you go from where you are to where you wanna be? And I think you have to have an enthusiasm for life. You have to have a dream, a goal. And you have to be willing to work for it.

5266.author: Jim Valvano
5266.quote: I just got one last thing, I urge all of you, all of you, to enjoy your life, the precious moments you have. To spend each day with some laughter and some thought, to get you're emotions going.

5267.author: Jim Valvano
5267.quote: No matter what business you're in, you can't run in place or someone will pass you by. It doesn't matter how many games you've won.

5268.author: Jim Valvano
5268.quote: I'm not happy to be here. I'm just happy to be!

5269.author: Jim Valvano
5269.quote: Now I'm fighting cancer, everybody knows that. People ask me all the time about how you go through your life and how's your day, and nothing is changed for me.

5270.author: Jim Valvano
5270.quote: I can't tell you what an honor it is, to even be mentioned in the same breath with Arthur Ashe. This is something I certainly will treasure forever.

5271.author: Jim Valvano
5271.quote: We need your help. I need your help. We need money for research. It may not save my life. It may save my children's life. It may save someone you love. And it's very important.

5272.author: Jim Valvano
5272.quote: I'll also tell you that five hundred thousand people will die this year of cancer. And I'll also tell you that one in every four will be afflicted with this disease, and yet, somehow, we seem to have put it in a little bit of the background.

5273.author: Jim Valvano
5273.quote: People think I have courage. The courage in my family are my wife Pam, my three daughters, here, Nicole, Jamie, LeeAnn, my mom, who's right here too.

5274.author: Jim Valvano
5274.quote: I talked about my family, my family's so important.

5275.author: Jim Valvano
5275.quote: Now, I look at where I am now and I know what I wanna to do. What I would like to be able to do is to spend whatever time I have left and to give, and maybe some hope to others.

5276.author: Jim Valvano
5276.quote: And I'm going to work as hard as I can... for cancer research and hopefully, maybe, we'll have some cures and some breakthroughs. I'd like to think I'm going to fight my brains out to be back here again next year for the Arthur Ashe recipient. I want to give it next year!

5277.author: Jim Valvano
5277.quote: I asked a ref if he could give me a technical foul for thinking bad things about him. He said, of course not. I said, well, I think you stink. And he gave me a technical. You can't trust em.

5278.author: Jim Valvano
5278.quote: Time is very precious to me. I don't know how much I have left and I have some things that I would like to say. Hopefully, at the end, I will have said something that will be important to other people too.

5279.author: Jim Valvano
5279.quote: How many people do you know who've had their dream come true? You're looking at one.

5280.author: Jim Valvano
5280.quote: I was an absolute maniac, a terrible husband and father.

5281.author: Jim Valvano
5281.quote: I set out very calculatedly to become known. The only thing I maybe miscalculated was how easy it would be.

5282.author: Jimi Hendrix
5282.quote: When the power of love overcomes the love of power the world will know peace.

5283.author: Jimi Hendrix
5283.quote: You have to go on and be crazy. Craziness is like heaven.

5285.author: Jimi Hendrix
5285.quote: The story of life is quicker than the blink of an eye, the story of love is hello, goodbye.

5286.author: Jimi Hendrix
5286.quote: Excuse me while I kiss the sky.

5287.author: Jimi Hendrix
5287.quote: Music doesn't lie. If there is something to be changed in this world, then it can only happen through music.

5288.author: Jimi Hendrix
5288.quote: Even Castles made of sand, fall into the sea, eventually.

5289.author: Jimi Hendrix
5289.quote: Every city in the world always has a gang, a street gang, or the so-called outcasts.

5290.author: Jimi Hendrix
5290.quote: It's funny how most people love the dead, once you're dead, you're made for life.

5291.author: Jimi Hendrix
5291.quote: We have time, there's no big rush.

5292.author: Jimi Hendrix
5292.quote: I've been imitated so well I've heard people copy my mistakes.

5293.author: Jimi Hendrix
5293.quote: I'm the one that has to die when it's time for me to die, so let me live my life, the way I want to.

5294.author: Jimi Hendrix
5294.quote: I used to live in a room full of mirrors; all I could see was me. I take my spirit and I crash my mirrors, now the whole world is here for me to see.

5295.author: Jimi Hendrix
5295.quote: Sometimes you want to give up the guitar, you'll hate the guitar. But if you stick with it, you're gonna be rewarded.

5296.author: Jimi Hendrix
5296.quote: In order to change the world, you have to get your head together first.

5297.author: Jimi Hendrix
5297.quote: I wish they'd had electric guitars in cotton fields back in the good old days. A whole lot of things would've been straightened out.

5298.author: Jimi Hendrix
5298.quote: If I'm free, it's because I'm always running.

5299.author: Jimi Hendrix
5299.quote: When things get too heavy, just call me helium, the lightest known gas to man.

5300.author: Jimi Hendrix
5300.quote: When I die, I want people to play my music, go wild and freak out and do anything they want to do.

5301.author: Jimi Hendrix
5301.quote: All I'm gonna do is just go on and do what I feel.

5302.author: Jimi Hendrix
5302.quote: Blues is easy to play, but hard to feel.

5303.author: Jimi Hendrix
5303.quote: I got a pet monkey called Charlie Chan.

5304.author: Jimi Hendrix
5304.quote: White collar conservative flashin down the street, pointing that plastic finger at me, they all assume my kind will drop and die, but I'm gonna wave my freak flag high.

5305.author: Jimi Hendrix
5305.quote: I don't have nothing to regret at all in the past, except that I might've unintentionally hurt somebody else or something.

5306.author: Jimi Hendrix
5306.quote: If it was up to me, there wouldn't be no such thing as the establishment.

5307.author: Jimi Hendrix
5307.quote: My goal is to be one with the music. I just dedicate my whole life to this art.

5308.author: Jimmy Dean
5308.quote: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.

5309.author: Jimmy Dean
5309.quote: Love is an ice cream sundae, with all the marvelous coverings. Sex is the cherry on top.

5310.author: Jimmy Dean
5310.quote: Poverty was the greatest motivating factor in my life.

5311.author: Jimmy Dean
5311.quote: Sausage is a great deal like life. You get out of it about what you put into it.

5312.author: Jimmy Dean
5312.quote: God is bigger than people think.

5313.author: Jimmy Dean
5313.quote: A lot of things I am, and a lot of things I am not. But I think I'm about as good an American as there is. I love this country. It's been very, very good to me. And it will be good to anybody if they are willing to give of themselves.

5314.author: Jimmy Dean
5314.quote: Do what you say you're going to do. And try to do it a little better than you said you would.

5315.author: Jimmy Dean
5315.quote: Nobody, man or woman, has ever wrecked a good marriage.

5316.author: Jimmy Dean
5316.quote: I went further on less talent than anyone, but I was a damned good entertainer.

5317.author: Jimmy Dean
5317.quote: Being a Baptist won't keep you from sinning, but it'll sure as hell keep you from enjoying it.

5318.author: Jimmy Dean
5318.quote: I've seen so many people in this business that made a fortune. They get old and broke and can't make any money. I tell you something... no one's going to play a benefit for Jimmy Dean.

5319.author: Jimmy Dean
5319.quote: I was a hard-workin' little boy. Oh, I worked. Pullin' cotton, shockin' grain, cuttin' wheat, loadin' wheat, choppin' cotton, cleanin' chicken houses, milkin' cows, plowin'.

5320.author: Jimmy Dean
5320.quote: You gotta try your luck at least once a day, because you could be going around lucky all day and not even know it.

5321.author: Jimmy Dean
5321.quote: When I was a kid, I used to think, 'Man, if I could ever afford all the ice cream I want to eat, that's as rich as I ever want to be.'

5322.author: Jimmy Dean
5322.quote: You know you're getting old when you go to more funerals than you do weddings.

5323.author: Jimmy Dean
5323.quote: My favorite song? 'Amazing Grace.' Anybody singing it. But the best it'll ever be done is by the Scottish National Pipe band and their National Orchestra. It'll bring tears to your eyes.

5324.author: Jimmy Dean
5324.quote: I think the kids in school that laughed at the clothes that we wore and the house that we lived in, and then my mother had to cut hair... I think that was a good motivator. Every time they laughed at me, they just built a fire, and there was only one way to put it out - to try and show 'em I was as good as they were.

5325.author: Jimmy Dean
5325.quote: I made more money yesterday than I ever thought I'd make in an entire lifetime. But it's like somebody's going to take it all away from me and I'll be back in Texas, installing them damned irrigation wells. I didn't like that when I was sixteen. And I know I wouldn't like it when I'm eighty.

5326.author: Jimmy Dean
5326.quote: I used to help my granddaddy make sausage. He would mix it up in a cleaned-out washtub with his hands, no gloves. Man, if we did anything like that today, they would jack the jail up and throw us under it.

5327.author: Jimmy Dean
5327.quote: I loved music since the Seth Ward Baptist Church outside of Plainview.

5328.author: Joel Osteen
5328.quote: I believe if you keep your faith, you keep your trust, you keep the right attitude, if you're grateful, you'll see God open up new doors.

5329.author: Joel Osteen
5329.quote: When you focus on being a blessing, God makes sure that you are always blessed in abundance.

5330.author: Joel Osteen
5330.quote: You're going to go through tough times - that's life. But I say, 'Nothing happens to you, it happens for you.' See the positive in negative events.

5331.author: Joel Osteen
5331.quote: Choosing to be positive and having a grateful attitude is going to determine how you're going to live your life.

5332.author: Joel Osteen
5332.quote: Every day we have plenty of opportunities to get angry, stressed or offended. But what you're doing when you indulge these negative emotions is giving something outside yourself power over your happiness. You can choose to not let little things upset you.

5333.author: Joel Osteen
5333.quote: Christmas is the perfect time to celebrate the love of God and family and to create memories that will last forever. Jesus is God's perfect, indescribable gift. The amazing thing is that not only are we able to receive this gift, but we are able to share it with others on Christmas and every other day of the year.

5334.author: Joel Osteen
5334.quote: Let go of yesterday. Let today be a new beginning and be the best that you can, and you'll get to where God wants you to be.

5335.author: Joel Osteen
5335.quote: See, when you drive home today, you've got a big windshield on the front of your car. And you've got a little bitty rearview mirror. And the reason the windshield is so large and the rearview mirror is so small is because what's happened in your past is not near as important as what's in your future.

5336.author: Joel Osteen
5336.quote: I believe that God has put gifts and talents and ability on the inside of every one of us. When you develop that and you believe in yourself and you believe that you're a person of influence and a person of purpose, I believe you can rise up out of any situation.

5337.author: Joel Osteen
5337.quote: It's easy to get negative because you get beat down. You go through a few disappointments and it's easy to stay in that negative frame of mind. Choosing to be positive and having a grateful attitude is a whole cliche, but your attitude is going to determine how you're going to live your life.

5338.author: Joel Osteen
5338.quote: Keep a good attitude and do the right thing even when it's hard. When you do that you are passing the test. And God promises you your marked moments are on their way.

5339.author: Joel Osteen
5339.quote: God made you a masterpiece - be blessed, secure, disciplined and equipped.

5340.author: Joel Osteen
5340.quote: Don't ever criticize yourself. Don't go around all day long thinking, 'I'm unattractive, I'm slow, I'm not as smart as my brother.' God wasn't having a bad day when he made you... If you don't love yourself in the right way, you can't love your neighbour. You can't be as good as you are supposed to be.

5341.author: Joel Osteen
5341.quote: Encouragement to others is something everyone can give. Somebody needs what you have to give. It may not be your money; it may be your time. It may be your listening ear. It may be your arms to encourage. It may be your smile to uplift. Who knows?

5342.author: Joel Osteen
5342.quote: If you don't set the tone for the day, the devil will set it for you.

5343.author: Joel Osteen
5343.quote: I think faith is incredibly important because you will become overwhelmed with what's happening and you will have waves of grief, but when you turn to your faith, I believe God will give you waves of grace to get through it.

5344.author: Joel Osteen
5344.quote: Sometimes we look back and 10 years from now we think, 'Boy, those were great old days.' Well, you know, we're living in the good old days.

5345.author: Joel Osteen
5345.quote: I want to challenge you today to get out of your comfort zone. You have so much incredible potential on the inside. God has put gifts and talents in you that you probably don't know anything about.

5346.author: Joel Osteen
5346.quote: I wouldn't ever say if you're having tough times then there must be something wrong with you or your attitude. Life's a fight. It's a good fight of faith. I encourage people to stay up, stay hopeful, stay faith-filled.

5347.author: Joel Osteen
5347.quote: You can change your world by changing your words... Remember, death and life are in the power of the tongue.

5348.author: Joel Osteen
5348.quote: God can cause opportunity to find you. He has unexpected blessings where you suddenly meet the right person, or suddenly your health improves, or suddenly you're able to pay off your house. That's God shifting things in your favor.

5349.author: Joel Osteen
5349.quote: You can live your life angry, bitter, mad at somebody or even guilty, not letting go of your own mistakes, but you won't receive the good things God has in store.

5350.author: Joel Osteen
5350.quote: I don't think you should spend your life praying for things, but I do believe you should thank God for what He's given you... but I think the scripture teaches us that we can pray for our dreams, pray for the big things... he's not a small God; this God is incredible.

5351.author: Joel Osteen
5351.quote: It's in the difficult times that we're growing and you can't just rebuke everything hard. We've got to endure it and fight the good fight of faith and pass the test.

5352.author: Joel Osteen
5352.quote: God didn't make a mistake when He made you. You need to see yourself as God sees you.

5353.author: Joel Osteen
5353.quote: You have to come to your closed doors before you get to your open doors... What if you knew you had to go through 32 closed doors before you got to your open door? Well, then you'd come to closed door number eight and you'd think, 'Great, I got another one out of the way'... Keep moving forward.

5354.author: John Adams
5354.quote: I must study politics and war that my sons may have liberty to study mathematics and philosophy.

5355.author: John Adams
5355.quote: Liberty cannot be preserved without general knowledge among the people.

5356.author: John Adams
5356.quote: Old minds are like old horses; you must exercise them if you wish to keep them in working order.

5357.author: John Adams
5357.quote: Our Constitution was made only for a moral and religious people. It is wholly inadequate to the government of any other.

5358.author: John Adams
5358.quote: Power always thinks... that it is doing God's service when it is violating all his laws.

5359.author: John Adams
5359.quote: Great is the guilt of an unnecessary war.

5360.author: John Adams
5360.quote: Democracy... while it lasts is more bloody than either aristocracy or monarchy. Remember, democracy never lasts long. It soon wastes, exhausts, and murders itself. There is never a democracy that did not commit suicide.

5361.author: John Adams
5361.quote: Fear is the foundation of most governments.

5362.author: John Adams
5362.quote: Because power corrupts, society's demands for moral authority and character increase as the importance of the position increases.

5363.author: John Adams
5363.quote: Facts are stubborn things; and whatever may be our wishes, our inclinations, or the dictates of our passions, they cannot alter the state of facts and evidence.

5364.author: John Adams
5364.quote: I must not write a word to you about politics, because you are a woman.

5365.author: John Adams
5365.quote: Posterity! You will never know how much it cost the present generation to preserve your freedom! I hope you will make a good use of it.

5366.author: John Adams
5366.quote: The happiness of society is the end of government.

5367.author: John Adams
5367.quote: The Hebrews have done more to civilize men than any other nation. If I were an atheist, and believed blind eternal fate, I should still believe that fate had ordained the Jews to be the most essential instrument for civilizing the nations.

5368.author: John Adams
5368.quote: Remember, democracy never lasts long. It soon wastes, exhausts, and murders itself. There never was a democracy yet that did not commit suicide.

5369.author: John Adams
5369.quote: When people talk of the freedom of writing, speaking or thinking I cannot choose but laugh. No such thing ever existed. No such thing now exists; but I hope it will exist. But it must be hundreds of years after you and I shall write and speak no more.

5370.author: John Adams
5370.quote: The right of a nation to kill a tyrant in case of necessity can no more be doubted than to hang a robber, or kill a flea.

5371.author: John Adams
5371.quote: A government of laws, and not of men.

5372.author: John Adams
5372.quote: Let us tenderly and kindly cherish, therefore, the means of knowledge. Let us dare to read, think, speak, and write.

5373.author: John Adams
5373.quote: Property is surely a right of mankind as real as liberty.

5374.author: John Adams
5374.quote: The essence of a free government consists in an effectual control of rivalries.

5375.author: John Adams
5375.quote: I have accepted a seat in the House of Representatives, and thereby have consented to my own ruin, to your ruin, and to the ruin of our children. I give you this warning that you may prepare your mind for your fate.

5376.author: John Adams
5376.quote: Here is everything which can lay hold of the eye, ear and imagination - everything which can charm and bewitch the simple and ignorant. I wonder how Luther ever broke the spell.

5377.author: John Adams
5377.quote: All the perplexities, confusion and distress in America arise, not from defects in their Constitution or Confederation, not from want of honor or virtue, so much as from the downright ignorance of the nature of coin, credit and circulation.

5378.author: John Adams
5378.quote: Abuse of words has been the great instrument of sophistry and chicanery, of party, faction, and division of society.

5379.author: John Adams
5379.quote: The Declaration of Independence I always considered as a theatrical show. Jefferson ran away with all the stage effect of that... and all the glory of it.

5380.author: John C. Maxwell
5380.quote: A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way.

5381.author: John C. Maxwell
5381.quote: People may hear your words, but they feel your attitude.

5382.author: John C. Maxwell
5382.quote: Family and friendships are two of the greatest facilitators of happiness.

5383.author: John C. Maxwell
5383.quote: A word of encouragement from a teacher to a child can change a life. A word of encouragement from a spouse can save a marriage. A word of encouragement from a leader can inspire a person to reach her potential.

5384.author: John C. Maxwell
5384.quote: The secret of your success is determined by your daily agenda.

5385.author: John C. Maxwell
5385.quote: Without failure there is no achievement.

5386.author: John C. Maxwell
5386.quote: There are two kinds of pride, both good and bad. 'Good pride' represents our dignity and self-respect. 'Bad pride' is the deadly sin of superiority that reeks of conceit and arrogance.

5387.author: John C. Maxwell
5387.quote: A minute of thought is greater than an hour of talk.

5388.author: John C. Maxwell
5388.quote: A man must be big enough to admit his mistakes, smart enough to profit from them, and strong enough to correct them.

5389.author: John C. Maxwell
5389.quote: Most people want to avoid pain, and discipline is usually painful.

5390.author: John C. Maxwell
5390.quote: Leaders must be close enough to relate to others, but far enough ahead to motivate them.

5391.author: John C. Maxwell
5391.quote: Your attitude towards failure determines your altitude after failure.

5392.author: John C. Maxwell
5392.quote: People buy into the leader before they buy into the vision.

5393.author: John C. Maxwell
5393.quote: Time management is an oxymoron. Time is beyond our control, and the clock keeps ticking regardless of how we lead our lives. Priority management is the answer to maximizing the time we have.

5394.author: John C. Maxwell
5394.quote: Teamwork makes the dream work, but a vision becomes a nightmare when the leader has a big dream and a bad team.

5395.author: John C. Maxwell
5395.quote: Enjoyment is an incredible energizer to the human spirit.

5396.author: John C. Maxwell
5396.quote: The difference between average people and achieving people is their perception of and response to failure.

5397.author: John C. Maxwell
5397.quote: Success is due to our stretching to the challenges of life. Failure comes when we shrink from them.

5398.author: John C. Maxwell
5398.quote: All of the people in my life whom I consider to be close friends or colleagues are good thinkers.

5399.author: John C. Maxwell
5399.quote: If you are a leader, you should never forget that everyone needs encouragement. And everyone who receives it - young or old, successful or less-than-successful, unknown or famous - is changed by it.

5401.author: John C. Maxwell
5401.quote: The dreams and passions stored within hearts are powerful keys which can unlock a wealth of potential.

5402.author: John C. Maxwell
5402.quote: Failed plans should not be interpreted as a failed vision. Visions don't change, they are only refined. Plans rarely stay the same, and are scrapped or adjusted as needed. Be stubborn about the vision, but flexible with your plan.

5403.author: John C. Maxwell
5403.quote: When your dream is bigger than you are, you only have two choices: give up or get help.

5404.author: John C. Maxwell
5404.quote: Growth is the great separator between those who succeed and those who do not. When I see a person beginning to separate themselves from the pack, it's almost always due to personal growth.

5405.author: John C. Maxwell
5405.quote: When a person starts to talk about their dreams, it's as if something bubbles up from within. Their eyes brighten, their face glows, and you can feel the excitement in their words.

5406.author: John D. Rockefeller
5406.quote: A friendship founded on business is better than a business founded on friendship.

5407.author: John D. Rockefeller
5407.quote: If you want to succeed you should strike out on new paths, rather than travel the worn paths of accepted success.

5408.author: John D. Rockefeller
5408.quote: The way to make money is to buy when blood is running in the streets.

5409.author: John D. Rockefeller
5409.quote: Every right implies a responsibility; Every opportunity, an obligation, Every possession, a duty.

5410.author: John D. Rockefeller
5410.quote: I do not think that there is any other quality so essential to success of any kind as the quality of perseverance. It overcomes almost everything, even nature.

5411.author: John D. Rockefeller
5411.quote: If your only goal is to become rich, you will never achieve it.

5412.author: John D. Rockefeller
5412.quote: Good leadership consists of showing average people how to do the work of superior people.

5413.author: John D. Rockefeller
5413.quote: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.

5414.author: John D. Rockefeller
5414.quote: I believe in the dignity of labor, whether with head or hand; that the world owes no man a living but that it owes every man an opportunity to make a living.

5415.author: John D. Rockefeller
5415.quote: The most important thing for a young man is to establish a credit... a reputation, character.

5416.author: John D. Rockefeller
5416.quote: I always tried to turn every disaster into an opportunity.

5417.author: John D. Rockefeller
5417.quote: This Sunday School has been of help to me, greater perhaps than any other force in my Christian life, and I can ask no better things for you than that you, and all that shall come after you in this great band of workers for Christ, shall receive the same measure of blessedness which I have been permitted to have.

5418.author: John D. Rockefeller
5418.quote: Do you know the only thing that gives me pleasure? It's to see my dividends coming in.

5419.author: John D. Rockefeller
5419.quote: Good management consists in showing average people how to do the work of superior people.

5420.author: John D. Rockefeller
5420.quote: The ability to deal with people is as purchasable a commodity as sugar or coffee and I will pay more for that ability than for any other under the sun.

5421.author: John D. Rockefeller
5421.quote: I would rather earn 1% off a 100 people's efforts than 100% of my own efforts.

5422.author: John D. Rockefeller
5422.quote: There is nothing in this world that can compare with the Christian fellowship; nothing that can satisfy but Christ.

5423.author: John D. Rockefeller
5423.quote: Charity is injurious unless it helps the recipient to become independent of it.

5424.author: John D. Rockefeller
5424.quote: Next to doing the right thing, the most important thing is to let people know you are doing the right thing.

5425.author: John D. Rockefeller
5425.quote: Giving should be entered into in just the same way as investing. Giving is investing.

5426.author: John D. Rockefeller
5426.quote: Singleness of purpose is one of the chief essentials for success in life, no matter what may be one's aim.

5428.author: John D. Rockefeller
5428.quote: I have ways of making money that you know nothing of.

5429.author: John D. Rockefeller
5429.quote: And we are never too old to study the Bible. Each time the lessons are studied comes some new meaning, some new thought which will make us better.

5430.author: John D. Rockefeller
5430.quote: It is wrong to assume that men of immense wealth are always happy.

5431.author: John D. Rockefeller
5431.quote: I believe that thrift is essential to well-ordered living.

5432.author: John Dewey
5432.quote: Education is not preparation for life; education is life itself.

5433.author: John Dewey
5433.quote: Arriving at one goal is the starting point to another.

5434.author: John Dewey
5434.quote: Time and memory are true artists; they remould reality nearer to the heart's desire.

5435.author: John Dewey
5435.quote: Education, therefore, is a process of living and not a preparation for future living.

5436.author: John Dewey
5436.quote: The good man is the man who, no matter how morally unworthy he has been, is moving to become better.

5437.author: John Dewey
5437.quote: To find out what one is fitted to do, and to secure an opportunity to do it, is the key to happiness.

5438.author: John Dewey
5438.quote: Just as a flower which seems beautiful and has color but no perfume, so are the fruitless words of the man who speaks them but does them not.

5439.author: John Dewey
5439.quote: The belief that all genuine education comes about through experience does not mean that all experiences are genuinely or equally educative.

5440.author: John Dewey
5440.quote: Without some goals and some efforts to reach it, no man can live.

5441.author: John Dewey
5441.quote: The self is not something ready-made, but something in continuous formation through choice of action.

5442.author: John Dewey
5442.quote: Skepticism: the mark and even the pose of the educated mind.

5443.author: John Dewey
5443.quote: The path of least resistance and least trouble is a mental rut already made. It requires troublesome work to undertake the alternation of old beliefs.

5444.author: John Dewey
5444.quote: Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of imagination.

5445.author: John Dewey
5445.quote: No man's credit is as good as his money.

5446.author: John Dewey
5446.quote: Man is not logical and his intellectual history is a record of mental reserves and compromises. He hangs on to what he can in his old beliefs even when he is compelled to surrender their logical basis.

5447.author: John Dewey
5447.quote: Luck, bad if not good, will always be with us. But it has a way of favoring the intelligent and showing its back to the stupid.

5448.author: John Dewey
5448.quote: Failure is instructive. The person who really thinks learns quite as much from his failures as from his successes.

5449.author: John Dewey
5449.quote: We only think when we are confronted with problems.

5450.author: John Dewey
5450.quote: Nature is the mother and the habitat of man, even if sometimes a stepmother and an unfriendly home.

5451.author: John Dewey
5451.quote: Anyone who has begun to think, places some portion of the world in jeopardy.

5452.author: John Dewey
5452.quote: Man lives in a world of surmise, of mystery, of uncertainties.

5453.author: John Dewey
5453.quote: To me faith means not worrying.

5454.author: John Dewey
5454.quote: Such happiness as life is capable of comes from the full participation of all our powers in the endeavor to wrest from each changing situations of experience its own full and unique meaning.

5455.author: John Dewey
5455.quote: One lives with so many bad deeds on one's conscience and some good intentions in one's heart.

5456.author: John Dewey
5456.quote: By object is meant some element in the complex whole that is defined in abstraction from the whole of which it is a distinction.

5457.author: John F. Kennedy
5457.quote: Leadership and learning are indispensable to each other.

5458.author: John F. Kennedy
5458.quote: We are not here to curse the darkness, but to light the candle that can guide us thru that darkness to a safe and sane future.

5459.author: John F. Kennedy
5459.quote: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.

5460.author: John F. Kennedy
5460.quote: Let us not seek the Republican answer or the Democratic answer, but the right answer. Let us not seek to fix the blame for the past. Let us accept our own responsibility for the future.

5461.author: John F. Kennedy
5461.quote: Things do not happen. Things are made to happen.

5462.author: John F. Kennedy
5462.quote: Forgive your enemies, but never forget their names.

5463.author: John F. Kennedy
5463.quote: If we cannot now end our differences, at least we can help make the world safe for diversity.

5464.author: John F. Kennedy
5464.quote: Conformity is the jailer of freedom and the enemy of growth.

5465.author: John F. Kennedy
5465.quote: Efforts and courage are not enough without purpose and direction.

5466.author: John F. Kennedy
5466.quote: Physical fitness is not only one of the most important keys to a healthy body, it is the basis of dynamic and creative intellectual activity.

5467.author: John F. Kennedy
5467.quote: We are tied to the ocean. And when we go back to the sea, whether it is to sail or to watch - we are going back from whence we came.

5468.author: John F. Kennedy
5468.quote: My fellow Americans, ask not what your country can do for you, ask what you can do for your country.

5469.author: John F. Kennedy
5469.quote: Man is still the most extraordinary computer of all.

5470.author: John F. Kennedy
5470.quote: Let every nation know, whether it wishes us well or ill, that we shall pay any price, bear any burden, meet any hardship, support any friend, oppose any foe to assure the survival and the success of liberty.

5471.author: John F. Kennedy
5471.quote: There are risks and costs to action. But they are far less than the long range risks of comfortable inaction.

5472.author: John F. Kennedy
5472.quote: Geography has made us neighbors. History has made us friends. Economics has made us partners, and necessity has made us allies. Those whom God has so joined together, let no man put asunder.

5473.author: John F. Kennedy
5473.quote: Politics is like football; if you see daylight, go through the hole.

5474.author: John F. Kennedy
5474.quote: Those who make peaceful revolution impossible will make violent revolution inevitable.

5475.author: John F. Kennedy
5475.quote: The great enemy of the truth is very often not the lie, deliberate, contrived and dishonest, but the myth, persistent, persuasive and unrealistic.

5476.author: John F. Kennedy
5476.quote: Tolerance implies no lack of commitment to one's own beliefs. Rather it condemns the oppression or persecution of others.

5477.author: John F. Kennedy
5477.quote: The goal of education is the advancement of knowledge and the dissemination of truth.

5478.author: John F. Kennedy
5478.quote: Communism has never come to power in a country that was not disrupted by war or corruption, or both.

5479.author: John F. Kennedy
5479.quote: The ignorance of one voter in a democracy impairs the security of all.

5480.author: John F. Kennedy
5480.quote: Israel was not created in order to disappear - Israel will endure and flourish. It is the child of hope and the home of the brave. It can neither be broken by adversity nor demoralized by success. It carries the shield of democracy and it honors the sword of freedom.

5481.author: John F. Kennedy
5481.quote: Those who dare to fail miserably can achieve greatly.

5482.author: John F. Kennedy
5482.quote: When power leads man toward arrogance, poetry reminds him of his limitations. When power narrows the area of man's concern, poetry reminds him of the richness and diversity of existence. When power corrupts, poetry cleanses.

5483.author: John Keats
5483.quote: I love you the more in that I believe you had liked me for my own sake and for nothing else.

5484.author: John Keats
5484.quote: Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard are sweeter.

5485.author: John Keats
5485.quote: A thing of beauty is a joy forever: its loveliness increases; it will never pass into nothingness.

5486.author: John Keats
5486.quote: Now a soft kiss - Aye, by that kiss, I vow an endless bliss.

5487.author: John Keats
5487.quote: Scenery is fine - but human nature is finer.

5488.author: John Keats
5488.quote: The poetry of the earth is never dead.

5489.author: John Keats
5489.quote: My imagination is a monastery and I am its monk.

5490.author: John Keats
5490.quote: Nothing ever becomes real till it is experienced.

5491.author: John Keats
5491.quote: 'Beauty is truth, truth beauty,' - that is all ye know on earth, and all ye need to know.

5492.author: John Keats
5492.quote: You are always new, the last of your kisses was ever the sweetest.

5493.author: John Keats
5493.quote: There is nothing stable in the world; uproar's your only music.

5494.author: John Keats
5494.quote: I have two luxuries to brood over in my walks, your loveliness and the hour of my death. O that I could have possession of them both in the same minute.

5495.author: John Keats
5495.quote: The only means of strengthening one's intellect is to make up one's mind about nothing, to let the mind be a thoroughfare for all thoughts.

5496.author: John Keats
5496.quote: Here lies one whose name was writ in water.

5497.author: John Keats
5497.quote: Do you not see how necessary a world of pains and troubles is to school an intelligence and make it a soul?

5498.author: John Keats
5498.quote: It appears to me that almost any man may like the spider spin from his own inwards his own airy citadel.

5499.author: John Keats
5499.quote: Philosophy will clip an angel's wings.

5500.author: John Keats
5500.quote: Poetry should surprise by a fine excess and not by singularity, it should strike the reader as a wording of his own highest thoughts, and appear almost a remembrance.

5501.author: John Keats
5501.quote: I am in that temper that if I were under water I would scarcely kick to come to the top.

5502.author: John Keats
5502.quote: You speak of Lord Byron and me; there is this great difference between us. He describes what he sees I describe what I imagine. Mine is the hardest task.

5503.author: John Keats
5503.quote: I will give you a definition of a proud man: he is a man who has neither vanity nor wisdom one filled with hatreds cannot be vain, neither can he be wise.

5504.author: John Keats
5504.quote: Land and sea, weakness and decline are great separators, but death is the great divorcer for ever.

5505.author: John Keats
5505.quote: Praise or blame has but a momentary effect on the man whose love of beauty in the abstract makes him a severe critic on his own works.

5506.author: John Keats
5506.quote: Love is my religion - I could die for it.

5507.author: John Keats
5507.quote: I am certain of nothing but the holiness of the heart's affections, and the truth of imagination.

5508.author: John Keats
5508.quote: There is an electric fire in human nature tending to purify - so that among these human creatures there is continually some birth of new heroism. The pity is that we must wonder at it, as we should at finding a pearl in rubbish.

5509.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5509.quote: Under capitalism, man exploits man. Under communism, it's just the opposite.

5510.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5510.quote: Economics is extremely useful as a form of employment for economists.

5511.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5511.quote: The modern conservative is engaged in one of man's oldest exercises in moral philosophy; that is, the search for a superior moral justification for selfishness.

5512.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5512.quote: The only function of economic forecasting is to make astrology look respectable.

5513.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5513.quote: A person buying ordinary products in a supermarket is in touch with his deepest emotions.

5514.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5514.quote: The salary of the chief executive of a large corporation is not a market award for achievement. It is frequently in the nature of a warm personal gesture by the individual to himself.

5515.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5515.quote: In any great organization it is far, far safer to be wrong with the majority than to be right alone.

5516.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5516.quote: The conventional view serves to protect us from the painful job of thinking.

5517.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5517.quote: There is certainly no absolute standard of beauty. That precisely is what makes its pursuit so interesting.

5518.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5518.quote: Meetings are indispensable when you don't want to do anything.

5519.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5519.quote: In the United States, though power corrupts, the expectation of power paralyzes.

5520.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5520.quote: Faced with the choice between changing one's mind and proving that there is no need to do so, almost everyone gets busy on the proof.

5521.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5521.quote: The process by which banks create money is so simple that the mind is repelled.

5522.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5522.quote: Modesty is a vastly overrated virtue.

5523.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5523.quote: Power is not something that can be assumed or discarded at will like underwear.

5524.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5524.quote: Meetings are a great trap. Soon you find yourself trying to get agreement and then the people who disagree come to think they have a right to be persuaded. However, they are indispensable when you don't want to do anything.

5525.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5525.quote: The conspicuously wealthy turn up urging the character building values of the privation of the poor.

5526.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5526.quote: Of all classes the rich are the most noticed and the least studied.

5527.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5527.quote: If wrinkles must be written upon our brows, let them not be written upon the heart. The spirit should never grow old.

5528.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5528.quote: In the choice between changing ones mind and proving there's no need to do so, most people get busy on the proof.

5529.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5529.quote: Politics is the art of choosing between the disastrous and the unpalatable.

5530.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5530.quote: Wealth, in even the most improbable cases, manages to convey the aspect of intelligence.

5531.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5531.quote: In economics, the majority is always wrong.

5532.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5532.quote: In all life one should comfort the afflicted, but verily, also, one should afflict the comfortable, and especially when they are comfortably, contentedly, even happily wrong.

5533.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5533.quote: We all agree that pessimism is a mark of superior intellect.

5534.author: John Kenneth Galbraith
5534.quote: In economics, hope and faith coexist with great scientific pretension and also a deep desire for respectability.

5535.author: John Lennon
5535.quote: Love is the answer, and you know that for sure; Love is a flower, you've got to let it grow.

5536.author: John Lennon
5536.quote: Love is the flower you've got to let grow.

5537.author: John Lennon
5537.quote: Yeah we all shine on, like the moon, and the stars, and the sun.

5538.author: John Lennon
5538.quote: Life is what happens while you are busy making other plans.

5539.author: John Lennon
5539.quote: We've got this gift of love, but love is like a precious plant. You can't just accept it and leave it in the cupboard or just think it's going to get on by itself. You've got to keep watering it. You've got to really look after it and nurture it.

5540.author: John Lennon
5540.quote: Imagine all the people living life in peace. You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us, and the world will be as one.

5541.author: John Lennon
5541.quote: If everyone demanded peace instead of another television set, then there'd be peace.

5542.author: John Lennon
5542.quote: As usual, there is a great woman behind every idiot.

5543.author: John Lennon
5543.quote: Surrealism had a great effect on me because then I realised that the imagery in my mind wasn't insanity. Surrealism to me is reality.

5544.author: John Lennon
5544.quote: Time you enjoy wasting, was not wasted.

5545.author: John Lennon
5545.quote: You don't need anybody to tell you who you are or what you are. You are what you are!

5546.author: John Lennon
5546.quote: Part of me suspects that I'm a loser, and the other part of me thinks I'm God Almighty.

5547.author: John Lennon
5547.quote: My role in society, or any artist's or poet's role, is to try and express what we all feel. Not to tell people how to feel. Not as a preacher, not as a leader, but as a reflection of us all.

5548.author: John Lennon
5548.quote: It doesn't matter how long my hair is or what colour my skin is or whether I'm a woman or a man.

5549.author: John Lennon
5549.quote: The thing the sixties did was to show us the possibilities and the responsibility that we all had. It wasn't the answer. It just gave us a glimpse of the possibility.

5550.author: John Lennon
5550.quote: I believe in everything until it's disproved. So I believe in fairies, the myths, dragons. It all exists, even if it's in your mind. Who's to say that dreams and nightmares aren't as real as the here and now?

5551.author: John Lennon
5551.quote: Reality leaves a lot to the imagination.

5552.author: John Lennon
5552.quote: I believe time wounds all heels.

5553.author: John Lennon
5553.quote: If someone thinks that love and peace is a cliche that must have been left behind in the Sixties, that's his problem. Love and peace are eternal.

5554.author: John Lennon
5554.quote: All we are saying is give peace a chance.

5555.author: John Lennon
5555.quote: Our society is run by insane people for insane objectives. I think we're being run by maniacs for maniacal ends and I think I'm liable to be put away as insane for expressing that. That's what's insane about it.

5557.author: John Lennon
5557.quote: Will the people in the cheaper seats clap your hands? And the rest of you, if you'll just rattle your jewelry.

5558.author: John Lennon
5558.quote: When you're drowning, you don't say 'I would be incredibly pleased if someone would have the foresight to notice me drowning and come and help me,' you just scream.

5559.author: John Lennon
5559.quote: Music is everybody's possession. It's only publishers who think that people own it.

5560.author: John Lennon
5560.quote: You're just left with yourself all the time, whatever you do anyway. You've got to get down to your own God in your own temple. It's all down to you, mate.

5561.author: John Locke
5561.quote: All mankind... being all equal and independent, no one ought to harm another in his life, health, liberty or possessions.

5562.author: John Locke
5562.quote: The discipline of desire is the background of character.

5563.author: John Locke
5563.quote: The end of law is not to abolish or restrain, but to preserve and enlarge freedom. For in all the states of created beings capable of law, where there is no law, there is no freedom.

5564.author: John Locke
5564.quote: We are like chameleons, we take our hue and the color of our moral character, from those who are around us.

5565.author: John Locke
5565.quote: Education begins the gentleman, but reading, good company and reflection must finish him.

5566.author: John Locke
5566.quote: Every man has a property in his own person. This nobody has a right to, but himself.

5568.author: John Locke
5568.quote: No man's knowledge here can go beyond his experience.

5569.author: John Locke
5569.quote: The improvement of understanding is for two ends: first, our own increase of knowledge; secondly, to enable us to deliver that knowledge to others.

5570.author: John Locke
5570.quote: To love our neighbor as ourselves is such a truth for regulating human society, that by that alone one might determine all the cases in social morality.

5571.author: John Locke
5571.quote: All wealth is the product of labor.

5572.author: John Locke
5572.quote: The Bible is one of the greatest blessings bestowed by God on the children of men. It has God for its author; salvation for its end, and truth without any mixture for its matter. It is all pure.

5573.author: John Locke
5573.quote: Our incomes are like our shoes; if too small, they gall and pinch us; but if too large, they cause us to stumble and to trip.

5574.author: John Locke
5574.quote: Fortitude is the guard and support of the other virtues.

5575.author: John Locke
5575.quote: Government has no other end, but the preservation of property.

5576.author: John Locke
5576.quote: The only fence against the world is a thorough knowledge of it.

5577.author: John Locke
5577.quote: I have always thought the actions of men the best interpreters of their thoughts.

5578.author: John Locke
5578.quote: Parents wonder why the streams are bitter, when they themselves have poisoned the fountain.

5579.author: John Locke
5579.quote: Where there is no property there is no injustice.

5580.author: John Locke
5580.quote: The reason why men enter into society is the preservation of their property.

5581.author: John Locke
5581.quote: New opinions are always suspected, and usually opposed, without any other reason but because they are not already common.

5582.author: John Locke
5582.quote: A sound mind in a sound body, is a short, but full description of a happy state in this World: he that has these two, has little more to wish for; and he that wants either of them, will be little the better for anything else.

5583.author: John Locke
5583.quote: An excellent man, like precious metal, is in every way invariable; A villain, like the beams of a balance, is always varying, upwards and downwards.

5584.author: John Locke
5584.quote: As people are walking all the time, in the same spot, a path appears.

5585.author: John Locke
5585.quote: There cannot be greater rudeness than to interrupt another in the current of his discourse.

5586.author: John Locke
5586.quote: The dread of evil is a much more forcible principle of human actions than the prospect of good.

5587.author: John Madden
5587.quote: Self-praise is for losers. Be a winner. Stand for something. Always have class, and be humble.

5588.author: John Madden
5588.quote: If you see a defense team with dirt and mud on their backs they've had a bad day.

5589.author: John Madden
5589.quote: If a guy doesn't work hard and doesn't play well, he can't lead anything. All he is, is a talker.

5590.author: John Madden
5590.quote: When the going gets tough, I'm not always sure what you do. I'm not saying that I know how to fix everything when the going gets tough, but I do know this: when the going goes tough, you don't quit. And you don't fold up. And you don't go in the other direction.

5591.author: John Madden
5591.quote: Since 1981, I've spent every Thanksgiving Day broadcasting a game, and it is one of my favorite days. You can say, 'Woe is me, I never get to be part of the tradition,' or you can say, 'Heck, we've got our own tradition, and it's pretty good.'

5592.author: John Madden
5592.quote: Don't worry about the horse being blind, just load the wagon.

5593.author: John Madden
5593.quote: I was introduced to the Turducken in New Orleans. And it wasn't Thanksgiving. Glenn at the Gourmet Butcher Block brought it by, and I had never heard of it or had seen one, and they put it in the booth, and it smelled so good that I had to taste it. And it was good. Then Thanksgiving came, and we got one in addition to the traditional turkey.

5594.author: John Madden
5594.quote: I'm a firm believer that there's no way that a six-year-old should have a helmet on and learn a tackling drill.

5595.author: John Madden
5595.quote: Al Davis has been the biggest influence in my professional football life. I mean, he was a guy that gave me an opportunity, one, to get into professional football in 1967 as an assistant coach, and then at the age of 32, giving me the opportunity to be the head coach.

5596.author: John Madden
5596.quote: There's so many kids who only know me from the video game. And they want to know if I'm home - and if I have a video game I can give them on Halloween. And sometimes they're surprised to learn there actually is a 'Madden.'

5597.author: John Madden
5597.quote: I was in New York on September 11 when those planes hit the World Trade Center. At the time, it seemed like it was a local thing. But three or four days later, by the time we drove across the country in the bus, we realized it wasn't a local thing. You could really feel the states become united. We became the United States of America.

5598.author: John Madden
5598.quote: I'm the luckiest guy in the world. I never really had a job. I was a football player, then a football coach, then a football broadcaster. It's been my life. Pro football has been my life since 1967. I've enjoyed every part of it. Never once did it ever feel like work.

5599.author: John Madden
5599.quote: I've got five grandkids. They play baseball, they play football, they play basketball. I go to all the games. You always have that urge to say something when you're watching them. But I've learned to keep it to myself. I've blurted out some things and embarrassed myself.

5600.author: John Madden
5600.quote: A consulting position might work in another profession, but not in pro football. There's no such thing. They give a guy a parking spot and put his name up as a consultant, and in six months, they erase the name.

5601.author: John Madden
5601.quote: Football isn't nuclear physics, but it's not so simple that you can make it simple. It takes some explaining to get it across.

5602.author: John Madden
5602.quote: The road to Easy Street goes through the sewer.

5603.author: John Madden
5603.quote: If you think about it, I've never held a job in my life. I went from being an NFL player to a coach to a broadcaster. I haven't worked a day in my life.

5604.author: John Madden
5604.quote: When I got out of coaching, I had taught a class at the University of California, an extension class on football for fans. I was looking for tools. I was showing them films. I was going to write a textbook. Trip Hawkins came to me about making it a game for computers.

5605.author: John Madden
5605.quote: That's the biggest gap in sports, the difference between the winner and the loser of the Super Bowl.

5606.author: John Madden
5606.quote: The only yardstick for success our society has is being a champion. No one remembers anything else.

5607.author: John Madden
5607.quote: If you win a Super Bowl before you're fired, you're a genius, and everyone listens to you. But a coach is just a guy whose best class in grammar school was recess and whose best class in high school was P.E. I never thought I was anything but a guy whose best class was P.E.

5608.author: John Madden
5608.quote: I would never bet against Peyton Manning. You know about the age and the neck and the strength. But I had George Blanda, and as he got older, he got smarter, and he just got rid of the ball quicker. I watch Peyton, and I see George Blanda.

5609.author: John Madden
5609.quote: I never watched TV because I was always doing a game. I didn't have any experience to be home watching games. I didn't know how to do it. Brent Musburger and those guys could sit and watch every game and know the scores. And I was amazed and said, 'I'd like to have something like that someday.'

5610.author: John Madden
5610.quote: Discipline is knowing what you're supposed to do and doing it as best you can... On third down and short yardage, the Raiders don't jump offside. That's discipline - not a coat and tie, not a clean shave.

5611.author: John Madden
5611.quote: Thursday night football is here to stay. So we're looking at ways to make it safer. Now they're playing division games, so you limit travel. Now the question is, should you play Sunday night before a Thursday night?

5612.author: John Madden
5612.quote: The only things that smell good are fat and sugar. Tofu being boiled doesn't smell good. Anything that smells good is fattening.

5613.author: John Muir
5613.quote: In every walk with nature one receives far more than he seeks.

5614.author: John Muir
5614.quote: Keep close to Nature's heart... and break clear away, once in awhile, and climb a mountain or spend a week in the woods. Wash your spirit clean.

5615.author: John Muir
5615.quote: The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.

5616.author: John Muir
5616.quote: The power of imagination makes us infinite.

5617.author: John Muir
5617.quote: The mountains are calling and I must go.

5618.author: John Muir
5618.quote: When we contemplate the whole globe as one great dewdrop, striped and dotted with continents and islands, flying through space with other stars all singing and shining together as one, the whole universe appears as an infinite storm of beauty.

5619.author: John Muir
5619.quote: How glorious a greeting the sun gives the mountains!

5620.author: John Muir
5620.quote: Everybody needs beauty as well as bread, places to play in and pray in, where nature may heal and give strength to body and soul.

5621.author: John Muir
5621.quote: Only by going alone in silence, without baggage, can one truly get into the heart of the wilderness. All other travel is mere dust and hotels and baggage and chatter.

5622.author: John Muir
5622.quote: Going to the woods is going home, for I suppose we came from the woods originally. But in some of nature's forests, the adventurous traveler seems a feeble, unwelcome creature; wild beasts and the weather trying to kill him, the rank, tangled vegetation, armed with spears and stinging needles, barring his way and making life a hard struggle.

5623.author: John Muir
5623.quote: When we try to pick out anything by itself, we find it hitched to everything else in the universe.

5624.author: John Muir
5624.quote: The more I see of deer, the more I admire them as mountaineers. They make their way into the heart of the roughest solitudes with smooth reserve of strength, through dense belts of brush and forest encumbered with fallen trees and boulder piles, across canons, roaring streams, and snow-fields, ever showing forth beauty and courage.

5625.author: John Muir
5625.quote: It is easier to feel than to realize, or in any way explain, Yosemite grandeur. The magnitudes of the rocks and trees and streams are so delicately harmonized, they are mostly hidden.

5626.author: John Muir
5626.quote: Oh, these vast, calm, measureless mountain days, days in whose light everything seems equally divine, opening a thousand windows to show us God.

5627.author: John Muir
5627.quote: Climb the mountains and get their good tidings.

5628.author: John Muir
5628.quote: God has cared for these trees, saved them from drought, disease, avalanches, and a thousand tempests and floods. But he cannot save them from fools.

5629.author: John Muir
5629.quote: A few minutes ago every tree was excited, bowing to the roaring storm, waving, swirling, tossing their branches in glorious enthusiasm like worship. But though to the outer ear these trees are now silent, their songs never cease.

5630.author: John Muir
5630.quote: Nature is ever at work building and pulling down, creating and destroying, keeping everything whirling and flowing, allowing no rest but in rhythmical motion, chasing everything in endless song out of one beautiful form into another.

5631.author: John Muir
5631.quote: Bread without flesh is a good diet, as on many botanical excursions I have proved. Tea also may easily be ignored. Just bread and water and delightful toil is all I need - not unreasonably much, yet one ought to be trained and tempered to enjoy life in these brave wilds in full independence of any particular kind of nourishment.

5632.author: John Muir
5632.quote: All the world lies warm in one heart, yet the Sierra seems to get more light than other mountains. The weather is mostly sunshine embellished with magnificent storms, and nearly everything shines from base to summit - the rocks, streams, lakes, glaciers, irised falls, and the forests of silver fir and silver pine.

5633.author: John Muir
5633.quote: The practical importance of the preservation of our forests is augmented by their relations to climate, soil and streams.

5634.author: John Muir
5634.quote: To the lover of wilderness, Alaska is one of the most wonderful countries in the world.

5635.author: John Muir
5635.quote: The waving of a pine tree on the top of a mountain - a magic wand in Nature's hand - every devout mountaineer knows its power; but the marvelous beauty value of what the Scotch call a breckan in a still dell, what poet has sung this?

5636.author: John Muir
5636.quote: Rocks and waters, etc., are words of God, and so are men. We all flow from one fountain Soul. All are expressions of one Love.

5637.author: John Muir
5637.quote: Take a course in good water and air; and in the eternal youth of Nature you may renew your own. Go quietly, alone; no harm will befall you.

5638.author: John Muir
5638.quote: Sheep, like people, are ungovernable when hungry.

5639.author: John Mulaney
5639.quote: I look back on being 17 and think, 'Oh my God, how did I not die?'

5640.author: John Mulaney
5640.quote: The more you do stuff, the better you get at dealing with how you still fail at it a lot of the time.

5641.author: John Mulaney
