5641.quote: It's been very funny to try to act like an adult. Even getting dressed. Every day, I'm like, 'Should I wear a blazer and walk around with an umbrella? Do I carry a briefcase?' Because I'm trying to be some image of the adults I saw on TV growing up.

5642.author: John Mulaney
5642.quote: All my money is in a savings account. My dad has explained the stock market to me maybe 75 times. I still don't understand it.

5643.author: John Mulaney
5643.quote: You can do good work simply staying up all night and eating nothing but junk food, but probably not in the long term.

5644.author: John Mulaney
5644.quote: As I got into high school and after puberty, I was a little more inward. I was a real extrovert when I was little, but I don't know, I just got quieter... With my friends, I was still an extrovert.

5645.author: John Mulaney
5645.quote: You can't always see both sides of the story. Eventually, you have to pick a side and stick with it. No more equivocating. You have to commit.

5646.author: John Mulaney
5646.quote: It's important to remember that life is a joke, and that outlook grants a lot of perspective, but I don't think comedy should change and become political due to other things. It should just laugh at that cosmic joke that life is all the time.

5647.author: John Mulaney
5647.quote: I have found that people who really want to work at 'Saturday Night Live' and pursue it get pretty close. You have to be funny - but everyone who works there, it was their dream to work there. So it's kind of nice in that way - there's a lot of people who say, 'I just always wanted to do this, and now I'm doing it.'

5648.author: John Mulaney
5648.quote: I like making fun of myself a lot. I like being made fun of, too. I've always enjoyed it. There's just something really, really funny about someone tearing into me.

5649.author: John Mulaney
5649.quote: I never knew you were supposed to push off of your feet when you walked. And I tried it, and I walked much faster.

5650.author: John Mulaney
5650.quote: I plan to join the 'SNL' band as a maraca player and stand behind saxophonist Lenny Pickett. That way they will at least cut to me before commercial breaks. I'll be sure to look right into camera.

5651.author: John Mulaney
5651.quote: Things have to be funny first, and if they want to have a point, that's awesome.

5652.author: John Mulaney
5652.quote: Stand-up for me is just my opinions on things, so it wouldn't be as fun translated into a sketch. Nor would a sketch be as fun if it were me standing there saying it.

5653.author: John Mulaney
5653.quote: If someone had written a review saying, ''Oh, Hello' is stupid,' we would have said, 'Yeah, it is. You're absolutely right.' That people liked it was extremely cool.

5654.author: John Mulaney
5654.quote: Nick Kroll, A.D. Miles, Chelsea Peretti - those were the people I was always doing open mics with.

5655.author: John Mulaney
5655.quote: I don't make plans anymore. So I'm not living minute to minute.

5656.author: John Mulaney
5656.quote: Bill Clinton fascinates me because, at the time, it seemed like his shenanigans and the people after him were the biggest political stories you could ever imagine. I remember when the 'Starr Report' was published in the newspaper, all of us were reading it in the high-school cafeteria, and a dean started taking the newspapers away from us.

5657.author: John Mulaney
5657.quote: If something is very, very funny but possibly controversial, if it's truly funny, then it's worth doing. Things aren't worth doing for the sake of being controversial.

5659.author: John Mulaney
5659.quote: Sometimes I - with comedy, it's like someone liking you in high school. They either do, or they don't. And when they don't, they don't. And that's it. There are no appeals. You show up, and you're like, 'Hi! I'm -' and you stumble, and they're like, 'It's over.'

5660.author: John Mulaney
5660.quote: When you have something that you did so many jobs on and were so front and center on, and then people dislike it, you want to learn lessons from it, and you want to move on, and you want to move on too fast.

5661.author: John Mulaney
5661.quote: I'm pretty self-critical about everything I've ever done: stand-up, 'SNL.'

5662.author: John Mulaney
5662.quote: I have too many influences to name. I like a wide variety of stuff, which I think has been helpful. I liked every comedian I saw on TV growing up in the '80s. Every comedian.

5663.author: John Mulaney
5663.quote: The difficulty of getting a movie made through a major studio is so extreme that when a movie comes out, everyone should give it four stars because it was accomplished.

5664.author: John Mulaney
5664.quote: Going on the road for long stretches can seem daunting, and I certainly miss being home sometimes, but the chance to see so many different cities, let alone perform in them, is something I am really grateful for.

5665.author: John Steinbeck
5665.quote: Power does not corrupt. Fear corrupts... perhaps the fear of a loss of power.

5666.author: John Steinbeck
5666.quote: One can find so many pains when the rain is falling.

5667.author: John Steinbeck
5667.quote: A sad soul can kill quicker than a germ.

5668.author: John Steinbeck
5668.quote: If you're in trouble, or hurt or need - go to the poor people. They're the only ones that'll help - the only ones.

5669.author: John Steinbeck
5669.quote: I have come to believe that a great teacher is a great artist and that there are as few as there are any other great artists. Teaching might even be the greatest of the arts since the medium is the human mind and spirit.

5670.author: John Steinbeck
5670.quote: I am impelled, not to squeak like a grateful and apologetic mouse, but to roar like a lion out of pride in my profession.

5671.author: John Steinbeck
5671.quote: Ideas are like rabbits. You get a couple and learn how to handle them, and pretty soon you have a dozen.

5672.author: John Steinbeck
5672.quote: The writer must believe that what he is doing is the most important thing in the world. And he must hold to this illusion even when he knows it is not true.

5673.author: John Steinbeck
5673.quote: You know how advice is. You only want it if it agrees with what you wanted to do anyway.

5674.author: John Steinbeck
5674.quote: Man is the only kind of varmint sets his own trap, baits it, then steps in it.

5675.author: John Steinbeck
5675.quote: No man really knows about other human beings. The best he can do is to suppose that they are like himself.

5676.author: John Steinbeck
5676.quote: In utter loneliness a writer tries to explain the inexplicable.

5677.author: John Steinbeck
5677.quote: Time is the only critic without ambition.

5678.author: John Steinbeck
5678.quote: It is a common experience that a problem difficult at night is resolved in the morning after the committee of sleep has worked on it.

5679.author: John Steinbeck
5679.quote: Many a trip continues long after movement in time and space have ceased.

5680.author: John Steinbeck
5680.quote: Men do change, and change comes like a little wind that ruffles the curtains at dawn, and it comes like the stealthy perfume of wildflowers hidden in the grass.

5681.author: John Steinbeck
5681.quote: In the souls of the people the grapes of wrath are filling and growing heavy, growing heavy for the vintage.

5682.author: John Steinbeck
5682.quote: A journey is like marriage. The certain way to be wrong is to think you control it.

5683.author: John Steinbeck
5683.quote: A journey is a person in itself; no two are alike. And all plans, safeguards, policing, and coercion are fruitless. We find that after years of struggle that we do not take a trip; a trip takes us.

5684.author: John Steinbeck
5684.quote: Man, unlike anything organic or inorganic in the universe, grows beyond his work, walks up the stairs of his concepts, emerges ahead of his accomplishments.

5685.author: John Steinbeck
5685.quote: No one wants advice - only corroboration.

5686.author: John Steinbeck
5686.quote: We spend our time searching for security and hate it when we get it.

5687.author: John Steinbeck
5687.quote: The profession of book writing makes horse racing seem like a solid, stable business.

5688.author: John Steinbeck
5688.quote: It seems to me that if you or I must choose between two courses of thought or action, we should remember our dying and try so to live that our death brings no pleasure on the world.

5689.author: John Steinbeck
5689.quote: Writers are a little below clowns and a little above trained seals.

5690.author: John Steinbeck
5690.quote: So in our pride we ordered for breakfast an omelet, toast and coffee and what has just arrived is a tomato salad with onions, a dish of pickles, a big slice of watermelon and two bottles of cream soda.

5691.author: John Stuart Mill
5691.quote: The only freedom which deserves the name is that of pursuing our own good, in our own way, so long as we do not attempt to deprive others of theirs, or impede their efforts to obtain it.

5692.author: John Stuart Mill
5692.quote: A person may cause evil to others not only by his actions but by his inaction, and in either case he is justly accountable to them for the injury.

5693.author: John Stuart Mill
5693.quote: Actions are right in proportion as they tend to promote happiness; wrong as they tend to produce the reverse of happiness. By happiness is intended pleasure and the absence of pain.

5694.author: John Stuart Mill
5694.quote: Conservatives are not necessarily stupid, but most stupid people are conservatives.

5695.author: John Stuart Mill
5695.quote: The only purpose for which power can be rightfully exercised over any member of a civilized community, against his will, is to prevent harm to others. His own good, either physical or moral, is not sufficient warrant.

5696.author: John Stuart Mill
5696.quote: It is questionable if all the mechanical inventions yet made have lightened the day's toil of any human being.

5697.author: John Stuart Mill
5697.quote: That so few now dare to be eccentric, marks the chief danger of the time.

5698.author: John Stuart Mill
5698.quote: As long as justice and injustice have not terminated their ever renewing fight for ascendancy in the affairs of mankind, human beings must be willing, when need is, to do battle for the one against the other.

5699.author: John Stuart Mill
5699.quote: All good things which exist are the fruits of originality.

5700.author: John Stuart Mill
5700.quote: One person with a belief is equal to ninety-nine who have only interests.

5701.author: John Stuart Mill
5701.quote: He who knows only his own side of the case knows little of that.

5702.author: John Stuart Mill
5702.quote: Pleasure and freedom from pain, are the only things desirable as ends.

5703.author: John Stuart Mill
5703.quote: The amount of eccentricity in a society has generally been proportional to the amount of genius, mental vigor, and moral courage it contained. That so few now dare to be eccentric marks the chief danger of the time.

5704.author: John Stuart Mill
5704.quote: The individual is not accountable to society for his actions in so far as these concern the interests of no person but himself.

5705.author: John Stuart Mill
5705.quote: The only part of the conduct of any one, for which he is amenable to society, is that which concerns others. In the part which merely concerns himself, his independence is, of right, absolute. Over himself, over his own body and mind, the individual is sovereign.

5706.author: John Stuart Mill
5706.quote: Of two pleasures, if there be one which all or almost all who have experience of both give a decided preference, irrespective of any feeling of moral obligation to prefer it, that is the more desirable pleasure.

5707.author: John Stuart Mill
5707.quote: All desirable things... are desirable either for the pleasure inherent in themselves, or as a means to the promotion of pleasure and the prevention of pain.

5708.author: John Stuart Mill
5708.quote: The person who has nothing for which he is willing to fight, nothing which is more important than his own personal safety, is a miserable creature and has no chance of being free unless made and kept so by the exertions of better men than himself.

5709.author: John Stuart Mill
5709.quote: The fatal tendency of mankind to leave off thinking about a thing when it is no longer doubtful is the cause of half their errors.

5710.author: John Stuart Mill
5710.quote: No slave is a slave to the same lengths, and in so full a sense of the word, as a wife is.

5711.author: John Stuart Mill
5711.quote: War is an ugly thing, but not the ugliest of things. The decayed and degraded state of moral and patriotic feeling which thinks that nothing is worth war is much worse.

5712.author: John Stuart Mill
5712.quote: A man who has nothing for which he is willing to fight, nothing which is more important than his own personal safety, is a miserable creature and has no chance of being free unless made and kept so by the exertions of better men than himself.

5713.author: John Stuart Mill
5713.quote: If all mankind minus one were of one opinion, mankind would be no more justified in silencing that one person than he, if he had the power, would be justified in silencing mankind.

5714.author: John Stuart Mill
5714.quote: I have learned to seek my happiness by limiting my desires, rather than in attempting to satisfy them.

5715.author: John Stuart Mill
5715.quote: Although it is not true that all conservatives are stupid people, it is true that most stupid people are conservative.

5716.author: John Stuart Mill
5716.quote: What distinguishes the majority of men from the few is their inability to act according to their beliefs.

5717.author: John W. Gardner
5717.quote: Life is the art of drawing without an eraser.

5718.author: John W. Gardner
5718.quote: True happiness involves the full use of one's power and talents.

5719.author: John W. Gardner
5719.quote: Excellence is doing ordinary things extraordinarily well.

5720.author: John W. Gardner
5720.quote: The society which scorns excellence in plumbing as a humble activity and tolerates shoddiness in philosophy because it is an exalted activity will have neither good plumbing nor good philosophy: neither its pipes nor its theories will hold water.

5721.author: John W. Gardner
5721.quote: Much education today is monumentally ineffective. All too often we are giving young people cut flowers when we should be teaching them to grow their own plants.

5722.author: John W. Gardner
5722.quote: One of the reasons people stop learning is that they become less and less willing to risk failure.

5723.author: John W. Gardner
5723.quote: History never looks like history when you are living through it.

5724.author: John W. Gardner
5724.quote: Whoever I am, or whatever I am doing, some kind of excellence is within my reach.

5725.author: John W. Gardner
5725.quote: Our problem is not to find better values but to be faithful to those we profess.

5726.author: John W. Gardner
5726.quote: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities - brilliantly disguised as insoluble problems.

5727.author: John W. Gardner
5727.quote: Political extremism involves two prime ingredients: an excessively simple diagnosis of the world's ills, and a conviction that there are identifiable villains back of it all.

5728.author: John W. Gardner
5728.quote: If you have some respect for people as they are, you can be more effective in helping them to become better than they are.

5729.author: John W. Gardner
5729.quote: Leaders come in many forms, with many styles and diverse qualities. There are quiet leaders and leaders one can hear in the next county. Some find strength in eloquence, some in judgment, some in courage.

5730.author: John W. Gardner
5730.quote: Some people have greatness thrust upon them. Very few have excellence thrust upon them.

5731.author: John W. Gardner
5731.quote: All laws are an attempt to domesticate the natural ferocity of the species.

5732.author: John W. Gardner
5732.quote: America's greatness has been the greatness of a free people who shared certain moral commitments. Freedom without moral commitment is aimless and promptly self-destructive.

5733.author: John W. Gardner
5733.quote: Men of integrity, by their very existence, rekindle the belief that as a people we can live above the level of moral squalor. We need that belief; a cynical community is a corrupt community.

5734.author: John W. Gardner
5734.quote: Some people strengthen the society just by being the kind of people they are.

5735.author: John W. Gardner
5735.quote: The creative individual has the capacity to free himself from the web of social pressures in which the rest of us are caught. He is capable of questioning the assumptions that the rest of us accept.

5736.author: John W. Gardner
5736.quote: It's a staggering transition for high school students that found they could study five hours a week and make As and Bs.

5737.author: John W. Gardner
5737.quote: The idea for which this nation stands will not survive if the highest goal free man can set themselves is an amiable mediocrity. Excellence implies striving for the highest standards in every phase of life.

5738.author: John W. Gardner
5738.quote: For every talent that poverty has stimulated it has blighted a hundred.

5739.author: John W. Gardner
5739.quote: It is hard to feel individually responsible with respect to the invisible processes of a huge and distant government.

5740.author: John W. Gardner
5740.quote: I am entirely certain that twenty years from now we will look back at education as it is practiced in most schools today and wonder that we could have tolerated anything so primitive.

5741.author: John W. Gardner
5741.quote: When one may pay out over two million dollars to presidential and Congressional campaigns, the U.S. government is virtually up for sale.

5742.author: John W. Gardner
5742.quote: The ultimate goal of the educational system is to shift to the individual the burden of pursing his own education. This will not be a widely shared pursuit until we get over our odd conviction that education is what goes on in school buildings and nowhere else.

5743.author: John Wayne
5743.quote: If everything isn't black and white, I say, 'Why the hell not?'

5744.author: John Wayne
5744.quote: Talk low, talk slow and don't say too much.

5745.author: John Wayne
5745.quote: Courage is being scared to death... and saddling up anyway.

5746.author: John Wayne
5746.quote: Tomorrow hopes we have learned something from yesterday.

5747.author: John Wayne
5747.quote: Tomorrow is the most important thing in life. Comes into us at midnight very clean. It's perfect when it arrives and it puts itself in our hands. It hopes we've learned something from yesterday.

5748.author: John Wayne
5748.quote: Get off your horse and drink your milk.

5749.author: John Wayne
5749.quote: All the screen cowboys behaved like real gentlemen. They didn't drink, they didn't smoke. When they knocked the bad guy down, they always stood with their fists up, waiting for the heavy to get back on his feet. I decided I was going to drag the bad guy to his feet and keep hitting him.

5750.author: John Wayne
5750.quote: I'm not the sort to back away from a fight. I don't believe in shrinking from anything. It's not my speed; I'm a guy who meets adversities head on.

5751.author: John Wayne
5751.quote: Nobody should come to the movies unless he believes in heroes.

5752.author: John Wayne
5752.quote: I don't feel we did wrong in taking this great country away from them. There were great numbers of people who needed new land, and the Indians were selfishly trying to keep it for themselves.

5753.author: John Wayne
5753.quote: When I was a sophomore at USC, I was a socialist, pretty much to the left. But not when I left the university. I quickly got wise. I'd read about what had happened to Russia in 1917 when the Communists took over.

5754.author: John Wayne
5754.quote: I suppose my best attribute, if you want to call it that, is sincerity. I can sell sincerity because that's the way I am.

5755.author: John Wayne
5755.quote: I never have really become accustomed to the 'John.' Nobody ever really calls me John... I've always been Duke or Marion or John Wayne. It's a name that goes well together, and it's like one word - John Wayne.

5756.author: John Wayne
5756.quote: All I'm for is the liberty of the individual.

5757.author: John Wayne
5757.quote: Get off your butt and join the Marines!

5758.author: John Wayne
5758.quote: I've loved reading all my life.

5759.author: John Wayne
5759.quote: I'd read up on the history of our country and I'd become fascinated with the story of the Alamo. To me it represented the fight for freedom, not just in America, but in all countries.

5760.author: John Wayne
5760.quote: Everybody that I was in school with had an uncle or father in the law, and I started to realize that I was going to end up writing briefs for about ten years for these fellows who I thought I was smarter than. And I was kind of losing my feeling for that.

5761.author: John Wayne
5761.quote: In westerns, you meet a hardy bunch of characters. There is no jealousy on such pictures.

5762.author: John Wayne
5762.quote: My folks always let me go to the movies every Saturday. We were really motion-picture goers.

5763.author: John Wayne
5763.quote: When you come to see a picture of mine, I want you to know that I'm not going to do anything that will make you uncomfortable. I want you to know that you won't be disappointed in me.

5764.author: John Wayne
5764.quote: Real art is basic emotion. If a scene is handled with simplicity - and I don't mean simple - it'll be good, and the public will know it.

5765.author: John Wayne
5765.quote: I was ashamed to admit I was hipped to the idea of acting. That's why I started in with the props.

5766.author: John Wayne
5766.quote: Nothing is so discouraging to an actor than to have to work for long hours upon hours in brightly lighted interior sets.

5767.author: John Wayne
5767.quote: I was sure I'd set the world on fire, and it was hard for a young feller like me to realize the truth - that I hadn't set the world on fire, and I was totally unprepared to handle the consequences if 'The Big Trail' had been a success and launched me as a star.

5768.author: John Wooden
5768.quote: The most important thing in the world is family and love.

5769.author: John Wooden
5769.quote: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece, make friendship a fine art, drink deeply from good books - especially the Bible, build a shelter against a rainy day, give thanks for your blessings and pray for guidance every day.

5770.author: John Wooden
5770.quote: Talent is God given. Be humble. Fame is man-given. Be grateful. Conceit is self-given. Be careful.

5771.author: John Wooden
5771.quote: It's the little details that are vital. Little things make big things happen.

5772.author: John Wooden
5772.quote: Whatever you do in life, surround yourself with smart people who'll argue with you.

5773.author: John Wooden
5773.quote: Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.

5774.author: John Wooden
5774.quote: Winning takes talent, to repeat takes character.

5775.author: John Wooden
5775.quote: Don't give up on your dreams, or your dreams will give up on you.

5776.author: John Wooden
5776.quote: Be more concerned with your character than your reputation, because your character is what you really are, while your reputation is merely what others think you are.

5777.author: John Wooden
5777.quote: Today is the only day. Yesterday is gone.

5778.author: John Wooden
5778.quote: Success is peace of mind which is a direct result of self-satisfaction in knowing you did your best to become the best you are capable of becoming.

5779.author: John Wooden
5779.quote: Never lie, never cheat, never steal.

5780.author: John Wooden
5780.quote: Discipline yourself, and others won't need to.

5782.author: John Wooden
5782.quote: Be true to yourself. Make each day a masterpiece. Help others. Drink deeply from good books. Make friendship a fine art. Build a shelter against a rainy day.

5783.author: John Wooden
5783.quote: Things turn out best for the people who make the best of the way things turn out.

5784.author: John Wooden
5784.quote: A coach is someone who can give correction without causing resentment.

5785.author: John Wooden
5785.quote: You can't let praise or criticism get to you. It's a weakness to get caught up in either one.

5786.author: John Wooden
5786.quote: If you're not making mistakes, then you're not doing anything. I'm positive that a doer makes mistakes.

5787.author: John Wooden
5787.quote: Do not let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.

5788.author: John Wooden
5788.quote: Just do the best you can. No one can do more than that.

5789.author: John Wooden
5789.quote: Failure is not fatal, but failure to change might be.

5790.author: John Wooden
5790.quote: Don't let making a living prevent you from making a life.

5791.author: John Wooden
5791.quote: You can't live a perfect day without doing something for someone who will never be able to repay you.

5792.author: John Wooden
5792.quote: I had three rules for my players: No profanity. Don't criticize a teammate. Never be late.

5793.author: John Wooden
5793.quote: I think the teaching profession contributes more to the future of our society than any other single profession.

5794.author: Johnny Cash
5794.quote: You build on failure. You use it as a stepping stone. Close the door on the past. You don't try to forget the mistakes, but you don't dwell on it. You don't let it have any of your energy, or any of your time, or any of your space.

5795.author: Johnny Cash
5795.quote: The things that have always been important: to be a good man, to try to live my life the way God would have me, to turn it over to Him that His will might be worked in my life, to do my work without looking back, to give it all I've got, and to take pride in my work as an honest performer.

5796.author: Johnny Cash
5796.quote: I wear black because I'm comfortable in it. But then in the summertime when it's hot I'm comfortable in light blue.

5797.author: Johnny Cash
5797.quote: Of emotions, of love, of breakup, of love and hate and death and dying, mama, apple pie, and the whole thing. It covers a lot of territory, country music does.

5798.author: Johnny Cash
5798.quote: Success is having to worry about every damn thing in the world, except money.

5799.author: Johnny Cash
5799.quote: People call me wild. Not really though, I'm not. I guess I've never been normal, not what you call Establishment. I'm country.

5800.author: Johnny Cash
5800.quote: I was wearing black clothes almost from the beginning. I feel comfortable in black. I felt like black looked good onstage, that it was attractive, so I started wearing it all the time.

5801.author: Johnny Cash
5801.quote: For you I know I'd even try to turn the tide.

5802.author: Johnny Cash
5802.quote: Sometimes I am two people. Johnny is the nice one. Cash causes all the trouble. They fight.

5803.author: Johnny Cash
5803.quote: God gives us life and takes us away as He sees fit.

5804.author: Johnny Cash
5804.quote: How well I have learned that there is no fence to sit on between heaven and hell. There is a deep, wide gulf, a chasm, and in that chasm is no place for any man.

5805.author: Johnny Cash
5805.quote: You've got to know your limitations. I don't know what your limitations are. I found out what mine were when I was twelve. I found out that there weren't too many limitations, if I did it my way.

5806.author: Johnny Cash
5806.quote: You've got a song you're singing from your gut, you want that audience to feel it in their gut. And you've got to make them think that you're one of them sitting out there with them too. They've got to be able to relate to what you're doing.

5807.author: Johnny Cash
5807.quote: That was the big thing when I was growing up, singing on the radio. The extent of my dream was to sing on the radio station in Memphis. Even when I got out of the Air Force in 1954, I came right back to Memphis and started knocking on doors at the radio station.

5808.author: Johnny Cash
5808.quote: I am not a Christian artist, I am an artist who is a Christian.

5809.author: Johnny Cash
5809.quote: When I record somebody else's song, I have to make it my own or it doesn't feel right. I'll say to myself, I wrote this and he doesn't know it!

5810.author: Johnny Cash
5810.quote: My father was a man of love. He always loved me to death. He worked hard in the fields, but my father never hit me. Never. I don't ever remember a really cross, unkind word from my father.

5811.author: Johnny Cash
5811.quote: God's the final judge for Elvis Presley and Johnny Cash too. That's solely in the hands of God.

5812.author: Johnny Cash
5812.quote: I'm very shy really. I spend a lot of time in my room alone reading or writing or watching television.

5813.author: Johnny Cash
5813.quote: I love to go to the studio and stay there 10 or 12 hours a day. I love it. What is it? I don't know. It's life.

5814.author: Johnny Cash
5814.quote: I start a lot more songs than I finish, because I realize when I get into them, they're no good. I don't throw them away, I just put them away, store them, get them out of sight.

5815.author: Johnny Cash
5815.quote: When my wife died, I booked myself into the studio just to work, to occupy myself.

5816.author: Johnny Cash
5816.quote: I knew I wanted to sing when I was a very small boy. When I was probably 4 years old. My mother played a guitar and I would sit with her and she would sing and I learned to sing along with her.

5817.author: Johnny Cash
5817.quote: It's like a novelist writing far out things. If it makes a point and makes sense, then people like to read that. But if it's off in left field and goes over the edge, you lose it. The same with musical talent, I think.

5818.author: Johnny Cash
5818.quote: I read novels but I also read the Bible. And study it, you know? And the more I learn, the more excited I get.

5819.author: Johnny Weir
5819.quote: Love myself I do. Not everything, but I love the good as well as the bad. I love my crazy lifestyle, and I love my hard discipline. I love my freedom of speech and the way my eyes get dark when I'm tired. I love that I have learned to trust people with my heart, even if it will get broken. I am proud of everything that I am and will become.

5820.author: Johnny Weir
5820.quote: I'm not ashamed to be me. More than anyone else I know, I love my life and accept myself. What's wrong with being unique? I am proud of everything that I am and will become.

5821.author: Johnny Weir
5821.quote: I'm different, and I have to be a warrior to be that way. But I have had some success; I hope I have touched the lives of some wonderful people, all by being what I see as myself but some others people see as different.

5822.author: Johnny Weir
5822.quote: Nobody gets lucky all the time. Nobody can win all the time. Nobody's a robot. Nobody's perfect.

5823.author: Johnny Weir
5823.quote: I want to be judged by who I am, not what I am. I mean, I am Johnny Weir. Judge me the way you see me, love me the way you see me, hate me the way you see me.

5824.author: Johnny Weir
5824.quote: I don't take on a project unless I know the end result is going to make me happy. If I can't give 100 percent to something, I choose not to do it because it's very difficult to have so many pots on the fire at one time.

5825.author: Johnny Weir
5825.quote: I grew my beard out a little bit just to show that, indeed, I am a man.

5826.author: Johnny Weir
5826.quote: I suppose being fierce is a very good thing, and a very cool thing. But more than fierce, I think I'm a strong person and a strong individual. And that's what I take with me every day.

5827.author: Johnny Weir
5827.quote: I'm going to be a happy housewife. I'm going to be washing boxers and cooking and doing all those sorts of housewife duties. I just want to be happy and proud of every single day.

5828.author: Johnny Weir
5828.quote: So many people in the gay community have always asked me to come out, say it like it is, and help our cause. But for me... I think my biggest statement I could give to the world is to be strong being myself... you have to make something of yourself, and that's what makes us strong.

5829.author: Johnny Weir
5829.quote: I want to create things while I have time on Earth, and the art of costume and culture has always inspired me.

5830.author: Johnny Weir
5830.quote: Figure skating is theatrical. It's artistic. It's elegant. It's extremely athletic. And there's a very specific audience for that.

5831.author: Johnny Weir
5831.quote: I never ever wanted to change my sport... Figure skating was my outlet, it was my breath, it was how I could live and transmit everything I was feeling and everything I had worked for and given up and all these sacrifices I'd made throughout the years. It was how I could make them all worth it.

5832.author: Johnny Weir
5832.quote: I'm a huge fur fan; it's no secret to anyone anymore.

5833.author: Johnny Weir
5833.quote: I'm not really one to go out in public in dresses too often. I definitely mix it up between masculine and feminine all the time, but wearing a dress goes a little bit too far.

5834.author: Johnny Weir
5834.quote: I've lived my whole life exactly the way I've wanted to. Being gay, being white, being male, it doesn't matter to me. They're all things I'm born with.

5835.author: Johnny Weir
5835.quote: I will be 60 or 70 years old still rocking my Chanel blazer with my hair all coiffed.

5836.author: Johnny Weir
5836.quote: I'm an ice skater. I'm all about the glitter.

5837.author: Johnny Weir
5837.quote: I love skating and sparkling and flying around the ice, and people clap for you. It's an amazing feeling.

5838.author: Johnny Weir
5838.quote: Figure skating is a bit dated - it's like that tweed jacket you pull out of the back of your closet from time to time, and I'm going to try to Chanel it up a little bit.

5839.author: Johnny Weir
5839.quote: Of course I was bullied and of course I was called names - my last name is Weir. That's very, very close to 'weird,' or 'queer' and any of those words. But I've never been anyone to cry over spilled milk or be upset because kids don't like me, or people don't like me... It makes my skin stronger and thicker. And why cry? Your mascara runs.

5840.author: Johnny Weir
5840.quote: When you have an audience standing and screaming the entire way through the short program and cheering every element you do, whether it's footwork, or spin, or a jump, to have that kind of emotion coming at you from every direction in the building, it's the most amazing sensation you can get as a sportsman.

5841.author: Johnny Weir
5841.quote: Masculinity is what you believe it to be. I think masculinity and femininity is something that's very old-fashioned. There's a whole new generation of people who aren't defined by their sex or race or who they like to sleep with.

5842.author: Johnny Weir
5842.quote: I am an American man, and in America, we still think of figure skaters as little girls in pretty, sparkly dresses - I worked very hard to change the perception and image of figure skating, and I think I've done a great job on my end, but in figure skating, taste needs to evolve.

5843.author: Johnny Weir
5843.quote: There's a lot in my closet. I've been collecting things since I was five. I'm definitely a pack rat. I'm not a hoarder, but I'm definitely a pack rat. I will keep anything if I have a memory in it or a good moment.

5844.author: Johnny Weir
5844.quote: I played soccer, and I was the kid who ran the wrong way, or I was pretending to be some sort of zebra and I would flail my arms and kick up my legs.

5845.author: Jordan Peterson
5845.quote: Part of the core information that I've been purveying is that identity politics is a sick game. You don't play racial, ethnic, and gender identity games. The Left plays them on behalf of the oppressed, let's say, and the Right tends to play them on behalf of nationalism and ethnic pride. I think they're equally dangerous.

5846.author: Jordan Peterson
5846.quote: Don't compare yourself with other people; compare yourself with who you were yesterday.

5847.author: Jordan Peterson
5847.quote: It's in responsibility that most people find the meaning that sustains them through life. It's not in happiness. It's not in impulsive pleasure.

5848.author: Jordan Peterson
5848.quote: It is more difficult to rule yourself than to rule a city.

5849.author: Jordan Peterson
5849.quote: To master a new technology, you have to play with it.

5850.author: Jordan Peterson
5850.quote: To me, ideology is corrupt; it's a parasite on religious structures. To be an ideologue is to have all of the terrible things that are associated with religious certainty and none of the utility. If you're an ideologue, you believe everything that you think. If you're religious, there's a mystery left there.

5851.author: Jordan Peterson
5851.quote: The connection between psychology, mythology, and literature is as important as the connection between psychology and biology and the hard sciences.

5852.author: Jordan Peterson
5852.quote: Adopt responsibility for your own well-being, try to put your family together, try to serve your community, try to seek for eternal truth... That's the sort of thing that can ground you in your life, enough so that you can withstand the difficulty of life.

5853.author: Jordan Peterson
5853.quote: No one gets away with anything, ever, so take responsibility for your own life.

5854.author: Jordan Peterson
5854.quote: It makes sense that a witch lives in a swamp.

5855.author: Jordan Peterson
5855.quote: There's no doubt that inequality destabilizes societies. I think the social science evidence on that front is crystal clear.

5856.author: Jordan Peterson
5856.quote: I don't tell people, 'You're okay the way that you are.' That's not the right story. The right story is, 'You're way less than you could be.'

5857.author: Jordan Peterson
5857.quote: If you don't stand your ground, then all that happens is people push you backwards.

5858.author: Jordan Peterson
5858.quote: Free speech is not just another value. It's the foundation of Western civilization.

5860.author: Jordan Peterson
5860.quote: You can't have a value structure without a hierarchy. They're the same thing because a value structure means one thing takes precedence over another.

5861.author: Jordan Peterson
5861.quote: If you're not going to be rewarded for your virtues, and instead you're going to be punished for them, then what's your motivation to continue?

5862.author: Jordan Peterson
5862.quote: There's a personality trait known as agreeableness. Agreeable people are compassionate and polite. And agreeable people get paid less than disagreeable people for the same job. Women are more agreeable than men.

5863.author: Jordan Peterson
5863.quote: You can't go backward in life.

5864.author: Jordan Peterson
5864.quote: I do believe that there are places where the mythological and the literal touch.

5865.author: Jordan Peterson
5865.quote: It's very difficult to regulate yourself, and if you learn to do that, well, it starts to spill over.

5866.author: Jordan Peterson
5866.quote: I've done some analysis of the biblical stories as part of my psychological work. I knew that I had more to do, and every time I've done it, it's been extremely valuable. It makes me a better teacher because I have a richer understanding of cultural history.

5867.author: Jordan Peterson
5867.quote: I have something in common with Nazis in that I am opposed to the radical Left. And when you oppose the radical Left, you end up being a part of a much larger group that includes Nazis in it.

5868.author: Jordan Peterson
5868.quote: You can think of the entire Internet as a place where ideas embodied in cyberspace are having a war, and it's not much different than the war of gods in heaven, which has been taking place since there's been human beings.

5869.author: Jordan Peterson
5869.quote: Assuming if there's such a thing as reality, if you have a false relationship with it, how can you do anything but fail?

5870.author: Jordan Peterson
5870.quote: You have to listen very carefully and tell the truth if you are going to get a paranoid person to open up to you.

5871.author: Joseph Campbell
5871.quote: A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.

5872.author: Joseph Campbell
5872.quote: Find a place inside where there's joy, and the joy will burn out the pain.

5873.author: Joseph Campbell
5873.quote: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.

5874.author: Joseph Campbell
5874.quote: Follow your bliss and the universe will open doors where there were only walls.

5875.author: Joseph Campbell
5875.quote: Computers are like Old Testament gods; lots of rules and no mercy.

5876.author: Joseph Campbell
5876.quote: Your sacred space is where you can find yourself again and again.

5877.author: Joseph Campbell
5877.quote: Opportunities to find deeper powers within ourselves come when life seems most challenging.

5878.author: Joseph Campbell
5878.quote: The big question is whether you are going to be able to say a hearty yes to your adventure.

5879.author: Joseph Campbell
5879.quote: Your life is the fruit of your own doing. You have no one to blame but yourself.

5880.author: Joseph Campbell
5880.quote: The privilege of a lifetime is being who you are.

5881.author: Joseph Campbell
5881.quote: When we quit thinking primarily about ourselves and our own self-preservation, we undergo a truly heroic transformation of consciousness.

5882.author: Joseph Campbell
5882.quote: I don't believe people are looking for the meaning of life as much as they are looking for the experience of being alive.

5883.author: Joseph Campbell
5883.quote: When people get married because they think it's a long-time love affair, they'll be divorced very soon, because all love affairs end in disappointment. But marriage is a recognition of a spiritual identity.

5884.author: Joseph Campbell
5884.quote: It is by going down into the abyss that we recover the treasures of life. Where you stumble, there lies your treasure.

5885.author: Joseph Campbell
5885.quote: The goal of life is to make your heartbeat match the beat of the universe, to match your nature with Nature.

5886.author: Joseph Campbell
5886.quote: Life is without meaning. You bring the meaning to it. The meaning of life is whatever you ascribe it to be. Being alive is the meaning.

5887.author: Joseph Campbell
5887.quote: Myths are public dreams, dreams are private myths.

5888.author: Joseph Campbell
5888.quote: We're so engaged in doing things to achieve purposes of outer value that we forget the inner value, the rapture that is associated with being alive, is what it is all about.

5889.author: Joseph Campbell
5889.quote: Love is a friendship set to music.

5890.author: Joseph Campbell
5890.quote: I think the person who takes a job in order to live - that is to say, for the money - has turned himself into a slave.

5891.author: Joseph Campbell
5891.quote: Every religion is true one way or another. It is true when understood metaphorically. But when it gets stuck in its own metaphors, interpreting them as facts, then you are in trouble.

5892.author: Joseph Campbell
5892.quote: Participate joyfully in the sorrows of the world. We cannot cure the world of sorrows, but we can choose to live in joy.

5893.author: Joseph Campbell
5893.quote: God is a metaphor for that which transcends all levels of intellectual thought. It's as simple as that.

5894.author: Joseph Campbell
5894.quote: One way or another, we all have to find what best fosters the flowering of our humanity in this contemporary life, and dedicate ourselves to that.

5895.author: Joseph Campbell
5895.quote: I don't have to have faith, I have experience.

5896.author: Joseph Campbell
5896.quote: What each must seek in his life never was on land or sea. It is something out of his own unique potentiality for experience, something that never has been and never could have been experienced by anyone else.

5897.author: Joseph Stalin
5897.quote: The people who cast the votes don't decide an election, the people who count the votes do.

5898.author: Joseph Stalin
5898.quote: Education is a weapon whose effects depend on who holds it in his hands and at whom it is aimed.

5899.author: Joseph Stalin
5899.quote: It is enough that the people know there was an election. The people who cast the votes decide nothing. The people who count the votes decide everything.

5900.author: Joseph Stalin
5900.quote: Death is the solution to all problems. No man - no problem.

5901.author: Joseph Stalin
5901.quote: Gratitude is a sickness suffered by dogs.

5902.author: Joseph Stalin
5902.quote: Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas.

5903.author: Joseph Stalin
5903.quote: In the Soviet army it takes more courage to retreat than advance.

5904.author: Joseph Stalin
5904.quote: When we hang the capitalists they will sell us the rope we use.

5905.author: Joseph Stalin
5905.quote: I trust no one, not even myself.

5906.author: Joseph Stalin
5906.quote: We don't let them have ideas. Why would we let them have guns?

5907.author: Joseph Stalin
5907.quote: Print is the sharpest and the strongest weapon of our party.

5908.author: Joseph Stalin
5908.quote: History shows that there are no invincible armies.

5909.author: Joseph Stalin
5909.quote: One death is a tragedy; one million is a statistic.

5910.author: Joseph Stalin
5910.quote: Gaiety is the most outstanding feature of the Soviet Union.

5911.author: Joseph Stalin
5911.quote: The writer is the engineer of the human soul.

5912.author: Joseph Stalin
5912.quote: The only real power comes out of a long rifle.

5913.author: Joseph Stalin
5913.quote: I believe in one thing only, the power of human will.

5914.author: Joseph Stalin
5914.quote: The death of one man is a tragedy. The death of millions is a statistic.

5915.author: Joseph Stalin
5915.quote: If any foreign minister begins to defend to the death a 'peace conference', you can be sure his government has already placed its orders for new battleships and airplanes.

5916.author: Joseph Stalin
5916.quote: Mankind is divided into rich and poor, into property owners and exploited; and to abstract oneself from this fundamental division; and from the antagonism between poor and rich means abstracting oneself from fundamental facts.

5917.author: Joseph Stalin
5917.quote: You cannot make a revolution with silk gloves.

5918.author: Joseph Stalin
5918.quote: Everyone imposes his own system as far as his army can reach.

5919.author: Joseph Stalin
5919.quote: The Pope? How many divisions has he got?

5920.author: Joseph Stalin
5920.quote: A sincere diplomat is like dry water or wooden iron.

5921.author: Joseph Stalin
5921.quote: If the opposition disarms, well and good. If it refuses to disarm, we shall disarm it ourselves.

5922.author: Joyce Meyer
5922.quote: Patience is not simply the ability to wait - it's how we behave while we're waiting.

5923.author: Joyce Meyer
5923.quote: I believe that the greatest gift you can give your family and the world is a healthy you.

5924.author: Joyce Meyer
5924.quote: I believe that a trusting attitude and a patient attitude go hand in hand. You see, when you let go and learn to trust God, it releases joy in your life. And when you trust God, you're able to be more patient. Patience is not just about waiting for something... it's about how you wait, or your attitude while waiting.

5925.author: Joyce Meyer
5925.quote: You cannot have a positive life and a negative mind.

5926.author: Joyce Meyer
5926.quote: I may not be where I want to be, but thank God I am not where I used to be.

5927.author: Joyce Meyer
5927.quote: God's mercy is fresh and new every morning.

5928.author: Joyce Meyer
5928.quote: Consider a tree for a moment. As beautiful as trees are to look at, we don't see what goes on underground - as they grow roots. Trees must develop deep roots in order to grow strong and produce their beauty. But we don't see the roots. We just see and enjoy the beauty. In much the same way, what goes on inside of us is like the roots of a tree.

5929.author: Joyce Meyer
5929.quote: There's no happier person than a truly thankful, content person.

5930.author: Joyce Meyer
5930.quote: Depression begins with disappointment. When disappointment festers in our soul, it leads to discouragement.

5931.author: Joyce Meyer
5931.quote: It's so important to realize that every time you get upset, it drains your emotional energy. Losing your cool makes you tired. Getting angry a lot messes with your health.

5932.author: Joyce Meyer
5932.quote: When you begin to worry, go find something to do. Get busy being a blessing to someone; do something fruitful. Talking about your problem or sitting alone, thinking about it, does no good; it serves only to make you miserable. Above all else, remember that worrying is totally useless. Worrying will not solve your problem.

5933.author: Joyce Meyer
5933.quote: The eagle has no fear of adversity. We need to be like the eagle and have a fearless spirit of a conqueror!

5934.author: Joyce Meyer
5934.quote: At school I pretended I had a normal life, but I felt lonely all the time and different from everyone else. I never felt like I fit in, and I wasn't allowed to participate in after-school activities, go to sports events or parties or date boys. Many times I had to make up stories about why I couldn't do anything with my classmates.

5935.author: Joyce Meyer
5935.quote: When you make a mistake and the devil comes and tells you 'You're no good,' you don't have to take on the guilt and condemnation he wants to put on you. No! You can immediately confess your mistake to God, thank Him for forgiving you and cleansing you with the blood of Jesus, and move forward in the victory of His grace and forgiveness.

5936.author: Joyce Meyer
5936.quote: Teachers can change lives with just the right mix of chalk and challenges.

5937.author: Joyce Meyer
5937.quote: If someone decides they're not going to be happy, it's not your problem. You don't have to spend your time and energy trying to cheer up someone who has already decided to stay in a bad mood. Believe it or not, you can actually hurt people by playing into their self-pity.

5938.author: Joyce Meyer
5938.quote: Watch out for the joy-stealers: gossip, criticism, complaining, faultfinding, and a negative, judgmental attitude.

5939.author: Joyce Meyer
5939.quote: A #2 pencil and a dream can take you anywhere.

5940.author: Joyce Meyer
5940.quote: We all face storms in life. Some are more difficult than others, but we all go through trials and tribulation. That's why we have the gift of faith.

5941.author: Joyce Meyer
5941.quote: Integrity means that you are the same in public as you are in private.

5942.author: Joyce Meyer
5942.quote: No matter what has happened to you in the past or what is going on in your life right now, it has no power to keep you from having an amazingly good future if you will walk by faith in God. God loves you! He wants you to live with victory over sin so you can possess His promises for your life today!

5943.author: Joyce Meyer
5943.quote: Every day is a gift from God. Learn to focus on the Giver and enjoy the gift!

5944.author: Joyce Meyer
5944.quote: If selfishness is the key to being miserable, then selflessness must be the key to being happy!

5945.author: Joyce Meyer
5945.quote: Spiritual people don't float around all day on clouds of glory; they live in the real world and deal with real issues in real ways.

5946.author: Joyce Meyer
5946.quote: I've been saying for a couple of years now that people need to let God out of the Sunday morning box, that He doesn't want to just be with you for an hour or two on Sunday morning and then put back in His box to sit there until you have an emergency, but He wants to invade your Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, and Sunday.

5947.author: Joyce Meyer
5947.quote: Getting stress out of your life takes more than prayer alone. You must take action to make changes and stop doing whatever is causing the stress. You can learn to calm down in the way you handle things.

5948.author: Julius Caesar
5948.quote: No one is so brave that he is not disturbed by something unexpected.

5949.author: Julius Caesar
5949.quote: Experience is the teacher of all things.

5950.author: Julius Caesar
5950.quote: I came, I saw, I conquered.

5951.author: Julius Caesar
5951.quote: In war, events of importance are the result of trivial causes.

5952.author: Julius Caesar
5952.quote: I had rather be first in a village than second at Rome.

5953.author: Julius Caesar
5953.quote: Cowards die many times before their actual deaths.

5954.author: Julius Caesar
5954.quote: I love the name of honor, more than I fear death.

5955.author: Julius Caesar
5955.quote: It is easier to find men who will volunteer to die, than to find those who are willing to endure pain with patience.

5956.author: Julius Caesar
5956.quote: If you must break the law, do it to seize power: in all other cases observe it.

5957.author: Julius Caesar
5957.quote: It is better to create than to learn! Creating is the essence of life.

5958.author: Julius Caesar
5958.quote: During a few days' halt near Vesontio for the provision of corn and other supplies, a panic arose from inquiries made by our troops and remarks uttered by Gauls and traders, who affirmed that the Germans were men of a mighty frame and an incredible valour and skill at arms.

5959.author: Julius Caesar
5959.quote: As a rule, men worry more about what they can't see than about what they can.

5960.author: Julius Caesar
5960.quote: What we wish, we readily believe, and what we ourselves think, we imagine others think also.

5961.author: Julius Caesar
5961.quote: I have lived long enough to satisfy both nature and glory.

5962.author: Julius Caesar
5962.quote: Fortune, which has a great deal of power in other matters but especially in war, can bring about great changes in a situation through very slight forces.

5963.author: Julius Caesar
5963.quote: Which death is preferably to every other? 'The unexpected'.

5965.author: Julius Caesar
5965.quote: Men willingly believe what they wish.

5966.author: Julius Caesar
5966.quote: I am prepared to resort to anything, to submit to anything, for the sake of the commonwealth.

5967.author: Julius Caesar
5967.quote: Caesar's wife must be above suspicion.

5968.author: Julius Caesar
5968.quote: It was the wont of the immortal gods sometimes to grant prosperity and long impunity to men whose crimes they were minded to punish in order that a complete reverse of fortune might make them suffer more bitterly.

5969.author: Julius Caesar
5969.quote: Men are nearly always willing to believe what they wish.

5970.author: Julius Caesar
5970.quote: I have lived long enough both in years and in accomplishments.

5971.author: Julius Caesar
5971.quote: Men in general are quick to believe that which they wish to be true.

5972.author: Julius Caesar
5972.quote: Men freely believe that which they desire.

5973.author: Julius Caesar
5973.quote: It is not these well-fed long-haired men that I fear, but the pale and the hungry-looking.

5974.author: Kanye West
5974.quote: All these walls that keep us from loving each other as one family or one race - racism, religion, where we grew up, whatever, class, socioeconomic - what makes us be so selfish and prideful, what keeps us from wanting to help the next man, what makes us be so focused on a personal legacy as opposed to the entire legacy of a race.

5975.author: Kanye West
5975.quote: People always tell you, 'Be humble. Be humble.' When was the last time someone told you to be amazing? Be great! Be great! Be awesome! Be awesome!

5976.author: Kanye West
5976.quote: I feel like I'm too busy writing history to read it.

5977.author: Kanye West
5977.quote: Keep your nose out the sky, keep your heart to god, and keep your face to the raising sun.

5978.author: Kanye West
5978.quote: George Bush doesn't care about black people.

5979.author: Kanye West
5979.quote: I'm a human being. I've got opinions, I'm not always right, I'm not always on time, I don't always say things in the proper way, but my intentions are always extremely pure.

5980.author: Kanye West
5980.quote: I think I do myself a disservice by comparing myself to Steve Jobs and Walt Disney and human beings that we've seen before. It should be more like Willy Wonka... and welcome to my chocolate factory.

5981.author: Kanye West
5981.quote: I refuse to accept other people's ideas of happiness for me. As if there's a 'one size fits all' standard for happiness.

5982.author: Kanye West
5982.quote: I don't think people are going to talk in the future. They're going to communicate through eye contact, body language, emojis, signs.

5983.author: Kanye West
5983.quote: If you have the opportunity to play this game of life you need to appreciate every moment. a lot of people don't appreciate the moment until it's passed.

5984.author: Kanye West
5984.quote: I can analyze people's intentions. Immediately. That's just a warning. To everyone.

5985.author: Kanye West
5985.quote: I still think I am the greatest.

5986.author: Kanye West
5986.quote: Would you believe in what you believe in if you were the only one who believed it?

5987.author: Kanye West
5987.quote: Nobody can tell me where I can and can't go.

5988.author: Kanye West
5988.quote: If we go on your iPhone and go to the dictionary and look up 'humble,' 80 per cent of the definition is negative. It's a controlling word. It's a way to control the masses and to control the sheep.

5989.author: Kanye West
5989.quote: I would never want a book's autograph. I am a proud non-reader of books.

5990.author: Kanye West
5990.quote: Fashion is merely an opinion. And I've got a lot of opinions.

5991.author: Kanye West
5991.quote: The risk for me would be in not taking one - that's the only thing that's really risky for me.

5992.author: Kanye West
5992.quote: I am Warhol. I am the No. 1 most impactful artist of our generation. I am Shakespeare in the flesh.

5993.author: Kanye West
5993.quote: I don't know what's better gettin' laid or gettin' paid.

5995.author: Kanye West
5995.quote: There's a lack of people in power that are motivated by the idea of helping people.

5996.author: Kanye West
5996.quote: People always say that you can't please everybody. I think that's a cop-out. Why not attempt it? 'Cause think of all the people you will please if you try.

5997.author: Kanye West
5997.quote: Nothing in life is promised except death.

5998.author: Kanye West
5998.quote: For me, money is not my definition of success. Inspiring people is a definition of success.

5999.author: Kanye West
5999.quote: It's not 'can'; it's 'will.' You have to will things into fruition.

6000.author: Karl Marx
6000.quote: History repeats itself, first as tragedy, second as farce.

6001.author: Karl Marx
6001.quote: Let the ruling classes tremble at a communist revolution. The proletarians have nothing to lose but their chains. They have a world to win. Workingmen of all countries, unite!

6002.author: Karl Marx
6002.quote: Democracy is the road to socialism.

6003.author: Karl Marx
6003.quote: Social progress can be measured by the social position of the female sex.

6004.author: Karl Marx
6004.quote: The production of too many useful things results in too many useless people.

6005.author: Karl Marx
6005.quote: The only antidote to mental suffering is physical pain.

6006.author: Karl Marx
6006.quote: The meaning of peace is the absence of opposition to socialism.

6007.author: Karl Marx
6007.quote: The theory of Communism may be summed up in one sentence: Abolish all private property.

6008.author: Karl Marx
6008.quote: The history of all previous societies has been the history of class struggles.

6009.author: Karl Marx
6009.quote: Religion is the opium of the masses.

6010.author: Karl Marx
6010.quote: Anyone who knows anything of history knows that great social changes are impossible without feminine upheaval. Social progress can be measured exactly by the social position of the fair sex, the ugly ones included.

6011.author: Karl Marx
6011.quote: From each according to his abilities, to each according to his needs.

6012.author: Karl Marx
6012.quote: Workers of the world unite; you have nothing to lose but your chains.

6013.author: Karl Marx
6013.quote: Reason has always existed, but not always in a reasonable form.

6014.author: Karl Marx
6014.quote: The ruling ideas of each age have ever been the ideas of its ruling class.

6015.author: Karl Marx
6015.quote: In bourgeois society capital is independent and has individuality, while the living person is dependent and has no individuality.

6016.author: Karl Marx
6016.quote: We should not say that one man's hour is worth another man's hour, but rather that one man during an hour is worth just as much as another man during an hour. Time is everything, man is nothing: he is at the most time's carcass.

6017.author: Karl Marx
6017.quote: The rich will do anything for the poor but get off their backs.

6018.author: Karl Marx
6018.quote: Society does not consist of individuals but expresses the sum of interrelations, the relations within which these individuals stand.

6019.author: Karl Marx
6019.quote: Nothing can have value without being an object of utility.

6020.author: Karl Marx
6020.quote: Revolutions are the locomotives of history.

6021.author: Karl Marx
6021.quote: Medicine heals doubts as well as diseases.

6022.author: Karl Marx
6022.quote: Men's ideas are the most direct emanations of their material state.

6023.author: Karl Marx
6023.quote: Art is always and everywhere the secret confession, and at the same time the immortal movement of its time.

6024.author: Karl Marx
6024.quote: Capital is reckless of the health or length of life of the laborer, unless under compulsion from society.

6025.author: Karl Marx
6025.quote: Religion is the sigh of the oppressed creature, the heart of a heartless world, and the soul of soulless conditions. It is the opium of the people.

6026.author: Keanu Reeves
6026.quote: Falling in love and having a relationship are two different things.

6027.author: Keanu Reeves
6027.quote: Money doesn't mean anything to me. I've made a lot of money, but I want to enjoy life and not stress myself building my bank account. I give lots away and live simply, mostly out of a suitcase in hotels. We all know that good health is much more important.

6028.author: Keanu Reeves
6028.quote: Grief changes shape, but it never ends.

6029.author: Keanu Reeves
6029.quote: I am not handsome or sexy. Of course, it's not like I am hopeless.

6030.author: Keanu Reeves
6030.quote: It's fun to be hopelessly in love. It's dangerous, but it's fun.

6031.author: Keanu Reeves
6031.quote: Basically it starts with four months of training, just basic stretching, kicking and punching. Then you come to the choreography and getting ready to put the dance together.

6032.author: Keanu Reeves
6032.quote: It's always wonderful to get to know women, with the mystery and the joy and the depth. If you can make a woman laugh, you're seeing the most beautiful thing on God's Earth.

6033.author: Keanu Reeves
6033.quote: The simple act of paying attention can take you a long way.

6034.author: Keanu Reeves
6034.quote: How do I confront aging? With a wonder and a terror. Yeah, I'll say that. Wonder and terror.

6035.author: Keanu Reeves
6035.quote: I'm Mickey Mouse. They don't know who's inside the suit.

6036.author: Keanu Reeves
6036.quote: On a good night, I get underwear, bras, and hotel-room keys thrown onstage... You start to think that you're Tom Jones.

6037.author: Keanu Reeves
6037.quote: Kissing someone is pretty intimate, actually very intimate, and your heart always kind of skips a beat before you do that.

6038.author: Keanu Reeves
6038.quote: When the people you love are gone, you're alone.

6039.author: Keanu Reeves
6039.quote: Letters are something from you. It's a different kind of intention than writing an e-mail.

6040.author: Keanu Reeves
6040.quote: The truth is often terrifying, which I think is one of the motifs of Larry and Andrew's cinema. The cost of knowledge is an important theme. In the second and third films, they explore the consequences of Neo's choice to know the truth. It's a beautiful, beautiful story.

6041.author: Keanu Reeves
6041.quote: I'm sorry my existence is not very noble or sublime.

6042.author: Keanu Reeves
6042.quote: The whole aspect of cinema and film festivals should be a moment to come together and celebrate art and humanity. It would be a shame if there was such a divide.

6043.author: Keanu Reeves
6043.quote: I do think there must be some kind of interaction between your living life and the life that goes on from here.

6044.author: Keanu Reeves
6044.quote: I try not to think about my life. I have no life. I need therapy.

6045.author: Keanu Reeves
6045.quote: It's easy to become very self-critical when you're an actor. Then you get critiqued by the critics. Whether you agree with them or not, people are passing judgment on you.

6046.author: Keanu Reeves
6046.quote: Sometimes when you make a film you can go away for three months and then come back and live your life. But this struck a much deeper chord. I don't have the ability yet to speak about it in an objective.

6047.author: Keanu Reeves
6047.quote: Mortality is very different when you're 20 to when you're 50.

6048.author: Keanu Reeves
6048.quote: I loved the material when I first read it, and the experience of making the film was a great one. So when we came around to complete the trilogy, I just signed on board without even reading the scripts because the experience of the first film was so good.

6049.author: Keanu Reeves
6049.quote: People were saying that David Geffen and I had gotten married and it just blew me away. Not that they thought I was gay, but that they thought I could land a guy that hot.

6050.author: Keanu Reeves
6050.quote: I don't know the law, the kind of law of quantity and quality, but I think the opportunity of people being able to express themselves and to have the means of production is a great thing. It's also changing how we're telling stories.

6051.author: Keanu Reeves
6051.quote: Here comes 40. I'm feeling my age and I've ordered the Ferrari. I'm going to get the whole mid-life crisis package.

6052.author: Kenneth Branagh
6052.quote: Lighten up, just enjoy life, smile more, laugh more, and don't get so worked up about things.

6053.author: Kenneth Branagh
6053.quote: I'll tell you what I'm grateful for, and that's the clarity of understanding that the most important things in life are health, family and friends, and the time to spend on them.

6055.author: Kenneth Branagh
6055.quote: Life is about making plans from which you deviate, almost always. If you are lucky, you do come up with a plan.

6056.author: Kenneth Branagh
6056.quote: I'm basically quite a cheerful person.

6057.author: Kenneth Branagh
6057.quote: It's very strange that the people you love are often the people you're most cruel to.

6058.author: Kenneth Branagh
6058.quote: My definition of success is control.

6059.author: Kenneth Branagh
6059.quote: How many times do you read about 'the Cinderella story,' the story of the underdog, the story of the ordinary human being, often subjected to cruelty and ignorance and neglect, who somehow triumphs?

6060.author: Kenneth Branagh
6060.quote: What you want is the opportunity to work and an audience. Prizes after that are just a great big bonus.

6061.author: Kenneth Branagh
6061.quote: The best actors, I think, have a childlike quality. They have a sort of an ability to lose themselves. There's still some silliness.

6062.author: Kenneth Branagh
6062.quote: I think that short films often contain an originality, a creative freedom, an energy and an invention that is inspiring and entertaining. I think they are, as Shakespeare put it, a good deed in a naughty world.

6063.author: Kenneth Branagh
6063.quote: So many plays with magic in them that would be a terrific invitation to an imaginative animation team.

6064.author: Kenneth Branagh
6064.quote: I think that music is crucially important in Shakespeare - and, clearly, was an important part of the Elizabethan theatre. And, it's always been something that was a profound element of the experience of Shakespeare that I have been drawn to - and interpreters have, as well.

6065.author: Kenneth Branagh
6065.quote: I am very much looking forward to new adventures - including, I hope, Broadway - sooner rather than later.

6066.author: Kenneth Branagh
6066.quote: I choose to be inspired by things that have been done well in the past. So, I don't worry about being compared, because I think that does paralyze you.

6067.author: Kenneth Branagh
6067.quote: I suppose, at 50, you value things in a different way. So you value connections, you value your friendships, you value your health, and you are much more aware of time passing.

6068.author: Kenneth Branagh
6068.quote: I was studying at the Royal Academy of Arts, and I was playing the role of Dr. Ivan Chebutikin in Chekov's 'Three Sisters.' I was about 50 years too young for the part.

6069.author: Kenneth Branagh
6069.quote: Sometimes I used to think to myself, 'Have I lost a sense of humor?' but I don't think that I have. I think one can be as snarky and sarcastic as lots of people, but I have never found that it makes me particularly happy.

6070.author: Kenneth Branagh
6070.quote: Certainly, I'm excited by epic subjects. It doesn't particularly frighten me.

6071.author: Kenneth Branagh
6071.quote: What I've found about 'Cinderella' is that what it provokes in an audience is really extraordinary. It appears to be a deceptively simple tale, but I've heard nothing but people drawing all different things out of it.

6072.author: Kenneth Branagh
6072.quote: I think we love the escapism of something like 'Cinderella,' and I think we do with 'Thor.'

6073.author: Kenneth Branagh
6073.quote: 'Thor' has got several big battles in it, a reckless, headstrong young hero who has to confront his past and deal with a complicated relationship with his father, it has lots of savage Europeans hacking each other to death at various points, and all of this sounded very much like 'Henry V.'

6074.author: Kenneth Branagh
6074.quote: Actors are the best and the worst of people. They're like kids. When they're good, they're very very good. When they're bad they're very very naughty.

6075.author: Kenneth Branagh
6075.quote: My experience of great storytelling, working with classics, is just finding a way to present it simply but let the story do its own work, or be an invite to the audience's imagination.

6076.author: Kenneth Branagh
6076.quote: I think the best actors are the most generous, the kindest, the greatest people and at their worst they are vain, greedy and insecure.

6077.author: Kenneth Branagh
6077.quote: I went to Moscow and met some slightly powerful and scary people.

6078.author: Kevin Gates
6078.quote: True wealth is not of the pocket, but of the heart and of the mind.

6079.author: Kevin Gates
6079.quote: When you stand for something, you've got to stand for it all the way, not half way.

6080.author: Kevin Gates
6080.quote: Glory be and praise to God. I didn't do any of this. God did. I don't have a recipe or a blueprint. I prayed for it, and my prayers are continuing to be answered.

6081.author: Kevin Gates
6081.quote: I don't really like talking. I like to execute. I'm not a talking person. I'm an action person.

6082.author: Kevin Gates
6082.quote: I suffer from deep depression, so my only release is music.

6083.author: Kevin Gates
6083.quote: Coming up in the streets, I had to learn how to read people early on. I'm a very analytical person. I observe a lot of the things that people don't notice.

6084.author: Kevin Gates
6084.quote: I adapt and I adjust to whatever environment I'm in.

6085.author: Kevin Gates
6085.quote: If you look at the movie 'Belly,' I identify with Sincere the most. I am a gangster. I love my lady to death. I'm not in the game for the wrong reasons. I'm not in the game for the glory. I'm in the game to survive so the people that I love could be straight. I'm a highly intelligent individual.

6086.author: Kevin Gates
6086.quote: Life is about conduct and how we conduct ourselves. But two wrongs never make a right.

6087.author: Kevin Gates
6087.quote: I look at other people's lives, and some people feel like they're too old to play with toys. But I still go through the toy section at the store, 'cause there were toys that I wanted when I was little that I couldn't have. So I still get them.

6088.author: Kevin Gates
6088.quote: I never go into a situation with any type of expectations.

6089.author: Kevin Gates
6089.quote: My skin is 24 karat gold when a sun hit it.

6090.author: Kevin Gates
6090.quote: I attended college in prison. I was in jail, so there ain't no going to no classes. They have programs in certain facilities where you can earn good time, and then you get time taken off your sentence. But as far as going to classes, it's not like that. You study, and then an administrator gives you a test. I got a Master's in psychology.

6091.author: Kevin Gates
6091.quote: I don't want no handouts. I want to get it out the mud.

6092.author: Kevin Gates
6092.quote: I have trouble with letting go. That's my problem.

6093.author: Kevin Gates
6093.quote: I'm an introvert somewhat. There could be a room full of people, I'll go stand in the corner.

6094.author: Kevin Gates
6094.quote: I don't let the left hand know what the right hand is doing.

6095.author: Kevin Gates
6095.quote: Sometimes I feel like being an intellectual. Sometimes I like to just be aggressive and all the way in my feelings. Sometimes I might be emotional, or sometimes I might drag on the track and be lazy. I just like to share the different states of existence of Kevin Gates with the rest of the world.

6096.author: Kevin Gates
6096.quote: I don't believe in conspiracy theories. I'm just a cold-blooded investigator.

6099.author: Kevin Gates
6099.quote: The more I grow in popularity, the lonelier it gets. Because you don't really know me. You just know this part of me. You fell in love with that. But it's way more intricate than what meets the surface.

6100.author: Kevin Gates
6100.quote: I always had music growing up, but music was also like a journal. It was like my personal diary or personal journal. A lot of the things I couldn't express to an individual, I would express them in my music.

6101.author: Kevin Gates
6101.quote: I'm not afraid to make mistakes.

6102.author: Kevin Gates
6102.quote: I put my flaws on front street. So the world accepted my flaws, so I don't have any flaws.

6103.author: Kevin Gates
6103.quote: 'Recreative' is a word that I invented because in urban culture, with colloquialism, we invent so many slangs. I don't like the way that 'recreational' sounds - I don't like to say I do a lot of 'recreational' reading. I like to say that I read 'recreatively.' I do a lot of 'recreative' reading.

6104.author: Khalil Gibran
6104.quote: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility, never an opportunity.

6105.author: Khalil Gibran
6105.quote: For life and death are one, even as the river and the sea are one.

6106.author: Khalil Gibran
6106.quote: In the sweetness of friendship let there be laughter, and sharing of pleasures. For in the dew of little things the heart finds its morning and is refreshed.

6107.author: Khalil Gibran
6107.quote: Yesterday is but today's memory, and tomorrow is today's dream.

6108.author: Khalil Gibran
6108.quote: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding.

6109.author: Khalil Gibran
6109.quote: Trust in dreams, for in them is hidden the gate to eternity.

6110.author: Khalil Gibran
6110.quote: Generosity is giving more than you can, and pride is taking less than you need.

6111.author: Khalil Gibran
6111.quote: Forget not that the earth delights to feel your bare feet and the winds long to play with your hair.

6112.author: Khalil Gibran
6112.quote: Doubt is a pain too lonely to know that faith is his twin brother.

6113.author: Khalil Gibran
6113.quote: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.

6114.author: Khalil Gibran
6114.quote: But let there be spaces in your togetherness and let the winds of the heavens dance between you. Love one another but make not a bond of love: let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.

6115.author: Khalil Gibran
6115.quote: I love you when you bow in your mosque, kneel in your temple, pray in your church. For you and I are sons of one religion, and it is the spirit.

6116.author: Khalil Gibran
6116.quote: If your heart is a volcano, how shall you expect flowers to bloom?

6117.author: Khalil Gibran
6117.quote: Progress lies not in enhancing what is, but in advancing toward what will be.

6118.author: Khalil Gibran
6118.quote: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.

6119.author: Khalil Gibran
6119.quote: Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.

6120.author: Khalil Gibran
6120.quote: We choose our joys and sorrows long before we experience them.

6121.author: Khalil Gibran
6121.quote: Your daily life is your temple and your religion. When you enter into it take with you your all.

6122.author: Khalil Gibran
6122.quote: Beauty is eternity gazing at itself in a mirror.

6123.author: Khalil Gibran
6123.quote: If you reveal your secrets to the wind, you should not blame the wind for revealing them to the trees.

6124.author: Khalil Gibran
6124.quote: I have learned silence from the talkative, toleration from the intolerant, and kindness from the unkind; yet, strange, I am ungrateful to those teachers.

6125.author: Khalil Gibran
6125.quote: And ever has it been known that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.

6126.author: Khalil Gibran
6126.quote: Your living is determined not so much by what life brings to you as by the attitude you bring to life; not so much by what happens to you as by the way your mind looks at what happens.

6127.author: Khalil Gibran
6127.quote: Life without liberty is like a body without spirit.

6128.author: Khalil Gibran
6128.quote: Generosity is not giving me that which I need more than you do, but it is giving me that which you need more than I do.

6129.author: Khalil Gibran
6129.quote: Love one another, but make not a bond of love: Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.

6130.author: Kim Kardashian
6130.quote: At the end of the day, life is about being happy being who you are, and I feel like we are so blessed to have the support system and the best family to really just support each other no matter what we're going through.

6131.author: Kim Kardashian
6131.quote: I think each shoot has a different personality.

6132.author: Kim Kardashian
