6655.author: Ludwig van Beethoven
6655.quote: Beethoven can write music, thank God, but he can do nothing else on earth.

6656.author: Ludwig van Beethoven
6656.quote: What you are, you are by accident of birth; what I am, I am by myself. There are and will be a thousand princes; there is only one Beethoven.

6657.author: Ludwig van Beethoven
6657.quote: Music from my fourth year began to be the first of my youthful occupations. Thus early acquainted with the gracious muse who tuned my soul to pure harmonies, I became fond of her, and, as it often seemed to me, she of me.

6658.author: Ludwig van Beethoven
6658.quote: Off with you! You're a happy fellow, for you'll give happiness and joy to many other people. There is nothing better or greater than that!

6659.author: Ludwig van Beethoven
6659.quote: Friends applaud, the comedy is over.

6660.author: Ludwig van Beethoven
6660.quote: The barriers are not erected which can say to aspiring talents and industry, 'Thus far and no farther.'

6661.author: Ludwig van Beethoven
6661.quote: Music is the one incorporeal entrance into the higher world of knowledge which comprehends mankind but which mankind cannot comprehend.

6662.author: Ludwig van Beethoven
6662.quote: A great poet is the most precious jewel of a nation.

6663.author: Ludwig van Beethoven
6663.quote: When somewhat at a distance, I cannot hear the high tones of instruments, voices. In speaking, it is not surprising that there are people who have never noticed it, for as a rule I am absent-minded, and they account for it in that way.

6664.author: Ludwig van Beethoven
6664.quote: There ought to be an artistic depot where the artist need only hand in his artwork in order to receive what he asks for. As things are, one must be half a business man, and how can one understand - good heavens! - that's what I really call troublesome.

6665.author: Ludwig van Beethoven
6665.quote: Music is the wine which inspires one to new generative processes, and I am Bacchus who presses out this glorious wine for mankind and makes them spiritually drunken.

6666.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6666.quote: The human body is the best picture of the human soul.

6667.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6667.quote: The limits of my language means the limits of my world.

6668.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6668.quote: If people never did silly things nothing intelligent would ever get done.

6669.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6669.quote: A confession has to be part of your new life.

6670.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6670.quote: Never stay up on the barren heights of cleverness, but come down into the green valleys of silliness.

6671.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6671.quote: Whereof one cannot speak, thereof one must be silent.

6672.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6672.quote: Death is not an event in life: we do not live to experience death. If we take eternity to mean not infinite temporal duration but timelessness, then eternal life belongs to those who live in the present.

6673.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6673.quote: If a lion could talk, we could not understand him.

6674.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6674.quote: Like everything metaphysical the harmony between thought and reality is to be found in the grammar of the language.

6675.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6675.quote: A new word is like a fresh seed sown on the ground of the discussion.

6676.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6676.quote: Philosophy is like trying to open a safe with a combination lock: each little adjustment of the dials seems to achieve nothing, only when everything is in place does the door open.

6677.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6677.quote: One of the most misleading representational techniques in our language is the use of the word 'I.'

6678.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6678.quote: Not every religion has to have St. Augustine's attitude to sex. Why even in our culture marriages are celebrated in a church, everyone present knows what is going to happen that night, but that doesn't prevent it being a religious ceremony.

6679.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6679.quote: It seems to me that, in every culture, I come across a chapter headed 'Wisdom.' And then I know exactly what is going to follow: 'Vanity of vanities, all is vanity.'

6680.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6680.quote: A man will be imprisoned in a room with a door that's unlocked and opens inwards; as long as it does not occur to him to pull rather than push.

6681.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6681.quote: A serious and good philosophical work could be written consisting entirely of jokes.

6682.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6682.quote: Uttering a word is like striking a note on the keyboard of the imagination.

6683.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6683.quote: Man has to awaken to wonder - and so perhaps do peoples. Science is a way of sending him to sleep again.

6684.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6684.quote: What is your aim in philosophy? To show the fly the way out of the fly-bottle.

6685.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6685.quote: A man's thinking goes on within his consciousness in a seclusion in comparison with which any physical seclusion is an exhibition to public view.

6686.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6686.quote: I sit astride life like a bad rider on a horse. I only owe it to the horse's good nature that I am not thrown off at this very moment.

6687.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6687.quote: You get tragedy where the tree, instead of bending, breaks.

6688.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6688.quote: A philosopher who is not taking part in discussions is like a boxer who never goes into the ring.

6689.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6689.quote: Humor is not a mood but a way of looking at the world. So if it is correct to say that humor was stamped out in Nazi Germany, that does not mean that people were not in good spirits, or anything of that sort, but something much deeper and more important.

6690.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6690.quote: You learned the concept 'pain' when you learned language.

6691.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
6691.quote: I don't know why we are here, but I'm pretty sure that it is not in order to enjoy ourselves.

6692.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6692.quote: Yesterday is not ours to recover, but tomorrow is ours to win or lose.

6693.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6693.quote: Peace is a journey of a thousand miles and it must be taken one step at a time.

6694.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6694.quote: You aren't learning anything when you're talking.

6695.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6695.quote: Every man has a right to a Saturday night bath.

6696.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6696.quote: We must open the doors of opportunity. But we must also equip our people to walk through those doors.

6697.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6697.quote: The noblest search is the search for excellence.

6698.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6698.quote: Until justice is blind to color, until education is unaware of race, until opportunity is unconcerned with the color of men's skins, emancipation will be a proclamation but not a fact.

6699.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6699.quote: If future generations are to remember us more with gratitude than sorrow, we must achieve more than just the miracles of technology. We must also leave them a glimpse of the world as it was created, not just as it looked when we got through with it.

6700.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6700.quote: The atomic bomb certainly is the most powerful of all weapons, but it is conclusively powerful and effective only in the hands of the nation which controls the sky.

6701.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6701.quote: We have talked long enough in this country about equal rights. It is time now to write the next chapter - and to write it in the books of law.

6702.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6702.quote: The separation of church and state is a source of strength, but the conscience of our nation does not call for separation between men of state and faith in the Supreme Being.

6703.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6703.quote: The fact that a man is a newspaper reporter is evidence of some flaw of character.

6704.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6704.quote: We have the opportunity to move not only toward the rich society and the powerful society, but upward to the Great Society.

6705.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6705.quote: The vote is the most powerful instrument ever devised by man for breaking down injustice and destroying the terrible walls which imprison men because they are different from other men.

6706.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6706.quote: There are no problems we cannot solve together, and very few that we can solve by ourselves.

6707.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6707.quote: A man without a vote is man without protection.

6708.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6708.quote: If one morning I walked on top of the water across the Potomac River, the headline that afternoon would read: 'President Can't Swim.'

6709.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6709.quote: Jerry Ford is so dumb he can't fart and chew gum at the same time.

6710.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6710.quote: The guns and the bombs, the rockets and the warships, are all symbols of human failure.

6711.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6711.quote: I'm tired. I'm tired of feeling rejected by the American people. I'm tired of waking up in the middle of the night worrying about the war.

6712.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6712.quote: Our purpose in Vietnam is to prevent the success of aggression. It is not conquest, it is not empire, it is not foreign bases, it is not domination. It is, simply put, just to prevent the forceful conquest of South Vietnam by North Vietnam.

6713.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6713.quote: Being president is like being a jackass in a hailstorm. There's nothing to do but to stand there and take it.

6714.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6714.quote: What convinces is conviction. Believe in the argument you're advancing. If you don't you're as good as dead. The other person will sense that something isn't there, and no chain of reasoning, no matter how logical or elegant or brilliant, will win your case for you.

6715.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6715.quote: No member of our generation who wasn't a Communist or a dropout in the thirties is worth a damn.

6716.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6716.quote: We live in a world that has narrowed into a neighborhood before it has broadened into a brotherhood.

6717.author: Lyndon B. Johnson
6717.quote: While you're saving your face, you're losing your ass.

6718.author: Mae West
6718.quote: Too much of a good thing can be taxing.

6719.author: Mae West
6719.quote: A man's kiss is his signature.

6720.author: Mae West
6720.quote: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.

6721.author: Mae West
6721.quote: An ounce of performance is worth pounds of promises.

6722.author: Mae West
6722.quote: Save a boyfriend for a rainy day - and another, in case it doesn't rain.

6723.author: Mae West
6723.quote: I used to be Snow White, but I drifted.

6724.author: Mae West
6724.quote: If I asked for a cup of coffee, someone would search for the double meaning.

6725.author: Mae West
6725.quote: Ten men waiting for me at the door? Send one of them home, I'm tired.

6726.author: Mae West
6726.quote: Love conquers all things except poverty and toothache.

6727.author: Mae West
6727.quote: Personality is the glitter that sends your little gleam across the footlights and the orchestra pit into that big black space where the audience is.

6728.author: Mae West
6728.quote: Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before.

6729.author: Mae West
6729.quote: All discarded lovers should be given a second chance, but with somebody else.

6731.author: Mae West
6731.quote: Keep a diary, and someday it'll keep you.

6732.author: Mae West
6732.quote: A dame that knows the ropes isn't likely to get tied up.

6733.author: Mae West
6733.quote: I'm no model lady. A model's just an imitation of the real thing.

6734.author: Mae West
6734.quote: I'll try anything once, twice if I like it, three times to make sure.

6735.author: Mae West
6735.quote: When I'm good, I'm very good. But when I'm bad I'm better.

6736.author: Mae West
6736.quote: I didn't discover curves; I only uncovered them.

6737.author: Mae West
6737.quote: When I'm good I'm very, very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better.

6738.author: Mae West
6738.quote: Cultivate your curves - they may be dangerous but they won't be avoided.

6739.author: Mae West
6739.quote: Marriage is a great institution, but I'm not ready for an institution.

6740.author: Mae West
6740.quote: It isn't what I do, but how I do it. It isn't what I say, but how I say it, and how I look when I do it and say it.

6741.author: Mae West
6741.quote: Look your best - who said love is blind?

6742.author: Mae West
6742.quote: A man can be short and dumpy and getting bald but if he has fire, women will like him.

6743.author: Mae West
6743.quote: Too much of a good thing can be wonderful.

6744.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6744.quote: Happiness radiates like the fragrance from a flower and draws all good things towards you.

6745.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6745.quote: The philosophy of life is this: Life is not a struggle, not a tension... Life is bliss. It is eternal wisdom, eternal existence.

6746.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6746.quote: Being happy is of the utmost importance. Success in anything is through happiness.

6747.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6747.quote: The kingdom of heaven is like electricity. You don't see it. It is within you.

6748.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6748.quote: Just think of any negativity that comes at you as a raindrop falling into the ocean of your bliss.

6749.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6749.quote: Problems will disappear as darkness disappears with the onset of light.

6750.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6750.quote: Whatever we put our attention on will grow stronger in our life.

6751.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6751.quote: When the conscious mind expands to embrace deeper levels of thinking, the thought wave becomes more powerful and results in added energy and intelligence.

6752.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6752.quote: The knowledge from an enlightened person breaks on the hard rocks of ignorance.

6753.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6753.quote: Behaviour arises from the level of one's consciousness.

6754.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6754.quote: There is one unity, unified wholeness, total natural law, in the transcendental unified consciousness.

6755.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6755.quote: Problems or successes, they all are the results of our own actions. Karma. The philosophy of action is that no one else is the giver of peace or happiness. One's own karma, one's own actions are responsible to come to bring either happiness or success or whatever.

6756.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6756.quote: Stress is the reason for crime and all other kinds of frustration. To relieve it will eliminate everything else.

6757.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6757.quote: Life finds its purpose and fulfillment in the expansion of happiness.

6758.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6758.quote: Great amount of scientific research is there to show that health is better because transcendental meditation deals with consciousness, and consciousness is the basic value of all the physical expressions. The entire creation is the expression of consciousness.

6759.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6759.quote: Monks are not expected to speak about themselves; the message is important, not the person.

6760.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6760.quote: The important thing is this: to be able, at any moment, to sacrifice what we are for what we could become.

6761.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6761.quote: My University of Management will create managers who will float in happiness, success and fulfillment.

6762.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6762.quote: You must learn to take life less seriously and to laugh.

6763.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6763.quote: The Self of everyone, the Atma of everyone, the transcendental field of reality of everyone, is the same in everyone. Whether the body calls itself an American, German, Indian or Chinese, it doesn't matter.

6765.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6765.quote: What we have done, the result of that comes to us whenever it comes, either today, tomorrow, hundred years later, hundred lives later, whatever, whatever. And so, it's our own karma. That is why that philosophy in every religion: Killing is sin. Killing is sin in every religion.

6766.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6766.quote: It's as if we live in a house which has a vast treasury in one of its rooms. Only we've forgotten about it. So, instead of living a life of royalty, we go about in poverty.

6767.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6767.quote: I want to eliminate the basis of problems and basis of crime, and basis of terrorism.

6768.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6768.quote: America is the most creative country and the most powerful government in the world.

6769.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
6769.quote: The United States influences government and life everywhere else.

6770.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6770.quote: Prayer is the key of the morning and the bolt of the evening.

6771.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6771.quote: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.

6772.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6772.quote: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.

6773.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6773.quote: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.

6774.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6774.quote: First they ignore you, then they laugh at you, then they fight you, then you win.

6775.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6775.quote: A nation's culture resides in the hearts and in the soul of its people.

6776.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6776.quote: When I admire the wonders of a sunset or the beauty of the moon, my soul expands in the worship of the creator.

6777.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6777.quote: Satisfaction lies in the effort, not in the attainment, full effort is full victory.

6778.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6778.quote: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.

6779.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6779.quote: It is health that is real wealth and not pieces of gold and silver.

6780.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6780.quote: An eye for an eye only ends up making the whole world blind.

6781.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6781.quote: A man is but the product of his thoughts what he thinks, he becomes.

6782.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6782.quote: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.

6784.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6784.quote: In prayer it is better to have a heart without words than words without a heart.

6785.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6785.quote: Morality is the basis of things and truth is the substance of all morality.

6786.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6786.quote: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.

6787.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6787.quote: Nobody can hurt me without my permission.

6788.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6788.quote: The essence of all religions is one. Only their approaches are different.

6789.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6789.quote: Anger is the enemy of non-violence and pride is a monster that swallows it up.

6790.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6790.quote: The good man is the friend of all living things.

6791.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6791.quote: There is a sufficiency in the world for man's need but not for man's greed.

6792.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6792.quote: The greatness of a nation can be judged by the way its animals are treated.

6793.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6793.quote: You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.

6794.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6794.quote: Anger and intolerance are the enemies of correct understanding.

6795.author: Mahatma Gandhi
6795.quote: Prayer is not asking. It is a longing of the soul. It is daily admission of one's weakness. It is better in prayer to have a heart without words than words without a heart.

6796.author: Maimonides
6796.quote: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day; teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.

6797.author: Maimonides
6797.quote: The risk of a wrong decision is preferable to the terror of indecision.

6798.author: Maimonides
6798.quote: Teach thy tongue to say 'I do not know', and thou shalt progress.

6799.author: Maimonides
6799.quote: One should see the world, and see himself as a scale with an equal balance of good and evil. When he does one good deed the scale is tipped to the good - he and the world is saved. When he does one evil deed the scale is tipped to the bad - he and the world is destroyed.

6800.author: Maimonides
6800.quote: Consequently he who wishes to attain to human perfection, must therefore first study Logic, next the various branches of Mathematics in their proper order, then Physics, and lastly Metaphysics.

6801.author: Maimonides
6801.quote: Do not consider it proof just because it is written in books, for a liar who will deceive with his tongue will not hesitate to do the same with his pen.

6802.author: Maimonides
6802.quote: No disease that can be treated by diet should be treated with any other means.

6803.author: Maimonides
6803.quote: You will certainly not doubt the necessity of studying astronomy and physics, if you are desirous of comprehending the relation between the world and Providence as it is in reality, and not according to imagination.

6804.author: Maimonides
6804.quote: Man's shortcomings and sins are all due to substance of the body and not to its form, while all his merits are exclusively due to his form.

6805.author: Maimonides
6805.quote: When man possesses a good, sound body that does not overpower him nor disturb the equilibrium in him, he possesses a divine gift. In short, a good constitution facilitates the rule of the soul over the body, but it is not impossible to conquer a bad constitution by training.

6806.author: Maimonides
6806.quote: If the whole earth is infinitely small in comparison with the sphere of the stars, what is man compared with all these created beings!

6807.author: Maimonides
6807.quote: The whole object of the Prophets and the Sages was to declare that a limit is set to human reason where it must halt.

6808.author: Maimonides
6808.quote: However great the exertion of our mind may be to comprehend the Divine Being or any of the ideals, we find a screen and partition between Him and ourselves. Thus the prophets frequently hint at the existence of a partition between God and us.

6809.author: Maimonides
6809.quote: The numerous evils to which individual persons are exposed are due to the defects existing in the persons themselves. We complain and seek relief from our own faults; we suffer from the evils which we, by our own free will, inflict on ourselves and ascribe them to God, who is far from being connected with them!

6810.author: Maimonides
6810.quote: All the great evils which men cause to each other because of certain intentions, desires, opinions, or religious principles, are likewise due to non-existence, because they originate in ignorance, which is absence of wisdom.

6812.author: Maimonides
6812.quote: If men possessed wisdom, which stands in the same relation to the form of man as the sight to the eye, they would not cause any injury to themselves or to others; for the knowledge of truth removes hatred and quarrels, and prevents mutual injuries.

6813.author: Maimonides
6813.quote: You must accept the truth from whatever source it comes.

6814.author: Maimonides
6814.quote: If a person studies too much and exhausts his reflective powers, he will be confused, and will not be able to apprehend even that which had been within the power of his apprehension. For the powers of the body are all alike in this respect.

6815.author: Maimonides
6815.quote: It is necessary to bear in mind that Scripture only teaches the chief points of those true principles which lead to the true perfection of man, and only demands in general terms faith in them.

6816.author: Maimonides
6816.quote: The same is the case with those opinions of man to which he has been accustomed from his youth; he likes them, defends them, and shuns the opposite views.

6817.author: Maimonides
6817.quote: To the totality of purposes of the perfect Law there belong the abandonment, depreciation, and restraint of desires in so far as possible.

6818.author: Maimonides
6818.quote: All this is applicable to the intellectual faculties of man. There is a considerable difference between one person and another as regards these faculties, as is well known to philosophers.

6819.author: Maimonides
6819.quote: Further, there are things of which the mind understands one part, but remains ignorant of the other; and when man is able to comprehend certain things, it does not follow that he must be able to comprehend everything.

6820.author: Maimonides
6820.quote: He, however, who begins with Metaphysics, will not only become confused in matters of religion, but will fall into complete infidelity.

6821.author: Maimonides
6821.quote: It is thus necessary to examine all things according to their essence, to infer from every species such true and well established propositions as may assist us in the solution of metaphysical problems.

6822.author: Malala Yousafzai
6822.quote: Let us remember: One book, one pen, one child, and one teacher can change the world.

6823.author: Malala Yousafzai
6823.quote: The best way to solve problems and to fight against war is through dialogue.

6824.author: Malala Yousafzai
6824.quote: There should be no discrimination against languages people speak, skin color, or religion.

6825.author: Malala Yousafzai
6825.quote: It is very important to know who you are. To make decisions. To show who you are.

6826.author: Malala Yousafzai
6826.quote: If you go anywhere, even paradise, you will miss your home.

6827.author: Malala Yousafzai
6827.quote: When the whole world is silent, even one voice becomes powerful.

6828.author: Malala Yousafzai
6828.quote: Let us make our future now, and let us make our dreams tomorrow's reality.

6829.author: Malala Yousafzai
6829.quote: I speak not for myself but for those without voice... those who have fought for their rights... their right to live in peace, their right to be treated with dignity, their right to equality of opportunity, their right to be educated.

6830.author: Malala Yousafzai
6830.quote: What is interesting is the power and the impact of social media... So we must try to use social media in a good way.

6831.author: Malala Yousafzai
6831.quote: Terrorism will spill over if you don't speak up.

6832.author: Malala Yousafzai
6832.quote: Some girls cannot go to school because of the child labor and child trafficking.

6833.author: Malala Yousafzai
6833.quote: There are many problems, but I think there is a solution to all these problems; it's just one, and it's education.

6834.author: Malala Yousafzai
6834.quote: The terrorists thought they would change my aims and stop my ambitions, but nothing changed in my life except this: weakness, fear and hopelessness died. Strength, power and courage were born.

6835.author: Malala Yousafzai
6835.quote: All I want is an education, and I am afraid of no one.

6836.author: Malala Yousafzai
6836.quote: In India, innocent and poor children are victims of child labor.

6837.author: Malala Yousafzai
6837.quote: In many parts of the world, especially Pakistan and Afghanistan, terrorism, war and conflict stop children to go to their schools. We are really tired of these wars. Women and children are suffering.

6838.author: Malala Yousafzai
6838.quote: I want poverty to end in tomorrow's Pakistan. I want every girl in Pakistan to go to school.

6839.author: Malala Yousafzai
6839.quote: In some parts of the world, students are going to school every day. It's their normal life. But in other part of the world, we are starving for education... it's like a precious gift. It's like a diamond.

6840.author: Malala Yousafzai
6840.quote: A doctor can only treat patients. A doctor can only help the people who are shot or who are injured. But a politician can stop people from injuries. A politician can take a step so that no person is scared tomorrow.

6841.author: Malala Yousafzai
6841.quote: I have learned so much from Nelson Mandela, and he has been my leader. He is a perpetual inspiration for me and millions of others around the world.

6842.author: Malala Yousafzai
6842.quote: I was a girl in a land where rifles are fired in celebration of a son, while daughters are hidden away behind a curtain, their role in life simply to prepare food and give birth to children.

6843.author: Malala Yousafzai
6843.quote: Thank you to the children whose innocent words encouraged me.

6844.author: Malala Yousafzai
6844.quote: At night when I used to sleep, I was thinking all the time that shall I put a knife under my pillow.

6845.author: Malala Yousafzai
6845.quote: When I was born, some of our relatives came to our house and told my mother, 'Don't worry, next time you will have a son.'

6846.author: Malala Yousafzai
6846.quote: Nelson Mandela is physically separated from us, but his soul and spirit will never die. He belongs to the whole world because he is an icon of equality, freedom and love, the values we need all the time everywhere.

6847.author: Malala Yousafzai
6847.quote: I want education for the sons and the daughters of all the extremists, especially the Taliban.

6848.author: Malcolm X
6848.quote: Education is the passport to the future, for tomorrow belongs to those who prepare for it today.

6849.author: Malcolm X
6849.quote: There is no better than adversity. Every defeat, every heartbreak, every loss, contains its own seed, its own lesson on how to improve your performance the next time.

6850.author: Malcolm X
6850.quote: The media's the most powerful entity on earth. They have the power to make the innocent guilty and to make the guilty innocent, and that's power. Because they control the minds of the masses.

6851.author: Malcolm X
6851.quote: The future belongs to those who prepare for it today.

6852.author: Malcolm X
6852.quote: Nobody can give you freedom. Nobody can give you equality or justice or anything. If you're a man, you take it.

6853.author: Malcolm X
6853.quote: I'm for truth, no matter who tells it. I'm for justice, no matter who it's for or against.

6854.author: Malcolm X
6854.quote: I don't even call it violence when it's in self defense; I call it intelligence.

6855.author: Malcolm X
6855.quote: I believe in the brotherhood of all men, but I don't believe in wasting brotherhood on anyone who doesn't want to practice it with me. Brotherhood is a two-way street.

6856.author: Malcolm X
6856.quote: America preaches integration and practices segregation.

6857.author: Malcolm X
6857.quote: I have more respect for a man who lets me know where he stands, even if he's wrong, than the one who comes up like an angel and is nothing but a devil.

6858.author: Malcolm X
6858.quote: Be peaceful, be courteous, obey the law, respect everyone; but if someone puts his hand on you, send him to the cemetery.

6859.author: Malcolm X
6859.quote: Without education, you are not going anywhere in this world.

6860.author: Malcolm X
6860.quote: Segregation is that which is forced upon an inferior by a superior. Separation is done voluntarily by two equals.

6861.author: Malcolm X
6861.quote: You're not supposed to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who says it.

6862.author: Malcolm X
6862.quote: Despite my firm convictions, I have always been a man who tries to face facts, and to accept the reality of life as new experience and new knowledge unfolds. I have always kept an open mind, a flexibility that must go hand in hand with every form of the intelligent search for truth.

6863.author: Malcolm X
6863.quote: The American Negro never can be blamed for his racial animosities - he is only reacting to 400 years of the conscious racism of the American whites.

6864.author: Malcolm X
6864.quote: Power in defense of freedom is greater than power in behalf of tyranny and oppression, because power, real power, comes from our conviction which produces action, uncompromising action.

6865.author: Malcolm X
6865.quote: History proves that the white man is a devil.

6866.author: Malcolm X
6866.quote: If it's lawful to have a rifle club to kill pheasants, it should be just as lawful to have one to kill wolves or dogs that are being sicked on little black babies. In fact, it's constitutional. Article Number Two of the constitution guarantees the right of every citizen to own a rifle or a shot gun.

6867.author: Malcolm X
6867.quote: If you have no critics you'll likely have no success.

6868.author: Malcolm X
6868.quote: When ghetto living seems normal, you have no shame, no privacy.

6869.author: Malcolm X
6869.quote: I have been blessed to visit the Holy City of Mecca.

6870.author: Malcolm X
6870.quote: We are not anti-white. But we don't have time for the white man. The white man is on top already, the white man is the boss already... he has first-class citizenship already. So you are wasting your time talking to the white man. We are working on our own people.

6871.author: Malcolm X
6871.quote: We won't organize any black man to be a Democrat or a Republican because both of them have sold us out. Both of them have sold us out; both parties have sold us out. Both parties are racist, and the Democratic Party is more racist than the Republican Party.

6872.author: Malcolm X
6872.quote: America needs to understand Islam, because this is the one religion that erases from its society the race problem. Throughout my travels in the Muslim world, I have met, talked to, even eaten with people who in America would have been considered 'white,' but the 'white' attitude had been removed from their minds by the religion of Islam.

6873.author: Malcolm X
6873.quote: You don't have to be a man to fight for freedom. All you have to do is to be an intelligent human being.

6874.author: Marc Anthony
6874.quote: If you do what you love, you'll never work a day in your life.

6875.author: Marc Anthony
6875.quote: What you see is what you get. My God, I don't have the time nor the energy to live up to some persona.

6876.author: Marc Anthony
6876.quote: I'm not a traditional sonero, at least not in the way they want me to be, I'm an interpreter, and I reach people in a different level.

6877.author: Marc Anthony
6877.quote: Be quiet, or my wife will take away your first born and make him or her work in one of her sweatshops!

6878.author: Marc Anthony
6878.quote: I just want to sing, I want to work on my music, I want to make my movies, that's all I want to do.

6879.author: Marc Anthony
6879.quote: Being Puerto Rican, born and raised on the streets of New York, you go, 'Wow, you're still friends with your ex, man? Really? That's weird.' I don't play that.

6880.author: Marc Anthony
6880.quote: These opportunities don't come around too often. It's quite an honor and a privilege to be able to sit here today saying that I'm a part-owner of an NFL team.

6881.author: Marc Anthony
6881.quote: Fame is addictive. Money is addictive. Attention is addictive. But golf is second to none.

6883.author: Marc Anthony
6883.quote: First you date the songs, and then you get engaged and then you marry them. They have to stand the test of time, because they are going to be yours for the next 20, 30, 40 years. So you had better choose right.

6884.author: Marc Anthony
6884.quote: I say it every day - I'm the luckiest man on earth.

6885.author: Marc Anthony
6885.quote: I think in general I've never dared compose in Spanish. First of all, it is such an intricate language.

6886.author: Marc Anthony
6886.quote: My mum always told me 95 per cent of success was partnering well.

6888.author: Marc Anthony
6888.quote: I'm not a salsa singer who wants to sing in English, and I'm not this American kid who wants to sing Spanish.

6889.author: Marc Anthony
6889.quote: I come from a pop background, but I'm also a Puerto Rican and I do feel this music. My approach to salsa is a humble one, and I defy anybody to prove that I'm faking it.

6890.author: Marc Anthony
6890.quote: Celebrity watching and speculation is almost like a sport.

6891.author: Marc Anthony
6891.quote: 'Livin' la Vida Loca' is not Latin music. It does not represent Latin music.

6892.author: Marc Anthony
6892.quote: What Jennifer Lopez puts out, it's not Latin music.

6893.author: Marcel Proust
6893.quote: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy, they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.

6894.author: Marcel Proust
6894.quote: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.

6895.author: Marcel Proust
6895.quote: A change in the weather is sufficient to recreate the world and ourselves.

6896.author: Marcel Proust
6896.quote: Time passes, and little by little everything that we have spoken in falsehood becomes true.

6897.author: Marcel Proust
6897.quote: It is in moments of illness that we are compelled to recognize that we live not alone but chained to a creature of a different kingdom, whole worlds apart, who has no knowledge of us and by whom it is impossible to make ourselves understood: our body.

6898.author: Marcel Proust
6898.quote: We are healed from suffering only by experiencing it to the full.

6899.author: Marcel Proust
6899.quote: The voyage of discovery is not in seeking new landscapes but in having new eyes.

6901.author: Marcel Proust
6901.quote: The only real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes but in having new eyes.

6902.author: Marcel Proust
6902.quote: We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us.

6903.author: Marcel Proust
6903.quote: Like many intellectuals, he was incapable of saying a simple thing in a simple way.

6904.author: Marcel Proust
6904.quote: As long as men are free to ask what they must, free to say what they think, free to think what they will, freedom can never be lost and science can never regress.

6905.author: Marcel Proust
6905.quote: Your soul is a dark forest. But the trees are of a particular species, they are genealogical trees.

6906.author: Marcel Proust
6906.quote: A powerful idea communicates some of its strength to him who challenges it.

6907.author: Marcel Proust
6907.quote: If a little dreaming is dangerous, the cure for it is not to dream less but to dream more, to dream all the time.

6908.author: Marcel Proust
6908.quote: If only for the sake of elegance, I try to remain morally pure.

6909.author: Marcel Proust
6909.quote: Happiness is beneficial for the body, but it is grief that develops the powers of the mind.

6910.author: Marcel Proust
6910.quote: Like everybody who is not in love, he thought one chose the person to be loved after endless deliberations and on the basis of particular qualities or advantages.

6911.author: Marcel Proust
6911.quote: The only paradise is paradise lost.

6912.author: Marcel Proust
6912.quote: We do not succeed in changing things according to our desire, but gradually our desire changes.

6913.author: Marcel Proust
6913.quote: We are able to find everything in our memory, which is like a dispensary or chemical laboratory in which chance steers our hand sometimes to a soothing drug and sometimes to a dangerous poison.

6914.author: Marcel Proust
6914.quote: Habit is a second nature which prevents us from knowing the first, of which it has neither the cruelties nor the enchantments.

6915.author: Marcel Proust
6915.quote: The paradoxes of today are the prejudices of tomorrow, since the most benighted and the most deplorable prejudices have had their moment of novelty when fashion lent them its fragile grace.

6916.author: Marcel Proust
6916.quote: Time, which changes people, does not alter the image we have retained of them.

6917.author: Marcel Proust
6917.quote: Illness is the doctor to whom we pay most heed; to kindness, to knowledge, we make promise only; pain we obey.

6918.author: Marcel Proust
6918.quote: There is no man, however wise, who has not at some period of his youth said things, or lived in a way the consciousness of which is so unpleasant to him in later life that he would gladly, if he could, expunge it from his memory.

6919.author: Marcus Aurelius
6919.quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.

6920.author: Marcus Aurelius
6920.quote: Reject your sense of injury and the injury itself disappears.

6921.author: Marcus Aurelius
6921.quote: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.

6922.author: Marcus Aurelius
6922.quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive - to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.

6923.author: Marcus Aurelius
6923.quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

6924.author: Marcus Aurelius
6924.quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.

6925.author: Marcus Aurelius
6925.quote: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.

6926.author: Marcus Aurelius
6926.quote: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.

6927.author: Marcus Aurelius
6927.quote: A man's worth is no greater than his ambitions.

6928.author: Marcus Aurelius
6928.quote: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe.

6929.author: Marcus Aurelius
6929.quote: Our life is what our thoughts make it.

6930.author: Marcus Aurelius
6930.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts: therefore, guard accordingly, and take care that you entertain no notions unsuitable to virtue and reasonable nature.

6931.author: Marcus Aurelius
6931.quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.

6932.author: Marcus Aurelius
6932.quote: Life is neither good or evil, but only a place for good and evil.

6933.author: Marcus Aurelius
6933.quote: Let men see, let them know, a real man, who lives as he was meant to live.

6934.author: Marcus Aurelius
6934.quote: We ought to do good to others as simply as a horse runs, or a bee makes honey, or a vine bears grapes season after season without thinking of the grapes it has borne.

6935.author: Marcus Aurelius
6935.quote: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.

6936.author: Marcus Aurelius
6936.quote: Look within. Within is the fountain of good, and it will ever bubble up, if thou wilt ever dig.

6937.author: Marcus Aurelius
6937.quote: Each day provides its own gifts.

6938.author: Marcus Aurelius
6938.quote: Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.

6939.author: Marcus Aurelius
6939.quote: The only wealth which you will keep forever is the wealth you have given away.

6940.author: Marcus Aurelius
6940.quote: Poverty is the mother of crime.

6941.author: Marcus Aurelius
6941.quote: Nothing has such power to broaden the mind as the ability to investigate systematically and truly all that comes under thy observation in life.

6942.author: Marcus Aurelius
6942.quote: I have often wondered how it is that every man loves himself more than all the rest of men, but yet sets less value on his own opinions of himself than on the opinions of others.

6943.author: Marcus Aurelius
6943.quote: Time is a sort of river of passing events, and strong is its current; no sooner is a thing brought to sight than it is swept by and another takes its place, and this too will be swept away.

6944.author: Marcus Aurelius
6944.quote: Nowhere can man find a quieter or more untroubled retreat than in his own soul.

6945.author: Marcus Garvey
6945.quote: A people without the knowledge of their past history, origin and culture is like a tree without roots.

6946.author: Marcus Garvey
6946.quote: If you have no confidence in self, you are twice defeated in the race of life.

6947.author: Marcus Garvey
6947.quote: The Black skin is not a badge of shame, but rather a glorious symbol of national greatness.

6948.author: Marcus Garvey
6948.quote: With confidence, you have won before you have started.

6949.author: Marcus Garvey
6949.quote: Real men laugh at opposition; real men smile when enemies appear.

6950.author: Marcus Garvey
6950.quote: Emancipate yourselves from mental slavery, none but ourselves can free our minds!

6951.author: Marcus Garvey
6951.quote: Look for me in the whirlwind or the storm.

6952.author: Marcus Garvey
6952.quote: Progress is the attraction that moves humanity.

6953.author: Marcus Garvey
6953.quote: Liberate the minds of men and ultimately you will liberate the bodies of men.

6954.author: Marcus Garvey
6954.quote: God and Nature first made us what we are, and then out of our own created genius we make ourselves what we want to be. Follow always that great law. Let the sky and God be our limit and Eternity our measurement.

6955.author: Marcus Garvey
6955.quote: Up, you mighty race, accomplish what you will.

6956.author: Marcus Garvey
6956.quote: Men who are in earnest are not afraid of consequences.

6957.author: Marcus Garvey
6957.quote: We see a new Ethiopia, a new Africa, stretching her hands of influence throughout the world, teaching man the way of life and peace, The Way to God.

6958.author: Marcus Garvey
6958.quote: I regard the Klan, the Anglo-Saxon clubs and White American societies, as far as the Negro is concerned, as better friends of the race than all other groups of hypocritical whites put together.

6959.author: Marcus Garvey
6959.quote: You may call me a Klansman if you will, but, potentially, every white man is a Klansman, as far as the Negro in competition with whites socially, economically and politically is concerned, and there is no use lying.

6960.author: Marcus Garvey
6960.quote: A reading man and woman is a ready man and woman, but a writing man and woman is exact.

6961.author: Marcus Garvey
6961.quote: If the enemy could only know that Marcus Garvey is but a John the Baptist in the wilderness, that a greater and more dangerous Marcus Garvey is yet to appear, the Garvey with whom you will have to reckon for the injustice of the present generation.

6962.author: Marcus Garvey
6962.quote: Marcus Garvey does not give a snap for anything human but justice, and that which is based upon righteousness.

6963.author: Marcus Garvey
6963.quote: I have no desire to take all black people back to Africa; there are blacks who are no good here and will likewise be no good there.

6964.author: Marcus Garvey
6964.quote: There is no force like success, and that is why the individual makes all effort to surround himself throughout life with the evidence of it; as of the individual, so should it be of the nation.

6965.author: Marcus Garvey
6965.quote: Chance has never yet satisfied the hope of a suffering people.

6966.author: Marcus Garvey
6966.quote: Our success educationally, industrially and politically is based upon the protection of a nation founded by ourselves. And the nation can be nowhere else but in Africa.

6967.author: Marcus Garvey
6967.quote: The enemies are not so much from without as from within the race.

6968.author: Marcus Garvey
6968.quote: Africa has become the big game of the nation hunters. Today, Africa looms as the greatest commercial, industrial and political prize in the world.

6969.author: Marcus Garvey
6969.quote: There shall be no solution to this race problem until you, yourselves, strike the blow for liberty.

6970.author: Marcus Garvey
6970.quote: I like honesty and fair play.

6971.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6971.quote: If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need.

6972.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6972.quote: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.

6973.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6973.quote: The life of the dead is placed in the memory of the living.

6974.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6974.quote: Silence is one of the great arts of conversation.

6975.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6975.quote: The safety of the people shall be the highest law.

6976.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6976.quote: Live as brave men; and if fortune is adverse, front its blows with brave hearts.

6977.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6977.quote: The countenance is the portrait of the soul, and the eyes mark its intentions.

6978.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6978.quote: Any man can make mistakes, but only an idiot persists in his error.

6979.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6979.quote: The wise are instructed by reason, average minds by experience, the stupid by necessity and the brute by instinct.

6980.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6980.quote: It is not by muscle, speed, or physical dexterity that great things are achieved, but by reflection, force of character, and judgment.

6981.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6981.quote: What sweetness is left in life, if you take away friendship? Robbing life of friendship is like robbing the world of the sun. A true friend is more to be esteemed than kinsfolk.

6982.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6982.quote: What then is freedom? The power to live as one wishes.

6983.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6983.quote: A home without books is a body without soul.

6984.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6984.quote: As fire when thrown into water is cooled down and put out, so also a false accusation when brought against a man of the purest and holiest character, boils over and is at once dissipated, and vanishes and threats of heaven and sea, himself standing unmoved.

6985.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6985.quote: Friendship improves happiness and abates misery, by the doubling of our joy and the dividing of our grief.

6987.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6987.quote: Every man can tell how many goats or sheep he possesses, but not how many friends.

6988.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6988.quote: Memory is the treasury and guardian of all things.

6989.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6989.quote: Let us not listen to those who think we ought to be angry with our enemies, and who believe this to be great and manly. Nothing is so praiseworthy, nothing so clearly shows a great and noble soul, as clemency and readiness to forgive.

6990.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6990.quote: Nobody can give you wiser advice than yourself.

6991.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6991.quote: The higher we are placed, the more humbly we should walk.

6992.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6992.quote: I prefer tongue-tied knowledge to ignorant loquacity.

6993.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6993.quote: The function of wisdom is to discriminate between good and evil.

6994.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6994.quote: Glory follows virtue as if it were its shadow.

6995.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6995.quote: Nothing is more noble, nothing more venerable than fidelity. Faithfulness and truth are the most sacred excellences and endowments of the human mind.

6996.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
6996.quote: The enemy is within the gates; it is with our own luxury, our own folly, our own criminality that we have to contend.

6997.author: Margaret Atwood
6997.quote: A voice is a human gift; it should be cherished and used, to utter fully human speech as possible. Powerlessness and silence go together.

6998.author: Margaret Atwood
6998.quote: Little girls are cute and small only to adults. To one another they are not cute. They are life-sized.

6999.author: Margaret Atwood
6999.quote: The answers you get from literature depend on the questions you pose.

7000.author: Margaret Atwood
7000.quote: Another belief of mine; that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise.

7001.author: Margaret Atwood
7001.quote: When things are really dismal, you can laugh, or you can cave in completely.

7002.author: Margaret Atwood
7002.quote: Heroes need monsters to establish their heroic credentials. You need something scary to overcome.

7003.author: Margaret Atwood
7003.quote: Every utopia - let's just stick with the literary ones - faces the same problem: What do you do with the people who don't fit in?

7004.author: Margaret Atwood
7004.quote: In the spring, at the end of the day, you should smell like dirt.

7005.author: Margaret Atwood
7005.quote: Reading and writing, like everything else, improve with practice. And, of course, if there are no young readers and writers, there will shortly be no older ones. Literacy will be dead, and democracy - which many believe goes hand in hand with it - will be dead as well.

7006.author: Margaret Atwood
7006.quote: I hope that people will finally come to realize that there is only one 'race' - the human race - and that we are all members of it.

7007.author: Margaret Atwood
7007.quote: The Eskimos had fifty-two names for snow because it was important to them: there ought to be as many for love.

7008.author: Margaret Atwood
7008.quote: If I waited for perfection... I would never write a word.

7009.author: Margaret Atwood
7009.quote: If the national mental illness of the United States is megalomania, that of Canada is paranoid schizophrenia.

7010.author: Margaret Atwood
7010.quote: Our problem right now is that we're so specialized that if the lights go out, there are a huge number of people who are not going to know what to do. But within every dystopia there's a little utopia.

7011.author: Margaret Atwood
7011.quote: We still think of a powerful man as a born leader and a powerful woman as an anomaly.

7012.author: Margaret Atwood
7012.quote: An eye for an eye only leads to more blindness.

7013.author: Margaret Atwood
7013.quote: A word after a word after a word is power.

7014.author: Margaret Atwood
7014.quote: This above all, to refuse to be a victim.

7015.author: Margaret Atwood
7015.quote: I was born in the Ottawa General Hospital right after the Gray Cup Football Game in 1939. Six months later, I was backpacked into the Quebec bush. I grew up in and out of the bush, in and out of Ottawa, Sault Ste. Marie and Toronto.

7016.author: Margaret Atwood
7016.quote: Optimism means better than reality; pessimism means worse than reality. I'm a realist.

7017.author: Margaret Atwood
7017.quote: Vampires get the joy of flying around and living forever, werewolves get the joy of animal spirits. But zombies, they're not rich, or aristocratic, they shuffle around. They're a group phenomenon, they're not very fast, they're quite sickly. So what's the pleasure of being one?

7018.author: Margaret Atwood
7018.quote: Sooner or later, I hate to break it to you, you're gonna die, so how do you fill in the space between here and there? It's yours. Seize your space.

7019.author: Margaret Atwood
7019.quote: Some people mistakenly think nature is very nice and benevolent and never betrays.

7020.author: Margaret Atwood
7020.quote: Myths can't be translated as they did in their ancient soil. We can only find our own meaning in our own time.

7021.author: Margaret Atwood
7021.quote: I'm a strict, strict agnostic. It's very different from a casual, 'I don't know.' It's that you cannot present as knowledge something that is not knowledge. You can present it as faith, you can present it as belief, but you can't present it as fact.

7022.author: Margaret Atwood
7022.quote: A divorce is like an amputation: you survive it, but there's less of you.

7023.author: Margaret Mead
7023.quote: Sister is probably the most competitive relationship within the family, but once the sisters are grown, it becomes the strongest relationship.

7024.author: Margaret Mead
7024.quote: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.

7025.author: Margaret Mead
7025.quote: We won't have a society if we destroy the environment.

7026.author: Margaret Mead
7026.quote: I learned the value of hard work by working hard.

7027.author: Margaret Mead
7027.quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.

7028.author: Margaret Mead
7028.quote: Never believe that a few caring people can't change the world. For, indeed, that's all who ever have.

7029.author: Margaret Mead
7029.quote: A small group of thoughtful people could change the world. Indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.

7030.author: Margaret Mead
7030.quote: What people say, what people do, and what they say they do are entirely different things.

7031.author: Margaret Mead
7031.quote: Human nature is potentially aggressive and destructive and potentially orderly and constructive.

7032.author: Margaret Mead
7032.quote: Anthropology demands the open-mindedness with which one must look and listen, record in astonishment and wonder that which one would not have been able to guess.

7033.author: Margaret Mead
7033.quote: Our humanity rests upon a series of learned behaviors, woven together into patterns that are infinitely fragile and never directly inherited.

7034.author: Margaret Mead
7034.quote: It may be necessary temporarily to accept a lesser evil, but one must never label a necessary evil as good.

7035.author: Margaret Mead
7035.quote: We have nowhere else to go... this is all we have.

7036.author: Margaret Mead
7036.quote: Instead of being presented with stereotypes by age, sex, color, class, or religion, children must have the opportunity to learn that within each range, some people are loathsome and some are delightful.

7037.author: Margaret Mead
7037.quote: Sooner or later I'm going to die, but I'm not going to retire.

7038.author: Margaret Mead
7038.quote: The way to do fieldwork is never to come up for air until it is all over.

7039.author: Margaret Mead
7039.quote: I was wise enough to never grow up while fooling most people into believing I had.

7040.author: Margaret Mead
7040.quote: I do not believe in using women in combat, because females are too fierce.

7041.author: Margaret Mead
7041.quote: It is utterly false and cruelly arbitrary to put all the play and learning into childhood, all the work into middle age, and all the regrets into old age.

7042.author: Margaret Mead
7042.quote: Man's role is uncertain, undefined, and perhaps unnecessary.

7043.author: Margaret Mead
7043.quote: I was brought up to believe that the only thing worth doing was to add to the sum of accurate information in the world.

7044.author: Margaret Mead
7044.quote: I must admit that I personally measure success in terms of the contributions an individual makes to her or his fellow human beings.

7045.author: Margaret Mead
7045.quote: Fathers are biological necessities, but social accidents.

7046.author: Margaret Mead
7046.quote: If we are to achieve a richer culture, rich in contrasting values, we must recognize the whole gamut of human potentialities, and so weave a less arbitrary social fabric, one in which each diverse human gift will find a fitting place.

7047.author: Margaret Mead
7047.quote: The solution to adult problems tomorrow depends on large measure upon how our children grow up today.

7048.author: Margaret Mead
7048.quote: For the very first time the young are seeing history being made before it is censored by their elders.

7049.author: Margaret Thatcher
7049.quote: The problem with socialism is that you eventually run out of other peoples' money.

7050.author: Margaret Thatcher
7050.quote: If you want something said, ask a man; if you want something done, ask a woman.

7051.author: Margaret Thatcher
7051.quote: If you set out to be liked, you would be prepared to compromise on anything at any time, and you would achieve nothing.

7052.author: Margaret Thatcher
7052.quote: Power is like being a lady... if you have to tell people you are, you aren't.

7053.author: Margaret Thatcher
7053.quote: You and I come by road or rail, but economists travel on infrastructure.

7054.author: Margaret Thatcher
7054.quote: You may have to fight a battle more than once to win it.

7055.author: Margaret Thatcher
7055.quote: Plan your work for today and every day, then work your plan.

7056.author: Margaret Thatcher
7056.quote: A world without nuclear weapons would be less stable and more dangerous for all of us.

7057.author: Margaret Thatcher
7057.quote: I love argument, I love debate. I don't expect anyone just to sit there and agree with me, that's not their job.

7058.author: Margaret Thatcher
7058.quote: I am in politics because of the conflict between good and evil, and I believe that in the end good will triumph.

7059.author: Margaret Thatcher
7059.quote: Disciplining yourself to do what you know is right and important, although difficult, is the highroad to pride, self-esteem, and personal satisfaction.

7060.author: Margaret Thatcher
7060.quote: I always cheer up immensely if an attack is particularly wounding because I think, well, if they attack one personally, it means they have not a single political argument left.

7061.author: Margaret Thatcher
7061.quote: Europe was created by history. America was created by philosophy.

7062.author: Margaret Thatcher
7062.quote: Nothing is more obstinate than a fashionable consensus.

7063.author: Margaret Thatcher
7063.quote: I am extraordinarily patient, provided I get my own way in the end.

7064.author: Margaret Thatcher
7064.quote: If you want to cut your own throat, don't come to me for a bandage.

7065.author: Margaret Thatcher
7065.quote: Being prime minister is a lonely job... you cannot lead from the crowd.

7066.author: Margaret Thatcher
7066.quote: If my critics saw me walking over the Thames they would say it was because I couldn't swim.

7067.author: Margaret Thatcher
7067.quote: If... many influential people have failed to understand, or have just forgotten, what we were up against in the Cold War and how we overcame it, they are not going to be capable of securing, let alone enlarging, the gains that liberty has made.

7068.author: Margaret Thatcher
7068.quote: To me, consensus seems to be the process of abandoning all beliefs, principles, values and policies. So it is something in which no one believes and to which no one objects.

7069.author: Margaret Thatcher
7069.quote: What is success? I think it is a mixture of having a flair for the thing that you are doing; knowing that it is not enough, that you have got to have hard work and a certain sense of purpose.

7070.author: Margaret Thatcher
7070.quote: I seem to smell the stench of appeasement in the air.

7071.author: Margaret Thatcher
7071.quote: To cure the British disease with socialism was like trying to cure leukaemia with leeches.

7072.author: Margaret Thatcher
7072.quote: Pennies do not come from heaven. They have to be earned here on earth.

7073.author: Margaret Thatcher
7073.quote: If you lead a country like Britain, a strong country, a country which has taken a lead in world affairs in good times and in bad, a country that is always reliable, then you have to have a touch of iron about you.

7075.author: Maria Montessori
7075.quote: Early childhood education is the key to the betterment of society.

7076.author: Maria Montessori
7076.quote: The development of language is part of the development of the personality, for words are the natural means of expressing thoughts and establishing understanding between people.

7077.author: Maria Montessori
7077.quote: Free the child's potential, and you will transform him into the world.

7078.author: Maria Montessori
7078.quote: The greatest sign of success for a teacher... is to be able to say, 'The children are now working as if I did not exist.'

7079.author: Maria Montessori
7079.quote: Never help a child with a task at which he feels he can succeed.

7080.author: Maria Montessori
7080.quote: Joy, feeling one's own value, being appreciated and loved by others, feeling useful and capable of production are all factors of enormous value for the human soul.

7081.author: Maria Montessori
7081.quote: The greatest development is achieved during the first years of life, and therefore it is then that the greatest care should be taken. If this is done, then the child does not become a burden; he will reveal himself as the greatest marvel of nature.

7082.author: Maria Montessori
7082.quote: Now, what really makes a teacher is love for the human child; for it is love that transforms the social duty of the educator into the higher consciousness of a mission.

7083.author: Maria Montessori
7083.quote: We cannot create observers by saying 'observe', but by giving them the power and the means for this observation and these means are procured through education of the senses.

7084.author: Maria Montessori
7084.quote: Travel stories teach geography; insect stories lead the child into natural science; and so on. The teacher, in short, can use reading to introduce her pupils to the most varied subjects; and the moment they have been thus started, they can go on to any limit guided by the single passion for reading.

7085.author: Maria Montessori
7085.quote: It is surprising to notice that even from the earliest age, man finds the greatest satisfaction in feeling independent. The exalting feeling of being sufficient to oneself comes as a revelation.

7086.author: Maria Montessori
7086.quote: Personal health is related to self-control and to the worship of life in all its natural beauty - self-control bringing with it happiness, renewed youth, and long life.

7087.author: Maria Montessori
7087.quote: We discovered that education is not something which the teacher does, but that it is a natural process which develops spontaneously in the human being.

7088.author: Maria Montessori
7088.quote: Every one in the world ought to do the things for which he is specially adapted. It is the part of wisdom to recognize what each one of us is best fitted for, and it is the part of education to perfect and utilize such predispositions. Because education can direct and aid nature but can never transform her.

7089.author: Maria Montessori
7089.quote: The person who is developing freely and naturally arrives at a spiritual equilibrium in which he is master of his actions, just as one who has acquired physical poise can move freely.

7090.author: Maria Montessori
7090.quote: Man is capable of every great heroism; it was man who found a means of conquering the formidable obstacles of his environment, establishing himself lord of the earth, and laying the foundations of civilization.

7091.author: Maria Montessori
7091.quote: If education is protection to life, you will realize that it is necessary that education accompany life during its whole course.

7092.author: Maria Montessori
7092.quote: The child who concentrates is immensely happy.

7093.author: Maria Montessori
7093.quote: The chief symptom of adolescence is a state of expectation, a tendency towards creative work, and a need for the strengthening of self-confidence. Suddenly, the child becomes very sensitive to the rudeness and humiliations which he had previously suffered with patient indifference.

7094.author: Maria Montessori
7094.quote: To aid life, leaving it free, however, that is the basic task of the educator.

7095.author: Maria Montessori
7095.quote: Through machinery, man can exert tremendous powers almost as fantastic as if he were the hero of a fairy tale. Through machinery, man can travel with an ever increasing velocity; he can fly through the air and go beneath the surface of the ocean.

7096.author: Maria Montessori
7096.quote: Many people must have noticed the intense attention given by children to the conversation of grown-ups when they cannot possibly be understanding a word of what they hear. They are trying to get hold of words, and they often demonstrate this fact by repeating joyously some word which they have been able to grasp.

7097.author: Maria Montessori
7097.quote: One test of the correctness of educational procedure is the happiness of the child.

7098.author: Maria Montessori
7098.quote: Moral Education is the source of that spiritual equilibrium on which everything else depends and which may be compared to that physical equilibrium or sense of balance, without which it is impossible to stand upright or to move into any other position.

7099.author: Maria Montessori
7099.quote: We teachers can only help the work going on, as servants wait upon a master.

7100.author: Maria Montessori
7100.quote: The purpose of life is to obey the hidden command which ensures harmony among all and creates an ever better world. We are not created only to enjoy the world, we are created in order to evolve the cosmos.

7101.author: Marianne Williamson
7101.quote: Forgiveness is not always easy. At times, it feels more painful than the wound we suffered, to forgive the one that inflicted it. And yet, there is no peace without forgiveness.

7102.author: Marianne Williamson
7102.quote: The key to abundance is meeting limited circumstances with unlimited thoughts.

7103.author: Marianne Williamson
7103.quote: One day I looked at something in myself that I had been avoiding because it was too painful. Yet once I did, I had an unexpected surprise. Rather than self-hatred, I was flooded with compassion for myself because I realized the pain necessary to develop that coping mechanism to begin with.

7104.author: Marianne Williamson
7104.quote: Maturity includes the recognition that no one is going to see anything in us that we don't see in ourselves. Stop waiting for a producer. Produce yourself.

7105.author: Marianne Williamson
7105.quote: As we let our light shine, we unconsciously give other people permission to do the same. As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence actually liberates others.

7106.author: Marianne Williamson
7106.quote: Relationships are eternal. The 'separation' is another chapter in the relationship. Often, letting go of the old form of the relationship becomes a lesson in pure love much deeper than any would have learned had the couple stayed together.

7107.author: Marianne Williamson
7107.quote: The top of one mountain is always the bottom of another.

7108.author: Marianne Williamson
7108.quote: Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our Light, not our Darkness, that most frightens us.

7109.author: Marianne Williamson
7109.quote: The goal of spiritual practice is full recovery, and the only thing you need to recover from is a fractured sense of self.

7110.author: Marianne Williamson
7110.quote: The mortal mind alone cannot devise an answer to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, because the true answer lies on a level of consciousness that's beyond our mortal thinking. Quite simply, when it comes to Israel and the Palestinians, we need a miracle.

7111.author: Marianne Williamson
7111.quote: The practice of forgiveness is our most important contribution to the healing of the world.

7112.author: Marianne Williamson
7112.quote: As someone who has faced as much disappointment as most people, I've come to trust not that events will always unfold exactly as I want, but that I will be fine either way.

7113.author: Marianne Williamson
7113.quote: The holidays are only holy if we make them so.

7114.author: Marianne Williamson
7114.quote: Trying to suppress or eradicate symptoms on the physical level can be extremely important, but there's more to healing than that; dealing with psychological, emotional and spiritual issues involved in treating sickness is equally important.

7115.author: Marianne Williamson
7115.quote: Self-awareness is not self-centeredness, and spirituality is not narcissism. 'Know thyself' is not a narcissistic pursuit.

7116.author: Marianne Williamson
7116.quote: We ask ourselves, 'Who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented, fabulous?' Actually, who are you not to be?

7117.author: Marianne Williamson
7117.quote: Old Newtonian physics claimed that things have an objective reality separate from our perception of them. Quantum physics, and particularly Heisenberg's Uncertainty Principle, reveal that, as our perception of an object changes, the object itself literally changes.

7118.author: Marianne Williamson
7118.quote: Unforgiveness is like drinking poison yourself and waiting for the other person to die.

7119.author: Marianne Williamson
7119.quote: My self healing lies in praying for those who have harmed me.

7120.author: Marianne Williamson
7120.quote: We're often afraid of looking at our shadow because we want to avoid the shame or embarrassment that comes along with admitting mistakes.

7121.author: Marianne Williamson
7121.quote: Use each interaction to be the best, most powerful version of yourself.

7122.author: Marianne Williamson
7122.quote: Some pain is simply the normal grief of human existence. That is pain that I try to make room for. I honor my grief.

7123.author: Marianne Williamson
7123.quote: I believe that hunger for a 'lost dimension' of experience is a natural yearning in all of us, and it doesn't go away just because we ignore it. It is evidenced among other places in the millions of children and adults who obsessively read the 'Harry Potter' books. It is said that fiction is where someone gets to tell the truth.

7124.author: Marianne Williamson
7124.quote: Nature is infinitely creative. It is always producing the possibility of new beginnings.

7125.author: Marianne Williamson
7125.quote: Hope lies in having more faith in the power of God to heal us than in the power of anything to hurt or destroy us. In realizing that as children of God we are bigger than our problems, we have the power at last to confront them.

7126.author: Marianne Williamson
7126.quote: People crave comfort, people crave connection, people crave community.

7127.author: Marie Curie
7127.quote: Life is not easy for any of us. But what of that? We must have perseverance and above all confidence in ourselves. We must believe that we are gifted for something and that this thing must be attained.

7128.author: Marie Curie
7128.quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.

7129.author: Marie Curie
7129.quote: You cannot hope to build a better world without improving the individuals. To that end, each of us must work for his own improvement and, at the same time, share a general responsibility for all humanity, our particular duty being to aid those to whom we think we can be most useful.

7130.author: Marie Curie
7130.quote: Be less curious about people and more curious about ideas.

7131.author: Marie Curie
7131.quote: I was taught that the way of progress was neither swift nor easy.

7132.author: Marie Curie
7132.quote: I am among those who think that science has great beauty.

7133.author: Marie Curie
7133.quote: One never notices what has been done; one can only see what remains to be done.

7134.author: Marie Curie
7134.quote: When radium was discovered, no one knew that it would prove useful in hospitals. The work was one of pure science. And this is a proof that scientific work must not be considered from the point of view of the direct usefulness of it.

7135.author: Marie Curie
7135.quote: I was only fifteen when I finished my high-school studies, always having held first rank in my class. The fatigue of growth and study compelled me to take almost a year's rest in the country. I then returned to my father in Warsaw, hoping to teach in the free schools.

7136.author: Marie Curie
7136.quote: In science, we must be interested in things, not in persons.

7137.author: Marie Curie
7137.quote: All my life through, the new sights of Nature made me rejoice like a child.

7138.author: Marie Curie
7138.quote: I am one of those who think like Nobel, that humanity will draw more good than evil from new discoveries.

7139.author: Marie Curie
7139.quote: A scientist in his laboratory is not a mere technician: he is also a child confronting natural phenomena that impress him as though they were fairy tales.

7140.author: Marie Curie
7140.quote: If I see anything vital around me, it is precisely that spirit of adventure, which seems indestructible and is akin to curiosity.

7141.author: Marie Curie
7141.quote: Unknown in Paris, I was lost in the great city, but the feeling of living there alone, taking care of myself without any aid, did not at all depress me. If sometimes I felt lonesome, my usual state of mind was one of calm and great moral satisfaction.

7142.author: Marie Curie
7142.quote: I tried out various experiments described in treatises on physics and chemistry, and the results were sometimes unexpected. At times, I would be encouraged by a little unhoped-for success; at others, I would be in the deepest despair because of accidents and failures resulting from my inexperience.

7143.author: Marie Curie
7143.quote: There are sadistic scientists who hurry to hunt down errors instead of establishing the truth.

7144.author: Marie Curie
7144.quote: In 1903, I finished my doctor's thesis and obtained the degree. At the end of the same year, the Nobel prize was awarded jointly to Becquerel, my husband and me for the discovery of radioactivity and new radioactive elements.

7145.author: Marie Curie
7145.quote: We should not allow it to be believed that all scientific progress can be reduced to mechanisms, machines, gearings, even though such machinery also has its beauty. Neither do I believe that the spirit of adventure runs any risk of disappearing in our world.

7146.author: Marie Curie
7146.quote: I have no dress except the one I wear every day. If you are going to be kind enough to give me one, please let it be practical and dark so that I can put it on afterwards to go to the laboratory.

7147.author: Marie Curie
7147.quote: Sometimes I had to spend a whole day mixing a boiling mass with a heavy iron rod nearly as large as myself. I would be broken with fatigue at the day's end. Other days, on the contrary, the work would be a most minute and delicate fractional crystallization, in the effort to concentrate the radium.

7148.author: Marie Curie
7148.quote: My experiments proved that the radiation of uranium compounds can be measured with precision under determined conditions and that this radiation is an atomic property of the element of uranium.

7149.author: Marie Curie
7149.quote: Pierre Curie came to see me and showed a simple and sincere sympathy with my student life. Soon he caught the habit of speaking to me of his dream of an existence consecrated entirely to scientific research, and he asked me to share that life.

7150.author: Marie Curie
7150.quote: The first experiments on the biological properties of radium were successfully made in France, with samples from our laboratory, while my husband was living.

7151.author: Marie Curie
7151.quote: The death of my husband, coming immediately after the general knowledge of the discoveries with which his name is associated, was felt by the public, and especially by the scientific circles, to be a national misfortune.

7152.author: Marie Curie
7152.quote: After all, science is essentially international, and it is only through lack of the historical sense that national qualities have been attributed to it.

7153.author: Marilyn Manson
