7642.quote: History suggests that capitalism is a necessary condition for political freedom. Clearly it is not a sufficient condition.

7643.author: Milton Friedman
7643.quote: The only way that has ever been discovered to have a lot of people cooperate together voluntarily is through the free market. And that's why it's so essential to preserving individual freedom.

7644.author: Milton Friedman
7644.quote: The greatest advances of civilization, whether in architecture or painting, in science and literature, in industry or agriculture, have never come from centralized government.

7645.author: Mitch Hedberg
7645.quote: My fake plants died because I did not pretend to water them.

7646.author: Mitch Hedberg
7646.quote: I don't have a girlfriend. But I do know a woman who'd be mad at me for saying that.

7647.author: Mitch Hedberg
7647.quote: I wanted to buy a candle holder, but the store didn't have one. So I got a cake.

7648.author: Mitch Hedberg
7648.quote: I wear a necklace, cause I wanna know when I'm upside down.

7649.author: Mitch Hedberg
7649.quote: My belt holds my pants up, but the belt loops hold my belt up. I don't really know what's happening down there. Who is the real hero?

7650.author: Mitch Hedberg
7650.quote: An escalator can never break: it can only become stairs. You should never see an Escalator Temporarily Out Of Order sign, just Escalator Temporarily Stairs. Sorry for the convenience.

7651.author: Mitch Hedberg
7651.quote: If carrots got you drunk, rabbits would be messed-up.

7652.author: Mitch Hedberg
7652.quote: This shirt is dry clean only. Which means... it's dirty.

7653.author: Mitch Hedberg
7653.quote: It's very dangerous to wave to people you don't know because what if they don't have hands? They'll think you're cocky.

7654.author: Mitch Hedberg
7654.quote: Fettucini alfredo is macaroni and cheese for adults.

7655.author: Mitch Hedberg
7655.quote: Rice is great if you're really hungry and want to eat two thousand of something.

7656.author: Mitch Hedberg
7656.quote: Is a hippopotamus a hippopotamus, or just a really cool Opotamus?

7657.author: Mitch Hedberg
7657.quote: A waffle is like a pancake with a syrup trap.

7658.author: Mitch Hedberg
7658.quote: I had a stick of CareFree gum, but it didn't work. I felt pretty good while I was blowing that bubble, but as soon as the gum lost its flavor, I was back to pondering my mortality.

7659.author: Mitch Hedberg
7659.quote: I bought a seven-dollar pen because I always lose pens and I got sick of not caring.

7660.author: Mitch Hedberg
7660.quote: People teach their dogs to sit; it's a trick. I've been sitting my whole life, and a dog has never looked at me as though he thought I was tricky.

7661.author: Mitch Hedberg
7661.quote: I want to get a vending machine, with fun sized candy bars, and the glass in front is a magnifying glass. You'll be mad, but it will be too late.

7662.author: Mitch Hedberg
7662.quote: The depressing thing about tennis is that no matter how good I get, I'll never be as good as a wall.

7663.author: Mitch Hedberg
7663.quote: Wearing a turtleneck is like being strangled by a really weak guy, all day. Wearing a backpack and a turtleneck is like a weak midget trying to bring you down.

7664.author: Mitch Hedberg
7664.quote: I like to play blackjack. I'm not addicted to gambling. I'm addicted to sitting in a semi-circle.

7665.author: Mitch Hedberg
7665.quote: A severed foot is the ultimate stocking stuffer.

7666.author: Mitch Hedberg
7666.quote: I like refried beans. That's why I wanna try fried beans, because maybe they're just as good and we're just wasting time. You don't have to fry them again after all.

7667.author: Mitch Hedberg
7667.quote: I know a lot about cars, man. I can look at any car's headlights and tell you exactly which way it's coming.

7668.author: Mitch Hedberg
7668.quote: I wish I could play little league now. I'd be way better than before.

7669.author: Mitch Hedberg
7669.quote: My sister wanted to be an actress, but she never made it. She does live in a trailer. She got halfway. She's an actress, she just never gets called to the set.

7670.author: Mitch Hedberg
7670.quote: I would imagine that if you could understand Morse code, a tap dancer would drive you crazy.

7671.author: Mother Teresa
7671.quote: Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.

7673.author: Mother Teresa
7673.quote: Loneliness and the feeling of being unwanted is the most terrible poverty.

7674.author: Mother Teresa
7674.quote: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.

7675.author: Mother Teresa
7675.quote: We shall never know all the good that a simple smile can do.

7676.author: Mother Teresa
7676.quote: We need to find God, and he cannot be found in noise and restlessness. God is the friend of silence. See how nature - trees, flowers, grass- grows in silence; see the stars, the moon and the sun, how they move in silence... We need silence to be able to touch souls.

7677.author: Mother Teresa
7677.quote: We think sometimes that poverty is only being hungry, naked and homeless. The poverty of being unwanted, unloved and uncared for is the greatest poverty. We must start in our own homes to remedy this kind of poverty.

7678.author: Mother Teresa
7678.quote: Joy is prayer; joy is strength: joy is love; joy is a net of love by which you can catch souls.

7679.author: Mother Teresa
7679.quote: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.

7680.author: Mother Teresa
7680.quote: The greatest destroyer of peace is abortion because if a mother can kill her own child, what is left for me to kill you and you to kill me? There is nothing between.

7681.author: Mother Teresa
7681.quote: Love is a fruit in season at all times, and within reach of every hand.

7682.author: Mother Teresa
7682.quote: Love begins by taking care of the closest ones - the ones at home.

7683.author: Mother Teresa
7683.quote: We ourselves feel that what we are doing is just a drop in the ocean. But the ocean would be less because of that missing drop.

7684.author: Mother Teresa
7684.quote: Being unwanted, unloved, uncared for, forgotten by everybody, I think that is a much greater hunger, a much greater poverty than the person who has nothing to eat.

7685.author: Mother Teresa
7685.quote: Intense love does not measure, it just gives.

7686.author: Mother Teresa
7686.quote: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.

7687.author: Mother Teresa
7687.quote: Love begins at home, and it is not how much we do... but how much love we put in that action.

7688.author: Mother Teresa
7688.quote: If you can't feed a hundred people, then feed just one.

7689.author: Mother Teresa
7689.quote: The biggest disease today is not leprosy or tuberculosis, but rather the feeling of being unwanted.

7690.author: Mother Teresa
7690.quote: The hunger for love is much more difficult to remove than the hunger for bread.

7691.author: Mother Teresa
7691.quote: Let us touch the dying, the poor, the lonely and the unwanted according to the graces we have received and let us not be ashamed or slow to do the humble work.

7692.author: Mother Teresa
7692.quote: I have found the paradox, that if you love until it hurts, there can be no more hurt, only more love.

7693.author: Mother Teresa
7693.quote: The miracle is not that we do this work, but that we are happy to do it.

7694.author: Mother Teresa
7694.quote: Words which do not give the light of Christ increase the darkness.

7695.author: Mother Teresa
7695.quote: One of the greatest diseases is to be nobody to anybody.

7696.author: Mother Teresa
7696.quote: I want you to be concerned about your next door neighbor. Do you know your next door neighbor?

7697.author: Muhammad Ali
7697.quote: He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life.

7698.author: Muhammad Ali
7698.quote: I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.'

7699.author: Muhammad Ali
7699.quote: Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee.

7700.author: Muhammad Ali
7700.quote: I believe in the religion of Islam. I believe in Allah and peace.

7701.author: Muhammad Ali
7701.quote: Service to others is the rent you pay for your room here on earth.

7702.author: Muhammad Ali
7702.quote: It isn't the mountains ahead to climb that wear you out; it's the pebble in your shoe.

7703.author: Muhammad Ali
7703.quote: It's just a job. Grass grows, birds fly, waves pound the sand. I beat people up.

7704.author: Muhammad Ali
7704.quote: It's lack of faith that makes people afraid of meeting challenges, and I believed in myself.

7705.author: Muhammad Ali
7705.quote: Friendship... is not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.

7706.author: Muhammad Ali
7706.quote: What keeps me going is goals.

7707.author: Muhammad Ali
7707.quote: The word 'Islam' means 'peace.' The word 'Muslim' means 'one who surrenders to God.' But the press makes us seem like haters.

7708.author: Muhammad Ali
7708.quote: Go up in an airplane. Go high enough, and it's like we don't even exist.

7709.author: Muhammad Ali
7709.quote: I know where I'm going and I know the truth, and I don't have to be what you want me to be. I'm free to be what I want.

7710.author: Muhammad Ali
7710.quote: Old age is just a record of one's whole life.

7711.author: Muhammad Ali
7711.quote: It's the repetition of affirmations that leads to belief. And once that belief becomes a deep conviction, things begin to happen.

7712.author: Muhammad Ali
7712.quote: I'm just hoping that people understand that Islam is peace and not violence.

7713.author: Muhammad Ali
7713.quote: If you even dream of beating me you'd better wake up and apologize.

7714.author: Muhammad Ali
7714.quote: Silence is golden when you can't think of a good answer.

7715.author: Muhammad Ali
7715.quote: I done wrestled with an alligator, I done tussled with a whale; handcuffed lightning, thrown thunder in jail; only last week, I murdered a rock, injured a stone, hospitalised a brick; I'm so mean I make medicine sick.

7716.author: Muhammad Ali
7716.quote: The fight is won or lost far away from witnesses - behind the lines, in the gym, and out there on the road, long before I dance under those lights.

7717.author: Muhammad Ali
7717.quote: Allah's the Arabic term for God. Stand up for God, fight for God, work for God and do the right thing, and go the right way, things will end up in your corner.

7718.author: Muhammad Ali
7718.quote: I am the greatest, I said that even before I knew I was.

7719.author: Muhammad Ali
7719.quote: Superman don't need no seat belt.

7720.author: Muhammad Ali
7720.quote: Rivers, ponds, lakes and streams - they all have different names, but they all contain water. Just as religions do - they all contain truths.

7721.author: Muhammad Ali
7721.quote: The name Muhammad is the most common name in the world. In all the countries around the world - Pakistan, Saudi Arabia, Morocco, Turkey, Syria, Lebanon - there are more Muhammads than anything else. When I joined the Nation of Islam and became a Muslim, they gave me the most famous name because I was the champ.

7722.author: Muhammad Ali
7722.quote: A man who views the world the same at fifty as he did at twenty has wasted thirty years of his life.

7723.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7723.quote: You must not fight too often with one enemy, or you will teach him all your art of war.

7724.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7724.quote: A leader is a dealer in hope.

7725.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7725.quote: Death is nothing, but to live defeated and inglorious is to die daily.

7726.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7726.quote: Impossible is a word to be found only in the dictionary of fools.

7727.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7727.quote: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.

7728.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7728.quote: In politics... never retreat, never retract... never admit a mistake.

7730.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7730.quote: A soldier will fight long and hard for a bit of colored ribbon.

7731.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7731.quote: There is no such thing as accident; it is fate misnamed.

7732.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7732.quote: In politics stupidity is not a handicap.

7733.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7733.quote: History is the version of past events that people have decided to agree upon.

7734.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7734.quote: Great ambition is the passion of a great character. Those endowed with it may perform very good or very bad acts. All depends on the principles which direct them.

7735.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7735.quote: A throne is only a bench covered with velvet.

7736.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7736.quote: The best cure for the body is a quiet mind.

7737.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7737.quote: The truest wisdom is a resolute determination.

7738.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7738.quote: If you want a thing done well, do it yourself.

7739.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7739.quote: Victory belongs to the most persevering.

7740.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7740.quote: Glory is fleeting, but obscurity is forever.

7741.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7741.quote: Throw off your worries when you throw off your clothes at night.

7742.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7742.quote: From the heights of these pyramids, forty centuries look down on us.

7743.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7743.quote: The strong man is the one who is able to intercept at will the communication between the senses and the mind.

7744.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7744.quote: Ten people who speak make more noise than ten thousand who are silent.

7745.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7745.quote: The first virtue in a soldier is endurance of fatigue; courage is only the second virtue.

7746.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7746.quote: A man will fight harder for his interests than for his rights.

7747.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7747.quote: Let the path be open to talent.

7748.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
7748.quote: An army marches on its stomach.

7749.author: Napoleon Hill
7749.quote: Strength and growth come only through continuous effort and struggle.

7750.author: Napoleon Hill
7750.quote: If you do not conquer self, you will be conquered by self.

7751.author: Napoleon Hill
7751.quote: Education comes from within; you get it by struggle and effort and thought.

7752.author: Napoleon Hill
7752.quote: Great achievement is usually born of great sacrifice, and is never the result of selfishness.

7753.author: Napoleon Hill
7753.quote: Patience, persistence and perspiration make an unbeatable combination for success.

7754.author: Napoleon Hill
7754.quote: Victory is always possible for the person who refuses to stop fighting.

7755.author: Napoleon Hill
7755.quote: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.

7756.author: Napoleon Hill
7756.quote: The starting point of all achievement is desire.

7757.author: Napoleon Hill
7757.quote: A goal is a dream with a deadline.

7758.author: Napoleon Hill
7758.quote: Think twice before you speak, because your words and influence will plant the seed of either success or failure in the mind of another.

7759.author: Napoleon Hill
7759.quote: It takes half your life before you discover life is a do-it-yourself project.

7760.author: Napoleon Hill
7760.quote: Your big opportunity may be right where you are now.

7761.author: Napoleon Hill
7761.quote: The ladder of success is never crowded at the top.

7762.author: Napoleon Hill
7762.quote: Effort only fully releases its reward after a person refuses to quit.

7763.author: Napoleon Hill
7763.quote: Every adversity, every failure, every heartache carries with it the seed of an equal or greater benefit.

7764.author: Napoleon Hill
7764.quote: First comes thought; then organization of that thought, into ideas and plans; then transformation of those plans into reality. The beginning, as you will observe, is in your imagination.

7765.author: Napoleon Hill
7765.quote: Opportunity often comes disguised in the form of misfortune, or temporary defeat.

7766.author: Napoleon Hill
7766.quote: Don't wait. The time will never be just right.

7767.author: Napoleon Hill
7767.quote: Just as our eyes need light in order to see, our minds need ideas in order to conceive.

7768.author: Napoleon Hill
7768.quote: Persistence is to the character of man as carbon is to steel.

7769.author: Napoleon Hill
7769.quote: Wise men, when in doubt whether to speak or to keep quiet, give themselves the benefit of the doubt, and remain silent.

7770.author: Napoleon Hill
7770.quote: It is literally true that you can succeed best and quickest by helping others to succeed.

7771.author: Napoleon Hill
7771.quote: Any idea, plan, or purpose may be placed in the mind through repetition of thought.

7772.author: Napoleon Hill
7772.quote: There are no limitations to the mind except those we acknowledge.

7773.author: Napoleon Hill
7773.quote: Failure is nature's plan to prepare you for great responsibilities.

7774.author: Napoleon Hill
7774.quote: What the mind of man can conceive and believe, it can achieve.

7775.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7775.quote: Humans aren't as good as we should be in our capacity to empathize with feelings and thoughts of others, be they humans or other animals on Earth. So maybe part of our formal education should be training in empathy. Imagine how different the world would be if, in fact, that were 'reading, writing, arithmetic, empathy.'

7776.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7776.quote: The Universe is under no obligation to make sense to you.

7777.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7777.quote: Even with all our technology and the inventions that make modern life so much easier than it once was, it takes just one big natural disaster to wipe all that away and remind us that, here on Earth, we're still at the mercy of nature.

7778.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7778.quote: No one is dumb who is curious. The people who don't ask questions remain clueless throughout their lives.

7779.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7779.quote: There is no greater education than one that is self-driven.

7780.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7780.quote: Once you have an innovation culture, even those who are not scientists or engineers - poets, actors, journalists - they, as communities, embrace the meaning of what it is to be scientifically literate. They embrace the concept of an innovation culture. They vote in ways that promote it. They don't fight science and they don't fight technology.

7781.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7781.quote: Everything we do, every thought we've ever had, is produced by the human brain. But exactly how it operates remains one of the biggest unsolved mysteries, and it seems the more we probe its secrets, the more surprises we find.

7782.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7782.quote: Dreams about the future are always filled with gadgets.

7783.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7783.quote: We are part of this universe; we are in this universe, but perhaps more important than both of those facts, is that the universe is in us.

7784.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7784.quote: Passion is what gets you through the hardest times that might otherwise make strong men weak, or make you give up.

7785.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7785.quote: If your ego starts out, 'I am important, I am big, I am special,' you're in for some disappointments when you look around at what we've discovered about the universe. No, you're not big. No, you're not. You're small in time and in space. And you have this frail vessel called the human body that's limited on Earth.

7786.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7786.quote: The most creative people are motivated by the grandest of problems that are presented before them.

7787.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7787.quote: Asteroids have us in our sight. The dinosaurs didn't have a space program, so they're not here to talk about this problem. We are, and we have the power to do something about it. I don't want to be the embarrassment of the galaxy, to have had the power to deflect an asteroid, and then not, and end up going extinct.

7788.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7788.quote: Rational thoughts never drive people's creativity the way emotions do.

7789.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7789.quote: I have a personal philosophy in life: If somebody else can do something that I'm doing, they should do it. And what I want to do is find things that would represent a unique contribution to the world - the contribution that only I, and my portfolio of talents, can make happen. Those are my priorities in life.

7790.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7790.quote: It may be that our cosmic curiosity... is a genetically-encoded force that we illuminate when we look up and wonder.

7791.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7791.quote: Half of my library are old books because I like seeing how people thought about their world at their time. So that I don't get bigheaded about something we just discovered and I can be humble about where we might go next. Because you can see who got stuff right and most of the people who got stuff wrong.

7792.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7792.quote: The only way you can invent tomorrow is if you break out of the enclosure that the school system has provided for you by the exams written by people who are trained in another generation.

7793.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7793.quote: Perhaps we've never been visited by aliens because they have looked upon Earth and decided there's no sign of intelligent life.

7794.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7794.quote: There is no science in this world like physics. Nothing comes close to the precision with which physics enables you to understand the world around you. It's the laws of physics that allow us to say exactly what time the sun is going to rise. What time the eclipse is going to begin. What time the eclipse is going to end.

7795.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7795.quote: I think the greatest of people that have ever been in society, they were never versions of someone else. They were themselves.

7796.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7796.quote: To make any future that we dreamt up real requires creative scientists, engineers, and technologists to make it happen. If people are not within your midst who dream about tomorrow - with the capacity to bring tomorrow into the present - then the country might as well just recede back into the cave because that's where we're headed.

7797.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7797.quote: Those who see the cosmic perspective as a depressing outlook, they really need to reassess how they think about the world. Because when I look up in the universe, I know I'm small but I'm also big. I'm big because I'm connected to the universe, and the universe is connected to me.

7798.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7798.quote: The problem is not scientifically illiterate kids; it is scientifically illiterate adults. Kids are born curious about the natural world. They are always turning over rocks, jumping with two feet into mud puddles and playing with the tablecloth and fine china.

7799.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7799.quote: Part of what it is to be scientifically-literate, it's not simply, 'Do you know what DNA is? Or what the Big Bang is?' That's an aspect of science literacy. The biggest part of it is do you know how to think about information that's presented in front of you.

7800.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
7800.quote: Innovations in science and technology are the engines of the 21st-century economy; if you care about the wealth and health of your nation tomorrow, then you'd better rethink how you allocate taxes to fund science. The federal budget needs to recognize this.

7801.author: Nelson Mandela
7801.quote: It always seems impossible until it's done.

7802.author: Nelson Mandela
7802.quote: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.

7803.author: Nelson Mandela
7803.quote: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.

7804.author: Nelson Mandela
7804.quote: A good head and a good heart are always a formidable combination.

7805.author: Nelson Mandela
7805.quote: After climbing a great hill, one only finds that there are many more hills to climb.

7806.author: Nelson Mandela
7806.quote: There is no passion to be found playing small - in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.

7807.author: Nelson Mandela
7807.quote: To deny people their human rights is to challenge their very humanity.

7808.author: Nelson Mandela
7808.quote: Money won't create success, the freedom to make it will.

7809.author: Nelson Mandela
7809.quote: As long as poverty, injustice and gross inequality persist in our world, none of us can truly rest.

7811.author: Nelson Mandela
7811.quote: It is better to lead from behind and to put others in front, especially when you celebrate victory when nice things occur. You take the front line when there is danger. Then people will appreciate your leadership.

7812.author: Nelson Mandela
7812.quote: Where globalization means, as it so often does, that the rich and powerful now have new means to further enrich and empower themselves at the cost of the poorer and weaker, we have a responsibility to protest in the name of universal freedom.

7813.author: Nelson Mandela
7813.quote: No country can really develop unless its citizens are educated.

7814.author: Nelson Mandela
7814.quote: If you talk to a man in a language he understands, that goes to his head. If you talk to him in his language, that goes to his heart.

7815.author: Nelson Mandela
7815.quote: Courageous people do not fear forgiving, for the sake of peace.

7816.author: Nelson Mandela
7816.quote: There is no easy walk to freedom anywhere, and many of us will have to pass through the valley of the shadow of death again and again before we reach the mountaintop of our desires.

7817.author: Nelson Mandela
7817.quote: After one has been in prison, it is the small things that one appreciates: being able to take a walk whenever one wants, going into a shop and buying a newspaper, speaking or choosing to remain silent. The simple act of being able to control one's person.

7818.author: Nelson Mandela
7818.quote: Our human compassion binds us the one to the other - not in pity or patronizingly, but as human beings who have learnt how to turn our common suffering into hope for the future.

7819.author: Nelson Mandela
7819.quote: There is nothing like returning to a place that remains unchanged to find the ways in which you yourself have altered.

7820.author: Nelson Mandela
7820.quote: Let there be work, bread, water and salt for all.

7821.author: Nelson Mandela
7821.quote: We pledge ourselves to liberate all our people from the continuing bondage of poverty, deprivation, suffering, gender and other discrimination.

7822.author: Nelson Mandela
7822.quote: People respond in accordance to how you relate to them. If you approach them on the basis of violence, that's how they'll react. But if you say, 'We want peace, we want stability,' we can then do a lot of things that will contribute towards the progress of our society.

7823.author: Nelson Mandela
7823.quote: There can be no keener revelation of a society's soul than the way in which it treats its children.

7824.author: Nelson Mandela
7824.quote: If there are dreams about a beautiful South Africa, there are also roads that lead to their goal. Two of these roads could be named Goodness and Forgiveness.

7825.author: Nelson Mandela
7825.quote: For to be free is not merely to cast off one's chains, but to live in a way that respects and enhances the freedom of others.

7826.author: Nelson Mandela
7826.quote: Let freedom reign. The sun never set on so glorious a human achievement.

7827.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7827.quote: Politics have no relation to morals.

7828.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7828.quote: If an injury has to be done to a man it should be so severe that his vengeance need not be feared.

7829.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7829.quote: It is better to be feared than loved, if you cannot be both.

7830.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7830.quote: The promise given was a necessity of the past: the word broken is a necessity of the present.

7831.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7831.quote: One who deceives will always find those who allow themselves to be deceived.

7832.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7832.quote: There is nothing more difficult to take in hand, more perilous to conduct, or more uncertain in its success, than to take the lead in the introduction of a new order of things.

7833.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7833.quote: It is not titles that honor men, but men that honor titles.

7834.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7834.quote: The wise man does at once what the fool does finally.

7835.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7835.quote: I'm not interested in preserving the status quo; I want to overthrow it.

7836.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7836.quote: It is double pleasure to deceive the deceiver.

7837.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7837.quote: There is no avoiding war; it can only be postponed to the advantage of others.

7838.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7838.quote: The more sand has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.

7839.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7839.quote: Never was anything great achieved without danger.

7840.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7840.quote: Severities should be dealt out all at once, so that their suddenness may give less offense; benefits ought to be handed ought drop by drop, so that they may be relished the more.

7841.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7841.quote: A return to first principles in a republic is sometimes caused by the simple virtues of one man. His good example has such an influence that the good men strive to imitate him, and the wicked are ashamed to lead a life so contrary to his example.

7842.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7842.quote: Men rise from one ambition to another: first, they seek to secure themselves against attack, and then they attack others.

7843.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7843.quote: Men ought either to be indulged or utterly destroyed, for if you merely offend them they take vengeance, but if you injure them greatly they are unable to retaliate, so that the injury done to a man ought to be such that vengeance cannot be feared.

7844.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7844.quote: Of mankind we may say in general they are fickle, hypocritical, and greedy of gain.

7845.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7845.quote: One change always leaves the way open for the establishment of others.

7846.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7846.quote: Hatred is gained as much by good works as by evil.

7847.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7847.quote: He who wishes to be obeyed must know how to command.

7849.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7849.quote: Tardiness often robs us opportunity, and the dispatch of our forces.

7850.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7850.quote: A prince never lacks legitimate reasons to break his promise.

7851.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7851.quote: Men should be either treated generously or destroyed, because they take revenge for slight injuries - for heavy ones they cannot.

7852.author: Niccolo Machiavelli
7852.quote: It is much more secure to be feared than to be loved.

7853.author: Nikola Tesla
7853.quote: It is paradoxical, yet true, to say, that the more we know, the more ignorant we become in the absolute sense, for it is only through enlightenment that we become conscious of our limitations. Precisely one of the most gratifying results of intellectual evolution is the continuous opening up of new and greater prospects.

7854.author: Nikola Tesla
7854.quote: Every living being is an engine geared to the wheelwork of the universe. Though seemingly affected only by its immediate surrounding, the sphere of external influence extends to infinite distance.

7855.author: Nikola Tesla
7855.quote: Today's scientists have substituted mathematics for experiments, and they wander off through equation after equation, and eventually build a structure which has no relation to reality.

7856.author: Nikola Tesla
7856.quote: We have soon to have everywhere smoke annihilators, dust absorbers, ozonizers, sterilizers of water, air, food and clothing, and accident preventers on streets, elevated roads and in subways. It will become next to impossible to contract disease germs or get hurt in the city, and country folk will got to town to rest and get well.

7857.author: Nikola Tesla
7857.quote: The human being is a self-propelled automaton entirely under the control of external influences. Willful and predetermined though they appear, his actions are governed not from within, but from without. He is like a float tossed about by the waves of a turbulent sea.

7858.author: Nikola Tesla
7858.quote: Let the future tell the truth, and evaluate each one according to his work and accomplishments. The present is theirs; the future, for which I have really worked, is mine.

7859.author: Nikola Tesla
7859.quote: Our virtues and our failings are inseparable, like force and matter. When they separate, man is no more.

7860.author: Nikola Tesla
7860.quote: In the twenty-first century, the robot will take the place which slave labor occupied in ancient civilization.

7861.author: Nikola Tesla
7861.quote: I do not think there is any thrill that can go through the human heart like that felt by the inventor as he sees some creation of the brain unfolding to success... such emotions make a man forget food, sleep, friends, love, everything.

7862.author: Nikola Tesla
7862.quote: The year 2100 will see eugenics universally established. In past ages, the law governing the survival of the fittest roughly weeded out the less desirable strains. Then man's new sense of pity began to interfere with the ruthless workings of nature. As a result, we continue to keep alive and to breed the unfit.

7863.author: Nikola Tesla
7863.quote: The scientists of today think deeply instead of clearly. One must be sane to think clearly, but one can think deeply and be quite insane.

7864.author: Nikola Tesla
7864.quote: With ideas it is like with dizzy heights you climb: At first they cause you discomfort and you are anxious to get down, distrustful of your own powers; but soon the remoteness of the turmoil of life and the inspiring influence of the altitude calm your blood; your step gets firm and sure and you begin to look - for dizzier heights.

7865.author: Nikola Tesla
7865.quote: In a time not distant, it will be possible to flash any image formed in thought on a screen and render it visible at any place desired. The perfection of this means of reading thought will create a revolution for the better in all our social relations.

7866.author: Nikola Tesla
7866.quote: By an irony of fate, my first employment was as a draughtsman. I hated drawing; it was for me the very worst of annoyances. Fortunately, it was not long before I secured the position I sought, that of chief electrician to the telephone company.

7867.author: Nikola Tesla
7867.quote: Electrical science has revealed to us the true nature of light, has provided us with innumerable appliances and instruments of precision, and has thereby vastly added to the exactness of our knowledge.

7868.author: Nikola Tesla
7868.quote: It seems that I have always been ahead of my time. I had to wait nineteen years before Niagara was harnessed by my system, fifteen years before the basic inventions for wireless which I gave to the world in 1893 were applied universally.

7869.author: Nikola Tesla
7869.quote: The history of science shows that theories are perishable. With every new truth that is revealed we get a better understanding of Nature and our conceptions and views are modified.

7870.author: Nikola Tesla
7870.quote: Electrical science has disclosed to us the more intimate relation existing between widely different forces and phenomena and has thus led us to a more complete comprehension of Nature and its many manifestations to our senses.

7871.author: Nikola Tesla
7871.quote: The trend of opinion among eugenists is that we must make marriage more difficult. Certainly no one who is not a desirable parent should be permitted to produce progeny.

7872.author: Nikola Tesla
7872.quote: I do not think you can name many great inventions that have been made by married men.

7873.author: Nikola Tesla
7873.quote: There is no doubt that some plant food, such as oatmeal, is more economical than meat, and superior to it in regard to both mechanical and mental performance. Such food, moreover, taxes our digestive organs decidedly less, and, in making us more contented and sociable, produces an amount of good difficult to estimate.

7874.author: Nikola Tesla
7874.quote: The scientific man does not aim at an immediate result. He does not expect that his advanced ideas will be readily taken up. His work is like that of the planter - for the future. His duty is to lay the foundation for those who are to come, and point the way.

7875.author: Nikola Tesla
7875.quote: I myself eschew all stimulants. I also practically abstain from meat.

7876.author: Nikola Tesla
7876.quote: I constructed a laboratory in the neighborhood of Pike's Peak. The conditions in the pure air of the Colorado Mountains proved extremely favorable for my experiments, and the results were most gratifying to me.

7877.author: Nikola Tesla
7877.quote: The feeling is constantly growing on me that I had been the first to hear the greeting of one planet to another.

7878.author: Nikola Tesla
7878.quote: There is no conflict between the ideal of religion and the ideal of science, but science is opposed to theological dogmas because science is founded on fact. To me, the universe is simply a great machine which never came into being and never will end. The human being is no exception to the natural order. Man, like the universe, is a machine.

7880.author: Noam Chomsky
7880.quote: If we choose, we can live in a world of comforting illusion.

7881.author: Noam Chomsky
7881.quote: The Iraq War was the first conflict in western history in which an imperialist war was massively protested against before it had even been launched.

7882.author: Noam Chomsky
7882.quote: If we don't believe in freedom of expression for people we despise, we don't believe in it at all.

7883.author: Noam Chomsky
7883.quote: The internet could be a very positive step towards education, organisation and participation in a meaningful society.

7884.author: Noam Chomsky
7884.quote: Two days after the Boston marathon bombings, there was a drone strike in Yemen attacking a peaceful village, which killed a target who could very easily have been apprehended. But, of course, it is just easier to terrorise people. The drones are a terrorist weapon; they not only kill targets but also terrorise other people.

7885.author: Noam Chomsky
7885.quote: There are very few people who are going to look into the mirror and say, 'That person I see is a savage monster;' instead, they make up some construction that justifies what they do.

7886.author: Noam Chomsky
7886.quote: There are two problems for our species' survival - nuclear war and environmental catastrophe - and we're hurtling towards them. Knowingly.

7887.author: Noam Chomsky
7887.quote: Changes and progress very rarely are gifts from above. They come out of struggles from below.

7888.author: Noam Chomsky
7888.quote: The more you can increase fear of drugs and crime, welfare mothers, immigrants and aliens, the more you control all the people.

7889.author: Noam Chomsky
7889.quote: With the development of industrial capitalism, a new and unanticipated system of injustice, it is libertarian socialism that has preserved and extended the radical humanist message of the Enlightenment and the classical liberal ideals that were perverted into an ideology to sustain the emerging social order.

7890.author: Noam Chomsky
7890.quote: I like the cold weather. It means you get work done.

7891.author: Noam Chomsky
7891.quote: All over the place, from the popular culture to the propaganda system, there is constant pressure to make people feel that they are helpless, that the only role they can have is to ratify decisions and to consume.

7892.author: Noam Chomsky
7892.quote: I have known people who are working class or craftsmen, who happen to be more intellectual than professors.

7893.author: Noam Chomsky
7893.quote: Some of the most moving experiences I've had are just in black churches in the South, during the Civil Rights Movement, where people were getting beaten, killed, really struggling for the most elementary rights.

7894.author: Noam Chomsky
7894.quote: Colombia has been the leading western recipient of U.S. arms and training as violence has grown through the '90s.

7895.author: Noam Chomsky
7895.quote: Everybody's worried about stopping terrorism. Well, there's a really easy way: stop participating in it.

7896.author: Noam Chomsky
7896.quote: Nationalism has a way of oppressing others.

7897.author: Noam Chomsky
7897.quote: Some may remember, if you have good memories, that there used to be a concept in Anglo-American law called a presumption of innocence, innocent until proven guilty in a court of law. Now that's so deep in history that there's no point even bringing it up, but it did once exist.

7898.author: Noam Chomsky
7898.quote: It is easier to go to the Internet than to go to the library, undoubtedly. But the shift from no libraries to the existence of libraries was a much greater shift than what we've seen with the Internet's development.

7899.author: Noam Chomsky
7899.quote: Concentration of wealth yields concentration of political power. And concentration of political power gives rise to legislation that increases and accelerates the cycle.

7900.author: Noam Chomsky
7900.quote: There's a lot of fuss on the Left about election irregularities, like, you know, the voting machines were tampered with, they didn't count the votes right, and so on. That's all accurate and of some importance, but of far more importance is the fact that elections just don't take place, not in any meaningful sense of the term 'election.'

7901.author: Noam Chomsky
7901.quote: The process of shaping opinion, attitudes, and perceptions was termed the 'engineering of consent' by one of the founders of the modern public relations industry, Edward Bernays.

7902.author: Noam Chomsky
7902.quote: I stated that Hiroshima and Nagasaki are 'among the most unspeakable crimes in history.' I took no position on just where they stand on the scale of horrors relative to Auschwitz, the bombing of Chungking, Lidice, and so on.

7903.author: Noam Chomsky
7903.quote: The major advances in speed of communication and ability to interact took place more than a century ago. The shift from sailing ships to telegraph was far more radical than that from telephone to email!

7904.author: Noam Chomsky
7904.quote: Significant anniversaries are solemnly commemorated - Japan's attack on the U.S. naval base at Pearl Harbor, for example.

7905.author: Norman Cousins
7905.quote: Death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside us while we live.

7906.author: Norman Cousins
7906.quote: The eternal quest of the individual human being is to shatter his loneliness.

7907.author: Norman Cousins
7907.quote: Hearty laughter is a good way to jog internally without having to go outdoors.

7908.author: Norman Cousins
7908.quote: Wisdom consists of the anticipation of consequences.

7909.author: Norman Cousins
7909.quote: A library is the delivery room for the birth of ideas, a place where history comes to life.

7910.author: Norman Cousins
7910.quote: If something comes to life in others because of you, then you have made an approach to immortality.

7911.author: Norman Cousins
7911.quote: History is a vast early warning system.

7912.author: Norman Cousins
7912.quote: The human body experiences a powerful gravitational pull in the direction of hope. That is why the patient's hopes are the physician's secret weapon. They are the hidden ingredients in any prescription.

7913.author: Norman Cousins
7913.quote: It makes little difference how many university courses or degrees a person may own. If he cannot use words to move an idea from one point to another, his education is incomplete.

7914.author: Norman Cousins
7914.quote: Life is an adventure in forgiveness.

7915.author: Norman Cousins
7915.quote: Your heaviest artillery will be your will to live. Keep that big gun going.

7916.author: Norman Cousins
7916.quote: People are never more insecure than when they become obsessed with their fears at the expense of their dreams.

7917.author: Norman Cousins
7917.quote: The tragedy of life is in what dies inside a man while he lives - the death of genuine feeling, the death of inspired response, the awareness that makes it possible to feel the pain or the glory of other men in yourself.

7918.author: Norman Cousins
7918.quote: The capacity for hope is the most significant fact of life. It provides human beings with a sense of destination and the energy to get started.

7920.author: Norman Cousins
7920.quote: He who keeps his cool best wins.

7921.author: Norman Cousins
7921.quote: Optimism doesn't wait on facts. It deals with prospects. Pessimism is a waste of time.

7922.author: Norman Cousins
7922.quote: A library, to modify the famous metaphor of Socrates, should be the delivery room for the birth of ideas - a place where history comes to life.

7923.author: Norman Cousins
7923.quote: My reason nourishes my faith and my faith my reason.

7925.author: Norman Cousins
7925.quote: If the United Nations is to survive, those who represent it must bolster it; those who advocate it must submit to it; and those who believe in it must fight for it.

7926.author: Norman Cousins
7926.quote: Man is not imprisoned by habit. Great changes in him can be wrought by crisis - once that crisis can be recognized and understood.

7927.author: Norman Cousins
7927.quote: The main failure of education is that it has not prepared people to comprehend matters concerning human destiny.

7928.author: Norman Cousins
7928.quote: Hope is independent of the apparatus of logic.

7929.author: Norman Cousins
7929.quote: A book is like a piece of rope; it takes on meaning only in connection with the things it holds together.

7930.author: Norman Cousins
7930.quote: Respect for the fragility and importance of an individual life is still the mark of an educated man.

7931.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7931.quote: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.

7932.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7932.quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.

7933.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7933.quote: Christmas waves a magic wand over this world, and behold, everything is softer and more beautiful.

7934.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7934.quote: The trouble with most of us is that we would rather be ruined by praise than saved by criticism.

7935.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7935.quote: Four things for success: work and pray, think and believe.

7936.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7936.quote: It's always too early to quit.

7937.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7937.quote: There is a real magic in enthusiasm. It spells the difference between mediocrity and accomplishment.

7938.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7938.quote: Watch your manner of speech if you wish to develop a peaceful state of mind. Start each day by affirming peaceful, contented and happy attitudes and your days will tend to be pleasant and successful.

7939.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7939.quote: We struggle with the complexities and avoid the simplicities.

7940.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7940.quote: Action is a great restorer and builder of confidence. Inaction is not only the result, but the cause, of fear. Perhaps the action you take will be successful; perhaps different action or adjustments will have to follow. But any action is better than no action at all.

7941.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7941.quote: Repetition of the same thought or physical action develops into a habit which, repeated frequently enough, becomes an automatic reflex.

7942.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7942.quote: Stand up to your obstacles and do something about them. You will find that they haven't half the strength you think they have.

7943.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7943.quote: Imagination is the true magic carpet.

7944.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7944.quote: If you paint in your mind a picture of bright and happy expectations, you put yourself into a condition conducive to your goal.

7945.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7945.quote: Every problem has in it the seeds of its own solution. If you don't have any problems, you don't get any seeds.

7946.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7946.quote: Empty pockets never held anyone back. Only empty heads and empty hearts can do that.

7947.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7947.quote: Part of the happiness of life consists not in fighting battles, but in avoiding them. A masterly retreat is in itself a victory.

7948.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7948.quote: The life of inner peace, being harmonious and without stress, is the easiest type of existence.

7949.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7949.quote: Getting people to like you is merely the other side of liking them.

7950.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7950.quote: Formulate and stamp indelibly on your mind a mental picture of yourself as succeeding. Hold this picture tenaciously. Never permit it to fade. Your mind will seek to develop the picture... Do not build up obstacles in your imagination.

7951.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7951.quote: Be interesting, be enthusiastic... and don't talk too much.

7952.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7952.quote: If you have zest and enthusiasm you attract zest and enthusiasm. Life does give back in kind.

7953.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7953.quote: One of the greatest moments in anybody's developing experience is when he no longer tries to hide from himself but determines to get acquainted with himself as he really is.

7954.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7954.quote: Any fact facing us is not as important as our attitude toward it, for that determines our success or failure. The way you think about a fact may defeat you before you ever do anything about it. You are overcome by the fact because you think you are.

7955.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7955.quote: It is of practical value to learn to like yourself. Since you must spend so much time with yourself you might as well get some satisfaction out of the relationship.

7956.author: Norman Vincent Peale
7956.quote: The Gateway to Christianity is not through an intricate labyrinth of dogma, but by a simple belief in the person of Christ.

7957.author: Og Mandino
7957.quote: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.

7958.author: Og Mandino
7958.quote: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.

7959.author: Og Mandino
7959.quote: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.

7960.author: Og Mandino
7960.quote: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Extend to them all the care, kindness and understanding you can muster, and do it with no thought of any reward. Your life will never be the same again.

7961.author: Og Mandino
7961.quote: Always render more and better service than is expected of you, no matter what your task may be.

7962.author: Og Mandino
7962.quote: Treasure the love you receive above all. It will survive long after your good health has vanished.

7963.author: Og Mandino
7963.quote: I am here for a purpose and that purpose is to grow into a mountain, not to shrink to a grain of sand. Henceforth will I apply ALL my efforts to become the highest mountain of all and I will strain my potential until it cries for mercy.

7964.author: Og Mandino
7964.quote: There is an immeasurable distance between late and too late.

7965.author: Og Mandino
7965.quote: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.

7966.author: Og Mandino
7966.quote: Take the attitude of a student, never be too big to ask questions, never know too much to learn something new.

7967.author: Og Mandino
7967.quote: Work as though you would live forever, and live as though you would die today. Go another mile!

7968.author: Og Mandino
7968.quote: To do anything truly worth doing, I must not stand back shivering and thinking of the cold and danger, but jump in with gusto and scramble through as well as I can.

7970.author: Og Mandino
7970.quote: Tomorrow is only found in the calendar of fools.

7971.author: Og Mandino
7971.quote: Obstacles are necessary for success because in selling, as in all careers of importance, victory comes only after many struggles and countless defeats.

7972.author: Og Mandino
7972.quote: I am rare, and there is value in all rarity; therefore, I am valuable.

7973.author: Og Mandino
7973.quote: One of the things is we tend to give up too soon. We get knocked down a couple of times, and we stay down. It's so important to get back up again.

7974.author: Og Mandino
7974.quote: You never know what events are going to transpire to get you home.

7975.author: Og Mandino
7975.quote: I seek constantly to improve my manners and graces, for they are the sugar to which all are attracted.

7976.author: Og Mandino
7976.quote: The person who knows one thing and does it better than anyone else, even if it only be the art of raising lentils, receives the crown he merits. If he raises all his energy to that end, he is a benefactor of mankind and its rewarded as such.

7977.author: Og Mandino
7977.quote: Sound character provides the power with which a person may ride the emergencies of life instead of being overwhelmed by them. Failure is... the highway to success.

7978.author: Og Mandino
7978.quote: The height of my goals will not hold me in awe, though I may stumble often before they are reached.

7979.author: Og Mandino
7979.quote: To be always intending to make a new and better life but never to find time to set about it is as to put off eating and drinking and sleeping from one day to the next until you're dead.

7980.author: Og Mandino
7980.quote: It is those who concentrates on but one thing at a time who advance in this world. The great man or woman is the one who never steps outside his or her specialty or foolishly dissipates his or her individuality.

7981.author: Og Mandino
7981.quote: I have never heard anything about the resolutions of the apostles, but a good deal about their acts.

7982.author: Og Mandino
7982.quote: I will form good habits and become their slave. And how will I accomplish this difficult feat? Through these scrolls it will be done, for each scroll contains a principle which will drive a bad habit from my life and replace it with one which will bring me closer to success.

7983.author: Omar Khayyam
7983.quote: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.

7984.author: Omar Khayyam
7984.quote: The Flower that once has blown forever dies.

7985.author: Omar Khayyam
7985.quote: A loaf of bread, a jug of wine, and thou.

7986.author: Omar Khayyam
7986.quote: The thoughtful soul to solitude retires.

7987.author: Omar Khayyam
7987.quote: When I want to understand what is happening today or try to decide what will happen tomorrow, I look back.

7988.author: Omar Khayyam
7988.quote: The moving finger writes, and having written moves on. Nor all thy piety nor all thy wit, can cancel half a line of it.

7989.author: Omar Khayyam
7989.quote: Living Life Tomorrow's fate, though thou be wise, Thou canst not tell nor yet surmise; Pass, therefore, not today in vain, For it will never come again.

7990.author: Omar Khayyam
7990.quote: Drink! for you know not whence you came nor why: drink! for you know not why you go, nor where.

7991.author: Omar Khayyam
7991.quote: A hair divides what is false and true.

7992.author: Omar Khayyam
7992.quote: Myself when young did eagerly frequent doctor and saint, and heard great argument about it and about: but evermore came out by the same door as in I went.

7993.author: Omar Khayyam
7993.quote: There was a door to which I found no key: There was the veil through which I might not see.

7994.author: Omar Khayyam
7994.quote: You know, my friends, with what a brave carouse I made a Second Marriage in my house; favored old barren reason from my bed, and took the daughter of the vine to spouse.

7995.author: Omar Khayyam
7995.quote: The Worldly Hope men set their Hearts upon Turns Ashes - or it prospers; and anon, Like Snow upon the Desert's dusty Face, Lighting a little hour or two - is gone.

7996.author: Oprah Winfrey
7996.quote: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough.

7997.author: Oprah Winfrey
7997.quote: The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams.

7998.author: Oprah Winfrey
7998.quote: Think like a queen. A queen is not afraid to fail. Failure is another steppingstone to greatness.

7999.author: Oprah Winfrey
7999.quote: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.

8000.author: Oprah Winfrey
8000.quote: Passion is energy. Feel the power that comes from focusing on what excites you.

8001.author: Oprah Winfrey
8001.quote: I still have my feet on the ground, I just wear better shoes.

8002.author: Oprah Winfrey
8002.quote: You can either see yourself as a wave in the ocean or you can see yourself as the ocean.

8003.author: Oprah Winfrey
8003.quote: Where there is no struggle, there is no strength.

8004.author: Oprah Winfrey
8004.quote: Real integrity is doing the right thing, knowing that nobody's going to know whether you did it or not.

8005.author: Oprah Winfrey
8005.quote: Do the one thing you think you cannot do. Fail at it. Try again. Do better the second time. The only people who never tumble are those who never mount the high wire. This is your moment. Own it.

8006.author: Oprah Winfrey
8006.quote: Surround yourself with only people who are going to lift you higher.

8007.author: Oprah Winfrey
8007.quote: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.

8008.author: Oprah Winfrey
8008.quote: The challenge of life, I have found, is to build a resume that doesn't simply tell a story about what you want to be, but it's a story about who you want to be.

8009.author: Oprah Winfrey
8009.quote: Cheers to a new year and another chance for us to get it right.

8010.author: Oprah Winfrey
8010.quote: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change his future by merely changing his attitude.

8011.author: Oprah Winfrey
8011.quote: When I look into the future, it's so bright it burns my eyes.

8012.author: Oprah Winfrey
8012.quote: Understand that the right to choose your own path is a sacred privilege. Use it. Dwell in possibility.

8013.author: Oprah Winfrey
8013.quote: Being human means you will make mistakes. And you will make mistakes, because failure is God's way of moving you in another direction.

8014.author: Oprah Winfrey
8014.quote: Doing the best at this moment puts you in the best place for the next moment.

8015.author: Oprah Winfrey
8015.quote: You are responsible for the energy that you create for yourself, and you're responsible for the energy that you bring to others.

8016.author: Oprah Winfrey
8016.quote: If you want to feel good, you have to go out and do some good.

8017.author: Oprah Winfrey
8017.quote: Breathe. Let go. And remind yourself that this very moment is the only one you know you have for sure.

8019.author: Oprah Winfrey
8019.quote: I am a woman in process. I'm just trying like everybody else. I try to take every conflict, every experience, and learn from it. Life is never dull.

8020.author: Oprah Winfrey
8020.quote: The whole point of being alive is to evolve into the complete person you were intended to be.

8021.author: Oprah Winfrey
8021.quote: I don't think of myself as a poor deprived ghetto girl who made good. I think of myself as somebody who from an early age knew I was responsible for myself, and I had to make good.

8022.author: Orson Welles
8022.quote: We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.

8023.author: Orson Welles
8023.quote: Create your own visual style... let it be unique for yourself and yet identifiable for others.

8024.author: Orson Welles
8024.quote: If you want a happy ending, that depends, of course, on where you stop your story.

8026.author: Orson Welles
8026.quote: The best thing commercially, which is the worst artistically, by and large, is the most successful.

8027.author: Orson Welles
8027.quote: Nobody gets justice. People only get good luck or bad luck.

8028.author: Orson Welles
8028.quote: A film is never really good unless the camera is an eye in the head of a poet.

8029.author: Orson Welles
8029.quote: Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask what's for lunch.

8030.author: Orson Welles
8030.quote: I've spent most of my mature life trying to prove that I'm not irresponsible.

8031.author: Orson Welles
8031.quote: Race hate isn't human nature; race hate is the abandonment of human nature.

8032.author: Orson Welles
8032.quote: The enemy of art is the absence of limitations.

8033.author: Orson Welles
8033.quote: The classy gangster is a Hollywood invention.

8034.author: Orson Welles
8034.quote: The notion of directing a film is the invention of critics - the whole eloquence of cinema is achieved in the editing room.

8035.author: Orson Welles
8035.quote: I hate television. I hate it as much as peanuts. But I can't stop eating peanuts.

8036.author: Orson Welles
8036.quote: There's no biography so interesting as the one in which the biographer is present.

8037.author: Orson Welles
8037.quote: Living in the lap of luxury isn't bad except that you never know when luxury is going to stand up.

8038.author: Orson Welles
8038.quote: Fake is as old as the Eden tree.

8039.author: Orson Welles
8039.quote: If there hadn't been women we'd still be squatting in a cave eating raw meat, because we made civilization in order to impress our girlfriends.

8040.author: Orson Welles
8040.quote: I have the terrible feeling that, because I am wearing a white beard and am sitting in the back of the theatre, you expect me to tell you the truth about something. These are the cheap seats, not Mount Sinai.

8041.author: Orson Welles
8041.quote: Good evening, ladies and gentleman. My name is Orson Welles. I am an actor. I am a writer. I am a producer. I am a director. I am a magician. I appear onstage and on the radio. Why are there so many of me and so few of you?

8042.author: Orson Welles
8042.quote: Everything about me is a contradiction, and so is everything about everybody else. We are made out of oppositions; we live between two poles. There's a philistine and an aesthete in all of us, and a murderer and a saint. You don't reconcile the poles. You just recognize them.

8043.author: Orson Welles
8043.quote: They teach anything in universities today. You can major in mud pies.

8044.author: Orson Welles
8044.quote: My mother and father were both much more remarkable than any story of mine can make them. They seem to me just mythically wonderful.

8045.author: Orson Welles
8045.quote: When you are down and out something always turns up - and it is usually the noses of your friends.

8046.author: Orson Welles
8046.quote: If I ever own a restaurant, I will never allow the waiters to ask if the diners like their dishes. Particularly when they're talking.

8047.author: Orson Welles
8047.quote: As a producer, sitting on the other side of the desk, I have never once had an agent go out on a limb for his client and fight for him. I've never heard one say, 'No, just a minute! This is the actor you should use.' They will always say, 'You don't like him? I've got somebody else.' They're totally spineless.

8048.author: Oscar Wilde
8048.quote: Men always want to be a woman's first love - women like to be a man's last romance.

8049.author: Oscar Wilde
8049.quote: Success is a science; if you have the conditions, you get the result.

8050.author: Oscar Wilde
8050.quote: True friends stab you in the front.

8051.author: Oscar Wilde
8051.quote: Women are made to be loved, not understood.

8052.author: Oscar Wilde
8052.quote: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.

8053.author: Oscar Wilde
8053.quote: Memory... is the diary that we all carry about with us.

8054.author: Oscar Wilde
8054.quote: If you are not too long, I will wait here for you all my life.

8055.author: Oscar Wilde
8055.quote: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.

8056.author: Oscar Wilde
8056.quote: A gentleman is one who never hurts anyone's feelings unintentionally.

8057.author: Oscar Wilde
8057.quote: No better way is there to learn to love Nature than to understand Art. It dignifies every flower of the field. And, the boy who sees the thing of beauty which a bird on the wing becomes when transferred to wood or canvas will probably not throw the customary stone.

8058.author: Oscar Wilde
8058.quote: Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people whom we personally dislike.

8059.author: Oscar Wilde
8059.quote: I can resist everything except temptation.

8060.author: Oscar Wilde
8060.quote: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.

8061.author: Oscar Wilde
8061.quote: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.

8062.author: Oscar Wilde
8062.quote: A dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world.

8063.author: Oscar Wilde
8063.quote: This suspense is terrible. I hope it will last.

8064.author: Oscar Wilde
8064.quote: Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.

8065.author: Oscar Wilde
8065.quote: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.

8066.author: Oscar Wilde
8066.quote: To expect the unexpected shows a thoroughly modern intellect.

8067.author: Oscar Wilde
8067.quote: Beauty is the only thing that time cannot harm. Philosophies fall away like sand, creeds follow one another, but what is beautiful is a joy for all seasons, a possession for all eternity.

8068.author: Oscar Wilde
8068.quote: Ambition is the last refuge of the failure.

8069.author: Oscar Wilde
8069.quote: Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live.

8070.author: Oscar Wilde
8070.quote: The only thing to do with good advice is to pass it on. It is never of any use to oneself.

8071.author: Oscar Wilde
8071.quote: Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation.

8072.author: Oscar Wilde
8072.quote: The true mystery of the world is the visible, not the invisible.

8073.author: Oscar Wilde
8073.quote: The only difference between the saint and the sinner is that every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future.

8074.author: Pablo Picasso
8074.quote: The purpose of art is washing the dust of daily life off our souls.

8075.author: Pablo Picasso
8075.quote: All children are artists. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.

8076.author: Pablo Picasso
8076.quote: Who sees the human face correctly: the photographer, the mirror, or the painter?

8077.author: Pablo Picasso
8077.quote: Some painters transform the sun into a yellow spot, others transform a yellow spot into the sun.

8078.author: Pablo Picasso
8078.quote: It takes a long time to become young.

8079.author: Pablo Picasso
8079.quote: Colors, like features, follow the changes of the emotions.

8081.author: Pablo Picasso
8081.quote: Painting is just another way of keeping a diary.

8082.author: Pablo Picasso
8082.quote: Our goals can only be reached through a vehicle of a plan, in which we must fervently believe, and upon which we must vigorously act. There is no other route to success.

8083.author: Pablo Picasso
8083.quote: I am always doing that which I cannot do, in order that I may learn how to do it.

8084.author: Pablo Picasso
8084.quote: Everything you can imagine is real.

8085.author: Pablo Picasso
8085.quote: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.

8086.author: Pablo Picasso
8086.quote: Every act of creation is first an act of destruction.

8087.author: Pablo Picasso
8087.quote: The artist is a receptacle for emotions that come from all over the place: from the sky, from the earth, from a scrap of paper, from a passing shape, from a spider's web.

8088.author: Pablo Picasso
8088.quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once we grow up.

8089.author: Pablo Picasso
8089.quote: Sculpture is the art of the intelligence.

8090.author: Pablo Picasso
8090.quote: Good artists copy, great artists steal.

8091.author: Pablo Picasso
8091.quote: There is no abstract art. You must always start with something. Afterward you can remove all traces of reality.

8092.author: Pablo Picasso
8092.quote: Every positive value has its price in negative terms... the genius of Einstein leads to Hiroshima.

8093.author: Pablo Picasso
8093.quote: Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.

8094.author: Pablo Picasso
8094.quote: God is really only another artist. He invented the giraffe, the elephant and the cat. He has no real style, He just goes on trying other things.

8095.author: Pablo Picasso
8095.quote: I paint objects as I think them, not as I see them.

8096.author: Pablo Picasso
8096.quote: When you start with a portrait and search for a pure form, a clear volume, through successive eliminations, you arrive inevitably at the egg. Likewise, starting with the egg and following the same process in reverse, one finishes with the portrait.

8097.author: Pablo Picasso
8097.quote: One does a whole painting for one peach and people think just the opposite - that particular peach is but a detail.

8098.author: Pablo Picasso
8098.quote: Art is a lie that makes us realize truth.

8099.author: Pablo Picasso
8099.quote: Painting is a blind man's profession. He paints not what he sees, but what he feels, what he tells himself about what he has seen.

8100.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8100.quote: Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts.

8101.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8101.quote: There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness, thinking of others first; when you learn to live for others, they will live for you.

8102.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8102.quote: Remain calm, serene, always in command of yourself. You will then find out how easy it is to get along.

8103.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8103.quote: The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success.

8104.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8104.quote: All honest work is good work; it is capable of leading to self-development, provided the doer seeks to discover the inherent lessons and makes the most of the potentialities for such growth.

8105.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8105.quote: Ignoring all prejudices of caste, creed, class, color, sex, or race, a swami follows the precepts of human brotherhood. His goal is absolute unity with Spirit.

8106.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8106.quote: This life is not man's own show; if he becomes personally and emotionally involved in the very complicated cosmic drama, he reaps inevitable suffering for having distorted the divine 'plot.'

8107.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8107.quote: Introspection, or 'sitting in the silence,' is an unscientific way of trying to force apart the mind and senses, tied together by the life force. The contemplative mind, attempting its return to divinity, is constantly dragged back toward the senses by the life currents.

8108.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8108.quote: Yoga is a method for restraining the natural turbulence of thoughts, which otherwise impartially prevent all men, of all lands, from glimpsing their true nature of Spirit. Yoga cannot know a barrier of East and West any more than does the healing and equitable light of the sun.

8109.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8109.quote: The physical ego, the active consciousness in man, should uplift its body-identified self into unity with the soul, its true nature; it should not allow itself to remain mired in the lowly delusive strata of the senses and material entanglement.

8110.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8110.quote: When your mind is fully withdrawn in superconsciousness, it becomes centered in the bliss of the spine. You are then in your ideational, or causal, body. That is the level of the soul.

8111.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8111.quote: It is wisest to be impartial. If you have health, but are attached to it, you will always be afraid of losing it. And if you fear that loss, but become ill, you will suffer. Why not remain forever joyful in the Self?

8112.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8112.quote: Only the wise know just where predestination ends and free will begins. Meanwhile, you must keep on doing your best, according to your own clearest understanding. you must long for freedom as the drowning man longs for air. Without sincere longing, you will never find God.

8113.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8113.quote: The happiness of one's own heart alone cannot satisfy the soul; one must try to include, as necessary to one's own happiness, the happiness of others.

8114.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8114.quote: No one can be a yogi, maintaining a state of mental equilibrium, free from inner involvement in planned desireful activities, unless he has renounced identification with his ego and its unsatisfiable lust for the fruits of actions.

8115.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8115.quote: Man is important in one sense only. He was made in the image of God: That is his importance. He is not important for his body, ego, or personality. His constant affirmation of ego-consciousness is the source of all his problems.

8116.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8116.quote: Many great works of art, poetry, and music are inspired by astral memories. The desire to do noble, beautiful things here on Earth is also often a carryover of astral experiences between a person's earth lives.

8117.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8117.quote: Careless indifference and bodily restlessness in meditation cause negative vibrations.

8118.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8118.quote: Cosmic energy enters the body through the medulla and then passes to the cerebrum, in which it is stored or concentrated.

8119.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8119.quote: Whoever comes to me finds me a mirror to whatever is in his heart. Thus, I try to help him to see qualities in himself that he needs to overcome.

8120.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8120.quote: My keen love of travel was seldom hindered by Father. He permitted me, even as a mere boy, to visit many cities and pilgrimage spots.

8121.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8121.quote: When the yogi starts to meditate, he must leave behind all sensory thoughts and all longings for possessions by quieting the waves of feeling (chitta), and the mental restlessness that arises therefrom, through the application of techniques that reinstate the controlling power of the untrammeled superconsciousness of the soul.

8122.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8122.quote: As often as you fail, get up and try again. God will never let you down, so long as you don't let Him down, and so long as you make the effort.

8123.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8123.quote: Everything, at first, is an idea, a special creation.

8124.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8124.quote: The man who has perceived God looks upon all types of men as dream motion-picture images, made of the relativities of the light of Cosmic Consciousness and the shadows of delusion.

8125.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
8125.quote: The Creator, in taking infinite pains to shroud with mystery His presence in every atom of creation, could have had but one motive - a sensitive desire that men seek Him only through free will.

8126.author: Paris Hilton
8126.quote: The only rule is don't be boring and dress cute wherever you go. Life is too short to blend in.

8127.author: Paris Hilton
8127.quote: No matter what a woman looks like, if she's confident, she's sexy.

8128.author: Paris Hilton
8128.quote: Some girls are just born with glitter in their veins.

8129.author: Paris Hilton
8129.quote: Some people change when they think they're a star or something.

8130.author: Paris Hilton
8130.quote: I think it's important for girls to be confident. Believe in yourself and... everybody's hot.

8131.author: Paris Hilton
8131.quote: The way I see it, you should live everyday like its your birthday.

8132.author: Paris Hilton
8132.quote: There's nobody in the world like me. I think every decade has an iconic blonde, like Marilyn Monroe or Princess Diana and, right now, I'm that icon.

8133.author: Paris Hilton
8133.quote: Every woman should have four pets in her life. A mink in her closet, a jaguar in her garage, a tiger in her bed, and a jackass who pays for everything.

8134.author: Paris Hilton
8134.quote: I hate the taste of alcohol. When I'm drinking, I'm drinking Red Bull.

8135.author: Paris Hilton
8135.quote: First I wanted to be a veterinarian. And then I realized you had to give them shots to put them to sleep, so I decided I'd just buy a bunch of animals and have them in my house instead.

8136.author: Paris Hilton
8136.quote: Life is too short to blend in.

8137.author: Paris Hilton
8137.quote: I'm blonde and tanned and normal-sized! I'm sweet, shy, funny, have a big heart and I'm nice - and I like to eat.

8138.author: Paris Hilton
8138.quote: I don't really think, I just walk.

8139.author: Paris Hilton
8139.quote: I get half a million just to show up at parties. My life is, like, really, really fun.

8140.author: Paris Hilton
8140.quote: I'd imagine my wedding as a fairy tale... huge, beautiful and white.

8141.author: Paris Hilton
8141.quote: This is Earth. Isn't it hot?

8143.author: Paris Hilton
8143.quote: I always knew I had a voice and I've always known I could sing, but I was too shy to let it come out. I think it's the hardest thing to do, to sing in front of people. When I finally let go and did it, I realized it's what I'm most talented at and what I love to do the most.

8144.author: Paris Hilton
8144.quote: I take my dog Tinkerbell seriously. I take my job seriously. But I don't take myself all that seriously.

8145.author: Paris Hilton
8145.quote: Wal-mart... do they like make walls there?

8146.author: Paris Hilton
8146.quote: I really don't like going out anymore. I used to love it, but now it's not fun. I'd rather have friends come over and hot have to worry about crazy people taking pictures.

8147.author: Paris Hilton
8147.quote: I don't think there's ever been anyone like me that's lasted. And I'm going to keep on lasting.

8148.author: Paris Hilton
