8148.quote: My mom decorated with lots of antiques. I never liked it when I was a little girl - I wanted to live in a modern house. But now I love it.

8149.author: Paris Hilton
8149.quote: I don't want to be known as the granddaughter of the Hiltons. I want to be known as Paris.

8150.author: Paris Hilton
8150.quote: Being grown up and in a serious relationship, I've learned so much. I'm happier than I've every been.

8151.author: Paris Hilton
8151.quote: Everything I do is blown out of proportion. It really hurts my feelings.

8152.author: Paulo Coelho
8152.quote: I have seen many storms in my life. Most storms have caught me by surprise, so I had to learn very quickly to look further and understand that I am not capable of controlling the weather, to exercise the art of patience and to respect the fury of nature.

8153.author: Paulo Coelho
8153.quote: Life was always a matter of waiting for the right moment to act.

8154.author: Paulo Coelho
8154.quote: Remember your dreams and fight for them. You must know what you want from life. There is just one thing that makes your dream become impossible: the fear of failure.

8155.author: Paulo Coelho
8155.quote: Be brave. Take risks. Nothing can substitute experience.

8156.author: Paulo Coelho
8156.quote: No one can lie, no one can hide anything, when he looks directly into someone's eyes.

8157.author: Paulo Coelho
8157.quote: Culture makes people understand each other better. And if they understand each other better in their soul, it is easier to overcome the economic and political barriers. But first they have to understand that their neighbour is, in the end, just like them, with the same problems, the same questions.

8158.author: Paulo Coelho
8158.quote: Waiting is painful. Forgetting is painful. But not knowing which to do is the worse kind of suffering.

8159.author: Paulo Coelho
8159.quote: When you are enthusiastic about what you do, you feel this positive energy. It's very simple.

8160.author: Paulo Coelho
8160.quote: I can control my destiny, but not my fate. Destiny means there are opportunities to turn right or left, but fate is a one-way street. I believe we all have the choice as to whether we fulfil our destiny, but our fate is sealed.

8161.author: Paulo Coelho
8161.quote: You have to take risks. We will only understand the miracle of life fully when we allow the unexpected to happen.

8162.author: Paulo Coelho
8162.quote: When you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.

8163.author: Paulo Coelho
8163.quote: I cry very easily. It can be a movie, a phone conversation, a sunset - tears are words waiting to be written.

8164.author: Paulo Coelho
8164.quote: Love is a trap. When it appears, we see only its light, not its shadows.

8165.author: Paulo Coelho
8165.quote: You drown not by falling into a river, but by staying submerged in it.

8166.author: Paulo Coelho
8166.quote: One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving.

8167.author: Paulo Coelho
8167.quote: Elegance is usually confused with superficiality, fashion, lack of depth. This is a serious mistake: human beings need to have elegance in their actions and in their posture because this word is synonymous with good taste, amiability, equilibrium and harmony.

8168.author: Paulo Coelho
8168.quote: The more violent the storm, the quicker it passes.

8169.author: Paulo Coelho
8169.quote: Elegance is achieved when all that is superfluous has been discarded and the human being discovers simplicity and concentration: the simpler and more sober the posture, the more beautiful it will be.

8170.author: Paulo Coelho
8170.quote: Every blessing ignored becomes a curse.

8171.author: Paulo Coelho
8171.quote: The more in harmony with yourself you are, the more joyful you are and the more faithful you are. Faith is not to disconnect you from reality - it connects you to reality.

8172.author: Paulo Coelho
8172.quote: What I can say is that all my characters are searching for their souls, because they are my mirrors. I'm someone who is constantly trying to understand my place in the world, and literature is the best way that I found in order to see myself.

8173.author: Paulo Coelho
8173.quote: Writing means sharing. It's part of the human condition to want to share things - thoughts, ideas, opinions.

8174.author: Paulo Coelho
8174.quote: My literature is much more the result of a paradox than that of an implacable logic, typical of police novels. The paradox is the tension that exists in my soul.

8175.author: Paulo Coelho
8175.quote: The good old days, when each idea had an owner, are gone forever.

8176.author: Paulo Coelho
8176.quote: You can become blind by seeing each day as a similar one. Each day is a different one, each day brings a miracle of its own. It's just a matter of paying attention to this miracle.

8177.author: Paulo Coelho
8177.quote: We have lost contact with reality, the simplicity of life.

8178.author: Pele
8178.quote: Success is no accident. It is hard work, perseverance, learning, studying, sacrifice and most of all, love of what you are doing or learning to do.

8179.author: Pele
8179.quote: Enthusiasm is everything. It must be taut and vibrating like a guitar string.

8180.author: Pele
8180.quote: A lot of people, when a guy scores a lot of goals, think, 'He's a great player', because a goal is very important, but a great player is a player who can do everything on the field. He can do assists, encourage his colleagues, give them confidence to go forward. It is someone who, when a team does not do well, becomes one of the leaders.

8182.author: Pele
8182.quote: I always had a philosophy which I got from my father. He used to say, 'Listen. God gave to you the gift to play football. This is your gift from God. If you take care of your health, if you are in good shape all the time, with your gift from God no one will stop you, but you must be prepared.'

8183.author: Pele
8183.quote: You must respect people and work hard to be in shape. And I used to train very hard. When the others players went to the beach after training, I was there kicking the ball.

8184.author: Pele
8184.quote: The first World Cup I remember was in the 1950 when I was 9 or 10 years old. My father was a soccer player, and there was a big party, and when Brazil lost to Uruguay, I saw my father crying.

8185.author: Pele
8185.quote: Wherever you go, there are three icons that everyone knows: Jesus Christ, Pele and Coca-Cola.

8186.author: Pele
8186.quote: If you don't give education to people, it is easy to manipulate them.

8187.author: Pele
8187.quote: I am constantly being asked about individuals. The only way to win is as a team. Football is not about one or two or three star players.

8188.author: Pele
8188.quote: I don't think I'm a very good businessman. I act too much with my heart.

8189.author: Pele
8189.quote: Brazil eats, sleeps and drinks football. It lives football!

8190.author: Pele
8190.quote: Everything on earth is a game. A passing thing. We all end up dead. We all end up the same, don't we?

8191.author: Pele
8191.quote: A penalty is a cowardly way to score.

8192.author: Pele
8192.quote: If I pass away one day, I am happy because I tried to do my best. My sport allowed me to do so much because it's the biggest sport in the world.

8193.author: Pele
8193.quote: When you are young, you do a lot of stupid things.

8194.author: Pele
8194.quote: I have to trust something that gives me power; I have to believe in something, but in my career I have a lot of moments I cannot explain with God.

8195.author: Pele
8195.quote: When you play against dirty players or very tough players, it's easy to escape because you know what they're going to do. But when the player is tough but intelligent, it's much more difficult.

8196.author: Pele
8196.quote: Of course, my father was a soccer player. He used to play very good. Then, when I was young, eight or nine years old, ten years old, I just want to be like my father.

8197.author: Pele
8197.quote: I was really proud that I was named after Thomas Edison and wanted to be called Edson. I thought Pele sounded horrible. It was a rubbish name. Edson sounded so much more serious and important.

8198.author: Pele
8198.quote: The World Cup is a very complicated tournament - six games, seven if you make it to the final - and maybe if you lose one game you're out, even if you're the best.

8199.author: Pele
8199.quote: The level of football in England is the top. English football is the leader in the world.

8200.author: Pele
8200.quote: The bicycle kick is not easy to do.

8201.author: Pele
8201.quote: I represent Brazil all over the world. Wherever I go I have to do my best, to not disappoint the Brazilian people. And that I've done.

8202.author: Pele
8202.quote: I always think that I would have become an actor if I hadn't been a soccer player.

8203.author: Pele
8203.quote: To be a striker you need to be in good shape.

8204.author: Peter Drucker
8204.quote: The most important thing in communication is hearing what isn't said.

8205.author: Peter Drucker
8205.quote: Management is doing things right; leadership is doing the right things.

8206.author: Peter Drucker
8206.quote: The best way to predict the future is to create it.

8207.author: Peter Drucker
8207.quote: Rank does not confer privilege or give power. It imposes responsibility.

8208.author: Peter Drucker
8208.quote: Unless commitment is made, there are only promises and hopes... but no plans.

8209.author: Peter Drucker
8209.quote: Efficiency is doing things right; effectiveness is doing the right things.

8210.author: Peter Drucker
8210.quote: The entrepreneur always searches for change, responds to it, and exploits it as an opportunity.

8211.author: Peter Drucker
8211.quote: The aim of marketing is to know and understand the customer so well the product or service fits him and sells itself.

8212.author: Peter Drucker
8212.quote: Follow effective action with quiet reflection. From the quiet reflection will come even more effective action.

8213.author: Peter Drucker
8213.quote: The only thing we know about the future is that it will be different.

8214.author: Peter Drucker
8214.quote: Knowledge has to be improved, challenged, and increased constantly, or it vanishes.

8215.author: Peter Drucker
8215.quote: There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all.

8216.author: Peter Drucker
8216.quote: Effective leadership is not about making speeches or being liked; leadership is defined by results not attributes.

8217.author: Peter Drucker
8217.quote: Never mind your happiness; do your duty.

8218.author: Peter Drucker
8218.quote: Most of what we call management consists of making it difficult for people to get their work done.

8219.author: Peter Drucker
8219.quote: Innovation is the specific instrument of entrepreneurship. The act that endows resources with a new capacity to create wealth.

8220.author: Peter Drucker
8220.quote: My greatest strength as a consultant is to be ignorant and ask a few questions.

8221.author: Peter Drucker
8221.quote: The new information technology... Internet and e-mail... have practically eliminated the physical costs of communications.

8222.author: Peter Drucker
8222.quote: We now accept the fact that learning is a lifelong process of keeping abreast of change. And the most pressing task is to teach people how to learn.

8223.author: Peter Drucker
8223.quote: No institution can possibly survive if it needs geniuses or supermen to manage it. It must be organized in such a way as to be able to get along under a leadership composed of average human beings.

8224.author: Peter Drucker
8224.quote: Trying to predict the future is like trying to drive down a country road at night with no lights while looking out the back window.

8225.author: Peter Drucker
8225.quote: When a subject becomes totally obsolete we make it a required course.

8226.author: Peter Drucker
8226.quote: So much of what we call management consists in making it difficult for people to work.

8227.author: Peter Drucker
8227.quote: Time is the scarcest resource and unless it is managed nothing else can be managed.

8228.author: Peter Drucker
8228.quote: Checking the results of a decision against its expectations shows executives what their strengths are, where they need to improve, and where they lack knowledge or information.

8229.author: Peter Drucker
8229.quote: The productivity of work is not the responsibility of the worker but of the manager.

8230.author: Philip Green
8230.quote: It's all about quality of life and finding a happy balance between work and friends and family.

8231.author: Philip Green
8231.quote: Good, bad or indifferent, if you are not investing in new technology, you are going to be left behind.

8232.author: Philip Green
8232.quote: I am a positive thinker. You have to have this positive energy to get somewhere.

8233.author: Philip Green
8233.quote: You've got to love what you do to really make things happen.

8234.author: Philip Green
8234.quote: People are always going to go shopping. A lot of our effort is just: 'How do we make the retail experience a great one?'

8235.author: Philip Green
8235.quote: It's not my style to blame anybody else.

8236.author: Philip Green
8236.quote: I am brave, but I take a view. It is an educated view. I am careful. I am not reckless.

8237.author: Philip Green
8237.quote: When I am driving my car down the street, I try not to go down the potholes.

8238.author: Philip Green
8238.quote: I don't regret anything I haven't done.

8239.author: Philip Green
8239.quote: I could spend my life having meetings, a meeting to have another meeting, a hundred meetings to have another thousand meetings. It's not what I'm about. I don't want to have to get in a queue; that's not how I like to live.

8240.author: Philip Green
8240.quote: They already know all about brands... but what 16- and 17-year-olds won't necessarily have is experience of the world of work. The more that businesses get involved with schools, the better, because businesses sometimes complain that students don't have what they require to succeed in work.

8241.author: Philip Green
8241.quote: When I've had a talk with someone, I like them to leave unconfused. No need for contention.

8242.author: Philip Green
8242.quote: I think I pick more winners than losers.

8243.author: Philip Green
8243.quote: I used to leave my house at 6:30 in the morning, and I would visit 10 shops every Saturday, starting at the furthest shop I'd decided to go to that day, ending up in Oxford Street 12 hours later.

8244.author: Philip Green
8244.quote: You are forced to have the best data capture, the best information, when you have goods in hundreds of factories around the world, and the question is: 'Where is everything?' And how do you bring it all together?

8245.author: Philip Green
8245.quote: If I say I'm going to do something, I do it.

8247.author: Philip Green
8247.quote: Arcadia was a typical venture capital deal, but I'm the adventurer and the capitalist.

8248.author: Philip Green
8248.quote: I could have closed down bits of British Home Stores to make more money but it's not my style. I want to make my money as a retailer, not by putting people out of work.

8249.author: Philip Green
8249.quote: I'm in the retail business, not the circus business.

8250.author: Philip Green
8250.quote: You're going to find England, unfortunately, is a place where you get a lot of jealous, envious, you know, negative people. That's how it is.

8251.author: Philip Green
8251.quote: On what possible basis would I want to stop someone from buying BHS if I had tried to save it?

8252.author: Philip Green
8252.quote: I sometimes think less is more. If you cut yourself in too many places, it is hard to execute.

8253.author: Philip Green
8253.quote: I was never going to be a scholar.

8254.author: Philip Green
8254.quote: I don't think there's anyone who can be unaware of the relevance of Kate Moss, the effect that she's had on the fashion industry.

8255.author: Philip Green
8255.quote: I don't like department stores. I had a chain of department stores back in 1994 which was Lewis's and Owen Owen, only for a short time, and I found department stores personally difficult.

8256.author: Phyllis Diller
8256.quote: A smile is a curve that sets everything straight.

8257.author: Phyllis Diller
8257.quote: Never go to bed mad. Stay up and fight.

8258.author: Phyllis Diller
8258.quote: My cooking is so bad my kids thought Thanksgiving was to commemorate Pearl Harbor.

8259.author: Phyllis Diller
8259.quote: Housework can't kill you, but why take a chance?

8260.author: Phyllis Diller
8260.quote: Aim high, and you won't shoot your foot off.

8261.author: Phyllis Diller
8261.quote: My recipe for dealing with anger and frustration: set the kitchen timer for twenty minutes, cry, rant, and rave, and at the sound of the bell, simmer down and go about business as usual.

8262.author: Phyllis Diller
8262.quote: You know you're old when someone compliments you on your alligator shoes, and you're barefoot.

8263.author: Phyllis Diller
8263.quote: We spend the first twelve months of our children's lives teaching them to walk and talk and the next twelve telling them to sit down and shut up.

8264.author: Phyllis Diller
8264.quote: I buried a lot of my ironing in the back yard.

8265.author: Phyllis Diller
8265.quote: You know you're old if they have discontinued your blood type.

8266.author: Phyllis Diller
8266.quote: Burt Reynolds once asked me out. I was in his room.

8267.author: Phyllis Diller
8267.quote: I admit, I have a tremendous sex drive. My boyfriend lives forty miles away.

8268.author: Phyllis Diller
8268.quote: My own laugh is the real thing and I've had it all my life.

8269.author: Phyllis Diller
8269.quote: Best way to get rid of kitchen odors: Eat out.

8270.author: Phyllis Diller
8270.quote: There's so little money in my bank account, my scenic checks show a ghetto.

8271.author: Phyllis Diller
8271.quote: I asked the waiter, 'Is this milk fresh?' He said, 'Lady, three hours ago it was grass.'

8272.author: Phyllis Diller
8272.quote: You know you're old if your walker has an airbag.

8273.author: Phyllis Diller
8273.quote: My photographs don't do me justice - they just look like me.

8274.author: Phyllis Diller
8274.quote: The only time I ever enjoyed ironing was the day I accidentally got gin in the steam iron.

8275.author: Phyllis Diller
8275.quote: Whatever you may look like, marry a man your own age - as your beauty fades, so will his eyesight.

8276.author: Phyllis Diller
8276.quote: I've been asked to say a couple of words about my husband, Fang. How about short and cheap?

8277.author: Phyllis Diller
8277.quote: Cleaning your house while your kids are still growing up is like shoveling the walk before it stops snowing.

8278.author: Phyllis Diller
8278.quote: The reason women don't play football is because 11 of them would never wear the same outfit in public.

8279.author: Phyllis Diller
8279.quote: If it weren't for baseball, many kids wouldn't know what a millionaire looked like.

8280.author: Phyllis Diller
8280.quote: A bachelor is a guy who never made the same mistake once.

8281.author: Phyllis Diller
8281.quote: His finest hour lasted a minute and a half.

8282.author: Plato
8282.quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; Fools because they have to say something.

8283.author: Plato
8283.quote: Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge.

8284.author: Plato
8284.quote: Music is the movement of sound to reach the soul for the education of its virtue.

8285.author: Plato
8285.quote: A good decision is based on knowledge and not on numbers.

8286.author: Plato
8286.quote: Courage is knowing what not to fear.

8287.author: Plato
8287.quote: Music is a moral law. It gives soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination, and charm and gaiety to life and to everything.

8288.author: Plato
8288.quote: Opinion is the medium between knowledge and ignorance.

8289.author: Plato
8289.quote: The beginning is the most important part of the work.

8290.author: Plato
8290.quote: Let parents bequeath to their children not riches, but the spirit of reverence.

8291.author: Plato
8291.quote: Thinking: the talking of the soul with itself.

8292.author: Plato
8292.quote: A hero is born among a hundred, a wise man is found among a thousand, but an accomplished one might not be found even among a hundred thousand men.

8293.author: Plato
8293.quote: People are like dirt. They can either nourish you and help you grow as a person or they can stunt your growth and make you wilt and die.

8294.author: Plato
8294.quote: Good people do not need laws to tell them to act responsibly, while bad people will find a way around the laws.

8295.author: Plato
8295.quote: Ignorance, the root and stem of all evil.

8296.author: Plato
8296.quote: Every heart sings a song, incomplete, until another heart whispers back. Those who wish to sing always find a song. At the touch of a lover, everyone becomes a poet.

8297.author: Plato
8297.quote: Rhetoric is the art of ruling the minds of men.

8298.author: Plato
8298.quote: Love is a serious mental disease.

8299.author: Plato
8299.quote: Dictatorship naturally arises out of democracy, and the most aggravated form of tyranny and slavery out of the most extreme liberty.

8300.author: Plato
8300.quote: This City is what it is because our citizens are what they are.

8301.author: Plato
8301.quote: If a man neglects education, he walks lame to the end of his life.

8302.author: Plato
8302.quote: For a man to conquer himself is the first and noblest of all victories.

8303.author: Plato
8303.quote: Better a little which is well done, than a great deal imperfectly.

8304.author: Plato
8304.quote: No law or ordinance is mightier than understanding.

8305.author: Plato
8305.quote: The direction in which education starts a man will determine his future in life.

8306.author: Plato
8306.quote: Life must be lived as play.

8307.author: Plato
8307.quote: All men are by nature equal, made all of the same earth by one Workman; and however we deceive ourselves, as dear unto God is the poor peasant as the mighty prince.

8308.author: Pope Francis
8308.quote: Christmas is joy, religious joy, an inner joy of light and peace.

8309.author: Pope Francis
8309.quote: Life is a journey. When we stop, things don't go right.

8310.author: Pope Francis
8310.quote: Abortion isn't a lesser evil, it's a crime. Taking one life to save another, that's what the Mafia does. It's a crime. It's an absolute evil.

8311.author: Pope Francis
8311.quote: A little bit of mercy makes the world less cold and more just.

8312.author: Pope Francis
8312.quote: Each of us has a vision of good and of evil. We have to encourage people to move towards what they think is good... Everyone has his own idea of good and evil and must choose to follow the good and fight evil as he conceives them. That would be enough to make the world a better place.

8313.author: Pope Francis
8313.quote: Human rights are not only violated by terrorism, repression or assassination, but also by unfair economic structures that creates huge inequalities.

8314.author: Pope Francis
8314.quote: God never gives someone a gift they are not capable of receiving. If he gives us the gift of Christmas, it is because we all have the ability to understand and receive it.

8315.author: Pope Francis
8315.quote: From my point of view, God is the light that illuminates the darkness, even if it does not dissolve it, and a spark of divine light is within each of us.

8316.author: Pope Francis
8316.quote: Although the life of a person is in a land full of thorns and weeds, there is always a space in which the good seed can grow. You have to trust God.

8317.author: Pope Francis
8317.quote: This is important: to get to know people, listen, expand the circle of ideas. The world is crisscrossed by roads that come closer together and move apart, but the important thing is that they lead towards the Good.

8318.author: Pope Francis
8318.quote: A person who thinks only about building walls, wherever they may be, and not building bridges is not Christian. This is not in the Gospel.

8319.author: Pope Francis
8319.quote: We must restore hope to young people, help the old, be open to the future, spread love. Be poor among the poor. We need to include the excluded and preach peace.

8320.author: Pope Francis
8320.quote: Grace is not part of consciousness; it is the amount of light in our souls, not knowledge nor reason.

8321.author: Pope Francis
8321.quote: Every man, every woman who has to take up the service of government, must ask themselves two questions: 'Do I love my people in order to serve them better? Am I humble and do I listen to everybody, to diverse opinions in order to choose the best path?' If you don't ask those questions, your governance will not be good.

8322.author: Pope Francis
8322.quote: The Church is or should go back to being a community of God's people, and priests, pastors and bishops, who have the care of souls, are at the service of the people of God.

8323.author: Pope Francis
8323.quote: Truth, according to the Christian faith, is God's love for us in Jesus Christ. Therefore, truth is a relationship.

8324.author: Pope Francis
8324.quote: If someone is gay and he searches for the Lord and has good will, who am I to judge? We shouldn't marginalise people for this. They must be integrated into society.

8325.author: Pope Francis
8325.quote: We have observed that, in society and the world in which we live, selfishness has increased more than love for others, and that men of good will must work, each with his own strengths and expertise, to ensure that love for others increases until it is equal and possibly exceeds love for oneself.

8326.author: Pope Francis
8326.quote: My choices, including those related to the day-to-day aspects of life, like the use of a modest car, are related to a spiritual discernment that responds to a need that arises from looking at things, at people and from reading the signs of the times. Discernment in the Lord guides me in my way of governing.

8327.author: Pope Francis
8327.quote: Money has to serve, not to rule.

8328.author: Pope Francis
8328.quote: You cannot be in a position of power and destroy the life of another person.

8329.author: Pope Francis
8329.quote: Together with a culture of work, there must be a culture of leisure as gratification. To put it another way: people who work must take the time to relax, to be with their families, to enjoy themselves, read, listen to music, play a sport.

8330.author: Pope Francis
8330.quote: Among us, who is above must be in service of the others. This doesn't mean we have to wash each other's feet every day, but we must help one another.

8331.author: Pope Francis
8331.quote: The Son of God became incarnate in the souls of men to instill the feeling of brotherhood. All are brothers and all children of God.

8332.author: Pope Francis
8332.quote: There is a need for financial reform along ethical lines that would produce in its turn an economic reform to benefit everyone. This would nevertheless require a courageous change of attitude on the part of political leaders.

8333.author: Pope Francis
8333.quote: The worship of the golden calf of old has found a new and heartless image in the cult of money and the dictatorship of an economy which is faceless and lacking any truly human goal.

8334.author: Post Malone
8334.quote: I like to be quiet and play guitar and just chill.

8335.author: Post Malone
8335.quote: You just got with the flow because life is just all about how you feel.

8336.author: Post Malone
8336.quote: In order to find yourself, who you really are, you got to be with yourself; you got to hang out with yourself.

8337.author: Post Malone
8337.quote: There's always gonna be setbacks; there's always gonna be knockdowns. There's always gonna be people telling you, 'Hey, you suck!'

8338.author: Post Malone
8338.quote: I started making music... I guess I was 12, and I started playing 'Guitar Hero.' And you know, it got to a point where on expert, you can only exceed to a certain point. And so, you know, I was like, 'Let's play real guitar. Let's not waste more time.' So, I got my mom, I told her to buy me a guitar for Christmas, and I started making music then.

8339.author: Post Malone
8339.quote: I'm just myself. That's the best way to put it.

8340.author: Post Malone
8340.quote: If you like something, rock it. If you want to rock a cape every day, go for it.

8341.author: Post Malone
8341.quote: Miami is always super, duper lit.

8342.author: Post Malone
8342.quote: I'm trying to bring a little bit of every type of sauce into one type of sound. Something that's really fresh.

8343.author: Post Malone
8343.quote: In New York, my dad raised me to listen to everything like hip-hop, rock and country music. When I moved to Dallas, I started listening to whatever I wanted to listen to.

8344.author: Post Malone
8344.quote: I'm just trying to make music everybody can get happy to and vibe to and turn up to. So long as I keep making good music, everything's going to be OK.

8345.author: Post Malone
8345.quote: I'm hungry. I'm ready to grow.

8346.author: Post Malone
8346.quote: All my dance moves are improv. I just make them up on the spot.

8347.author: Post Malone
8347.quote: I don't know what people think of me.

8348.author: Post Malone
8348.quote: Hip-hop and country aren't too far different: They got shiny suits and the boots and the guitars with their names on it. I was infatuated with that type of stuff.

8349.author: Post Malone
8349.quote: I'm not worried about making a certain type of music or sticking to one type of music.

8350.author: Post Malone
8350.quote: I might wear skinny pants one day; I might wear thrift shop pants the next day.

8352.author: Post Malone
8352.quote: It's not normal for a white guy to get corn rows; a lot of people judged me. I like the way it looks, so you have to be confident.

8353.author: Post Malone
8353.quote: Once you have an established song, you can really come out of your shell and experiment with the sound you want to make.

8354.author: Post Malone
8354.quote: I didn't have no friends or nothing; I was a nerdy kid.

8355.author: Post Malone
8355.quote: You can't get tired in the studio. It's really tough. But you just gotta keep on going.

8356.author: Post Malone
8356.quote: My dad was always playing music. Not, like, playing music but listening to music.

8358.author: Post Malone
8358.quote: I'm trying to make music that I like, and I love hip-hop. At the same time, I love guitar. I love rock and everything.

8359.author: Post Malone
8359.quote: I am just creating the music I enjoy to make, and people seem to enjoy it.

8360.author: Prince
8360.quote: Every day I feel is a blessing from God. And I consider it a new beginning. Yeah, everything is beautiful.

8361.author: Prince
8361.quote: I like constructive criticism from smart people.

8362.author: Prince
8362.quote: There's a dark side to everything.

8363.author: Prince
8363.quote: Art is about building a new foundation, not just laying something on top of what's already there.

8364.author: Prince
8364.quote: No one can come and claim ownership of my work. I am the creator of it, and it lives within me.

8365.author: Prince
8365.quote: Sometimes ideas are coming so fast that I have to stop doing one song to get another. But I don't forget the first one. If it works, it will always be there. It's like the truth: it will find you and lift you up. And if it ain't right, it will dissolve like sand on the beach.

8367.author: Prince
8367.quote: People say I'm wearing heels because I'm short. I wear heels because the women like 'em.

8368.author: Prince
8368.quote: Too much freedom can lead to the soul's decay.

8369.author: Prince
8369.quote: Technology is cool, but you've got to use it as opposed to letting it use you.

8370.author: Prince
8370.quote: Well, my musicians are my friends.

8371.author: Prince
8371.quote: Hip-hop is very diverse, but if you only focus on one aspect of it, then what you get is this image of Black America that is completely contrary to what actually goes on.

8372.author: Prince
8372.quote: When you sit down to write something, there should be no guidelines. The main idea is not supposed to be, 'How many different ways can we sell it?' That's so far away from the true spirit of what music is.

8374.author: Prince
8374.quote: Oh, I love critics. Because they love me. It's not a joke. They care.

8375.author: Prince
8375.quote: Despite everything, no one can dictate who you are to other people.

8376.author: Prince
8376.quote: YouTube is the hippest network, and they abuse copyright right and left.

8377.author: Prince
8377.quote: You can always tell when the groove is working or not.

8378.author: Prince
8378.quote: I've always understood the two to be intertwined: sexuality and spirituality. That never changed.

8379.author: Prince
8379.quote: My father left his piano at the house when he left, and I wasn't allowed to play it when he was there because I wasn't as good as him. So when he left, I was determined to get as good as him, and I taught myself how to play music, and I just stuck with it, and I did it all the time.

8380.author: Prince
8380.quote: The music industry is a matrix that is counter to what is natural and right.

8381.author: Prince
8381.quote: It's fun being in Islamic countries, to know there's only one religion. There's order. You wear a burqa. There's no choice. People are happy with that.

8382.author: Prince
8382.quote: I don't talk to old people; they try to find ways to stay static. Young folks are the ones with the ideas and constantly moving forward.

8383.author: Prince
8383.quote: I learned from Jimi Hendrix. They all wanted him to do the tricks, and at the end of his career, he just wanted to play. I lived longer than he did, and I can see how those pressures can really play with your head.

8385.author: Prince
8385.quote: When everyone recognizes Jehovah's name, then everyone will be happy because everyone will know what to do and how to do it.

8386.author: Quincy Jones
8386.quote: Every day, my daddy told me the same thing. 'Once a task is just begun, never leave it till it's done. Be the labour great or small, do it well or not at all.'

8387.author: Quincy Jones
8387.quote: I tell my kids and I tell proteges, always have humility when you create and grace when you succeed, because it's not about you. You are a terminal for a higher power. As soon as you accept that, you can do it forever.

8388.author: Quincy Jones
8388.quote: I guess hip-hop has been closer to the pulse of the streets than any music we've had in a long time. It's sociology as well as music, which is in keeping with the tradition of black music in America.

8389.author: Quincy Jones
8389.quote: I have all the tools and gadgets. I tell my son, who's a producer, 'You never work for the machine; the machine works for you.'

8390.author: Quincy Jones
8390.quote: Without the Fender bass, there'd be no rock n' roll or no Motown. The electric guitar had been waiting 'round since 1939 for a nice partner to come along. It became an electric rhythm section, and that changed everything.

8391.author: Quincy Jones
8391.quote: Cherish your mistakes, and you won't keep making them over and over again. It's the same with heartbreaks and girls and everything else. Cherish them, and they'll put some wealth in you.

8392.author: Quincy Jones
8392.quote: Imagine what a harmonious world it could be if every single person, both young and old shared a little of what he is good at doing.

8393.author: Quincy Jones
8393.quote: You make your mistakes to learn how to get to the good stuff.

8394.author: Quincy Jones
8394.quote: I was reading Omar Khayyam, Kahlil Gibran, Rumi, L. Ron Hubbard, all sorts of philosophy. Bebop cats are like that. Curious. I wanted to know about everything.

8395.author: Quincy Jones
8395.quote: I was raised in Chicago and I guess that was one of the special breeding grounds for gangsters of all colors. That was the Detroit of the gangster world. The car industry was thugs.

8396.author: Quincy Jones
8396.quote: I don't ever want to grow up. That's boring.

8397.author: Quincy Jones
8397.quote: I only hope that one day, America will recognize what the rest of the world already has known, that our indigenous music - gospel, blues, jazz and R&B - is the heart and soul of all popular music; and that we cannot afford to let this legacy slip into obscurity, I'm telling you.

8398.author: Quincy Jones
8398.quote: We were in the heart of the ghetto in Chicago during the Depression, and every block - it was probably the biggest black ghetto in America - every block also is the spawning ground practically for every gangster, black and white, in America too.

8399.author: Quincy Jones
8399.quote: If architecture is frozen music then music must be liquid architecture.

8400.author: Quincy Jones
8400.quote: Melody is king, and don't you ever forget it. Lyrics appear to be out front, but they're not; they're just an accompanying factor. If they're good, you're really in good shape. Lyrics are written to be rewritten.

8401.author: Quincy Jones
8401.quote: I like all music. The only music I don't like is bad music.

8402.author: Quincy Jones
8402.quote: I found this out over the years, that racism is a thinly veiled disguise over economics and money. It really is.

8403.author: Quincy Jones
8403.quote: I never cared about money or fame, and I don't care now. I follow the groove, and money always follows.

8404.author: Quincy Jones
8404.quote: Few rappers realize the genre sprang from West African griots through Delta slave songs to jazz poetry and the comedic trash talk of 'the dozens.'

8405.author: Quincy Jones
8405.quote: I travel like a maniac. I travel more than anyone I know. I love learning the languages.

8406.author: Quincy Jones
8406.quote: I got in the school band and the school choir. It all hit me like a ton of bricks, everything just came out. I played percussion for a while, and stayed after school forever just tinkering around with different things, the clarinets and the violins.

8407.author: Quincy Jones
8407.quote: Bebop and hip-hop, in so many ways, they're connected. A lot of rappers remind me so much of bebop guys in terms of improvisation, beats and rhymes. My dream is to see hip-hop incorporated in education. You've got the youth of the world in the palm of your hand.

8408.author: Quincy Jones
8408.quote: I lost my mother when I was 7 and they put her in a mental hospital. My brother and I watched her being taken away in a strait jacket. That's something you never forget. And my stepmother was like in the movie 'Precious.' I couldn't handle it. So I said to myself, 'I don't have a mother. I don't need one. I'm going to let music be my mother.'

8409.author: Quincy Jones
8409.quote: I'm probably the only one in the world you can name that's worked with Billie Holiday, Louie Armstrong, Ella, Duke, Miles, Dizzy, Ray Charles, Aretha, Michael Jackson, rappers. 'Fly Me to the Moon' was played on the moon by Buzz Aldrin. Sinatra. Paul Simon. Tony Bennett. I'm the only one.

8410.author: Quincy Jones
8410.quote: A great song can make a terrible singer sound good, but a good singer - you put a great song on top of that, you're really in great shape!

8411.author: Quincy Jones
8411.quote: Everybody, no matter what vocation they're looking at, should add music as an essential to their curriculum. Music can be a very important part of your soul and your growth as a human being. It's so powerful.

8412.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8412.quote: You can't cross the sea merely by standing and staring at the water.

8413.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8413.quote: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.

8414.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8414.quote: Beauty is truth's smile when she beholds her own face in a perfect mirror.

8415.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8415.quote: Faith is the bird that feels the light when the dawn is still dark.

8416.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8416.quote: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.

8417.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8417.quote: By plucking her petals, you do not gather the beauty of the flower.

8418.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8418.quote: The butterfly counts not months but moments, and has time enough.

8419.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8419.quote: Depth of friendship does not depend on length of acquaintance.

8420.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8420.quote: Love does not claim possession, but gives freedom.

8421.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8421.quote: Death is not extinguishing the light; it is only putting out the lamp because the dawn has come.

8422.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8422.quote: Don't limit a child to your own learning, for he was born in another time.

8423.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8423.quote: Facts are many, but the truth is one.

8424.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8424.quote: Trees are the earth's endless effort to speak to the listening heaven.

8425.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8425.quote: Everything comes to us that belongs to us if we create the capacity to receive it.

8426.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8426.quote: Love is an endless mystery, for it has nothing else to explain it.

8427.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8427.quote: The highest education is that which does not merely give us information but makes our life in harmony with all existence.

8428.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8428.quote: Music fills the infinite between two souls.

8429.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8429.quote: The flower which is single need not envy the thorns that are numerous.

8430.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8430.quote: He who is too busy doing good finds no time to be good.

8431.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8431.quote: Let us not pray to be sheltered from dangers but to be fearless when facing them.

8432.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8432.quote: Every child comes with the message that God is not yet discouraged of man.

8433.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8433.quote: In Art, man reveals himself and not his objects.

8434.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8434.quote: I slept and dreamt that life was joy. I awoke and saw that life was service. I acted and behold, service was joy.

8435.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8435.quote: A mind all logic is like a knife all blade. It makes the hand bleed that uses it.

8436.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8436.quote: I have become my own version of an optimist. If I can't make it through one door, I'll go through another door - or I'll make a door. Something terrific will come no matter how dark the present.

8437.author: Rabindranath Tagore
8437.quote: If you shut the door to all errors, truth will be shut out.

8438.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8438.quote: And now we welcome the new year. Full of things that have never been.

8439.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8439.quote: The only journey is the one within.

8440.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8440.quote: I hold this to be the highest task for a bond between two people: that each protects the solitude of the other.

8441.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8441.quote: Once the realization is accepted that even between the closest human beings infinite distances continue, a wonderful living side by side can grow, if they succeed in loving the distance between them which makes it possible for each to see the other whole against the sky.

8442.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8442.quote: For one human being to love another; that is perhaps the most difficult of all our tasks, the ultimate, the last test and proof, the work for which all other work is but preparation.

8443.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8443.quote: This is the miracle that happens every time to those who really love: the more they give, the more they possess.

8444.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8444.quote: Live your questions now, and perhaps even without knowing it, you will live along some distant day into your answers.

8445.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8445.quote: Perhaps all the dragons of our lives are princesses who are only waiting to see us once beautiful and brave.

8446.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8446.quote: If your daily life seems poor, do not blame it; blame yourself that you are not poet enough to call forth its riches; for the Creator, there is no poverty.

8447.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8447.quote: Love consists in this, that two solitudes protect and touch and greet each other.

8448.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8448.quote: Let life happen to you. Believe me: life is in the right, always.

8449.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8449.quote: Everything is blooming most recklessly; if it were voices instead of colors, there would be an unbelievable shrieking into the heart of the night.

8450.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8450.quote: It is good to be solitary, for solitude is difficult; that something is difficult must be a reason the more for us to do it.

8451.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8451.quote: Perhaps everything terrible is in its deepest being something helpless that wants help from us.

8452.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8452.quote: All the soarings of my mind begin in my blood.

8453.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8453.quote: The deepest experience of the creator is feminine, for it is experience of receiving and bearing.

8454.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8454.quote: There are no classes in life for beginners; right away you are always asked to deal with what is most difficult.

8455.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8455.quote: Love is like the measles. The older you get it, the worse the attack.

8456.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8456.quote: The purpose of life is to be defeated by greater and greater things.

8457.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8457.quote: The future enters into us, in order to transform itself in us, long before it happens.

8458.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8458.quote: It is a tremendous act of violence to begin anything. I am not able to begin. I simply skip what should be the beginning.

8459.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8459.quote: A person isn't who they are during the last conversation you had with them - they're who they've been throughout your whole relationship.

8460.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8460.quote: No great art has ever been made without the artist having known danger.

8461.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8461.quote: Who has not sat before his own heart's curtain? It lifts: and the scenery is falling apart.

8462.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8462.quote: Surely all art is the result of one's having been in danger, of having gone through an experience all the way to the end, where no one can go any further.

8463.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
8463.quote: He reproduced himself with so much humble objectivity, with the unquestioning, matter of fact interest of a dog who sees himself in a mirror and thinks: there's another dog.

8464.author: Ralph Marston
8464.quote: Make it a habit to tell people thank you. To express your appreciation, sincerely and without the expectation of anything in return. Truly appreciate those around you, and you'll soon find many others around you. Truly appreciate life, and you'll find that you have more of it.

8465.author: Ralph Marston
8465.quote: What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.

8466.author: Ralph Marston
8466.quote: Excellence is not a skill, it's an attitude.

8467.author: Ralph Marston
8467.quote: Rest when you're weary. Refresh and renew yourself, your body, your mind, your spirit. Then get back to work.

8468.author: Ralph Marston
8468.quote: When was the last time you spent a quiet moment just doing nothing - just sitting and looking at the sea, or watching the wind blowing the tree limbs, or waves rippling on a pond, a flickering candle or children playing in the park?

8469.author: Ralph Marston
8469.quote: You've done it before and you can do it now. See the positive possibilities. Redirect the substantial energy of your frustration and turn it into positive, effective, unstoppable determination.

8470.author: Ralph Marston
8470.quote: Don't lower your expectations to meet your performance. Raise your level of performance to meet your expectations. Expect the best of yourself, and then do what is necessary to make it a reality.

8471.author: Ralph Marston
8471.quote: Your goals, minus your doubts, equal your reality.

8472.author: Ralph Marston
8472.quote: The keys to patience are acceptance and faith. Accept things as they are, and look realistically at the world around you. Have faith in yourself and in the direction you have chosen.

8473.author: Ralph Marston
8473.quote: Concern yourself more with accepting responsibility than with assigning blame. Let the possibilities inspire you more than the obstacles discourage you.

8474.author: Ralph Marston
8474.quote: Your destiny is to fulfill those things upon which you focus most intently. So choose to keep your focus on that which is truly magnificent, beautiful, uplifting and joyful. Your life is always moving toward something.

8475.author: Ralph Marston
8475.quote: Don't lower your expectations to meet your performance. Raise your level of performance to meet your expectations.

8476.author: Ralph Marston
8476.quote: If you so choose, even the unexpected setbacks can bring new and positive possibilities. If you so choose, you can find value and fulfillment in every circumstance.

8477.author: Ralph Marston
8477.quote: What if you gave someone a gift, and they neglected to thank you for it - would you be likely to give them another? Life is the same way. In order to attract more of the blessings that life has to offer, you must truly appreciate what you already have.

8478.author: Ralph Marston
8478.quote: Live your days on the positive side of life, in tune with your most treasured values. And in each moment you'll have much to live for.

8479.author: Ralph Marston
8479.quote: Enjoy doing nothing, and you can enjoy doing anything. Enjoy having nothing, and you can enjoy whatever you have.

8480.author: Ralph Marston
8480.quote: Welcome those big, sticky, complicated problems. In them are your most powerful opportunities.

8481.author: Ralph Marston
8481.quote: There are plenty of difficult obstacles in your path. Don't allow yourself to become one of them.

8482.author: Ralph Marston
8482.quote: Look up from what you're doing and look around for a minute. See what a beautiful world you're in.

8483.author: Ralph Marston
8483.quote: Put your energy into building what is creative, valuable and empowering. And you won't have to constantly fight against what is destructive and draining.

8484.author: Ralph Marston
8484.quote: If you so choose, each day can be filled with even more joy than the one before. If you so choose, even the most seemingly random events can work in your favor.

8485.author: Ralph Marston
8485.quote: Beset by a difficult problem? Now is your chance to shine. Pick yourself up, get to work and get triumphantly through it.

8486.author: Ralph Marston
8486.quote: Dare to visualize a world in which your most treasured dreams have become true.

8487.author: Ralph Marston
8487.quote: The more closely you get in touch with your dreams, the more able you are to make them real. The more vividly you consider how you want your world to be, the more real and effective tools you will have for making it so.

8488.author: Ralph Marston
8488.quote: If you so choose, the challenges can make you stronger. If you so choose, the disappointments can make you more determined.

8489.author: Ralph Marston
8489.quote: If you so choose, every mistake can lead to greater understanding and effectiveness. If you so choose, every frustration can help you to be more patient and more persistent.

8490.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8490.quote: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.

8491.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8491.quote: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.

8492.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8492.quote: Never lose an opportunity of seeing anything beautiful, for beauty is God's handwriting.

8493.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8493.quote: Nature always wears the colors of the spirit.

8494.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8494.quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.

8495.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8495.quote: Love of beauty is taste. The creation of beauty is art.

8496.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8496.quote: For every minute you remain angry, you give up sixty seconds of peace of mind.

8497.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8497.quote: You cannot do a kindness too soon, for you never know how soon it will be too late.

8498.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8498.quote: Character is higher than intellect. A great soul will be strong to live as well as think.

8499.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8499.quote: What lies behind you and what lies in front of you, pales in comparison to what lies inside of you.

8500.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8500.quote: The only way to have a friend is to be one.

8501.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8501.quote: The sky is the daily bread of the eyes.

8502.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8502.quote: Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year.

8503.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8503.quote: A hero is no braver than an ordinary man, but he is brave five minutes longer.

8504.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8504.quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.

8505.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8505.quote: Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss.

8506.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8506.quote: Once you make a decision, the universe conspires to make it happen.

8507.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8507.quote: Every particular in nature, a leaf, a drop, a crystal, a moment of time is related to the whole, and partakes of the perfection of the whole.

8509.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8509.quote: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.

8510.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8510.quote: Shallow men believe in luck. Strong men believe in cause and effect.

8511.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8511.quote: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.

8512.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8512.quote: Common sense is genius dressed in its working clothes.

8513.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8513.quote: In art, the hand can never execute anything higher than the heart can imagine.

8514.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8514.quote: We aim above the mark to hit the mark.

8515.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
8515.quote: People do not seem to realize that their opinion of the world is also a confession of character.

8516.author: Ray Bradbury
8516.quote: Jump, and you will find out how to unfold your wings as you fall.

8517.author: Ray Bradbury
8517.quote: You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them.

8518.author: Ray Bradbury
8518.quote: Living at risk is jumping off the cliff and building your wings on the way down.

8519.author: Ray Bradbury
8519.quote: I hate all politics. I don't like either political party. One should not belong to them - one should be an individual, standing in the middle. Anyone that belongs to a party stops thinking.

8520.author: Ray Bradbury
8520.quote: There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them.

8521.author: Ray Bradbury
8521.quote: You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you.

8522.author: Ray Bradbury
8522.quote: Video games are a waste of time for men with nothing else to do. Real brains don't do that.

8523.author: Ray Bradbury
8523.quote: If we listened to our intellect, we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go into business, because we'd be cynical. Well, that's nonsense. You've got to jump off cliffs all the time and build your wings on the way down.

8524.author: Ray Bradbury
8524.quote: We are cups, constantly and quietly being filled. The trick is, knowing how to tip ourselves over and let the beautiful stuff out.

8525.author: Ray Bradbury
8525.quote: Stuff your eyes with wonder, live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories.

8526.author: Ray Bradbury
8526.quote: In my later years, I have looked in the mirror each day and found a happy person staring back. Occasionally I wonder why I can be so happy. The answer is that every day of my life I've worked only for myself and for the joy that comes from writing and creating. The image in my mirror is not optimistic, but the result of optimal behavior.

8527.author: Ray Bradbury
8527.quote: After Hiroshima was bombed, I saw a photograph of the side of a house with the shadows of the people who had lived there burned into the wall from the intensity of the bomb. The people were gone, but their shadows remained.

8528.author: Ray Bradbury
8528.quote: I discovered me in the library. I went to find me in the library.

8529.author: Ray Bradbury
8529.quote: A book has got smell. A new book smells great. An old book smells even better. An old book smells like ancient Egypt.

8530.author: Ray Bradbury
8530.quote: Without libraries what have we? We have no past and no future.

8531.author: Ray Bradbury
8531.quote: Everything is generated through your own will power.

8532.author: Ray Bradbury
8532.quote: If you enjoy living, it is not difficult to keep the sense of wonder.

8533.author: Ray Bradbury
8533.quote: Don't think. Thinking is the enemy of creativity. It's self-conscious, and anything self-conscious is lousy. You can't try to do things. You simply must do things.

8534.author: Ray Bradbury
8534.quote: When I was seven or eight years old, I began to read the science-fiction magazines that were brought by guests into my grandparents' boarding house in Waukegan, Illinois. Those were the years when Hugo Gernsback was publishing 'Amazing Stories,' with vivid, appallingly imaginative cover paintings that fed my hungry imagination.

8535.author: Ray Bradbury
8535.quote: I don't try to describe the future. I try to prevent it.

8536.author: Ray Bradbury
8536.quote: It's not going to do any good to land on Mars if we're stupid.

8537.author: Ray Bradbury
8537.quote: Science fiction is any idea that occurs in the head and doesn't exist yet, but soon will, and will change everything for everybody, and nothing will ever be the same again. As soon as you have an idea that changes some small part of the world you are writing science fiction. It is always the art of the possible, never the impossible.

8538.author: Ray Bradbury
8538.quote: Ideas excite me, and as soon as I get excited, the adrenaline gets going and the next thing I know I'm borrowing energy from the ideas themselves.

8539.author: Ray Bradbury
8539.quote: Love. Fall in love and stay in love. Write only what you love, and love what you write. The key word is love. You have to get up in the morning and write something you love, something to live for.

8540.author: Ray Bradbury
8540.quote: Books are alive, you see. They're not dead, they're alive.

8541.author: Ray Bradbury
8541.quote: Journalism keeps you planted in the earth.

8542.author: Reba McEntire
8542.quote: To succeed in life, you need three things: a wishbone, a backbone and a funny bone.

8543.author: Reba McEntire
8543.quote: I have a lot to be thankful for. I am healthy, happy and I am loved.

8544.author: Reba McEntire
8544.quote: I don't think quantity time is as special as quality time with your family.

8545.author: Reba McEntire
8545.quote: All the money in the world can't buy you back good health.

8546.author: Reba McEntire
8546.quote: For me, singing sad songs often has a way of healing a situation. It gets the hurt out in the open into the light, out of the darkness.

8547.author: Reba McEntire
8547.quote: Be different, stand out, and work your butt off.

8548.author: Reba McEntire
8548.quote: A good song has to have a great melody, and the lyrics have to touch my heart. Now, if it's just a little toe-tapper, got to make me feel good somehow or another, or when I sing it I can't make you feel good.

8549.author: Reba McEntire
8549.quote: I just try not to judge. Don't judge me, and I won't judge you.

8550.author: Reba McEntire
8550.quote: I treat myself pretty good. I take lots of vacations, I eat well, I take supplements, I do mercury detox, I get plenty of sleep, I drink plenty of water and I stay away from drama and stress.

8551.author: Reba McEntire
8551.quote: Being a strong woman is very important to me. But doing it all on my own is not.

8552.author: Reba McEntire
8552.quote: The upside to anger? Getting it out of your system. You got to express your anger. Then you have room for more positive things. If I hold something in a long time, and then I speak it, it's amazing how the light shines so much brighter.

8553.author: Reba McEntire
8553.quote: My goals have changed throughout my life. At one time it was winning awards, selling out concert dates, selling more albums than anyone else. Now, my goals are to see my grandchildren grown, live a long and healthy life with my family and friends and travel the world.

8554.author: Reba McEntire
8554.quote: The biggest challenge in my life is getting all these kids raised. I've helped with nieces, stepchildren and my own son, so the biggest challenge is making sure the kids are raised and finding enough quality time with them.

8555.author: Reba McEntire
8555.quote: Everything I've done in my career is a result of growing up in rural Oklahoma, because if I hadn't had the training from Mama and Daddy to work hard, to do what I'm told, to take directions, to mind and to do a good job at anything I set out to do, then I wouldn't be where I am today.

8556.author: Reba McEntire
8556.quote: Waiting makes me restless. When I'm ready, I'm ready.

8557.author: Reba McEntire
8557.quote: You don't waste your entire life waiting to go back to dust.

8558.author: Reba McEntire
8558.quote: Besides, I'm a gypsy at heart and I like to travel around.

8559.author: Reba McEntire
8559.quote: I've never turned my back on country music.

8560.author: Reba McEntire
8560.quote: I have talked to Debbie Hammond quite a bit, Jim Hammond's wife, his widow. I've seen their kids. And last time we played Dallas, a lot of them came over. It's hard for them to come see the show. It's still hard.

8561.author: Reba McEntire
8561.quote: It's very important to surround yourself with people you can learn from.

8562.author: Reba McEntire
8562.quote: Never have doubted it, even when the plane crash happened. I wasn't mad at God. I just knew that there was a reason that I didn't know about why it happened.

8563.author: Reba McEntire
8563.quote: I had lots of breaks. I guess the one that got my foot in the door was singing the National Anthem at the National Finals Rodeo in Oklahoma City in '74.

8564.author: Reba McEntire
8564.quote: I'm open to any kind of situation in a song as long as it touches my heart.

8565.author: Reba McEntire
8565.quote: I grew up in southeastern Oklahoma on a working cattle ranch, and it was always very romantic to me: The West, the cowboy, the Western way of life.

8566.author: Reba McEntire
8566.quote: At this time when I turn 50, because so there's many of my friends and family who didn't get to see 50-years-old, and so, I'm celebrating for them too.

8567.author: Reba McEntire
8567.quote: Finding a good bus driver can be as important as finding a good musician.

8568.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8568.quote: God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.

8569.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8569.quote: God, give us grace to accept with serenity the things that cannot be changed, courage to change the things which should be changed and the wisdom to distinguish the one from the other.

8570.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8570.quote: Nothing we do, however virtuous, can be accomplished alone; therefore we are saved by love.

8571.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8571.quote: Forgiveness is the final form of love.

8572.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8572.quote: Goodness, armed with power, is corrupted; and pure love without power is destroyed.

8573.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8573.quote: Life is a battle between faith and reason in which each feeds upon the other, drawing sustenance from it and destroying it.

8574.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8574.quote: Man's capacity for justice makes democracy possible, but man's inclination to injustice makes democracy necessary.

8575.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8575.quote: The mastery of nature is vainly believed to be an adequate substitute for self mastery.

8576.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8576.quote: Democracies are indeed slow to make war, but once embarked upon a martial venture are equally slow to make peace and reluctant to make a tolerable, rather than a vindictive, peace.

8577.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8577.quote: Democracy is finding proximate solutions to insoluble problems.

8578.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8578.quote: There is no cure for the pride of a virtuous nation but pure religion.

8579.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8579.quote: There are historic situations in which refusal to defend the inheritance of a civilization, however imperfect, against tyranny and aggression may result in consequences even worse than war.

8580.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8580.quote: The final wisdom of life requires not the annulment of incongruity but the achievement of serenity within and above it.

8581.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8581.quote: The sad duty of politics is to establish justice in a sinful world.

8582.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8582.quote: Nothing that is worth doing can be achieved in a lifetime; therefore we must be saved by hope.

8583.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8583.quote: Our age knows nothing but reaction, and leaps from one extreme to another.

8584.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8584.quote: If we can find God only as he is revealed in nature we have no moral God.

8585.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8585.quote: Family life is too intimate to be preserved by the spirit of justice. It can be sustained by a spirit of love which goes beyond justice.

8586.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8586.quote: The tendency to claim God as an ally for our partisan value and ends is the source of all religious fanaticism.

8587.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8587.quote: Original sin is that thing about man which makes him capable of conceiving of his own perfection and incapable of achieving it.

8588.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8588.quote: Nothing which is true or beautiful or good makes complete sense in any immediate context of history; therefore we must be saved by faith.

8589.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8589.quote: If we survive danger it steels our courage more than anything else.

8590.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8590.quote: I think there ought to be a club in which preachers and journalists could come together and have the sentimentalism of the one matched with the cynicism of the other. That ought to bring them pretty close to the truth.

8591.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8591.quote: All human sin seems so much worse in its consequences than in its intentions.

8592.author: Reinhold Niebuhr
8592.quote: Evil is not to be traced back to the individual but to the collective behavior of humanity.

8593.author: Rem Koolhaas
8593.quote: Infrastructure is much more important than architecture.

8594.author: Rem Koolhaas
8594.quote: The acceptance of certain realities doesn't preclude idealism. It can lead to certain breakthroughs.

8595.author: Rem Koolhaas
8595.quote: It is not possible to live in this age if you don't have a sense of many contradictory forces.

8596.author: Rem Koolhaas
8596.quote: Architects work in two ways. One is to respond precisely to a client's needs or demands. Another is to look at what the client asks and reinterpret it.

8597.author: Rem Koolhaas
8597.quote: People can inhabit anything. And they can be miserable in anything and ecstatic in anything. More and more I think that architecture has nothing to do with it. Of course, that's both liberating and alarming.

8598.author: Rem Koolhaas
8598.quote: That has been my entire life story, running against the current and running with the current. Sometimes running with the current is underestimated.

8599.author: Rem Koolhaas
8599.quote: The areas of consensus shift unbelievably fast; the bubbles of certainty are constantly exploding.

8600.author: Rem Koolhaas
8600.quote: Designs are increasingly winning competitions because they are literally green, and because somewhere they feature a small windmill.

8601.author: Rem Koolhaas
8601.quote: We live in an almost perfect stillness and work with incredible urgency.

8602.author: Rem Koolhaas
8602.quote: Prada is extremely directed in terms of communicating what they like and what they don't like. That is actually extremely pleasant because it clarifies very easily what you can do and what you need to do.

8603.author: Rem Koolhaas
8603.quote: A building has at least two lives - the one imagined by its maker and the life it lives afterward - and they are never the same.

8604.author: Rem Koolhaas
8604.quote: When shopping was still connected to the street it was also an intensification and articulation of the street. Now it has become utterly independent - contained, controlled, surveyed.

8605.author: Rem Koolhaas
8605.quote: If you have this reputation you can sit back and endure it, or you can try to do things with it.

8606.author: Rem Koolhaas
8606.quote: Not many architects have the luxury to reject significant things.

8607.author: Rem Koolhaas
8607.quote: There's nothing Dutch about my architecture.

8608.author: Rem Koolhaas
8608.quote: One of our theories is that one can offset this excessive compulsion toward the spectacular with a return to simplicity.

8609.author: Rem Koolhaas
8609.quote: When air conditioning, escalators, and advertising appeared, shopping expanded its scale, but also limited its spontaneity. And it became much more predictable, almost scientific. What had once been the most surprising became the most manipulated.

8610.author: Rem Koolhaas
8610.quote: It's a weird city because the uglier the weather, the more beautiful the city. And the uglier the buildings, the more coherent the city.

8611.author: Rem Koolhaas
8611.quote: Our office acts like a kind of educational establishment and we are very careful who we educate.

8612.author: Rem Koolhaas
8612.quote: Influence is a very unpleasant subject and I deal with it in a maybe irresponsible way, which is to really ignore it. It would be a nightmare if we started to really think about it; it would tie our hands, it would tie everyone else's hands.

8613.author: Rem Koolhaas
8613.quote: The work in S, M, L, XL was almost suicidal. It required so much effort that our office almost went bankrupt.

8614.author: Rem Koolhaas
8614.quote: I think one of the important evolutions is that we no longer feel compulsively the need to argue, or to justify things on a kind of rational level. We are much more willing to admit that certain things are completely instinctive and others are really intellectual.

8615.author: Rem Koolhaas
8615.quote: Any architectural project we do takes at least four or five years, so increasingly there is a discrepancy between the acceleration of culture and the continuing slowness of architecture.

8616.author: Rem Koolhaas
8616.quote: Escape from the architecture ghetto is one of the major drivers and has been from the very beginning.

8617.author: Rem Koolhaas
8617.quote: The luxury of our position now is that we can almost assemble any team to address any issue.

8618.author: Rem Koolhaas
8618.quote: The great problem of the concert hall is that the shoebox is the ideal shape for acoustics but that no architect worth their names wants to build a shoebox.

8619.author: Rene Descartes
8619.quote: It is not enough to have a good mind; the main thing is to use it well.

8621.author: Rene Descartes
8621.quote: Divide each difficulty into as many parts as is feasible and necessary to resolve it.

8622.author: Rene Descartes
8622.quote: Perfect numbers like perfect men are very rare.

8623.author: Rene Descartes
8623.quote: If you would be a real seeker after truth, it is necessary that at least once in your life you doubt, as far as possible, all things.

8624.author: Rene Descartes
8624.quote: Whenever anyone has offended me, I try to raise my soul so high that the offense cannot reach it.

8625.author: Rene Descartes
8625.quote: In order to improve the mind, we ought less to learn, than to contemplate.

8626.author: Rene Descartes
8626.quote: The senses deceive from time to time, and it is prudent never to trust wholly those who have deceived us even once.

8627.author: Rene Descartes
8627.quote: The greatest minds are capable of the greatest vices as well as of the greatest virtues.

8628.author: Rene Descartes
8628.quote: Nothing is more fairly distributed than common sense: no one thinks he needs more of it than he already has.

8629.author: Rene Descartes
8629.quote: A state is better governed which has few laws, and those laws strictly observed.

8630.author: Rene Descartes
8630.quote: Except our own thoughts, there is nothing absolutely in our power.

8631.author: Rene Descartes
8631.quote: Illusory joy is often worth more than genuine sorrow.

8633.author: Rene Descartes
8633.quote: An optimist may see a light where there is none, but why must the pessimist always run to blow it out?

8634.author: Rene Descartes
8634.quote: When it is not in our power to follow what is true, we ought to follow what is most probable.

8635.author: Rene Descartes
8635.quote: The first precept was never to accept a thing as true until I knew it as such without a single doubt.

8636.author: Rene Descartes
8636.quote: Each problem that I solved became a rule, which served afterwards to solve other problems.

8637.author: Rene Descartes
8637.quote: Common sense is the most fairly distributed thing in the world, for each one thinks he is so well-endowed with it that even those who are hardest to satisfy in all other matters are not in the habit of desiring more of it than they already have.

8638.author: Rene Descartes
8638.quote: I am indeed amazed when I consider how weak my mind is and how prone to error.

8639.author: Rene Descartes
8639.quote: I am accustomed to sleep and in my dreams to imagine the same things that lunatics imagine when awake.

8640.author: Rene Descartes
8640.quote: Travelling is almost like talking with those of other centuries.

8641.author: Rene Descartes
8641.quote: The reading of all good books is like a conversation with the finest minds of past centuries.

8642.author: Rene Descartes
8642.quote: I hope that posterity will judge me kindly, not only as to the things which I have explained, but also to those which I have intentionally omitted so as to leave to others the pleasure of discovery.

8643.author: Rene Descartes
8643.quote: The two operations of our understanding, intuition and deduction, on which alone we have said we must rely in the acquisition of knowledge.

8644.author: Rene Descartes
8644.quote: It is only prudent never to place complete confidence in that by which we have even once been deceived.

8645.author: Ric Flair
8645.quote: I'm Ric Flair! The Stylin', profilin', limousine riding, jet flying, kiss-stealing, wheelin' n' dealin' son of a gun!

8646.author: Ric Flair
8646.quote: Without your health, you've got nothing going on. I thank God every day for good health.

8647.author: Ric Flair
8647.quote: Space Mountain may be the oldest ride in the park, but it has the longest line.

8648.author: Ric Flair
8648.quote: To be the man, you gotta beat the man!

8649.author: Ric Flair
8649.quote: I was really good at being a bad guy.

8650.author: Ric Flair
8650.quote: If you don't like it, learn to love it!

8651.author: Ric Flair
8651.quote: I'm every woman's dream and every man's nightmare.

8652.author: Ric Flair
8652.quote: All the women want to be with me, all the men want to be like me.

8653.author: Ric Flair
8653.quote: When somebody has convinced you that you're not worth anything to anybody anymore, and they spend a lot of time doing it, you start believing it yourself.

8654.author: Ric Flair
8654.quote: For me, it's about camaraderie. My whole life is like, if something's going on, nothing ever preceded fun. I always put my friends and the fun and the business ahead of everything.

8655.author: Ric Flair
8655.quote: I tell everyone in the world that I have always been the best father I could be and that I was the worst husband. Wooo!

8656.author: Ric Flair
8656.quote: I do close to 30 minutes in cardio at a very high rate. I raise the level of intensity. I do a level 18 on the elliptical at four miles an hour for 20 minutes. That's 360 calories. I want to see someone else try that. The resistance factor at 18 is brutal. No one goes to 20.

8657.author: Ric Flair
8657.quote: My problem is that I think everybody needs to work as hard as I worked when I was in my prime.

8658.author: Ric Flair
8658.quote: I feel great. I had a blood clot. It was a bad deal. But when I look at my friends with hip replacements, knee replacements, shoulder replacements, neck surgeries, back surgeries, I'll take the blood clot.

8659.author: Ric Flair
8659.quote: I can take more punishment than anyone in the business.

8660.author: Ric Flair
8660.quote: None of this was written to hurt anybody's feelings.

8662.author: Ric Flair
8662.quote: First of all, Vince McMahon doesn't argue - he tells you!

8663.author: Ric Flair
8663.quote: Miami was always a town that was kind to me as a wrestler. It's a great wrestling town, and it's a great town, period. There's so much to do in Miami.

8664.author: Ric Flair
8664.quote: I have had the greatest wrestling career in the history of pro wrestling.

8665.author: Ric Flair
8665.quote: You gotta have a pocket square, I think.

8666.author: Ric Flair
8666.quote: In order to be the man, you have to beat the man.

8667.author: Ric Flair
8667.quote: I had my first 'Survivor Series' in 1991 and I was fortunate enough to be an instrumental part of the shows I was on.

8668.author: Ric Flair
8668.quote: Nobody has wrestled everybody in the business like I have, especially not Bret Hart.

8669.author: Ric Flair
8669.quote: The guy who could be me, but he knows when to draw the line, is John Cena. John Cena can rock 'n' roll, let me tell you.

8670.author: Ric Flair
8670.quote: I spent more money on one robe than guys spend in five years.

8671.author: Richard Bach
8671.quote: The best way to pay for a lovely moment is to enjoy it.

8672.author: Richard Bach
8672.quote: If you love someone, set them free. If they come back they're yours; if they don't they never were.

8673.author: Richard Bach
8673.quote: The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other's life.

8674.author: Richard Bach
8674.quote: True love stories never have endings.

8675.author: Richard Bach
8675.quote: Your conscience is the measure of the honesty of your selfishness. Listen to it carefully.

8676.author: Richard Bach
8676.quote: What the caterpillar calls the end of the world the master calls a butterfly.

8677.author: Richard Bach
