9171.quote: Men go abroad to wonder at the heights of mountains, at the huge waves of the sea, at the long courses of the rivers, at the vast compass of the ocean, at the circular motions of the stars, and they pass by themselves without wondering.

9172.author: Saint Augustine
9172.quote: Do you wish to rise? Begin by descending. You plan a tower that will pierce the clouds? Lay first the foundation of humility.

9173.author: Saint Augustine
9173.quote: What does love look like? It has the hands to help others. It has the feet to hasten to the poor and needy. It has eyes to see misery and want. It has the ears to hear the sighs and sorrows of men. That is what love looks like.

9174.author: Saint Augustine
9174.quote: Since you cannot do good to all, you are to pay special attention to those who, by the accidents of time, or place, or circumstances, are brought into closer connection with you.

9175.author: Saint Augustine
9175.quote: Love is the beauty of the soul.

9176.author: Saint Augustine
9176.quote: Punishment is justice for the unjust.

9177.author: Saint Augustine
9177.quote: Resentment is like drinking poison and waiting for the other person to die.

9178.author: Saint Augustine
9178.quote: O Holy Spirit, descend plentifully into my heart. Enlighten the dark corners of this neglected dwelling and scatter there Thy cheerful beams.

9179.author: Saint Augustine
9179.quote: In doing what we ought we deserve no praise, because it is our duty.

9180.author: Saint Augustine
9180.quote: Do you wish to be great? Then begin by being. Do you desire to construct a vast and lofty fabric? Think first about the foundations of humility. The higher your structure is to be, the deeper must be its foundation.

9181.author: Saint Augustine
9181.quote: The words printed here are concepts. You must go through the experiences.

9182.author: Saint Augustine
9182.quote: This is the very perfection of a man, to find out his own imperfections.

9183.author: Saint Augustine
9183.quote: Humility is the foundation of all the other virtues hence, in the soul in which this virtue does not exist there cannot be any other virtue except in mere appearance.

9184.author: Saint Augustine
9184.quote: Will is to grace as the horse is to the rider.

9185.author: Saint Augustine
9185.quote: Seek not to understand that you may believe, but believe that you may understand.

9186.author: Saint Augustine
9186.quote: It is not the punishment but the cause that makes the martyr.

9187.author: Saint Augustine
9187.quote: Miracles are not contrary to nature, but only contrary to what we know about nature.

9188.author: Saint Augustine
9188.quote: In the absence of justice, what is sovereignty but organized robbery?

9189.author: Saint Augustine
9189.quote: God loves each of us as if there were only one of us.

9190.author: Saint Augustine
9190.quote: Since love grows within you, so beauty grows. For love is the beauty of the soul.

9191.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9191.quote: The tree that is beside the running water is fresher and gives more fruit.

9192.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9192.quote: Prayer is an act of love; words are not needed. Even if sickness distracts from thoughts, all that is needed is the will to love.

9193.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9193.quote: If Christ Jesus dwells in a man as his friend and noble leader, that man can endure all things, for Christ helps and strengthens us and never abandons us. He is a true friend.

9194.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9194.quote: Be gentle to all and stern with yourself.

9195.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9195.quote: For prayer is nothing else than being on terms of friendship with God.

9196.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9196.quote: Mental prayer in my opinion is nothing else than an intimate sharing between friends; it means taking time frequently to be alone with Him who we know loves us. The important thing is not to think much but to love much and so do that which best stirs you to love. Love is not great delight but desire to please God in everything.

9197.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9197.quote: More tears are shed over answered prayers than unanswered ones.

9198.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9198.quote: Those who give themselves to prayer should in a special manner have always a devotion to St. Joseph; for I know not how any man can think of the Queen of the angels, during the time that she suffered so much with the Infant Jesus, without giving thanks to St. Joseph for the services he rendered them then.

9199.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9199.quote: There are more tears shed over answered prayers than over unanswered prayers.

9200.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9200.quote: I do not fear Satan half so much as I fear those who fear him.

9201.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9201.quote: When the soul, through its own fault... becomes rooted in a pool of pitch-black, evil smelling water, it produces nothing but misery and filth.

9202.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9202.quote: All things must come to the soul from its roots, from where it is planted.

9203.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9203.quote: A beginner must look on himself as one setting out to make a garden for his Lord's pleasure, on most unfruitful soil which abounds in weeds. His Majesty roots up the weeds and will put in good plants instead. Let us reckon that this is already done when the soul decides to practice prayer and has begun to do so.

9204.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9204.quote: May God protect me from gloomy saints.

9205.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9205.quote: To have courage for whatever comes in life - everything lies in that.

9206.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9206.quote: I had many friends to help me to fall; but as to rising again, I was so much left to myself, that I wonder now I was not always on the ground. I praise God for His mercy; for it was He only Who stretched out His hand to me. May He be blessed for ever! Amen.

9207.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9207.quote: I thought of the soul as resembling a castle, formed of a single diamond or a very transparent crystal, and containing many rooms, just as in Heaven there are many mansions.

9208.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9208.quote: I know the power obedience has of making things easy which seem impossible.

9209.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9209.quote: To reach something good it is very useful to have gone astray, and thus acquire experience.

9210.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9210.quote: I was living an extremely burdensome life, because every time I prayed, I became more clearly aware of my faults. On the one hand, God was calling me. On the other, I was following the way of the world. Doing what God wanted made me happy; but I felt bound by the things of this world.

9211.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9211.quote: Accustom yourself continually to make many acts of love, for they enkindle and melt the soul.

9213.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9213.quote: We can only learn to know ourselves and do what we can - namely, surrender our will and fulfill God's will in us.

9214.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9214.quote: If I should say anything that is not in conformity with what is held by the Holy Roman Catholic Church, it will be through ignorance and not through malice. This may be taken as certain, and also that, through God's goodness, I am, and shall always be, as I always have been, subject to her.

9215.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9215.quote: I have often thought with wonder of the great goodness of God; and my soul has rejoiced in the contemplation of His great magnificence and mercy. May He be blessed for ever! For I see clearly that He has not omitted to reward me, even in this life, for every one of my good desires.

9216.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
9216.quote: The feeling remains that God is on the journey, too.

9217.author: Salvador Dali
9217.quote: Those who do not want to imitate anything, produce nothing.

9218.author: Salvador Dali
9218.quote: Intelligence without ambition is a bird without wings.

9219.author: Salvador Dali
9219.quote: Drawing is the honesty of the art. There is no possibility of cheating. It is either good or bad.

9220.author: Salvador Dali
9220.quote: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.

9221.author: Salvador Dali
9221.quote: Surrealism is destructive, but it destroys only what it considers to be shackles limiting our vision.

9222.author: Salvador Dali
9222.quote: There is only one difference between a madman and me. The madman thinks he is sane. I know I am mad.

9223.author: Salvador Dali
9223.quote: The thermometer of success is merely the jealousy of the malcontents.

9224.author: Salvador Dali
9224.quote: I don't do drugs. I am drugs.

9225.author: Salvador Dali
9225.quote: The difference between false memories and true ones is the same as for jewels: it is always the false ones that look the most real, the most brilliant.

9226.author: Salvador Dali
9226.quote: Mistakes are almost always of a sacred nature. Never try to correct them. On the contrary: rationalize them, understand them thoroughly. After that, it will be possible for you to sublimate them.

9227.author: Salvador Dali
9227.quote: Take me, I am the drug; take me, I am hallucinogenic.

9228.author: Salvador Dali
9228.quote: There are some days when I think I'm going to die from an overdose of satisfaction.

9229.author: Salvador Dali
9229.quote: What is a television apparatus to man, who has only to shut his eyes to see the most inaccessible regions of the seen and the never seen, who has only to imagine in order to pierce through walls and cause all the planetary Baghdads of his dreams to rise from the dust.

9230.author: Salvador Dali
9230.quote: The first man to compare the cheeks of a young woman to a rose was obviously a poet; the first to repeat it was possibly an idiot.

9231.author: Salvador Dali
9231.quote: Instead of stubbornly attempting to use surrealism for purposes of subversion, it is necessary to try to make of surrealism something as solid, complete and classic as the works of museums.

9232.author: Salvador Dali
9232.quote: In order to acquire a growing and lasting respect in society, it is a good thing, if you possess great talent, to give, early in your youth, a very hard kick to the right shin of the society that you love. After that, be a snob.

9233.author: Salvador Dali
9233.quote: The only difference between me and a madman is that I'm not mad.

9234.author: Salvador Dali
9234.quote: Each morning when I awake, I experience again a supreme pleasure - that of being Salvador Dali.

9235.author: Salvador Dali
9235.quote: Progressive art can assist people to learn not only about the objective forces at work in the society in which they live, but also about the intensely social character of their interior lives. Ultimately, it can propel people toward social emancipation.

9236.author: Salvador Dali
9236.quote: I do not paint a portrait to look like the subject, rather does the person grow to look like his portrait.

9237.author: Salvador Dali
9237.quote: Painting is an infinitely minute part of my personality.

9238.author: Salvador Dali
9238.quote: The secret of my influence has always been that it remained secret.

9239.author: Salvador Dali
9239.quote: Let my enemies devour each other.

9240.author: Salvador Dali
9240.quote: I have Dalinian thought: the one thing the world will never have enough of is the outrageous.

9241.author: Salvador Dali
9241.quote: Liking money like I like it, is nothing less than mysticism. Money is a glory.

9242.author: Salvador Dali
9242.quote: The terrifying and edible beauty of Art Nouveau architecture.

9243.author: Sam Walton
9243.quote: We're all working together; that's the secret.

9244.author: Sam Walton
9244.quote: There is only one boss. The customer. And he can fire everybody in the company from the chairman on down, simply by spending his money somewhere else.

9245.author: Sam Walton
9245.quote: Celebrate your successes. Find some humor in your failures.

9246.author: Sam Walton
9246.quote: High expectations are the key to everything.

9247.author: Sam Walton
9247.quote: Outstanding leaders go out of their way to boost the self-esteem of their personnel. If people believe in themselves, it's amazing what they can accomplish.

9248.author: Sam Walton
9248.quote: Exceed your customer's expectations. If you do, they'll come back over and over. Give them what they want - and a little more.

9249.author: Sam Walton
9249.quote: Nothing else can quite substitute for a few well-chosen, well-timed, sincere words of praise. They're absolutely free and worth a fortune.

9250.author: Sam Walton
9250.quote: If you love your work, you'll be out there every day trying to do it the best you possibly can, and pretty soon everybody around will catch the passion from you - like a fever.

9251.author: Sam Walton
9251.quote: All of us profit from being corrected - if we're corrected in a positive way.

9252.author: Sam Walton
9252.quote: Appreciate everything your associates do for the business.

9253.author: Sam Walton
9253.quote: Swim upstream. Go the other way. Ignore the conventional wisdom.

9254.author: Sam Walton
9254.quote: Loosen up, and everybody around you will loosen up.

9255.author: Sam Walton
9255.quote: We let folks know we're interested in them and that they're vital to us. cause they are.

9256.author: Sam Walton
9256.quote: I learned this early on in the variety business: You've got to give folks responsibility, you've got to trust them, and then you've got to check on them.

9257.author: Sam Walton
9257.quote: The way management treats associates is exactly how the associates will treat the customers.

9258.author: Sam Walton
9258.quote: If everybody is doing it one way, there's a good chance you can find your niche by going exactly in the opposite direction.

9259.author: Sam Walton
9259.quote: Control your expenses better than your competition. This is where you can always find the competitive advantage.

9260.author: Sam Walton
9260.quote: The key to success is to get out into the store and listen to what the associates have to say.

9261.author: Sam Walton
9261.quote: Give ordinary folk the chance to buy the same things as rich people.

9262.author: Sam Walton
9262.quote: I don't know what would have happened to Wal-Mart if we had laid low and never stirred up the competition. My guess is that we would have remained a strictly regional operator.

9263.author: Sam Walton
9263.quote: Most of us don't invent ideas. We take the best ideas from someone else.

9264.author: Sam Walton
9264.quote: Maybe I was born to be a merchant, maybe it was fate. I don't know about that. But I know this for sure: I loved retail from the very beginning.

9265.author: Sam Walton
9265.quote: One person seeking glory doesn't accomplish very much.

9266.author: Sam Walton
9266.quote: Share your profits with all your associates, and treat them as partners. In turn, they will treat you as a partner, and together you will all perform beyond your wildest expectations.

9267.author: Sam Walton
9267.quote: I had to pick myself up and get on with it, do it all over again, only even better this time.

9268.author: Sam Walton
9268.quote: Each Wal-Mart store should reflect the values of its customers and support the vision they hold for their community.

9269.author: Samuel Johnson
9269.quote: Great works are performed not by strength but by perseverance.

9270.author: Samuel Johnson
9270.quote: The world is like a grand staircase, some are going up and some are going down.

9271.author: Samuel Johnson
9271.quote: Kindness is in our power, even when fondness is not.

9272.author: Samuel Johnson
9272.quote: Revenge is an act of passion; vengeance of justice. Injuries are revenged; crimes are avenged.

9273.author: Samuel Johnson
9273.quote: The true measure of a man is how he treats someone who can do him absolutely no good.

9274.author: Samuel Johnson
9274.quote: My dear friend, clear your mind of cant.

9275.author: Samuel Johnson
9275.quote: If your determination is fixed, I do not counsel you to despair. Few things are impossible to diligence and skill. Great works are performed not by strength, but perseverance.

9276.author: Samuel Johnson
9276.quote: Praise, like gold and diamonds, owes its value only to its scarcity.

9277.author: Samuel Johnson
9277.quote: What we hope ever to do with ease, we must learn first to do with diligence.

9278.author: Samuel Johnson
9278.quote: Agriculture not only gives riches to a nation, but the only riches she can call her own.

9279.author: Samuel Johnson
9279.quote: Patriotism is the last refuge of the scoundrel.

9280.author: Samuel Johnson
9280.quote: When a man is tired of London, he is tired of life; for there is in London all that life can afford.

9281.author: Samuel Johnson
9281.quote: No man can taste the fruits of autumn while he is delighting his scent with the flowers of spring.

9282.author: Samuel Johnson
9282.quote: Self-confidence is the first requisite to great undertakings.

9283.author: Samuel Johnson
9283.quote: A wise man will make haste to forgive, because he knows the true value of time, and will not suffer it to pass away in unnecessary pain.

9285.author: Samuel Johnson
9285.quote: Bachelors have consciences, married men have wives.

9286.author: Samuel Johnson
9286.quote: He that will enjoy the brightness of sunshine, must quit the coolness of the shade.

9287.author: Samuel Johnson
9287.quote: The future is purchased by the present.

9288.author: Samuel Johnson
9288.quote: Language is the dress of thought.

9289.author: Samuel Johnson
9289.quote: The mind is never satisfied with the objects immediately before it, but is always breaking away from the present moment, and losing itself in schemes of future felicity... The natural flights of the human mind are not from pleasure to pleasure, but from hope to hope.

9290.author: Samuel Johnson
9290.quote: Of the blessings set before you make your choice, and be content.

9291.author: Samuel Johnson
9291.quote: One of the disadvantages of wine is that it makes a man mistake words for thoughts.

9292.author: Samuel Johnson
9292.quote: When any calamity has been suffered the first thing to be remembered is, how much has been escaped.

9293.author: Samuel Johnson
9293.quote: The use of travelling is to regulate imagination by reality, and instead of thinking how things may be, to see them as they are.

9294.author: Samuel Johnson
9294.quote: Every man is rich or poor according to the proportion between his desires and his enjoyments.

9295.author: Satchel Paige
9295.quote: Work like you don't need the money. Love like you've never been hurt. Dance like nobody's watching.

9296.author: Satchel Paige
9296.quote: Age is a case of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it don't matter.

9297.author: Satchel Paige
9297.quote: How old would you be if you didn't know how old you are?

9298.author: Satchel Paige
9298.quote: Don't look back. Something might be gaining on you.

9299.author: Satchel Paige
9299.quote: Don't pray when it rains if you don't pray when the sun shines.

9300.author: Satchel Paige
9300.quote: Not to be cheered by praise, not to be grieved by blame, but to know thoroughly one's own virtues or powers are the characteristics of an excellent man.

9301.author: Satchel Paige
9301.quote: Money and women. They're two of the strongest things in the world. The things you do for a woman you wouldn't do for anything else. Same with money.

9302.author: Satchel Paige
9302.quote: Airplanes may kill you, but they ain't likely to hurt you.

9303.author: Satchel Paige
9303.quote: I ain't ever had a job, I just always played baseball.

9304.author: Satchel Paige
9304.quote: Avoid fried foods, which angry up the blood.

9305.author: Satchel Paige
9305.quote: Ain't no man can avoid being born average, but there ain't no man got to be common.

9306.author: Satchel Paige
9306.quote: I was born in August, no July, 1908.

9307.author: Satchel Paige
9307.quote: My pitching philosophy is simple - keep the ball way from the bat.

9308.author: Satchel Paige
9308.quote: I don't generally like running. I believe in training by rising gently up and down from the bench.

9309.author: Satchel Paige
9309.quote: Just take the ball and throw it where you want to. Throw strikes. Home plate don't move.

9310.author: Satchel Paige
9310.quote: I never threw an illegal pitch. The trouble is, once in a while I toss one that ain't never been seen by this generation.

9311.author: Satchel Paige
9311.quote: When a batter swings and I see his knees move, I can tell just what his weaknesses are then I just put the ball where I know he can't hit it.

9312.author: Satchel Paige
9312.quote: The only change is that baseball has turned Paige from a second class citizen to a second class immortal.

9313.author: Satchel Paige
9313.quote: I've said it once and I'll say it a a hundred times, I'm forty-four years old.

9314.author: Satchel Paige
9314.quote: I never rush myself. See, they can't start the game without me.

9315.author: Satchel Paige
9315.quote: You gotta keep the ball off the fat part of the bat.

9316.author: Satchel Paige
9316.quote: My feet ain't got nothing to do with my nickname, but when folks get it in their heads that a feller's got big feet, soon the feet start looking big.

9317.author: Satchel Paige
9317.quote: If your stomach disputes you, lie down and pacify it with cool thoughts.

9318.author: Satchel Paige
9318.quote: If a man can beat you, walk him.

9319.author: Satchel Paige
9319.quote: It's funny what a few no-hitters do for a body.

9321.author: Shelby Foote
9321.quote: I think making mistakes and discovering them for yourself is of great value, but to have someone else to point out your mistakes is a shortcut of the process.

9323.author: Shelby Foote
9323.quote: Getting close to books, and spending time by myself, I was obliged to think about things I would never have thought about if I was busy romping around with a brother and sister.

9324.author: Shelby Foote
9324.quote: And I'm a slow writer: five, six hundred words is a good day. That's the reason it took me 20 years to write those million and a half words of the Civil War.

9325.author: Shelby Foote
9325.quote: When you grow up in a totally segregated society, where everybody around you believes that segregation is proper, you have a hard time. You can't believe how much it's a part of your thinking.

9326.author: Shelby Foote
9326.quote: I used to write sonnets and various things, and moved from there into writing prose, which, incidentally, is a lot more interesting than poetry, including the rhythms of prose.

9327.author: Shelby Foote
9327.quote: I never cared what kind of grade I got.

9328.author: Shelby Foote
9328.quote: Most of my inspiration, if that's the word, came from books themselves.

9329.author: Shelby Foote
9329.quote: I think that everything you do helps you to write if you're a writer. Adversity and success both contribute largely to making you what you are. If you don't experience either one of those, you're being deprived of something.

9330.author: Shelby Foote
9330.quote: I've never shown anybody a draft of anything.

9331.author: Shelby Foote
9331.quote: Of all the passions of mankind, the love of novelty most rules the mind. In search of this, from realm to realm we roam. Our fleets come loaded with every folly home.

9332.author: Shelby Foote
9332.quote: I don't want anything to do with anything mechanical between me and the paper, including a typewriter, and I don't even want a fountain pen between me and the paper.

9333.author: Shelby Foote
9333.quote: Shiloh is a wonderfully dramatic battle. The leader of one side is killed, and the other one is going on to glory, and it was the first great battle. It lasted two days.

9334.author: Shelby Foote
9334.quote: I began the way nearly everybody I ever heard of - I began writing poetry. And I find that to be quite usual with writers, their trying their hand at poetry.

9335.author: Shelby Foote
9335.quote: I prize the Depression, for instance, because I learned the value of things in the Depression that a way people who don't have to worry about such things never learned to prize it really, I believe.

9336.author: Shelby Foote
9336.quote: But the same thing was true in the army. You slept in a barracks with all kinds of people of every nationality, every trade, every character and quality you can imagine, and that was a good experience.

9337.author: Shelby Foote
9337.quote: If you want to study writing, read Dickens. That's how to study writing, or Faulkner, or D.H. Lawrence, or John Keats. They can teach you everything you need to know about writing.

9338.author: Shelby Foote
9338.quote: And I really do think that the difficulty of research makes it more real to you than punching a thing to find out how many men were killed at this particular action.

9339.author: Shelby Foote
9339.quote: My second book, Follow Me Down had some success, got good critical notices, went into a second printing and things like that, but Shiloh was by far the most successful of those first five novels.

9340.author: Shelby Foote
9340.quote: I took five years on the first volume, five years on the second volume, and ten years on the third volume.

9341.author: Shelby Foote
9341.quote: I'm crazy about Grant: his character, his nature, his science in fighting and everything else. But I don't like the idea that he never accepted the blame for anything, always found someone else to blame for any mistake that was ever made, including blaming Prentiss for Shiloh.

9342.author: Sigmund Freud
9342.quote: Flowers are restful to look at. They have neither emotions nor conflicts.

9343.author: Sigmund Freud
9343.quote: I cannot think of any need in childhood as strong as the need for a father's protection.

9344.author: Sigmund Freud
9344.quote: Time spent with cats is never wasted.

9345.author: Sigmund Freud
9345.quote: The mind is like an iceberg, it floats with one-seventh of its bulk above water.

9346.author: Sigmund Freud
9346.quote: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.

9347.author: Sigmund Freud
9347.quote: The interpretation of dreams is the royal road to a knowledge of the unconscious activities of the mind.

9348.author: Sigmund Freud
9348.quote: The ego is not master in its own house.

9349.author: Sigmund Freud
9349.quote: We are never so defensless against suffering as when we love.

9350.author: Sigmund Freud
9350.quote: Love and work... work and love, that's all there is.

9351.author: Sigmund Freud
9351.quote: Neurosis is the inability to tolerate ambiguity.

9352.author: Sigmund Freud
9352.quote: Most people do not really want freedom, because freedom involves responsibility, and most people are frightened of responsibility.

9353.author: Sigmund Freud
9353.quote: If youth knew; if age could.

9354.author: Sigmund Freud
9354.quote: Dreams are often most profound when they seem the most crazy.

9355.author: Sigmund Freud
9355.quote: The goal of all life is death.

9356.author: Sigmund Freud
9356.quote: Civilization began the first time an angry person cast a word instead of a rock.

9357.author: Sigmund Freud
9357.quote: If you can't do it, give up!

9358.author: Sigmund Freud
9358.quote: The voice of the intellect is a soft one, but it does not rest until it has gained a hearing.

9359.author: Sigmund Freud
9359.quote: I have found little that is 'good' about human beings on the whole. In my experience most of them are trash, no matter whether they publicly subscribe to this or that ethical doctrine or to none at all. That is something that you cannot say aloud, or perhaps even think.

9360.author: Sigmund Freud
9360.quote: Where id was, there ego shall be.

9361.author: Sigmund Freud
9361.quote: The first human who hurled an insult instead of a stone was the founder of civilization.

9362.author: Sigmund Freud
9362.quote: Sometimes a cigar is just a cigar.

9363.author: Sigmund Freud
9363.quote: Civilized society is perpetually menaced with disintegration through this primary hostility of men towards one another.

9364.author: Sigmund Freud
9364.quote: What a distressing contrast there is between the radiant intelligence of the child and the feeble mentality of the average adult.

9365.author: Sigmund Freud
9365.quote: Illusions commend themselves to us because they save us pain and allow us to enjoy pleasure instead. We must therefore accept it without complaint when they sometimes collide with a bit of reality against which they are dashed to pieces.

9366.author: Sigmund Freud
9366.quote: He that has eyes to see and ears to hear may convince himself that no mortal can keep a secret. If his lips are silent, he chatters with his fingertips; betrayal oozes out of him at every pore.

9368.author: Simon Sinek
9368.quote: The strong bond of friendship is not always a balanced equation; friendship is not always about giving and taking in equal shares. Instead, friendship is grounded in a feeling that you know exactly who will be there for you when you need something, no matter what or when.

9369.author: Simon Sinek
9369.quote: Leadership is not about the next election, it's about the next generation.

9370.author: Simon Sinek
9370.quote: A leader's job is not to do the work for others, it's to help others figure out how to do it themselves, to get things done, and to succeed beyond what they thought possible.

9371.author: Simon Sinek
9371.quote: There is no decision that we can make that doesn't come with some sort of balance or sacrifice.

9372.author: Simon Sinek
9372.quote: Champions are not the ones who always win races - champions are the ones who get out there and try. And try harder the next time. And even harder the next time. 'Champion' is a state of mind. They are devoted. They compete to best themselves as much if not more than they compete to best others. Champions are not just athletes.

9373.author: Simon Sinek
9373.quote: Don't quit. Never give up trying to build the world you can see, even if others can't see it. Listen to your drum and your drum only. It's the one that makes the sweetest sound.

9374.author: Simon Sinek
9374.quote: If you want to be a great leader, remember to treat all people with respect at all times. For one, because you never know when you'll need their help. And two, because it's a sign you respect people, which all great leaders do.

9375.author: Simon Sinek
9375.quote: Leadership is a way of thinking, a way of acting and, most importantly, a way of communicating.

9376.author: Simon Sinek
9376.quote: More information is always better than less. When people know the reason things are happening, even if it's bad news, they can adjust their expectations and react accordingly. Keeping people in the dark only serves to stir negative emotions.

9377.author: Simon Sinek
9377.quote: There is a difference between listening and waiting for your turn to speak.

9378.author: Simon Sinek
9378.quote: Some people are born good-looking. Some have the gift of gab. And some are lucky enough to be born smarter than the rest of us. Whether we like it or not, Mother Nature does not dole these characteristics out evenly.

9379.author: Simon Sinek
9379.quote: One of the best paradoxes of leadership is a leader's need to be both stubborn and open-minded. A leader must insist on sticking to the vision and stay on course to the destination. But he must be open-minded during the process.

9380.author: Simon Sinek
9380.quote: If you have the opportunity to do amazing things in your life, I strongly encourage you to invite someone to join you.

9381.author: Simon Sinek
9381.quote: Great leaders don't need to act tough. Their confidence and humility serve to underscore their toughness.

9382.author: Simon Sinek
9382.quote: The quality of a leader cannot be judged by the answers he gives, but by the questions he asks.

9383.author: Simon Sinek
9383.quote: My concern is that we live in an economy in which stabbing someone and waiting for them to complain before we remove the knife has become the normal way of doing business. When did we lose sight of the fact that it's not nice to stab people in the first place?

9384.author: Simon Sinek
9384.quote: Panic causes tunnel vision. Calm acceptance of danger allows us to more easily assess the situation and see the options.

9385.author: Simon Sinek
9385.quote: A friend is an emotional bond, just like friendship is a human experience.

9386.author: Simon Sinek
9386.quote: The most effective leaders are actually better at guarding against danger when they acknowledge it that it exists. Cowards, in contrast, cling to the hope that failure will never happen and may be sloppy in the face of danger - not because they don't acknowledge that it exists, but because they are just too afraid of it to look it in the eye.

9387.author: Simon Sinek
9387.quote: Corporate culture matters. How management chooses to treat its people impacts everything - for better or for worse.

9388.author: Simon Sinek
9388.quote: Believing that your competition is stronger and better than you pushes you to better yourselves.

9389.author: Simon Sinek
9389.quote: We live in times of high stress. Messages that are simple, messages that are inspiring, messages that are life-affirming, are a welcome break from our real lives.

9390.author: Simon Sinek
9390.quote: The irony is, the advertising industry knows everyone hates what they produce. This is why they keep looking for new ways to force people to stay tuned.

9391.author: Simon Sinek
9391.quote: It's important to slow down, every now and then, for no other reason than to call someone to say 'Hi.' It doesn't have to be a long conversation. Just calling out of the blue does more to let someone know you still care about them than nearly anything else.

9392.author: Simon Sinek
9392.quote: Good listeners have a huge advantage. For one, when they engage in conversation, they make people 'feel' heard. They 'feel' that someone really understands their wants, needs and desires. And for good reason; a good listener does care to understand.

9393.author: Simon Sinek
9393.quote: The cost of leadership is self-interest.

9394.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9394.quote: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay.

9395.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9395.quote: I wish that every human life might be pure transparent freedom.

9396.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9396.quote: One is not born a woman, but becomes one.

9397.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9397.quote: If you live long enough, you'll see that every victory turns into a defeat.

9398.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9398.quote: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion.

9399.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9399.quote: No one is more arrogant toward women, more aggressive or scornful, than the man who is anxious about his virility.

9400.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9400.quote: Society cares for the individual only so far as he is profitable.

9401.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9401.quote: In the face of an obstacle which is impossible to overcome, stubbornness is stupid.

9402.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9402.quote: Defending the truth is not something one does out of a sense of duty or to allay guilt complexes, but is a reward in itself.

9403.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9403.quote: I tore myself away from the safe comfort of certainties through my love for truth - and truth rewarded me.

9404.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9404.quote: In itself, homosexuality is as limiting as heterosexuality: the ideal should be to be capable of loving a woman or a man; either, a human being, without feeling fear, restraint, or obligation.

9405.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9405.quote: I am incapable of conceiving infinity, and yet I do not accept finity.

9406.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9406.quote: Life is occupied in both perpetuating itself and in surpassing itself; if all it does is maintain itself, then living is only not dying.

9407.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9407.quote: All oppression creates a state of war.

9408.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9408.quote: Representation of the world, like the world itself, is the work of men; they describe it from their own point of view, which they confuse with the absolute truth.

9409.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9409.quote: Why one man rather than another? It was odd. You find yourself involved with a fellow for life just because he was the one that you met when you were nineteen.

9410.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9410.quote: The writer of originality, unless dead, is always shocking, scandalous; novelty disturbs and repels.

9411.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9411.quote: All the idols made by man, however terrifying they may be, are in point of fact subordinate to him, and that is why he will always have it in his power to destroy them.

9412.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9412.quote: This has always been a man's world, and none of the reasons that have been offered in explanation have seemed adequate.

9413.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9413.quote: It is old age, rather than death, that is to be contrasted with life. Old age is life's parody, whereas death transforms life into a destiny: in a way it preserves it by giving it the absolute dimension. Death does away with time.

9414.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9414.quote: Society, being codified by man, decrees that woman is inferior; she can do away with this inferiority only by destroying the male's superiority.

9415.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9415.quote: When an individual is kept in a situation of inferiority, the fact is that he does become inferior.

9416.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9416.quote: What is an adult? A child blown up by age.

9417.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9417.quote: Sex pleasure in woman is a kind of magic spell; it demands complete abandon; if words or movements oppose the magic of caresses, the spell is broken.

9418.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9418.quote: Man is defined as a human being and a woman as a female - whenever she behaves as a human being she is said to imitate the male.

9419.author: Simone de Beauvoir
9419.quote: It is not in giving life but in risking life that man is raised above the animal; that is why superiority has been accorded in humanity not to the sex that brings forth but to that which kills.

9420.author: Socrates
9420.quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.

9421.author: Socrates
9421.quote: I know that I am intelligent, because I know that I know nothing.

9422.author: Socrates
9422.quote: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.

9423.author: Socrates
9423.quote: From the deepest desires often come the deadliest hate.

9424.author: Socrates
9424.quote: False words are not only evil in themselves, but they infect the soul with evil.

9425.author: Socrates
9425.quote: Death may be the greatest of all human blessings.

9426.author: Socrates
9426.quote: Worthless people live only to eat and drink; people of worth eat and drink only to live.

9427.author: Socrates
9427.quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.

9428.author: Socrates
9428.quote: Beware the barrenness of a busy life.

9430.author: Socrates
9430.quote: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.

9431.author: Socrates
9431.quote: Our prayers should be for blessings in general, for God knows best what is good for us.

9432.author: Socrates
9432.quote: By all means, marry. If you get a good wife, you'll become happy; if you get a bad one, you'll become a philosopher.

9433.author: Socrates
9433.quote: The way to gain a good reputation is to endeavor to be what you desire to appear.

9434.author: Socrates
9434.quote: Be as you wish to seem.

9435.author: Socrates
9435.quote: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when thou art in, continue firm and constant.

9436.author: Socrates
9436.quote: An honest man is always a child.

9437.author: Socrates
9437.quote: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.

9438.author: Socrates
9438.quote: Once made equal to man, woman becomes his superior.

9439.author: Socrates
9439.quote: It is not living that matters, but living rightly.

9441.author: Socrates
9441.quote: He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.

9442.author: Socrates
9442.quote: To know, is to know that you know nothing. That is the meaning of true knowledge.

9443.author: Socrates
9443.quote: A system of morality which is based on relative emotional values is a mere illusion, a thoroughly vulgar conception which has nothing sound in it and nothing true.

9444.author: Socrates
9444.quote: Let him that would move the world first move himself.

9445.author: Socrates
9445.quote: He is a man of courage who does not run away, but remains at his post and fights against the enemy.

9446.author: Sojourner Truth
9446.quote: I am not going to die, I'm going home like a shooting star.

9447.author: Sojourner Truth
9447.quote: Truth is powerful and it prevails.

9448.author: Sojourner Truth
9448.quote: The Lord gave me 'Sojourner,' because I was to travel up an' down the land, showin' the people their sins an' bein' a sign unto them. Afterwards, I told the Lord I wanted another name 'cause everybody else had two names, and the Lord gave me 'Truth,' because I was to declare the truth to people.

9449.author: Sojourner Truth
9449.quote: There is a great stir about colored men getting their rights, but not a word about the colored women; and if colored men get their rights, and not colored women theirs, you see, the colored men will be masters over the women, and it will be just as bad as it was before.

9450.author: Sojourner Truth
9450.quote: I know and do what is right better than many big men who read.

9451.author: Sojourner Truth
9451.quote: If women want any rights more than they's got, why don't they just take them, and not be talking about it.

9452.author: Sojourner Truth
9452.quote: That little man in black there, he says women can't have as much rights as men 'cause Christ wasn't a woman! Where did your Christ come from? Where did your Christ come from? From God and a woman! Man had nothing to do with Him.

9453.author: Sojourner Truth
9453.quote: God will take care of the poor trampled slave, but where will the slaveholder be when eternity begins?

9454.author: Sojourner Truth
9454.quote: Religion without humanity is very poor human stuff.

9455.author: Sojourner Truth
9455.quote: The rich rob the poor, and the poor rob one another.

9456.author: Sojourner Truth
9456.quote: Those are the same stars, and that is the same moon, that look down upon your brothers and sisters, and which they see as they look up to them, though they are ever so far away from us, and each other.

9457.author: Sojourner Truth
9457.quote: The slaveholders are terrible for promising to give you this or that, or such and such a privilege, if you will do thus and so, and when the time of fulfillment comes, and one claims the promise, they, forsooth, recollect nothing of the kind; and you are, like as not, taunted with being a liar.

9458.author: Sojourner Truth
9458.quote: I have plowed and planted and gathered into barns, and no man could head me. And aren't I a woman?

9459.author: Sojourner Truth
9459.quote: We do as much, we eat as much, we want as much.

9460.author: Sojourner Truth
9460.quote: Where there is so much racket, there must be something out of kilter. I think that 'twixt the Negroes of the South and the women at the North, all talking about rights, the white men will be in a fix pretty soon.

9461.author: Sojourner Truth
9461.quote: I tell you I can't read a book, but I can read de people.

9462.author: Sojourner Truth
9462.quote: Good man! Genuine gentleman! God bless George Thompson, the great-hearted friend of my race.

9463.author: Sojourner Truth
9463.quote: It is the mind that makes the body.

9464.author: Sojourner Truth
9464.quote: When I got religion, I found some work to do to benefit somebody.

9465.author: Sojourner Truth
9465.quote: If the Lord comes and burns - as you say he will - I am not going away; I am going to stay here and stand the fire, like Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego! And Jesus will walk with me through the fire and keep me from harm.

9466.author: Sojourner Truth
9466.quote: The Lord only knows how many times I let my children go hungry rather than take secretly the bread I liked not to ask for.

9467.author: Sojourner Truth
9467.quote: It is written that there shall be a separation, and the sheep shall be separated from the goats. The other preachers have the sheep; I have the goats. And I have a few sheep among my goats, but they are very ragged.

9468.author: Sojourner Truth
9468.quote: Oh God, you know I have no money, but you can make the people do for me, and you must make the people do for me.

9469.author: Sojourner Truth
9469.quote: When I preaches, I has just one text to preach from, an' I always preaches from this one. My text is, 'When I found Jesus.'

9470.author: Sojourner Truth
9470.quote: Though it seems curious, I do not remember ever asking for anything but what I got it. And I always received it as an answer to my prayers.

9471.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9471.quote: Until we get equality in education, we won't have an equal society.

9472.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9472.quote: I am an ordinary person who has been blessed with extraordinary opportunities and experiences. Today is one of those experiences.

9473.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9473.quote: My diabetes is such a central part of my life... it did teach me discipline... it also taught me about moderation... I've trained myself to be super-vigilant... because I feel better when I am in control.

9474.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9474.quote: I have never had to face anything that could overwhelm the native optimism and stubborn perseverance I was blessed with.

9475.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9475.quote: We educated, privileged lawyers have a professional and moral duty to represent the underrepresented in our society, to ensure that justice exists for all, both legal and economic justice.

9476.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9476.quote: When everyone at school is speaking one language, and a lot of your classmates' parents also speak it, and you go home and see that your community is different -there is a sense of shame attached to that. It really takes growing up to treasure the specialness of being different.

9478.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9478.quote: I am a product of affirmative action. I am the perfect affirmative action baby. I am Puerto Rican, born and raised in the south Bronx. My test scores were not comparable to my colleagues at Princeton and Yale. Not so far off so that I wasn't able to succeed at those institutions.

9479.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9479.quote: I do know one thing about me: I don't measure myself by others' expectations or let others define my worth.

9480.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9480.quote: There are uses to adversity, and they don't reveal themselves until tested. Whether it's serious illness, financial hardship, or the simple constraint of parents who speak limited English, difficulty can tap unexpected strengths.

9481.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9481.quote: My job as a prosecutor is to do justice. And justice is served when a guilty man is convicted and an innocent man is not.

9482.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9482.quote: I think that the day a justice forgets that each decision comes at a cost to someone, then I think you start losing your humanity.

9483.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9483.quote: It is important for all of us to appreciate where we come from and how that history has really shaped us in ways that we might not understand.

9484.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9484.quote: The Latina in me is an ember that blazes forever.

9485.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9485.quote: I came to accept during my freshman year that many of the gaps in my knowledge and understanding were simply limits of class and cultural background, not lack of aptitude or application as I'd feared.

9486.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9486.quote: I do believe that every person has an equal opportunity to be a good and wise judge regardless of their background or life experiences.

9487.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9487.quote: An alcoholic father, poverty, my own juvenile diabetes, the limited English my parents spoke - although my mother has become completely bilingual since. All these things intrude on what most people think of as happiness.

9488.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9488.quote: The truth is that since childhood I had cultivated an existential independence. It came from perceiving the adults around me as unreliable, and without it I felt I wouldn't have survived. I cared deeply for everyone in my family, but in the end I depended on myself.

9489.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9489.quote: You can't be a minority in this society without having someone express disapproval about affirmative action.

9490.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9490.quote: I firmly believe in the rule of law as the foundation for all of our basic rights.

9491.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9491.quote: I want to state upfront, unequivocally and without doubt: I do not believe that any racial, ethnic or gender group has an advantage in sound judging. I do believe that every person has an equal opportunity to be a good and wise judge, regardless of their background or life experiences.

9492.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9492.quote: I honestly felt no envy or resentment, only astonishment at how much of a world there was out there and how much of it others already knew. The agenda for self-cultivation that had been set for my classmates by their teachers and parents was something I'd have to develop for myself.

9493.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9493.quote: Sometimes, idealistic people are put off the whole business of networking as something tainted by flattery and the pursuit of selfish advantage. But virtue in obscurity is rewarded only in Heaven. To succeed in this world you have to be known to people.

9494.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9494.quote: If your child marches to a different beat, a different drummer, you might just have to go along with that music. Help them achieve what's important to them.

9495.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9495.quote: A career is something that you train for and prepare for and plan on doing for a long time.

9496.author: Sonia Sotomayor
9496.quote: My hope is that I will take the good from my experiences and extrapolate them further into areas with which I am unfamiliar. I simply do not know exactly what that difference will be in my judging. But I accept there will be some based on my gender and my Latina heritage.

9497.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9497.quote: Prayer does not change God, but it changes him who prays.

9498.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9498.quote: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.

9499.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9499.quote: Be that self which one truly is.

9501.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9501.quote: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.

9502.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9502.quote: People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use.

9503.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9503.quote: Boredom is the root of all evil - the despairing refusal to be oneself.

9504.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9504.quote: What is a poet? An unhappy person who conceals profound anguish in his heart but whose lips are so formed that as sighs and cries pass over them they sound like beautiful music.

9505.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9505.quote: Life has its own hidden forces which you can only discover by living.

9506.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9506.quote: I see it all perfectly; there are two possible situations - one can either do this or that. My honest opinion and my friendly advice is this: do it or do not do it - you will regret both.

9507.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9507.quote: Our life always expresses the result of our dominant thoughts.

9508.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9508.quote: Most men pursue pleasure with such breathless haste that they hurry past it.

9509.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9509.quote: The highest and most beautiful things in life are not to be heard about, nor read about, nor seen but, if one will, are to be lived.

9510.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9510.quote: The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.

9511.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9511.quote: The tyrant dies and his rule is over, the martyr dies and his rule begins.

9512.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9512.quote: Face the facts of being what you are, for that is what changes what you are.

9513.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9513.quote: To dare is to lose one's footing momentarily. Not to dare is to lose oneself.

9514.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9514.quote: Once you label me you negate me.

9515.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9515.quote: The paradox is really the pathos of intellectual life and just as only great souls are exposed to passions it is only the great thinker who is exposed to what I call paradoxes, which are nothing else than grandiose thoughts in embryo.

9516.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9516.quote: Listen to the cry of a woman in labor at the hour of giving birth - look at the dying man's struggle at his last extremity, and then tell me whether something that begins and ends thus could be intended for enjoyment.

9517.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9517.quote: Patience is necessary, and one cannot reap immediately where one has sown.

9518.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9518.quote: The truth is a snare: you cannot have it, without being caught. You cannot have the truth in such a way that you catch it, but only in such a way that it catches you.

9519.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9519.quote: It seems essential, in relationships and all tasks, that we concentrate only on what is most significant and important.

9520.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9520.quote: People understand me so poorly that they don't even understand my complaint about them not understanding me.

9521.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9521.quote: There are, as is known, insects that die in the moment of fertilization. So it is with all joy: life's highest, most splendid moment of enjoyment is accompanied by death.

9522.author: Soren Kierkegaard
9522.quote: Personality is only ripe when a man has made the truth his own.

9523.author: Spike Milligan
9523.quote: My Father had a profound influence on me. He was a lunatic.

9524.author: Spike Milligan
9524.quote: All I ask is the chance to prove that money can't make me happy.

9525.author: Spike Milligan
9525.quote: We reach a secondary road and - here comes the bonus - we pass the Temple of Neptune and Cerene, at Paestum, both looking beautiful in the sunlight. Strung from the Doric columns are lines of soldiers' washing. At last they had been put to practical use. If only the ancient Greeks had known.

9526.author: Spike Milligan
9526.quote: A sure cure for seasickness is to sit under a tree.

9527.author: Spike Milligan
9527.quote: And God said, 'Let there be light' and there was light, but the Electricity Board said He would have to wait until Thursday to be connected.

9528.author: Spike Milligan
9528.quote: We come across thirty or so hurried graves with makeshift wooden markers. 'Private Edwards, E.', a number, and that was all. Fourteen days ago he was alive, thinking feeling, hoping... If war was a game of cards, I'd say someone was cheating.

9529.author: Spike Milligan
9529.quote: The night before Tilbury, the Cordon Bleu gourmet dinner turned out Cordon Brown. Six out of ten to the chef for trying and ten out of ten to us for eating it.

9530.author: Spike Milligan
9530.quote: I don't think of depression as contagious. Other depressed people challenge the idea - which can be very persistent and irritating - that there is something odd about you: that you are unique with regard to this wretched state.

9531.author: Spike Milligan
9531.quote: May 8th 1943. Deluge. The rain not only fell mainly on the plain in Spain; it also fell mainly on the back of the bloody neck, dripping down the spine into the socks where it came out of the lace-holes in the boots.

9532.author: Spike Milligan
9532.quote: I have the body of an eighteen year old. I keep it in the fridge.

9533.author: Spike Milligan
9533.quote: Money can't buy you happiness but it does bring you a more pleasant form of misery.

9534.author: Spike Milligan
9534.quote: Contraceptives should be used on every conceivable occasion.

9535.author: Spike Milligan
9535.quote: I am afraid that, like Timon of Athens, I just cannot let go of my friendships.

9536.author: Spike Milligan
9536.quote: Is the modern social pattern of unending change and movement the cause of two modern diseases, insecurity and dissatisfaction? How lucky Thomas Hood was to be able to write, 'I remember, I remember the house where I was born.' I don't even know what mine looked like!

9537.author: Spike Milligan
9537.quote: I shook hands with a friendly Arab. I still have my right arm to prove it.

9538.author: Spike Milligan
9538.quote: I spent many years laughing at Harry Secombe's singing until somebody told me that it wasn't a joke.

9539.author: Spike Milligan
9539.quote: I'm not afraid of dying I just don't want to be there when it happens.

9540.author: Spike Milligan
9540.quote: Money couldn't buy friends, but you got a better class of enemy.

9541.author: Spike Milligan
9541.quote: I can't stand being late. I try to be professional. I try not to let people down. But people let me down. That's why I don't rely on anyone to call me. That's why I have clocks as well as people. I have to be able to call myself; it's the only way to be sure.

9542.author: Spike Milligan
9542.quote: How long was I in the army? Five foot eleven.

9543.author: Spike Milligan
9543.quote: I thought I'd begin by reading a poem by Shakespeare, but then I thought, why should I? He never reads any of mine.

9544.author: Spike Milligan
9544.quote: Are you going to come quietly, or do I have to use earplugs?

9545.author: Spike Milligan
9545.quote: I'm a hero with coward's legs.

9546.author: Spike Milligan
9546.quote: Driver Shepherd and I had been detailed to drive Lt. Budden in the Wireless Truck. We had been standing by vehicles for an hour, and nothing had happened, but it happened frequently.

9547.author: Spike Milligan
9547.quote: When I get depressed, I try to get something for the terrible sadness that comes over me and create something in terms of poetry.

9548.author: Spike Milligan
9548.quote: You couldn't enclose people in institutions or hospitals or almshouses in the way the Victorians managed to do. India was too big. Seeing the suffering people was terrible, but I think I was more distraught at the needless cruelty to so many animals.

9549.author: St. Jerome
9549.quote: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. 'Til your good is better and your better is best.

9550.author: St. Jerome
9550.quote: The face is the mirror of the mind, and eyes without speaking confess the secrets of the heart.

9551.author: St. Jerome
9551.quote: Marriage is good for those who are afraid to sleep alone at night.

9552.author: St. Jerome
9552.quote: True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks.

9553.author: St. Jerome
9553.quote: Love is not to be purchased, and affection has no price.

9554.author: St. Jerome
9554.quote: The scars of others should teach us caution.

9556.author: St. Jerome
9556.quote: The friendship that can cease has never been real.

9557.author: St. Jerome
9557.quote: Why do you not practice what you preach.

9558.author: St. Jerome
9558.quote: They talk like angels but they live like men.

9559.author: St. Jerome
9559.quote: Be ever engaged, so that whenever the devil calls he may find you occupied.

9560.author: St. Jerome
9560.quote: A friend is long sought, hardly found, and with difficulty kept.

9561.author: St. Jerome
9561.quote: Keep doing some kind of work, that the devil may always find you employed.

9562.author: St. Jerome
9562.quote: Virginity can be lost by a thought.

9563.author: St. Jerome
9563.quote: What good is speed if the brain has oozed out on the way.

9564.author: St. Jerome
9564.quote: It is not enough for us to restrain from doing evil, unless we shall also do good.

9565.author: St. Jerome
9565.quote: A fat stomach never breeds fine thoughts.

9566.author: St. Jerome
9566.quote: I am like the sick sheep that strays from the rest of the flock. Unless the Good Shepherd takes me on His shoulders and carries me back to His fold, my steps will falter, and in the very effort of rising, my feet will give way.

9567.author: St. Jerome
9567.quote: Beauty when unadorned is adorned the most.

9568.author: St. Jerome
9568.quote: Those who persevere in sin are those who are held in abhorrence by God, but those who abandon the ways of sin are loved by the Lord.

9569.author: St. Jerome
9569.quote: My native land is a slave of heathenism, men's god is their belly, and they live only for the present. The richer a man, the holier.

9570.author: St. Jerome
9570.quote: Act as if the maxim of your action were to become through your will a be general natural law.

9571.author: St. Jerome
9571.quote: Someone may ask, 'How is justice greater than all the other virtues?' The other virtues gratify the one who possesses them; justice does not give pleasure to the one possessing it, but instead pleases others.

9572.author: St. Jerome
9572.quote: Being over seventy is like being engaged in a war. All our friends are going or gone and we survive amongst the dead and the dying as on a battlefield.

9573.author: St. Jerome
9573.quote: Action without a name, a 'who' attached to it, is meaningless.

9574.author: St. Jerome
9574.quote: I am that prodigal son who wasted all the portion entrusted to me by my father. But I have not yet fallen at my father's knees. I have not yet begun to put away from me the enticements of my former riotous living.

9575.author: Stan Lee
9575.quote: We live in a diverse society - in fact, a diverse world - and we must learn to live in peace and with respect for each other.

9576.author: Stan Lee
9576.quote: Sooner or later, if man is ever to be worthy of his destiny, we must fill our hearts with tolerance.

9577.author: Stan Lee
9577.quote: The pleasure of reading a story and wondering what will come next for the hero is a pleasure that has lasted for centuries and, I think, will always be with us.

9578.author: Stan Lee
9578.quote: I think I've never stopped feeling like a kid.

9579.author: Stan Lee
9579.quote: America is made of different races and different religions, but we're all co-travelers on the spaceship Earth and must respect and help each other along the way.

9580.author: Stan Lee
9580.quote: For years, kids have been asking me what's the greatest superpower. I always say luck. If you're lucky, everything works. I've been lucky.

9581.author: Stan Lee
9581.quote: I've been the luckiest man in the world because I've had friends, and to have the right friends is everything: people you can depend on, people who tell you the truth if you ask something.

9582.author: Stan Lee
9582.quote: If I'm half as good as everybody said I am, I'm far too good to be wasting time with ordinary people. But I seem to be spending my life with ordinary people, who are the best people in the world.

9583.author: Stan Lee
9583.quote: My mother was the greatest mother in the world. She thought I was the greatest thing on two feet. I'd come home with a little composition I had written at school, and she'd look at it and say, 'It's wonderful! You're another Shakespeare!' I always assumed I could do anything. It really is amazing how much that has to do with your attitude.

9584.author: Stan Lee
9584.quote: I always felt the 'X-Men,' in a subtle way, often touched upon the subject of racism and inequality, and I believe that subject has come up in other titles, too. But we would never pound hard on the subject, which must be handled with care and intelligence.

9585.author: Stan Lee
9585.quote: I like being with people. I like talking to them. I like everything about my life, so it's fun.

9586.author: Stan Lee
9586.quote: All of the characters at Marvel were my ideas, but the ideas meant nothing unless I had somebody who could illustrate it.

9587.author: Stan Lee
9587.quote: It's totally irrational, patently insane to condemn an entire race - to despise an entire nation - to vilify an entire religion.

9588.author: Stan Lee
9588.quote: I have always included minority characters in my stories, often as heroes.

9589.author: Stan Lee
9589.quote: I think the world has a place for gay superheroes, certainly.

9590.author: Stan Lee
9590.quote: I love Marvel and the people there. I'm glad I'm still part of it.

9591.author: Stan Lee
9591.quote: I always wrote for myself. I figured I'm not that different from other people. If there's a story I like a lot, there's got to be others with similar tastes.

9592.author: Stan Lee
9592.quote: I grew up in New York City during the Depression. My earliest recollections were of my parents talking about what they would do if they didn't have the rent money. Luckily, we were never evicted. But my father was unemployed most of the time.

9593.author: Stan Lee
9593.quote: When I was a kid, Disney was one of my gods. I just loved movies like 'Snow White' and 'Pinocchio.'

9594.author: Stan Lee
9594.quote: When I was a kid, my favorite superhero was Robin Hood.

9595.author: Stan Lee
9595.quote: Because I've spent most of my life with such a beautiful, talented, challenging female, I feel I've gained - and am still gaining - a great deal of knowledge about the feminine mystique and about personal relationships - knowledge which is so important to a writer.

9596.author: Stan Lee
9596.quote: The experience of reading a printed comic book will never change, but now, thanks to the digital age, there are many different ways to enjoy the same story. Digital comic books, of course, can be interactive in many different ways, allowing the reader to feel like a participant in the story.

9597.author: Stan Lee
9597.quote: I was stupid in a business way. I should have been greedier.

9598.author: Stan Lee
9598.quote: I have never had a lap dance in Tampa or any other part of Florida. If I ever did have a lap dance, I don't think I would be discussing television ideas with the girl that was giving it to me.

9599.author: Stan Lee
9599.quote: I don't sound disloyal, but I've never had a pair of Marvel pyjamas or underwear. I do have a lot of Marvel figurines at home in a cabinet. Every time they make a new Marvel figure I put it in my cabinet.

9600.author: Stan Lee
9600.quote: Marvel Studios has depicted the Marvel superheroes so beautifully that the whole world loves them.

9601.author: Stephen Covey
9601.quote: Every human has four endowments - self awareness, conscience, independent will and creative imagination. These give us the ultimate human freedom... The power to choose, to respond, to change.

9602.author: Stephen Covey
9602.quote: Leadership is a choice, not a position.

9603.author: Stephen Covey
9603.quote: The key is not to prioritize what's on your schedule, but to schedule your priorities.

9604.author: Stephen Covey
9604.quote: Listen with your eyes for feelings.

9605.author: Stephen Covey
9605.quote: Strength lies in differences, not in similarities.

9607.author: Stephen Covey
9607.quote: There are three constants in life... change, choice and principles.

9608.author: Stephen Covey
9608.quote: Listen with the intent to understand, not the intent to reply.

9609.author: Stephen Covey
9609.quote: Just as we develop our physical muscles through overcoming opposition - such as lifting weights - we develop our character muscles by overcoming challenges and adversity.

9610.author: Stephen Covey
9610.quote: The more people rationalize cheating, the more it becomes a culture of dishonesty. And that can become a vicious, downward cycle. Because suddenly, if everyone else is cheating, you feel a need to cheat, too.

9611.author: Stephen Covey
9611.quote: When you show deep empathy toward others, their defensive energy goes down, and positive energy replaces it. That's when you can get more creative in solving problems.

9612.author: Stephen Covey
9612.quote: Synergy is what happens when one plus one equals ten or a hundred or even a thousand! It's the profound result when two or more respectful human beings determine to go beyond their preconceived ideas to meet a great challenge.

9613.author: Stephen Covey
9613.quote: Stop setting goals. Goals are pure fantasy unless you have a specific plan to achieve them.

9614.author: Stephen Covey
9614.quote: Management is efficiency in climbing the ladder of success; leadership determines whether the ladder is leaning against the right wall.

9615.author: Stephen Covey
9615.quote: The key is taking responsibility and initiative, deciding what your life is about and prioritizing your life around the most important things.

9616.author: Stephen Covey
9616.quote: Trust is the glue of life. It's the most essential ingredient in effective communication. It's the foundational principle that holds all relationships.

9617.author: Stephen Covey
9617.quote: Synergy is better than my way or your way. It's our way.

9618.author: Stephen Covey
9618.quote: Find your voice and inspire others to find theirs.

9619.author: Stephen Covey
9619.quote: The deepest desire of the human spirit is to be acknowledged.

9620.author: Stephen Covey
9620.quote: Live out of your imagination, not your history.

9621.author: Stephen Covey
9621.quote: Effective leadership is putting first things first. Effective management is discipline, carrying it out.

9622.author: Stephen Covey
9622.quote: If you want small changes in your life, work on your attitude. But if you want big and primary changes, work on your paradigm.

9623.author: Stephen Covey
9623.quote: Seek first to understand, then to be understood.

9624.author: Stephen Covey
9624.quote: People and organizations don't grow much without delegation and completed staff work because they are confined to the capacities of the boss and reflect both personal strengths and weaknesses.

9625.author: Stephen Covey
9625.quote: The proactive approach to a mistake is to acknowledge it instantly, correct and learn from it.

9626.author: Stephen Covey
9626.quote: The main thing is to keep the main thing the main thing.

9627.author: Stephen Hawking
9627.quote: Look up at the stars and not down at your feet. Try to make sense of what you see, and wonder about what makes the universe exist. Be curious.

9628.author: Stephen Hawking
9628.quote: We are all now connected by the Internet, like neurons in a giant brain.

9629.author: Stephen Hawking
9629.quote: Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change.

9630.author: Stephen Hawking
9630.quote: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.

9631.author: Stephen Hawking
9631.quote: People won't have time for you if you are always angry or complaining.

9632.author: Stephen Hawking
9632.quote: Scientists have become the bearers of the torch of discovery in our quest for knowledge.

9633.author: Stephen Hawking
9633.quote: The past, like the future, is indefinite and exists only as a spectrum of possibilities.

9634.author: Stephen Hawking
9634.quote: Science is beautiful when it makes simple explanations of phenomena or connections between different observations. Examples include the double helix in biology and the fundamental equations of physics.

9635.author: Stephen Hawking
9635.quote: While physics and mathematics may tell us how the universe began, they are not much use in predicting human behavior because there are far too many equations to solve. I'm no better than anyone else at understanding what makes people tick, particularly women.

9636.author: Stephen Hawking
9636.quote: Science is not only a disciple of reason but, also, one of romance and passion.

9637.author: Stephen Hawking
9637.quote: Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.

9638.author: Stephen Hawking
9638.quote: We are in danger of destroying ourselves by our greed and stupidity. We cannot remain looking inwards at ourselves on a small and increasingly polluted and overcrowded planet.

9639.author: Stephen Hawking
9639.quote: Work gives you meaning and purpose and life is empty without it.

9640.author: Stephen Hawking
9640.quote: Stem cell research is the key to developing cures for degenerative conditions like Parkinson's and motor neuron disease from which I and many others suffer. The fact that the cells may come from embryos is not an objection, because the embryos are going to die anyway.

9641.author: Stephen Hawking
9641.quote: With genetic engineering, we will be able to increase the complexity of our DNA, and improve the human race. But it will be a slow process, because one will have to wait about 18 years to see the effect of changes to the genetic code.

9642.author: Stephen Hawking
9642.quote: My advice to other disabled people would be, concentrate on things your disability doesn't prevent you doing well, and don't regret the things it interferes with. Don't be disabled in spirit as well as physically.

9643.author: Stephen Hawking
9643.quote: I was not a good student. I did not spend much time at college; I was too busy enjoying myself.

9644.author: Stephen Hawking
9644.quote: There is no unique picture of reality.

9645.author: Stephen Hawking
9645.quote: I believe alien life is quite common in the universe, although intelligent life is less so. Some say it has yet to appear on planet Earth.

9646.author: Stephen Hawking
9646.quote: Even if it turns out that time travel is impossible, it is important that we understand why it is impossible.

9647.author: Stephen Hawking
9647.quote: In my school, the brightest boys did math and physics, the less bright did physics and chemistry, and the least bright did biology. I wanted to do math and physics, but my father made me do chemistry because he thought there would be no jobs for mathematicians.

9648.author: Stephen Hawking
9648.quote: I believe things cannot make themselves impossible.

9649.author: Stephen Hawking
9649.quote: If aliens visit us, the outcome would be much as when Columbus landed in America, which didn't turn out well for the Native Americans.

9650.author: Stephen Hawking
9650.quote: A few years ago, the city council of Monza, Italy, barred pet owners from keeping goldfish in curved bowls... saying that it is cruel to keep a fish in a bowl with curved sides because, gazing out, the fish would have a distorted view of reality. But how do we know we have the true, undistorted picture of reality?

9651.author: Stephen Hawking
9651.quote: Success in creating AI would be the biggest event in human history. Unfortunately, it might also be the last, unless we learn how to avoid the risks.

9652.author: Stephen Hawking
9652.quote: We are all different. There is no such thing as a standard or run-of-the-mill human being, but we share the same human spirit.

9653.author: Stephen King
9653.quote: The trust of the innocent is the liar's most useful tool.

9654.author: Stephen King
9654.quote: Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win.

9655.author: Stephen King
9655.quote: Talent is cheaper than table salt. What separates the talented individual from the successful one is a lot of hard work.

9656.author: Stephen King
9656.quote: Life is like a wheel. Sooner or later, it always come around to where you started again.

9657.author: Stephen King
9657.quote: Every book you pick up has its own lesson or lessons, and quite often the bad books have more to teach than the good ones.

9658.author: Stephen King
9658.quote: Get busy living, or get busy dying.

9659.author: Stephen King
9659.quote: I think there ought to be some serious discussion by smart people, really smart people, about whether or not proliferation of things like The Smoking Gun and TMZ and YouTube and the whole celebrity culture is healthy.

9660.author: Stephen King
9660.quote: Fiction is the truth inside the lie.

9661.author: Stephen King
9661.quote: People think that I must be a very strange person. This is not correct. I have the heart of a small boy. It is in a glass jar on my desk.

9662.author: Stephen King
9662.quote: We make up horrors to help us cope with the real ones.

9663.author: Stephen King
9663.quote: The place where you made your stand never mattered. Only that you were there... and still on your feet.

9664.author: Stephen King
9664.quote: You have to stay faithful to what you're working on.

9665.author: Stephen King
9665.quote: And as a writer, one of the things that I've always been interested in doing is actually invading your comfort space. Because that's what we're supposed to do. Get under your skin, and make you react.

9666.author: Stephen King
9666.quote: I had a period where I thought I might not be good enough to publish.

9667.author: Stephen King
9667.quote: A lot of us grow up and we grow out of the literal interpretation that we get when we're children, but we bear the scars all our life. Whether they're scars of beauty or scars of ugliness, it's pretty much in the eye of the beholder.

9668.author: Stephen King
9668.quote: If you want to be a writer, you must do two things above all others: read a lot and write a lot. There's no way around these two things that I'm aware of, no shortcut.

9669.author: Stephen King
9669.quote: Let's face it. No kid in high school feels as though they fit in.

9670.author: Stephen King
9670.quote: Each life makes its own immitation of immortality.

9671.author: Stephen King
9671.quote: It's better to be good than evil, but one achieves goodness at a terrific cost.

9672.author: Stephen King
9672.quote: French is the language that turns dirt into romance.

9673.author: Stephen King
9673.quote: The most important things are the hardest things to say. They are the things you get ashamed of because words diminish your feelings - words shrink things that seem timeless when they are in your head to no more than living size when they are brought out.

9674.author: Stephen King
9674.quote: Only enemies speak the truth; friends and lovers lie endlessly, caught in the web of duty.

9675.author: Stephen King
9675.quote: And in real life endings aren't always neat, whether they're happy endings, or whether they're sad endings.

9676.author: Stephen King
9676.quote: When his life was ruined, his family killed, his farm destroyed, Job knelt down on the ground and yelled up to the heavens, 'Why god? Why me?' and the thundering voice of God answered, 'There's just something about you that pisses me off.'

9677.author: Stephen King
9677.quote: We've switched from a culture that was interested in manufacturing, economics, politics - trying to play a serious part in the world - to a culture that's really entertainment-based.

9678.author: Stephen King
9678.quote: I recognize terror as the finest emotion and so I will try to terrorize the reader. But if I find that I cannot terrify, I will try to horrify, and if I find that I cannot horrify, I'll go for the gross-out. I'm not proud.

9679.author: Steve Jobs
9679.quote: Great things in business are never done by one person. They're done by a team of people.

9680.author: Steve Jobs
