10175.quote: It is amazing that people who think we cannot afford to pay for doctors, hospitals, and medication somehow think that we can afford to pay for doctors, hospitals, medication and a government bureaucracy to administer it.

10176.author: Thomas Sowell
10176.quote: Do countries with strong gun control laws have lower murder rates? Only if you cherry-pick the data.

10177.author: Thomas Sowell
10177.quote: What 'multiculturalism' boils down to is that you can praise any culture in the world except Western culture - and you cannot blame any culture in the world except Western culture.

10178.author: Thomas Sowell
10178.quote: What is ominous is the ease with which some people go from saying that they don't like something to saying that the government should forbid it. When you go down that road, don't expect freedom to survive very long.

10179.author: Thomas Sowell
10179.quote: Creating whole departments of ethnic, gender, and other 'studies' was part of the price of academic peace. All too often, these 'studies' are about propaganda rather than serious education.

10180.author: Thomas Sowell
10180.quote: Would you bet your paycheck on a weather forecast for tomorrow? If not, then why should this country bet billions on global warming predictions that have even less foundation?

10181.author: Thomas Sowell
10181.quote: Facts are not liberals' strong suit. Rhetoric is.

10182.author: Thomas Sowell
10182.quote: The time is long overdue to stop looking for progress through racial or ethnic leaders. Such leaders have too many incentives to promote polarizing attitudes and actions that are counterproductive for minorities and disastrous for the country.

10183.author: Thomas Sowell
10183.quote: It is a way to take people's wealth from them without having to openly raise taxes. Inflation is the most universal tax of all.

10184.author: Thomas Sowell
10184.quote: The word 'racism' is like ketchup. It can be put on practically anything - and demanding evidence makes you a 'racist.'

10185.author: Thomas Sowell
10185.quote: The real minimum wage is zero.

10186.author: Thomas Sowell
10186.quote: Those who cry out that the government should 'do something' never even ask for data on what has actually happened when the government did something, compared to what actually happened when the government did nothing.

10187.author: Thomas Sowell
10187.quote: Without a moral framework, there is nothing left but immediate self-indulgence by some and the path of least resistance by others. Neither can sustain a free society.

10188.author: Thomas Sowell
10188.quote: Life in general has never been even close to fair, so the pretense that the government can make it fair is a valuable and inexhaustible asset to politicians who want to expand government.

10189.author: Thomas Sowell
10189.quote: The least productive people are usually the ones who are most in favor of holding meetings.

10190.author: Thomas Sowell
10190.quote: The most fundamental fact about the ideas of the political left is that they do not work. Therefore we should not be surprised to find the left concentrated in institutions where ideas do not have to work in order to survive.

10191.author: Tom Brady
10191.quote: Who's my hero? That's a great question... Well, I think my dad is my hero, because he's someone I look up to every day.

10192.author: Tom Brady
10192.quote: To me, football is so much about mental toughness, it's digging deep, it's doing whatever you need to do to help a team win and that comes in a lot of shapes and forms.

10193.author: Tom Brady
10193.quote: Too often in life, something happens and we blame other people for us not being happy or satisfied or fulfilled. So the point is, we all have choices, and we make the choice to accept people or situations or to not accept situations.

10195.author: Tom Brady
10195.quote: I could talk food all day. I love good food.

10196.author: Tom Brady
10196.quote: I just love working hard. I love being part of a team; I love working toward a common goal.

10197.author: Tom Brady
10197.quote: If I feel anxious every time someone is staring at me, well, I can't control what they stare at, but my reaction is, I'm just not going to go outside the house. I'm going to stay in and chill. And when I do go out, I understand what comes along with that.

10198.author: Tom Brady
10198.quote: To score points, you need a lot of consistent effort over the course of the game. If you're throwing it or running it in, it's not a big difference in terms of the score at all, obviously. But turnovers limit your scoring. That's the problem with turnovers.

10199.author: Tom Brady
10199.quote: Every quarterback can throw a ball; every running back can run; every receiver is fast; but that mental toughness that you talk about translates into competitiveness.

10200.author: Tom Brady
10200.quote: The true competitors, though, are the ones who always play to win.

10201.author: Tom Brady
10201.quote: You have to believe in your process. You have to believe in the things that you are doing to help the team win. I think you have to take the good with the bad.

10202.author: Tom Brady
10202.quote: There's nothing more comfortable or leisurely than having a pair of Ugg slippers on in the house.

10203.author: Tom Brady
10203.quote: So many guys are so conservative with their hair, and I always joke with all my buddies when they mess with me, and I'll say, 'That's right, keep the same haircut for ten years.' How fun is that?

10204.author: Tom Brady
10204.quote: People want to go out and travel around and meet cool people. I could just go live in Vermont, but is that what I really want?

10205.author: Tom Brady
10205.quote: I like to have fun all the time, even if I'm working.

10206.author: Tom Brady
10206.quote: A lot of times I find that people who are blessed with the most talent don't ever develop that attitude, and the ones who aren't blessed in that way are the most competitive and have the biggest heart.

10207.author: Tom Brady
10207.quote: All I do is work out. Oh my God! Half my life is spent in a gym somewhere, sweating.

10208.author: Tom Brady
10208.quote: My job is to play quarterback, and I'm going to do that the best way I know how, because I owe that to my teammates regardless of who is out there on the field with me.

10209.author: Tom Brady
10209.quote: I don't want to say anything negative about anybody or anything or anybody's political beliefs. I've never done that. I've never tried to get involved in those things.

10210.author: Tom Brady
10210.quote: In Boston, they love their sports celebrities. And it's great.

10211.author: Tom Brady
10211.quote: I've never eaten a strawberry in my life. I have no desire to do that.

10212.author: Tom Brady
10212.quote: To me, if you're trying to impress a girl, get a date, they're gonna like that more because you're a confident guy. That's what it comes down to.

10213.author: Tom Brady
10213.quote: It's a real strength for me that I've never minded the training process. It's something I enjoy. I really like being in the gym or, certainly, on the field.

10214.author: Tom Brady
10214.quote: I don't believe you could be a 39-year-old quarterback in the NFL and eat cheeseburgers every day. I want to be able to do what I love to do for a long time.

10215.author: Tom Brady
10215.quote: I don't think any country is perfect. It's our responsibility to do the best we can do to change the things we don't like. I think that's part of social responsibility, and everybody is going to do that in their own way.

10216.author: Tom Brady
10216.quote: I'm not a person who defends myself very often. I kind of let my actions speak for me.

10217.author: Tony Robbins
10217.quote: Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.

10218.author: Tony Robbins
10218.quote: It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.

10219.author: Tony Robbins
10219.quote: To effectively communicate, we must realize that we are all different in the way we perceive the world and use this understanding as a guide to our communication with others.

10220.author: Tony Robbins
10220.quote: Stay committed to your decisions, but stay flexible in your approach.

10221.author: Tony Robbins
10221.quote: The path to success is to take massive, determined action.

10222.author: Tony Robbins
10222.quote: Only those who have learned the power of sincere and selfless contribution experience life's deepest joy: true fulfillment.

10223.author: Tony Robbins
10223.quote: We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish.

10224.author: Tony Robbins
10224.quote: The only limit to your impact is your imagination and commitment.

10225.author: Tony Robbins
10225.quote: Successful people ask better questions, and as a result, they get better answers.

10226.author: Tony Robbins
10226.quote: There is no such thing as failure. There are only results.

10227.author: Tony Robbins
10227.quote: We aren't in an information age, we are in an entertainment age.

10228.author: Tony Robbins
10228.quote: If you want to be successful, find someone who has achieved the results you want and copy what they do and you'll achieve the same results.

10229.author: Tony Robbins
10229.quote: Life is a gift, and it offers us the privilege, opportunity, and responsibility to give something back by becoming more.

10230.author: Tony Robbins
10230.quote: A real decision is measured by the fact that you've taken a new action. If there's no action, you haven't truly decided.

10231.author: Tony Robbins
10231.quote: If you do what you've always done, you'll get what you've always gotten.

10232.author: Tony Robbins
10232.quote: One reason so few of us achieve what we truly want is that we never direct our focus; we never concentrate our power. Most people dabble their way through life, never deciding to master anything in particular.

10233.author: Tony Robbins
10233.quote: There's no abiding success without commitment.

10234.author: Tony Robbins
10234.quote: People are not lazy. They simply have impotent goals - that is, goals that do not inspire them.

10235.author: Tony Robbins
10235.quote: It's not the events of our lives that shape us, but our beliefs as to what those events mean.

10236.author: Tony Robbins
10236.quote: Success comes from taking the initiative and following up... persisting... eloquently expressing the depth of your love. What simple action could you take today to produce a new momentum toward success in your life?

10238.author: Tony Robbins
10238.quote: You see, it's never the environment; it's never the events of our lives, but the meaning we attach to the events - how we interpret them - that shapes who we are today and who we'll become tomorrow.

10239.author: Tony Robbins
10239.quote: Passion is the genesis of genius.

10240.author: Tony Robbins
10240.quote: What we can or cannot do, what we consider possible or impossible, is rarely a function of our true capability. It is more likely a function of our beliefs about who we are.

10241.author: Tony Robbins
10241.quote: It is not what we get. But who we become, what we contribute... that gives meaning to our lives.

10242.author: Tony Robbins
10242.quote: You always succeed in producing a result.

10243.author: Travis Scott
10243.quote: There's a lot of us out here that are birds, man. We all need to just fly.

10244.author: Travis Scott
10244.quote: I'm just here for good times, man. I want people to have the best time ever. Especially if they're around me.

10245.author: Travis Scott
10245.quote: You can't buy vision, and you can't buy aesthetic.

10246.author: Travis Scott
10246.quote: I don't need a stage to perform. We just need something to stand on.

10247.author: Travis Scott
10247.quote: Everybody just has different steps in their life that they take to do what they should.

10248.author: Travis Scott
10248.quote: I'm La Flame at all times. That, at times, can be bad, at times can be good.

10249.author: Travis Scott
10249.quote: Drake is an amazing person. Also, a magician. He's a big brother, super-talent; he's cool.

10250.author: Travis Scott
10250.quote: My whole story is straight mythical. It's tangible, but it's also what life could be.

10251.author: Travis Scott
10251.quote: I'm attached to the beat. The beat speaks words. I love music.

10252.author: Travis Scott
10252.quote: Yes, money is important. But it's all about the creative process.

10253.author: Travis Scott
10253.quote: I design music; I don't produce it.

10255.author: Travis Scott
10255.quote: You can't buy being a rock star.

10256.author: Travis Scott
10256.quote: A nerd can call another nerd a nerd.

10257.author: Travis Scott
10257.quote: I feel like Houston is one of the leading things in music culture. Everyone loves the Houston culture. It needs to have its own monument, its own moment for artists like me, artists like Beyonce who set it off.

10258.author: Travis Scott
10258.quote: I think, with production, I pay very close attention. 'Cause that's my favorite thing in music. That's the whole drive. That's the reason.

10259.author: Travis Scott
10259.quote: You grow up in a small community, there's no outlet like New York or L.A.

10260.author: Travis Scott
10260.quote: I was a smart kid. I went to private school in middle school and got kicked out.

10261.author: Travis Scott
10261.quote: I know what my identity is.

10263.author: Travis Scott
10263.quote: I was born in Houston, Texas. I grew up in Houston, by Missouri City. It's, like, a suburb in the area; it's middle-class. But I used to stay with my grandma in the hood from ages one to six.

10264.author: Travis Scott
10264.quote: I want first and foremost to help other artists, launch new names, to provide opportunities. I want to do for them what happened to me, but better.

10265.author: Travis Scott
10265.quote: My work ethic is crazy. I'm a producer, an artist, and a video director.

10266.author: Travis Scott
10266.quote: Sometimes I might be sleepy, and sometimes I've literally been sleeping backstage, woken up, gone straight on stage or gone crazy. It's not like I psyche myself; I don't do any of that.

10267.author: Travis Scott
10267.quote: The most ironic thing is my grandfather has his masters in music composition; he was a jazz composer. My dad was a musician, too. He played more, like, soul music.

10268.author: Travis Scott
10268.quote: Me being in Houston, I wanted to leave there because it was only known for one thing. That's why I hit N.Y.; that's why I hit L.A. That's why I hit Paris, London. I just picked up basically everything, but I morphed it into what Travi$ Scott is and into what I know is fresh.

10269.author: Tupac Shakur
10269.quote: Reality is wrong. Dreams are for real.

10270.author: Tupac Shakur
10270.quote: My mama always used to tell me: 'If you can't find somethin' to live for, you best find somethin' to die for.'

10271.author: Tupac Shakur
10271.quote: It's the game of life. Do I win or do I lose? One day they're gonna shut the game down. I gotta have as much fun and go around the board as many times as I can before it's my turn to leave.

10272.author: Tupac Shakur
10272.quote: It's a struggle for every young Black man. You know how it is, only God can judge us.

10273.author: Tupac Shakur
10273.quote: I don't have no fear of death. My only fear is coming back reincarnated.

10274.author: Tupac Shakur
10274.quote: The only thing that comes to a sleeping man is dreams.

10275.author: Tupac Shakur
10275.quote: All I'm trying to do is survive and make good out of the dirty, nasty, unbelievable lifestyle that they gave me.

10276.author: Tupac Shakur
10276.quote: It seems like every time you come up something happens to bring you back down.

10277.author: Tupac Shakur
10277.quote: The only time I have problems is when I sleep.

10278.author: Tupac Shakur
10278.quote: Is it a crime, to fight, for what is mine?

10279.author: Tupac Shakur
10279.quote: I'm a reflection of the community.

10280.author: Tupac Shakur
10280.quote: I just spent 11 and a half months in a maximum-security jail, got shot five times, and was wrongly convicted of a crime I didn't commit.

10281.author: Tupac Shakur
10281.quote: Thug Life to me is dead.

10282.author: Tupac Shakur
10282.quote: Don't change on me. Don't extort me unless you intend to do it forever.

10283.author: Tupac Shakur
10283.quote: In my mind I'm a blind man doin' time.

10284.author: Tupac Shakur
10284.quote: We all gonna die, we bleed from similar veins.

10285.author: Tupac Shakur
10285.quote: I think I'm a natural-born leader. I know how to bow down to authority if it's authority that I respect.

10286.author: Tupac Shakur
10286.quote: I don't see myself being special; I just see myself having more responsibilities than the next man. People look to me to do things for them, to have answers.

10287.author: Tupac Shakur
10287.quote: Somebody help me, tell me where to go from here cause even Thugs cry, but do the Lord care?

10288.author: Tupac Shakur
10288.quote: I'll probably be punished for hard living.

10289.author: Tupac Shakur
10289.quote: I would rather have been shot straight-up in cold blood-but to be set up? By people who you trusted? That's bad.

10290.author: Tupac Shakur
10290.quote: There's nobody in the business strong enough to scare me.

10291.author: Tupac Shakur
10291.quote: What I learned in jail is that I can't change. I can't live a different lifestyle - this is it. This is the life that they gave and this is the life that I made.

10293.author: Tupac Shakur
10293.quote: Let the Lord judge the criminals.

10294.author: Tupac Shakur
10294.quote: I'm 23 years old. I might just be my mother's child, but in all reality, I'm everybody's child. Nobody raised me; I was raised in this society.

10295.author: Unknown
10295.quote: The past cannot be changed. The future is yet in your power.

10296.author: Unknown
10296.quote: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.

10297.author: Unknown
10297.quote: Turn your face to the sun and the shadows fall behind you.

10298.author: Unknown
10298.quote: Everybody wants to go to heaven, but nobody wants to die.

10299.author: Unknown
10299.quote: Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.

10300.author: Unknown
10300.quote: When a father gives to his son, both laugh; when a son gives to his father, both cry.

10301.author: Unknown
10301.quote: A picture is worth a thousand words.

10302.author: Unknown
10302.quote: Better to remain silent and be thought a fool than to speak out and remove all doubt.

10303.author: Unknown
10303.quote: The way is not in the sky. The way is in the heart.

10304.author: Unknown
10304.quote: In a time of universal deceit - telling the truth is a revolutionary act.

10305.author: Unknown
10305.quote: You should examine yourself daily. If you find faults, you should correct them. When you find none, you should try even harder.

10306.author: Unknown
10306.quote: The secret to creativity is knowing how to hide your sources.

10307.author: Unknown
10307.quote: You have to learn the rules of the game. And then you have to play better than anyone else.

10308.author: Unknown
10308.quote: Things may come to those who wait, but only the things left by those who hustle.

10309.author: Unknown
10309.quote: A man who stands for nothing will fall for anything.

10310.author: Unknown
10310.quote: It has become appallingly obvious that our technology has exceeded our humanity.

10311.author: Unknown
10311.quote: He was a wise man who invented beer.

10312.author: Unknown
10312.quote: An insincere and evil friend is more to be feared than a wild beast; a wild beast may wound your body, but an evil friend will wound your mind.

10313.author: Unknown
10313.quote: It's a damn poor mind that can only think of one way to spell a word.

10314.author: Unknown
10314.quote: There has to be evil so that good can prove its purity above it.

10315.author: Unknown
10315.quote: Anytime you see a turtle up on top of a fence post, you know he had some help.

10316.author: Unknown
10316.quote: True change takes place in the imagination.

10317.author: Unknown
10317.quote: All warfare is based on deception.

10318.author: Unknown
10318.quote: Never ascribe to malice that which is adequately explained by incompetence.

10319.author: Unknown
10319.quote: Large skepticism leads to large understanding. Small skepticism leads to small understanding. No skepticism leads to no understanding.

10320.author: Unknown
10320.quote: If the facts don't fit the theory, change the facts.

10321.author: Victor Hugo
10321.quote: Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human face.

10322.author: Victor Hugo
10322.quote: Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.

10323.author: Victor Hugo
10323.quote: Concision in style, precision in thought, decision in life.

10324.author: Victor Hugo
10324.quote: A mother's arms are made of tenderness and children sleep soundly in them.

10325.author: Victor Hugo
10325.quote: When a woman is talking to you, listen to what she says with her eyes.

10326.author: Victor Hugo
10326.quote: Life is the flower for which love is the honey.

10328.author: Victor Hugo
10328.quote: When grace is joined with wrinkles, it is adorable. There is an unspeakable dawn in happy old age.

10329.author: Victor Hugo
10329.quote: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.

10330.author: Victor Hugo
10330.quote: To give thanks in solitude is enough. Thanksgiving has wings and goes where it must go. Your prayer knows much more about it than you do.

10331.author: Victor Hugo
10331.quote: When dictatorship is a fact, revolution becomes a right.

10332.author: Victor Hugo
10332.quote: How did it happen that their lips came together? How does it happen that birds sing, that snow melts, that the rose unfolds, that the dawn whitens behind the stark shapes of trees on the quivering summit of the hill? A kiss, and all was said.

10333.author: Victor Hugo
10333.quote: Initiative is doing the right thing without being told.

10334.author: Victor Hugo
10334.quote: Change your opinions, keep to your principles; change your leaves, keep intact your roots.

10335.author: Victor Hugo
10335.quote: There is one spectacle grander than the sea, that is the sky; there is one spectacle grander than the sky, that is the interior of the soul.

10336.author: Victor Hugo
10336.quote: Be as a bird perched on a frail branch that she feels bending beneath her, still she sings away all the same, knowing she has wings.

10337.author: Victor Hugo
10337.quote: Intelligence is the wife, imagination is the mistress, memory is the servant.

10338.author: Victor Hugo
10338.quote: Short as life is, we make it still shorter by the careless waste of time.

10339.author: Victor Hugo
10339.quote: The wicked envy and hate; it is their way of admiring.

10340.author: Victor Hugo
10340.quote: To think of shadows is a serious thing.

10341.author: Victor Hugo
10341.quote: Forty is the old age of youth; fifty the youth of old age.

10342.author: Victor Hugo
10342.quote: The soul has illusions as the bird has wings: it is supported by them.

10343.author: Victor Hugo
10343.quote: Be like the bird who, pausing in her flight awhile on boughs too slight, feels them give way beneath her, and yet sings, knowing she hath wings.

10344.author: Victor Hugo
10344.quote: Adversity makes men, and prosperity makes monsters.

10345.author: Victor Hugo
10345.quote: All the forces in the world are not so powerful as an idea whose time has come.

10346.author: Victor Hugo
10346.quote: Virtue has a veil, vice a mask.

10347.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10347.quote: Between stimulus and response there is a space. In that space is our power to choose our response. In our response lies our growth and our freedom.

10348.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10348.quote: When we are no longer able to change a situation - we are challenged to change ourselves.

10349.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10349.quote: Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of human freedoms - to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose one's own way.

10350.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10350.quote: Everyone has his own specific vocation or mission in life; everyone must carry out a concrete assignment that demands fulfillment. Therein he cannot be replaced, nor can his life be repeated, thus, everyone's task is unique as his specific opportunity to implement it.

10351.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10351.quote: Since Auschwitz, we know what man is capable of. And since Hiroshima, we know what is at stake.

10352.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10352.quote: Challenging the meaning of life is the truest expression of the state of being human.

10353.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10353.quote: Man is that being who invented the gas chambers of Auschwitz; however, he is also that being who entered those chambers upright, with the Lord's Prayer or the Shema Yisrael on his lips.

10354.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10354.quote: In a position of utter desolation, when man cannot express himself in positive action, when his only achievement may consist in enduring his sufferings in the right way - an honorable way - in such a position man can, through loving contemplation of the image he carries of his beloved, achieve fulfillment.

10355.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10355.quote: The last of human freedoms - the ability to chose one's attitude in a given set of circumstances.

10356.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10356.quote: A man who becomes conscious of the responsibility he bears toward a human being who affectionately waits for him, or to an unfinished work, will never be able to throw away his life. He knows the 'why' for his existence, and will be able to bear almost any 'how.'

10357.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10357.quote: If there is a meaning in life at all, then there must be a meaning in suffering. Suffering is an ineradicable part of life, even as fate and death. Without suffering and death, human life cannot be complete.

10358.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10358.quote: For the meaning of life differs from man to man, from day to day and from hour to hour. What matters, therefore, is not the meaning of life in general but rather the specific meaning of a person's life at a given moment.

10359.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10359.quote: Life can be pulled by goals just as surely as it can be pushed by drives.

10360.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10360.quote: The more one forgets himself - by giving himself to a cause to serve or another person to love - the more human he is.

10361.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10361.quote: Live as if you were living a second time, and as though you had acted wrongly the first time.

10362.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10362.quote: A thought transfixed me: for the first time in my life, I saw the truth as it is set into song by so many poets, proclaimed as the final wisdom by so many thinkers. The truth - that love is the ultimate and the highest goal to which man can aspire.

10363.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10363.quote: Ultimately, man should not ask what the meaning of his life is, but rather he must recognize that it is he who is asked.

10364.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10364.quote: Ever more people today have the means to live, but no meaning to live for.

10365.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10365.quote: Being human always points, and is directed, to something or someone, other than oneself - be it a meaning to fulfill or another human being to encounter.

10366.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10366.quote: We who lived in concentration camps can remember the men who walked through the huts comforting others, giving away their last piece of bread.

10367.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10367.quote: When I was taken to the concentration camp of Auschwitz, a manuscript of mine ready for publication was confiscated. Certainly, my deep desire to write this manuscript anew helped me to survive the rigors of the camps I was in.

10368.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10368.quote: I recommend that the Statue of Liberty be supplemented by a Statue of Responsibility on the west coast.

10369.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10369.quote: When we are no longer able to change a situation - just think of an incurable disease such as an inoperable cancer - we are challenged to change ourselves.

10370.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10370.quote: Faith is trust in ultimate meaning.

10371.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10371.quote: No one can become fully aware of the very essence of another human being unless he loves him.

10372.author: Viktor E. Frankl
10372.quote: Even a genius cannot completely resist his Zeitgeist, the spirit of his time.

10373.author: Vince Lombardi
10373.quote: The price of success is hard work, dedication to the job at hand, and the determination that whether we win or lose, we have applied the best of ourselves to the task at hand.

10374.author: Vince Lombardi
10374.quote: Winners never quit and quitters never win.

10375.author: Vince Lombardi
10375.quote: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.

10376.author: Vince Lombardi
10376.quote: Practice does not make perfect. Only perfect practice makes perfect.

10377.author: Vince Lombardi
10377.quote: Individual commitment to a group effort - that is what makes a team work, a company work, a society work, a civilization work.

10378.author: Vince Lombardi
10378.quote: Football is like life - it requires perseverance, self-denial, hard work, sacrifice, dedication and respect for authority.

10379.author: Vince Lombardi
10379.quote: The achievements of an organization are the results of the combined effort of each individual.

10380.author: Vince Lombardi
10380.quote: The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.

10381.author: Vince Lombardi
10381.quote: Football is a great deal like life in that it teaches that work, sacrifice, perseverance, competitive drive, selflessness and respect for authority is the price that each and every one of us must pay to achieve any goal that is worthwhile.

10382.author: Vince Lombardi
10382.quote: The greatest accomplishment is not in never falling, but in rising again after you fall.

10383.author: Vince Lombardi
10383.quote: Winning is habit. Unfortunately, so is losing.

10384.author: Vince Lombardi
10384.quote: The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.

10385.author: Vince Lombardi
10385.quote: People who work together will win, whether it be against complex football defenses, or the problems of modern society.

10386.author: Vince Lombardi
10386.quote: I firmly believe that any man's finest hour, the greatest fulfillment of all that he holds dear, is that moment when he has worked his heart out in a good cause and lies exhausted on the field of battle - victorious.

10387.author: Vince Lombardi
10387.quote: Show me a good loser, and I'll show you a loser.

10388.author: Vince Lombardi
10388.quote: Mental toughness is spartanism with qualities of sacrifice, self-denial, dedication. It is fearlessness, and it is love.

10389.author: Vince Lombardi
10389.quote: The quality of a person's life is in direct proportion to their commitment to excellence, regardless of their chosen field of endeavor.

10390.author: Vince Lombardi
10390.quote: It's not whether you get knocked down, it's whether you get up.

10391.author: Vince Lombardi
10391.quote: We didn't lose the game; we just ran out of time.

10392.author: Vince Lombardi
10392.quote: Some guys play with their heads. That's okay. You've got to be smart to be number one in any business. But more importantly, you've got to play with your heart, with every fiber of your body.

10393.author: Vince Lombardi
10393.quote: Confidence is contagious. So is lack of confidence.

10394.author: Vince Lombardi
10394.quote: Leaders are made, they are not born. They are made by hard effort, which is the price which all of us must pay to achieve any goal that is worthwhile.

10395.author: Vince Lombardi
10395.quote: Every time a football player goes to ply his trade, he's got to play from the ground up - from the soles of his feet right up to his head. Every inch of him has to play.

10396.author: Vince Lombardi
10396.quote: Go back through football, and you will see that the team with the best defense wins.

10397.author: Vince Lombardi
10397.quote: It's easy to have faith in yourself and have discipline when you're a winner, when you're number one. What you got to have is faith and discipline when you're not a winner.

10398.author: Vince Lombardi
10398.quote: There is no room for second place. There is only one place in my game and that is first place. I have finished second twice in my time at Green Bay and I never want to finish second again.

10399.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10399.quote: Great things are done by a series of small things brought together.

10400.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10400.quote: I often think that the night is more alive and more richly colored than the day.

10401.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10401.quote: I dream of painting and then I paint my dream.

10402.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10402.quote: For my part I know nothing with any certainty, but the sight of the stars makes me dream.

10403.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10403.quote: I put my heart and my soul into my work, and have lost my mind in the process.

10404.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10404.quote: The fishermen know that the sea is dangerous and the storm terrible, but they have never found these dangers sufficient reason for remaining ashore.

10405.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10405.quote: There is no blue without yellow and without orange.

10406.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10406.quote: There may be a great fire in our hearts, yet no one ever comes to warm himself at it, and the passers-by see only a wisp of smoke.

10407.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10407.quote: What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?

10408.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10408.quote: I am still far from being what I want to be, but with God's help I shall succeed.

10409.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10409.quote: In spite of everything I shall rise again: I will take up my pencil, which I have forsaken in my great discouragement, and I will go on with my drawing.

10410.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10410.quote: Paintings have a life of their own that derives from the painter's soul.

10411.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10411.quote: The way to know life is to love many things.

10412.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10412.quote: I feel that there is nothing more truly artistic than to love people.

10413.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10413.quote: As we advance in life it becomes more and more difficult, but in fighting the difficulties the inmost strength of the heart is developed.

10414.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10414.quote: If you hear a voice within you say 'you cannot paint,' then by all means paint, and that voice will be silenced.

10415.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10415.quote: I wish they would only take me as I am.

10416.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10416.quote: Even the knowledge of my own fallibility cannot keep me from making mistakes. Only when I fall do I get up again.

10418.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10418.quote: Love always brings difficulties, that is true, but the good side of it is that it gives energy.

10419.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10419.quote: Love many things, for therein lies the true strength, and whosoever loves much performs much, and can accomplish much, and what is done in love is done well.

10420.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10420.quote: It is better to be high-spirited even though one makes more mistakes, than to be narrow-minded and all too prudent.

10421.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10421.quote: The more I think about it, the more I realize there is nothing more artistic than to love others.

10422.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10422.quote: Do not quench your inspiration and your imagination; do not become the slave of your model.

10423.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10423.quote: One must work and dare if one really wants to live.

10424.author: Vincent Van Gogh
10424.quote: Painting is a faith, and it imposes the duty to disregard public opinion.

10425.author: Vladimir Lenin
10425.quote: The goal of socialism is communism.

10426.author: Vladimir Lenin
10426.quote: One man with a gun can control 100 without one.

10427.author: Vladimir Lenin
10427.quote: A lie told often enough becomes the truth.

10428.author: Vladimir Lenin
10428.quote: Give me four years to teach the children and the seed I have sown will never be uprooted.

10429.author: Vladimir Lenin
10429.quote: The oppressed are allowed once every few years to decide which particular representatives of the oppressing class are to represent and repress them in parliament.

10430.author: Vladimir Lenin
10430.quote: The press should be not only a collective propagandist and a collective agitator, but also a collective organizer of the masses.

10431.author: Vladimir Lenin
10431.quote: If it were necessary to give the briefest possible definition of imperialism, we should have to say that imperialism is the monopoly stage of capitalism.

10432.author: Vladimir Lenin
10432.quote: The way to crush the bourgeoisie is to grind them between the millstones of taxation and inflation.

10434.author: Vladimir Lenin
10434.quote: There are no morals in politics; there is only expedience. A scoundrel may be of use to us just because he is a scoundrel.

10435.author: Vladimir Lenin
10435.quote: Freedom in capitalist society always remains about the same as it was in ancient Greek republics: Freedom for slave owners.

10436.author: Vladimir Lenin
10436.quote: No amount of political freedom will satisfy the hungry masses.

10438.author: Vladimir Lenin
10438.quote: A revolution is impossible without a revolutionary situation; furthermore, not every revolutionary situation leads to revolution.

10440.author: Vladimir Lenin
10440.quote: Without revolutionary theory there can be no revolutionary movement.

10441.author: Vladimir Lenin
10441.quote: When one makes a Revolution, one cannot mark time; one must always go forward - or go back. He who now talks about the 'freedom of the press' goes backward, and halts our headlong course towards Socialism.

10442.author: Vladimir Lenin
10442.quote: The most important thing when ill is to never lose heart.

10443.author: Vladimir Lenin
10443.quote: The best way to destroy the capitalist system is to debauch the currency.

10444.author: Vladimir Lenin
10444.quote: While the State exists there can be no freedom; when there is freedom there will be no State.

10445.author: Vladimir Lenin
10445.quote: Our program necessarily includes the propaganda of atheism.

10446.author: Vladimir Lenin
10446.quote: Crime is a product of social excess.

10447.author: Vladimir Lenin
10447.quote: Any cook should be able to run the country.

10448.author: Vladimir Lenin
10448.quote: Communism is Soviet power plus the electrification of the whole country.

10449.author: Vladimir Lenin
10449.quote: Capitalists are no more capable of self-sacrifice than a man is capable of lifting himself up by his own bootstraps.

10450.author: Vladimir Lenin
10450.quote: Give us the child for 8 years and it will be a Bolshevik forever.

10451.author: Voltaire
10451.quote: God gave us the gift of life; it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well.

10452.author: Voltaire
10452.quote: The ear is the avenue to the heart.

10453.author: Voltaire
10453.quote: The art of medicine consists in amusing the patient while nature cures the disease.

10454.author: Voltaire
10454.quote: Faith consists in believing when it is beyond the power of reason to believe.

10455.author: Voltaire
10455.quote: Tears are the silent language of grief.

10456.author: Voltaire
10456.quote: Appreciation is a wonderful thing: It makes what is excellent in others belong to us as well.

10457.author: Voltaire
10457.quote: It is better to risk saving a guilty man than to condemn an innocent one.

10458.author: Voltaire
10458.quote: Common sense is not so common.

10459.author: Voltaire
10459.quote: Judge a man by his questions rather than his answers.

10460.author: Voltaire
10460.quote: Those who can make you believe absurdities can make you commit atrocities.

10461.author: Voltaire
10461.quote: What is tolerance? It is the consequence of humanity. We are all formed of frailty and error; let us pardon reciprocally each other's folly - that is the first law of nature.

10462.author: Voltaire
10462.quote: Man is free at the moment he wishes to be.

10463.author: Voltaire
10463.quote: Friendship is the marriage of the soul, and this marriage is liable to divorce.

10464.author: Voltaire
10464.quote: It is difficult to free fools from the chains they revere.

10465.author: Voltaire
10465.quote: To hold a pen is to be at war.

10466.author: Voltaire
10466.quote: By appreciation, we make excellence in others our own property.

10467.author: Voltaire
10467.quote: Optimism is the madness of insisting that all is well when we are miserable.

10468.author: Voltaire
10468.quote: One great use of words is to hide our thoughts.

10469.author: Voltaire
10469.quote: It is not love that should be depicted as blind, but self-love.

10470.author: Voltaire
10470.quote: Life is thickly sown with thorns, and I know no other remedy than to pass quickly through them. The longer we dwell on our misfortunes, the greater is their power to harm us.

10471.author: Voltaire
10471.quote: Doubt is not a pleasant condition, but certainty is absurd.

10472.author: Voltaire
10472.quote: Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination.

10473.author: Voltaire
10473.quote: Opinion has caused more trouble on this little earth than plagues or earthquakes.

10474.author: Voltaire
10474.quote: Paradise was made for tender hearts; hell, for loveless hearts.

10475.author: Voltaire
10475.quote: Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do.

10476.author: Voltaire
10476.quote: Chance is a word void of sense; nothing can exist without a cause.

10477.author: W. C. Fields
10477.quote: Start every day off with a smile and get it over with.

10478.author: W. C. Fields
10478.quote: A rich man is nothing but a poor man with money.

10479.author: W. C. Fields
10479.quote: If you can't dazzle them with brilliance, baffle them with bull.

10480.author: W. C. Fields
10480.quote: I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food.

10481.author: W. C. Fields
10481.quote: Horse sense is the thing a horse has which keeps it from betting on people.

10482.author: W. C. Fields
10482.quote: Once, during Prohibition, I was forced to live for days on nothing but food and water.

10483.author: W. C. Fields
10483.quote: If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. Then quit. There's no point in being a damn fool about it.

10484.author: W. C. Fields
10484.quote: I never vote for anyone. I always vote against.

10485.author: W. C. Fields
10485.quote: Never try to impress a woman, because if you do she'll expect you to keep up the standard for the rest of your life.

10486.author: W. C. Fields
10486.quote: Always carry a flagon of whiskey in case of snakebite and furthermore always carry a small snake.

10487.author: W. C. Fields
10487.quote: It ain't what they call you, it's what you answer to.

10488.author: W. C. Fields
10488.quote: I am free of all prejudices. I hate everyone equally.

10490.author: W. C. Fields
10490.quote: Reminds me of my safari in Africa. Somebody forgot the corkscrew and for several days we had to live on nothing but food and water.

10491.author: W. C. Fields
10491.quote: The best cure for insomnia is to get a lot of sleep.

10492.author: W. C. Fields
10492.quote: I once spent a year in Philadelphia, I think it was on a Sunday.

10493.author: W. C. Fields
10493.quote: The laziest man I ever met put popcorn in his pancakes so they would turn over by themselves.

10494.author: W. C. Fields
10494.quote: There comes a time in the affairs of man when he must take the bull by the tail and face the situation.

10495.author: W. C. Fields
10495.quote: No doubt exists that all women are crazy; it's only a question of degree.

10496.author: W. C. Fields
10496.quote: I'd like to see Paris before I die... Philadelphia will do.

10497.author: W. C. Fields
10497.quote: It's morally wrong to allow a sucker to keep his money.

10498.author: W. C. Fields
10498.quote: Ah, the patter of little feet around the house. There's nothing like having a midget for a butler.

10499.author: W. C. Fields
10499.quote: Drown in a cold vat of whiskey? Death, where is thy sting?

10500.author: W. C. Fields
10500.quote: A woman drove me to drink and I didn't even have the decency to thank her.

10501.author: W. C. Fields
10501.quote: Some weasel took the cork out of my lunch.

10502.author: W. C. Fields
10502.quote: You can't trust water: Even a straight stick turns crooked in it.

10503.author: W. Clement Stone
10503.quote: If you are really thankful, what do you do? You share.

10504.author: W. Clement Stone
10504.quote: Aim for the moon. If you miss, you may hit a star.

10505.author: W. Clement Stone
10505.quote: Truth will always be truth, regardless of lack of understanding, disbelief or ignorance.

10506.author: W. Clement Stone
10506.quote: Sales are contingent upon the attitude of the salesman - not the attitude of the prospect.

10508.author: W. Clement Stone
10508.quote: Every great man, every successful man, no matter what the field of endeavor, has known the magic that lies in these words: every adversity has the seed of an equivalent or greater benefit.

10509.author: W. Clement Stone
10509.quote: Have the courage to say no. Have the courage to face the truth. Do the right thing because it is right. These are the magic keys to living your life with integrity.

10510.author: W. Clement Stone
10510.quote: Success is achieved and maintained by those who try and keep trying.

10511.author: W. Clement Stone
10511.quote: Like success, failure is many things to many people. With Positive Mental Attitude, failure is a learning experience, a rung on the ladder, a plateau at which to get your thoughts in order and prepare to try again.

10512.author: W. Clement Stone
10512.quote: What contemptible scoundrel has stolen the cork to my lunch?

10513.author: W. Clement Stone
10513.quote: All personal achievement starts in the mind of the individual. Your personal achievement starts in your mind. The first step is to know exactly what your problem, goal or desire is.

10514.author: W. Clement Stone
10514.quote: Definiteness of purpose is the starting point of all achievement.

10515.author: W. Clement Stone
10515.quote: To every disadvantage there is a corresponding advantage.

10516.author: W. Clement Stone
10516.quote: Your most precious, valued possessions and your greatest powers are invisible and intangible. No one can take them. You, and you alone, can give them. You will receive abundance for your giving.

10517.author: W. Clement Stone
10517.quote: No matter how carefully you plan your goals they will never be more than pipe dreams unless you pursue them with gusto.

10518.author: W. Clement Stone
10518.quote: There is little difference in people, but that little difference makes a big difference. The little difference is attitude. The big difference is whether it is positive or negative.

10519.author: W. Clement Stone
10519.quote: Be careful the environment you choose for it will shape you; be careful the friends you choose for you will become like them.

10520.author: W. Clement Stone
10520.quote: Big doors swing on little hinges.

10521.author: W. Clement Stone
10521.quote: When you do the wrong thing, knowing it is wrong, you do so because you haven't developed the habit of effectively controlling or neutralizing strong inner urges that tempt you, or because you have established the wrong habit and don't know how to eliminate them effectively.

10522.author: W. Clement Stone
10522.quote: You affect your subconscious mind by verbal repetition.

10523.author: W. Clement Stone
10523.quote: Everyone who achieves success in a great venture, solves each problem as they came to it. They helped themselves. And they were helped through powers known and unknown to them at the time they set out on their voyage. They keep going regardless of the obstacles they met.

10524.author: W. Clement Stone
10524.quote: When you discover your mission, you will feel its demand. It will fill you with enthusiasm and a burning desire to get to work on it.

10525.author: W. Clement Stone
10525.quote: To be happy, make other people happy.

10526.author: W. Clement Stone
10526.quote: You are a product of your environment. So choose the environment that will best develop you toward your objective. Analyze your life in terms of its environment. Are the things around you helping you toward success - or are they holding you back?

10527.author: W. Clement Stone
10527.quote: Thinking will not overcome fear but action will.

10528.author: W. Clement Stone
10528.quote: Tell everyone what you want to do and someone will want to help you do it.

10529.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10529.quote: Education must not simply teach work - it must teach Life.

10530.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10530.quote: I believe in Liberty for all men: the space to stretch their arms and their souls, the right to breathe and the right to vote, the freedom to choose their friends, enjoy the sunshine, and ride on the railroads, uncursed by color; thinking, dreaming, working as they will in a kingdom of beauty and love.

10531.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10531.quote: Reconstruction was a vast labor movement of ignorant, muddled, and bewildered white men who had been disinherited of land and labor and fought a long battle with sheer subsistence, hanging on the edge of poverty, eating clay and chasing slaves and now lurching up to manhood.

10532.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10532.quote: To be a poor man is hard, but to be a poor race in a land of dollars is the very bottom of hardships.

10533.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10533.quote: The Negro race, like all races, is going to be saved by its exceptional men. The problem of education, then, among Negroes must first of all deal with the Talented Tenth; it is the problem of developing the Best of this race that they may guide the Mass away from the contamination and death of the Worst, in their own and other races.

10534.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10534.quote: From the very first, it has been the educated and intelligent of the Negro people that have led and elevated the mass, and the sole obstacles that nullified and retarded their efforts were slavery and race prejudice; for what is slavery but the legalized survival of the unfit and the nullification of the work of natural internal leadership?

10535.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10535.quote: If white people need colleges to furnish teachers, ministers, lawyers, and doctors, do black people need nothing of the sort?

10536.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10536.quote: Education is that whole system of human training within and without the school house walls, which molds and develops men.

10537.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10537.quote: Education is the development of power and ideal.

10538.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10538.quote: No universal selfishness can bring social good to all. Communism - the effort to give all men what they need and to ask of each the best they can contribute - this is the only way of human life.

10539.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10539.quote: School houses do not teach themselves - piles of brick and mortar and machinery do not send out men. It is the trained, living human soul, cultivated and strengthened by long study and thought, that breathes the real breath of life into boys and girls and makes them human, whether they be black or white, Greek, Russian or American.

10540.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10540.quote: Most men today cannot conceive of a freedom that does not involve somebody's slavery.

10541.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10541.quote: A true and worthy ideal frees and uplifts a people; a false ideal imprisons and lowers.

10542.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10542.quote: I believe in God, who made of one blood all nations that on earth do dwell. I believe that all men, black and brown and white, are brothers, varying through time and opportunity, in form and gift and feature, but differing in no essential particular, and alike in soul and the possibility of infinite development.

10543.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10543.quote: Capitalism cannot reform itself; it is doomed to self-destruction.

10544.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10544.quote: Strange, is it not, my brothers, how often in America those great watchwords of human energy - 'Be strong!' 'Know thyself!' 'Hitch your wagon to a star!' - how often these die away into dim whispers when we face these seething millions of black men? And yet do they not belong to them? Are they not their heritage as well as yours?

10545.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10545.quote: What a world this will be when human possibilities are freed, when we discover each other, when the stranger is no longer the potential criminal and the certain inferior!

10546.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10546.quote: Education and work are the levers to uplift a people.

10547.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10547.quote: A system of education is not one thing, nor does it have a single definite object, nor is it a mere matter of schools. Education is that whole system of human training within and without the school house walls, which molds and develops men.

10548.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10548.quote: Before and after emancipation, the Negro, in self-defense, was propelled toward the white employer. The endowments of wealthy white men have developed great institutions of learning for the Negro, but the freedom of action on the part of these same universities has been curtailed in proportion as they are indebted to white philanthropies.

10549.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10549.quote: Before the Civil War, the Negro was certainly as efficient a workman as the raw immigrant from Ireland or Germany. But, whereas the Irishmen found economic opportunity wide and daily growing wider, the Negro found public opinion determined to 'keep him in his place.'

10550.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10550.quote: The problem of the twentieth century is the problem of the color line: the relation of the darker to the lighter races of men in Asia and Africa, in America and the islands of the sea.

10551.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10551.quote: The cost of liberty is less than the price of repression.

10552.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10552.quote: Progress in human affairs is more often a pull than a push, surging forward of the exceptional man, and the lifting of his duller brethren slowly and painfully to his vantage ground.

10553.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10553.quote: North as well as South, the Negroes have emerged from slavery into a serfdom of poverty and restricted rights.

10554.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
10554.quote: The Talented Tenth of the Negro race must be made leaders of thought and missionaries of culture among their people.

10557.author: W. Edwards Deming
10557.quote: A bad system will beat a good person every time.

10558.author: W. Edwards Deming
10558.quote: It is not enough to do your best; you must know what to do, and then do your best.

10559.author: W. Edwards Deming
10559.quote: If you can't describe what you are doing as a process, you don't know what you're doing.

10560.author: W. Edwards Deming
10560.quote: Profit in business comes from repeat customers, customers that boast about your project or service, and that bring friends with them.

10561.author: W. Edwards Deming
10561.quote: It is not necessary to change. Survival is not mandatory.

10562.author: W. Edwards Deming
10562.quote: Rational behavior requires theory. Reactive behavior requires only reflex action.

10563.author: W. Edwards Deming
10563.quote: Research shows that the climate of an organization influences an individual's contribution far more than the individual himself.

10564.author: W. Edwards Deming
10564.quote: If you don't understand how to run an efficient operation, new machinery will just give you new problems of operation and maintenance. The sure way to increase productivity is to better administrate man and machine.

10566.author: W. Edwards Deming
10566.quote: The big problems are where people don't realise they have one in the first place.

10567.author: W. Edwards Deming
10567.quote: Innovation comes from the producer - not from the customer.

10568.author: W. Edwards Deming
10568.quote: The prevailing - and foolish - attitude is that a good manager can be a good manager anywhere, with no special knowledge of the production process he's managing. A man with a financial background may know nothing about manufacturing shoes or cars, but he's put in charge anyway.

10569.author: W. Edwards Deming
10569.quote: Customer expectations? Nonsense. No customer ever asked for the electric light, the pneumatic tire, the VCR, or the CD. All customer expectations are only what you and your competitor have led him to expect. He knows nothing else.

10570.author: W. Edwards Deming
10570.quote: You can not define being exactly on time.

10571.author: W. Edwards Deming
10571.quote: We are here to make another world.

10572.author: W. Edwards Deming
10572.quote: What should be the aim of management? What is their job? Quality is the responsibility of the top people. Its origin is in the boardroom. They are the ones who decide.

10573.author: W. Edwards Deming
10573.quote: No one knows the cost of a defective product - don't tell me you do. You know the cost of replacing it, but not the cost of a dissatisfied customer.

10574.author: W. Edwards Deming
10574.quote: All anyone asks for is a chance to work with pride.

10575.author: W. Edwards Deming
10575.quote: People with targets and jobs dependent upon meeting them will probably meet the targets - even if they have to destroy the enterprise to do it.

10576.author: W. Edwards Deming
10576.quote: The prevailing system of management has crushed fun out of the workplace.

10577.author: W. Edwards Deming
10577.quote: The emphasis should be on why we do a job.

10578.author: W. Edwards Deming
10578.quote: 'Quality' means what will sell and do a customer some good - at least try to.

10579.author: W. Edwards Deming
10579.quote: Whenever there is fear, you will get wrong figures.

10580.author: W. Edwards Deming
10580.quote: Learning is not compulsory... neither is survival.

10581.author: Walt Disney
10581.quote: It's kind of fun to do the impossible.

10582.author: Walt Disney
10582.quote: If you can dream it, you can do it.

10583.author: Walt Disney
10583.quote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.

10584.author: Walt Disney
10584.quote: We keep moving forward, opening new doors, and doing new things, because we're curious and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths.

10585.author: Walt Disney
10585.quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.

10586.author: Walt Disney
10586.quote: All the adversity I've had in my life, all my troubles and obstacles, have strengthened me... You may not realize it when it happens, but a kick in the teeth may be the best thing in the world for you.

10587.author: Walt Disney
10587.quote: The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.

10588.author: Walt Disney
10588.quote: Times and conditions change so rapidly that we must keep our aim constantly focused on the future.

10589.author: Walt Disney
10589.quote: When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.

10590.author: Walt Disney
10590.quote: You can design and create, and build the most wonderful place in the world. But it takes people to make the dream a reality.

10591.author: Walt Disney
10591.quote: I only hope that we don't lose sight of one thing - that it was all started by a mouse.

10592.author: Walt Disney
10592.quote: I love Mickey Mouse more than any woman I have ever known.

10593.author: Walt Disney
10593.quote: Mickey Mouse popped out of my mind onto a drawing pad 20 years ago on a train ride from Manhattan to Hollywood at a time when business fortunes of my brother Roy and myself were at lowest ebb and disaster seemed right around the corner.

10594.author: Walt Disney
10594.quote: When you believe in a thing, believe in it all the way, implicitly and unquestionable.

10595.author: Walt Disney
10595.quote: I always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter.

10596.author: Walt Disney
10596.quote: Animation offers a medium of story telling and visual entertainment which can bring pleasure and information to people of all ages everywhere in the world.

10597.author: Walt Disney
10597.quote: There is more treasure in books than in all the pirate's loot on Treasure Island.

10598.author: Walt Disney
10598.quote: A man should never neglect his family for business.

10599.author: Walt Disney
10599.quote: Mickey Mouse is, to me, a symbol of independence. He was a means to an end.

10600.author: Walt Disney
10600.quote: Movies can and do have tremendous influence in shaping young lives in the realm of entertainment towards the ideals and objectives of normal adulthood.

10601.author: Walt Disney
10601.quote: I don't like formal gardens. I like wild nature. It's just the wilderness instinct in me, I guess.

10602.author: Walt Disney
10602.quote: Our heritage and ideals, our code and standards - the things we live by and teach our children - are preserved or diminished by how freely we exchange ideas and feelings.

10603.author: Walt Disney
10603.quote: I do not like to repeat successes, I like to go on to other things.

10604.author: Walt Disney
10604.quote: You're dead if you aim only for kids. Adults are only kids grown up, anyway.

10605.author: Walt Disney
10605.quote: I believe in being an innovator.

10606.author: Walt Disney
10606.quote: When people laugh at Mickey Mouse, it's because he's so human; and that is the secret of his popularity.

10607.author: Walt Whitman
10607.quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.

10608.author: Walt Whitman
10608.quote: Every moment of light and dark is a miracle.

10609.author: Walt Whitman
10609.quote: Simplicity is the glory of expression.

10610.author: Walt Whitman
10610.quote: I have learned that to be with those I like is enough.

10611.author: Walt Whitman
10611.quote: I believe a leaf of grass is no less than the journey-work of the stars.

10612.author: Walt Whitman
10612.quote: The art of art, the glory of expression and the sunshine of the light of letters, is simplicity.

10613.author: Walt Whitman
10613.quote: I am as bad as the worst, but, thank God, I am as good as the best.

10614.author: Walt Whitman
10614.quote: Let your soul stand cool and composed before a million universes.

10616.author: Walt Whitman
10616.quote: Re-examine all that you have been told... dismiss that which insults your soul.

10617.author: Walt Whitman
10617.quote: To me, every hour of the day and night is an unspeakably perfect miracle.

10618.author: Walt Whitman
10618.quote: Give me odorous at sunrise a garden of beautiful flowers where I can walk undisturbed.

10619.author: Walt Whitman
10619.quote: I exist as I am, that is enough.

10621.author: Walt Whitman
10621.quote: When I give I give myself.

10622.author: Walt Whitman
10622.quote: After you have exhausted what there is in business, politics, conviviality, and so on - have found that none of these finally satisfy, or permanently wear - what remains? Nature remains.

10623.author: Walt Whitman
10623.quote: Viewed freely, the English language is the accretion and growth of every dialect, race, and range of time, and is both the free and compacted composition of all.

10624.author: Walt Whitman
10624.quote: The future is no more uncertain than the present.

10625.author: Walt Whitman
10625.quote: Do I contradict myself? Very well, then I contradict myself, I am large, I contain multitudes.

10626.author: Walt Whitman
10626.quote: I no doubt deserved my enemies, but I don't believe I deserved my friends.

10627.author: Walt Whitman
10627.quote: There is no week nor day nor hour when tyranny may not enter upon this country, if the people lose their roughness and spirit of defiance.

10628.author: Walt Whitman
10628.quote: A morning-glory at my window satisfies me more than the metaphysics of books.

10629.author: Walt Whitman
10629.quote: Seeing, hearing, feeling, are miracles, and each part and tag of me is a miracle.

10630.author: Walt Whitman
10630.quote: I see great things in baseball. It's our game - the American game.

10631.author: Walt Whitman
10631.quote: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.

10632.author: Walt Whitman
10632.quote: I celebrate myself, and sing myself.

10633.author: Walter Scott
10633.quote: For success, attitude is equally as important as ability.

10634.author: Walter Scott
10634.quote: O, what a tangled web we weave when first we practise to deceive!

10635.author: Walter Scott
10635.quote: We build statues out of snow, and weep to see them melt.

10636.author: Walter Scott
10636.quote: Look back, and smile on perils past.

10637.author: Walter Scott
10637.quote: What I have to say is far more important than how long my eyelashes are.

10638.author: Walter Scott
10638.quote: Unless a tree has borne blossoms in spring, you will vainly look for fruit on it in autumn.

10639.author: Walter Scott
10639.quote: A lawyer without history or literature is a mechanic, a mere working mason; if he possesses some knowledge of these, he may venture to call himself an architect.

10640.author: Walter Scott
10640.quote: Success - keeping your mind awake and your desire asleep.

10641.author: Walter Scott
10641.quote: To all, to each, a fair good-night, and pleasing dreams, and slumbers light.

10642.author: Walter Scott
10642.quote: One hour of life, crowded to the full with glorious action, and filled with noble risks, is worth whole years of those mean observances of paltry decorum, in which men steal through existence, like sluggish waters through a marsh, without either honor or observation.

10643.author: Walter Scott
10643.quote: He is the best sailor who can steer within fewest points of the wind, and exact a motive power out of the greatest obstacles.

10644.author: Walter Scott
10644.quote: Each age has deemed the new-born year the fittest time for festal cheer.

10645.author: Walter Scott
10645.quote: What is a diary as a rule? A document useful to the person who keeps it. Dull to the contemporary who reads it and invaluable to the student, centuries afterwards, who treasures it.

10646.author: Walter Scott
10646.quote: To be ambitious of true honor, of the true glory and perfection of our natures, is the very principle and incentive of virtue.

10647.author: Walter Scott
10647.quote: Faces that have charmed us the most escape us the soonest.

10648.author: Walter Scott
10648.quote: Discretion is the perfection of reason, and a guide to us in all the duties of life.

10649.author: Walter Scott
10649.quote: O! many a shaft, at random sent, Finds mark the archer little meant! And many a word, at random spoken, May soothe or wound a heart that's broken!

10650.author: Walter Scott
10650.quote: If a farmer fills his barn with grain, he gets mice. If he leaves it empty, he gets actors.

10651.author: Walter Scott
10651.quote: Many miles away there's a shadow on the door of a cottage on the Shore of a dark Scottish lake.

10652.author: Walter Scott
10652.quote: A rusty nail placed near a faithful compass, will sway it from the truth, and wreck the argosy.

10653.author: Walter Scott
10653.quote: Love rules the court, the camp, the grove, And men below, and saints above: For love is heaven, and heaven is love.

10654.author: Walter Scott
10654.quote: It is wonderful what strength of purpose and boldness and energy of will are roused by the assurance that we are doing our duty.

10655.author: Walter Scott
10655.quote: There is a vulgar incredulity, which in historical matters, as well as in those of religion, finds it easier to doubt than to examine.

10656.author: Walter Scott
10656.quote: Success or failure in business is caused more by the mental attitude even than by mental capacities.

10657.author: Walter Scott
10657.quote: To the timid and hesitating everything is impossible because it seems so.

10658.author: Walter Scott
10658.quote: The race of mankind would perish did they cease to aid each other. We cannot exist without mutual help. All therefore that need aid have a right to ask it from their fellow-men; and no one who has the power of granting can refuse it without guilt.

10659.author: Warren Buffett
10659.quote: Someone is sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.

10660.author: Warren Buffett
10660.quote: In the business world, the rearview mirror is always clearer than the windshield.

10661.author: Warren Buffett
10661.quote: Price is what you pay. Value is what you get.

10662.author: Warren Buffett
10662.quote: Chains of habit are too light to be felt until they are too heavy to be broken.

10663.author: Warren Buffett
10663.quote: Rule No.1: Never lose money. Rule No.2: Never forget rule No.1.

10664.author: Warren Buffett
10664.quote: Predicting rain doesn't count. Building arks does.

10665.author: Warren Buffett
10665.quote: It takes 20 years to build a reputation and five minutes to ruin it. If you think about that, you'll do things differently.

10666.author: Warren Buffett
10666.quote: Risk comes from not knowing what you're doing.

10667.author: Warren Buffett
10667.quote: Only when the tide goes out do you discover who's been swimming naked.

10668.author: Warren Buffett
10668.quote: I buy expensive suits. They just look cheap on me.

10669.author: Warren Buffett
10669.quote: Derivatives are financial weapons of mass destruction.

10670.author: Warren Buffett
10670.quote: Wall Street is the only place that people ride to in a Rolls Royce to get advice from those who take the subway.

10671.author: Warren Buffett
10671.quote: The only way to get love is to be lovable. It's very irritating if you have a lot of money. You'd like to think you could write a check: 'I'll buy a million dollars' worth of love.' But it doesn't work that way. The more you give love away, the more you get.

10672.author: Warren Buffett
10672.quote: I always knew I was going to be rich. I don't think I ever doubted it for a minute.

10673.author: Warren Buffett
10673.quote: It's better to hang out with people better than you. Pick out associates whose behavior is better than yours and you'll drift in that direction.

10674.author: Warren Buffett
10674.quote: The first rule is not to lose. The second rule is not to forget the first rule.

10675.author: Warren Buffett
10675.quote: The best thing I did was to choose the right heroes.

10676.author: Warren Buffett
10676.quote: I never attempt to make money on the stock market. I buy on the assumption that they could close the market the next day and not reopen it for five years.

10677.author: Warren Buffett
10677.quote: The investor of today does not profit from yesterday's growth.

10678.author: Warren Buffett
10678.quote: In the 20th century, the United States endured two world wars and other traumatic and expensive military conflicts; the Depression; a dozen or so recessions and financial panics; oil shocks; a flu epidemic; and the resignation of a disgraced president. Yet the Dow rose from 66 to 11,497.

10679.author: Warren Buffett
10679.quote: Should you find yourself in a chronically leaking boat, energy devoted to changing vessels is likely to be more productive than energy devoted to patching leaks.

10681.author: Warren Buffett
10681.quote: Time is the friend of the wonderful company, the enemy of the mediocre.

10682.author: Warren Buffett
10682.quote: When you combine ignorance and leverage, you get some pretty interesting results.

10683.author: Warren Buffett
10683.quote: You know, people talk about this being an uncertain time. You know, all time is uncertain. I mean, it was uncertain back in - in 2007, we just didn't know it was uncertain. It was - uncertain on September 10th, 2001. It was uncertain on October 18th, 1987, you just didn't know it.

10684.author: Warren Buffett
10684.quote: There seems to be some perverse human characteristic that likes to make easy things difficult.

10685.author: Wayne Dyer
10685.quote: How people treat you is their karma; how you react is yours.

10686.author: Wayne Dyer
10686.quote: Be miserable. Or motivate yourself. Whatever has to be done, it's always your choice.

10687.author: Wayne Dyer
10687.quote: If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.

10688.author: Wayne Dyer
10688.quote: The truth is that there is no actual stress or anxiety in the world; it's your thoughts that create these false beliefs. You can't package stress, touch it, or see it. There are only people engaged in stressful thinking.

10689.author: Wayne Dyer
10689.quote: When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself.

10690.author: Wayne Dyer
10690.quote: Go for it now. The future is promised to no one.

10691.author: Wayne Dyer
10691.quote: When you dance, your purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It's to enjoy each step along the way.

10692.author: Wayne Dyer
10692.quote: To be more childlike, you don't have to give up being an adult. The fully integrated person is capable of being both an adult and a child simultaneously. Recapture the childlike feelings of wide-eyed excitement, spontaneous appreciation, cutting loose, and being full of awe and wonder at this magnificent universe.

10693.author: Wayne Dyer
10693.quote: The ego is only an illusion, but a very influential one. Letting the ego-illusion become your identity can prevent you from knowing your true self. Ego, the false idea of believing that you are what you have or what you do, is a backwards way of assessing and living life.

10694.author: Wayne Dyer
10694.quote: You can either be a host to God, or a hostage to your ego. It's your call.

10695.author: Wayne Dyer
10695.quote: Everything that's created comes out of silence. Your thoughts emerge from the nothingness of silence. Your words come out of this void. Your very essence emerged from emptiness. All creativity requires some stillness.

10696.author: Wayne Dyer
10696.quote: Real magic in relationships means an absence of judgment of others.

10697.author: Wayne Dyer
10697.quote: Self-worth comes from one thing - thinking that you are worthy.

10698.author: Wayne Dyer
10698.quote: Give yourself a gift of five minutes of contemplation in awe of everything you see around you. Go outside and turn your attention to the many miracles around you. This five-minute-a-day regimen of appreciation and gratitude will help you to focus your life in awe.

10699.author: Wayne Dyer
10699.quote: Miracles come in moments. Be ready and willing.

10700.author: Wayne Dyer
10700.quote: The essential lesson I've learned in life is to just be yourself. Treasure the magnificent being that you are and recognize first and foremost you're not here as a human being only. You're a spiritual being having a human experience.

10701.author: Wayne Dyer
10701.quote: Live one day at a time emphasizing ethics rather than rules.

10702.author: Wayne Dyer
10702.quote: Conflict cannot survive without your participation.

10703.author: Wayne Dyer
10703.quote: The child inside of you knows how to take things as they come, how to deal most effectively and happily with everything and everyone it encounters on this planet. If you can recapture that childlike essence of your being, you can stay 'forever young at heart.'

10704.author: Wayne Dyer
10704.quote: You aren't your work, your accomplishments, your possessions, your home, your family... your anything. You're a creation of your Source, dressed in a physical human body intended to experience and enjoy life on Earth.

10705.author: Wayne Dyer
10705.quote: Your life is like a play with several acts. Some of the characters who enter have short roles to play, others, much larger. Some are villains and others are good guys. But all of them are necessary; otherwise, they wouldn't be in the play. Embrace them all, and move on to the next act.

10706.author: Wayne Dyer
10706.quote: Within all of us is a divine capacity to manifest and attract all that we need and desire.

10707.author: Wayne Dyer
10707.quote: If you have passion, there is no need for excuses because your enthusiasm will trump any negative reasoning you might come up with. Enthusiasm makes excuses a nonissue.

10709.author: Wayne Dyer
10709.quote: The highest form of ignorance is when you reject something you don't know anything about.

10710.author: Wayne Dyer
10710.quote: When you are spiritually connected, you are not looking for occasions to be offended, and you are not judging and labeling others. You are in a state of grace in which you know you are connected to God and thus free from the effects of anyone or anything external to yourself.

10711.author: Will Rogers
10711.quote: It's not what you pay a man, but what he costs you that counts.

10712.author: Will Rogers
10712.quote: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.

10713.author: Will Rogers
10713.quote: I am not a member of any organized political party. I am a Democrat.

10714.author: Will Rogers
10714.quote: Be thankful we're not getting all the government we're paying for.

10715.author: Will Rogers
10715.quote: Everything is funny, as long as it's happening to somebody else.

10716.author: Will Rogers
10716.quote: Don't let yesterday use up too much of today.

10717.author: Will Rogers
10717.quote: The farmer has to be an optimist or he wouldn't still be a farmer.

10718.author: Will Rogers
10718.quote: I don't make jokes. I just watch the government and report the facts.

10719.author: Will Rogers
10719.quote: Good judgment comes from experience, and a lot of that comes from bad judgment.

10720.author: Will Rogers
10720.quote: Diplomacy is the art of saying 'Nice doggie' until you can find a rock.

10721.author: Will Rogers
10721.quote: People's minds are changed through observation and not through argument.

10722.author: Will Rogers
10722.quote: A fool and his money are soon elected.

10723.author: Will Rogers
10723.quote: Advertising is the art of convincing people to spend money they don't have for something they don't need.

10724.author: Will Rogers
10724.quote: Make crime pay. Become a lawyer.

10725.author: Will Rogers
10725.quote: Everything is changing. People are taking their comedians seriously and the politicians as a joke.

10726.author: Will Rogers
10726.quote: The only time people dislike gossip is when you gossip about them.

10727.author: Will Rogers
10727.quote: You've got to go out on a limb sometimes because that's where the fruit is.

10728.author: Will Rogers
10728.quote: Too many people spend money they haven't earned to buy things they don't want to impress people they don't like.

10729.author: Will Rogers
10729.quote: There are three kinds of men. The one that learns by reading. The few who learn by observation. The rest of them have to pee on the electric fence for themselves.

10730.author: Will Rogers
