10730.quote: Instead of giving money to found colleges to promote learning, why don't they pass a constitutional amendment prohibiting anybody from learning anything? If it works as good as the Prohibition one did, why, in five years we would have the smartest race of people on earth.

10731.author: Will Rogers
10731.quote: If Stupidity got us into this mess, then why can't it get us out?

10732.author: Will Rogers
10732.quote: Why don't they pass a constitutional amendment prohibiting anybody from learning anything? If it works as well as prohibition did, in five years Americans would be the smartest race of people on Earth.

10733.author: Will Rogers
10733.quote: People who fly into a rage always make a bad landing.

10734.author: Will Rogers
10734.quote: We will never have true civilization until we have learned to recognize the rights of others.

10735.author: Will Rogers
10735.quote: A man only learns in two ways, one by reading, and the other by association with smarter people.

10736.author: Will Rogers
10736.quote: If you want to be successful, it's just this simple. Know what you are doing. Love what you are doing. And believe in what you are doing.

10737.author: William Arthur Ward
10737.quote: Gratitude can transform common days into thanksgivings, turn routine jobs into joy, and change ordinary opportunities into blessings.

10738.author: William Arthur Ward
10738.quote: Feeling gratitude and not expressing it is like wrapping a present and not giving it.

10739.author: William Arthur Ward
10739.quote: A warm smile is the universal language of kindness.

10740.author: William Arthur Ward
10740.quote: Opportunities are like sunrises. If you wait too long, you miss them.

10741.author: William Arthur Ward
10741.quote: The mediocre teacher tells. The good teacher explains. The superior teacher demonstrates. The great teacher inspires.

10742.author: William Arthur Ward
10742.quote: Adversity causes some men to break; others to break records.

10743.author: William Arthur Ward
10743.quote: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.

10744.author: William Arthur Ward
10744.quote: Curiosity is the wick in the candle of learning.

10745.author: William Arthur Ward
10745.quote: Change, like sunshine, can be a friend or a foe, a blessing or a curse, a dawn or a dusk.

10746.author: William Arthur Ward
10746.quote: If you can imagine it, you can achieve it. If you can dream it, you can become it.

10747.author: William Arthur Ward
10747.quote: When we seek to discover the best in others, we somehow bring out the best in ourselves.

10748.author: William Arthur Ward
10748.quote: Flatter me, and I may not believe you. Criticize me, and I may not like you. Ignore me, and I may not forgive you. Encourage me, and I will not forget you. Love me and I may be forced to love you.

10749.author: William Arthur Ward
10749.quote: It is wise to direct your anger towards problems - not people; to focus your energies on answers - not excuses.

10750.author: William Arthur Ward
10750.quote: Forgiveness is a funny thing. It warms the heart and cools the sting.

10751.author: William Arthur Ward
10751.quote: A cloudy day is no match for a sunny disposition.

10752.author: William Arthur Ward
10752.quote: The more generous we are, the more joyous we become. The more cooperative we are, the more valuable we become. The more enthusiastic we are, the more productive we become. The more serving we are, the more prosperous we become.

10753.author: William Arthur Ward
10753.quote: A well-developed sense of humor is the pole that adds balance to your steps as you walk the tightrope of life.

10754.author: William Arthur Ward
10754.quote: Today is a most unusual day, because we have never lived it before; we will never live it again; it is the only day we have.

10755.author: William Arthur Ward
10755.quote: God gave you a gift of 86,400 seconds today. Have you used one to say 'thank you?'

10757.author: William Arthur Ward
10757.quote: To make mistakes is human; to stumble is commonplace; to be able to laugh at yourself is maturity.

10758.author: William Arthur Ward
10758.quote: Lose yourself in generous service and every day can be a most unusual day, a triumphant day, an abundantly rewarding day!

10759.author: William Arthur Ward
10759.quote: Humanity either makes, or breeds, or tolerates all its afflictions.

10760.author: William Arthur Ward
10760.quote: Wise are they who have learned these truths: Trouble is temporary. Time is tonic. Tribulation is a test tube.

10761.author: William Arthur Ward
10761.quote: We can learn much from wise words, little from wisecracks, and less from wise guys.

10762.author: William Arthur Ward
10762.quote: Wise are those who learn that the bottom line doesn't always have to be their top priority.

10763.author: William Barclay
10763.quote: There are two great days in a person's life - the day we are born and the day we discover why.

10764.author: William Barclay
10764.quote: Endurance is not just the ability to bear a hard thing, but to turn it into glory.

10765.author: William Barclay
10765.quote: Love always involves responsibility, and love always involves sacrifice. And we do not really love Christ unless we are prepared to face His task and to take up His Cross.

10766.author: William Barclay
10766.quote: A man may well be condemned, not for doing something, but for doing nothing.

10767.author: William Barclay
10767.quote: When we love anyone with our whole hearts, life begins when we are with that person; it is only in their company that we are really and truly alive.

10768.author: William Barclay
10768.quote: The awful importance of this life is that it determines eternity.

10769.author: William Barclay
10769.quote: For the Christian, heaven is where Jesus is. We do not need to speculate on what heaven will be like. It is enough to know that we will be for ever with Him.

10770.author: William Barclay
10770.quote: Religion fails if it cannot speak to men as they are.

10771.author: William Barclay
10771.quote: The tragedy of life and of the world is not that men do not know God; the tragedy is that, knowing Him, they still insist on going their own way.

10772.author: William Barclay
10772.quote: If a man fights his way through his doubts to the conviction that Jesus Christ is Lord, he has attained to a certainty that the man who unthinkingly accepts things can never reach.

10773.author: William Barclay
10773.quote: We will often find compensation if we think more of what life has given us and less about what life has taken away.

10774.author: William Barclay
10774.quote: In the time we have it is surely our duty to do all the good we can to all the people we can in all the ways we can.

10775.author: William Barclay
10775.quote: When we believe that God is Father, we also believe that such a father's hand will never cause his child a needless tear. We may not understand life any better, but we will not resent life any longer.

10776.author: William Barclay
10776.quote: But the best definition of it is to say that heaven is that state where we will always be with Jesus, and where nothing will separate us from Him any more.

10777.author: William Barclay
10777.quote: God himself took this human flesh upon him.

10778.author: William Blake
10778.quote: The thankful receiver bears a plentiful harvest.

10779.author: William Blake
10779.quote: The tigers of wrath are wiser than the horses of instruction.

10780.author: William Blake
10780.quote: Think in the morning. Act in the noon. Eat in the evening. Sleep in the night.

10781.author: William Blake
10781.quote: Great things are done when men and mountains meet.

10782.author: William Blake
10782.quote: No bird soars too high if he soars with his own wings.

10783.author: William Blake
10783.quote: To see a world in a grain of sand and heaven in a wild flower Hold infinity in the palm of your hand and eternity in an hour.

10784.author: William Blake
10784.quote: When the green woods laugh with the voice of joy, And the dimpling stream runs laughing by; When the air does laugh with our merry wit, And the green hill laughs with the noise of it.

10785.author: William Blake
10785.quote: The bird a nest, the spider a web, man friendship.

10786.author: William Blake
10786.quote: A fool sees not the same tree that a wise man sees.

10787.author: William Blake
10787.quote: Art can never exist without naked beauty displayed.

10788.author: William Blake
10788.quote: I am in you and you in me, mutual in divine love.

10789.author: William Blake
10789.quote: In seed time learn, in harvest teach, in winter enjoy.

10791.author: William Blake
10791.quote: If the doors of perception were cleansed everything would appear to man as it is, infinite.

10792.author: William Blake
10792.quote: Art is the tree of life. Science is the tree of death.

10793.author: William Blake
10793.quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.

10794.author: William Blake
10794.quote: The true method of knowledge is experiment.

10795.author: William Blake
10795.quote: The glory of Christianity is to conquer by forgiveness.

10796.author: William Blake
10796.quote: The tree which moves some to tears of joy is in the eyes of others only a green thing that stands in the way. Some see nature all ridicule and deformity... and some scarce see nature at all. But to the eyes of the man of imagination, nature is imagination itself.

10797.author: William Blake
10797.quote: Without contraries is no progression. Attraction and repulsion, reason and energy, love and hate, are necessary to human existence.

10798.author: William Blake
10798.quote: The road of excess leads to the palace of wisdom.

10799.author: William Blake
10799.quote: When I tell the truth, it is not for the sake of convincing those who do not know it, but for the sake of defending those that do.

10800.author: William Blake
10800.quote: He who binds to himself a joy Does the winged life destroy; But he who kisses the joy as it flies Lives in eternity's sun rise.

10801.author: William Blake
10801.quote: What is a wife and what is a harlot? What is a church and what is a theatre? are they two and not one? Can they exist separate? Are not religion and politics the same thing? Brotherhood is religion. O demonstrations of reason dividing families in cruelty and pride!

10802.author: William Blake
10802.quote: I was angry with my friend: I told my wrath, my wrath did end. I was angry with my foe: I told it not, my wrath did grow.

10803.author: William Blake
10803.quote: Imagination is the real and eternal world of which this vegetable universe is but a faint shadow.

10804.author: William Butler Yeats
10804.quote: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met.

10805.author: William Butler Yeats
10805.quote: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.

10806.author: William Butler Yeats
10806.quote: Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire.

10807.author: William Butler Yeats
10807.quote: Come Fairies, take me out of this dull world, for I would ride with you upon the wind and dance upon the mountains like a flame!

10808.author: William Butler Yeats
10808.quote: How far away the stars seem, and how far is our first kiss, and ah, how old my heart.

10809.author: William Butler Yeats
10809.quote: The innocent and the beautiful have no enemy but time.

10810.author: William Butler Yeats
10810.quote: The worst thing about some men is that when they are not drunk they are sober.

10811.author: William Butler Yeats
10811.quote: Think like a wise man but communicate in the language of the people.

10812.author: William Butler Yeats
10812.quote: Take, if you must, this little bag of dreams, Unloose the cord, and they will wrap you round.

10813.author: William Butler Yeats
10813.quote: The best lack all conviction, while the worst are full of passionate intensity.

10815.author: William Butler Yeats
10815.quote: If suffering brings wisdom, I would wish to be less wise.

10817.author: William Butler Yeats
10817.quote: I think you can leave the arts, superior or inferior, to the conscience of mankind.

10818.author: William Butler Yeats
10818.quote: Happiness is neither virtue nor pleasure nor this thing nor that but simply growth, We are happy when we are growing.

10819.author: William Butler Yeats
10819.quote: The light of lights looks always on the motive, not the deed, the shadow of shadows on the deed alone.

10820.author: William Butler Yeats
10820.quote: I have believed the best of every man. And find that to believe is enough to make a bad man show him at his best, or even a good man swings his lantern higher.

10821.author: William Butler Yeats
10821.quote: Being Irish, he had an abiding sense of tragedy, which sustained him through temporary periods of joy.

10822.author: William Butler Yeats
10822.quote: Think where man's glory most begins and ends, and say my glory was I had such friends.

10823.author: William Butler Yeats
10823.quote: And say my glory was I had such friends.

10824.author: William Butler Yeats
10824.quote: Come away, O human child: To the waters and the wild with a fairy, hand in hand, For the world's more full of weeping than you can understand.

10825.author: William Butler Yeats
10825.quote: Too long a sacrifice can make a stone of the heart. O when may it suffice?

10826.author: William Butler Yeats
10826.quote: When you are old and gray and full of sleep, and nodding by the fire, take down this book and slowly read, and dream of the soft look your eyes had once, and of their shadows deep.

10827.author: William Butler Yeats
10827.quote: Life is a long preparation for something that never happens.

10828.author: William Butler Yeats
10828.quote: We make out of the quarrel with others, rhetoric, but of the quarrel with ourselves, poetry.

10829.author: William Butler Yeats
10829.quote: I wonder anybody does anything at Oxford but dream and remember, the place is so beautiful. One almost expects the people to sing instead of speaking. It is all like an opera.

10830.author: William Goldman
10830.quote: Life isn't fair. It's just fairer than death, that's all.

10831.author: William Goldman
10831.quote: The easiest thing to do on earth is not write.

10832.author: William Goldman
10832.quote: Life is pain, highness. Anyone who tells you differently is selling something.

10833.author: William Goldman
10833.quote: We are men of action, lies do not become us.

10834.author: William Goldman
10834.quote: As far as the filmmaking process is concerned, stars are essentially worthless - and absolutely essential.

10835.author: William Goldman
10835.quote: Being a screenwriter is not enough for a full creative life.

10836.author: William Goldman
10836.quote: But this is life on earth, you can't have everything.

10838.author: William Goldman
10838.quote: One way an author dies a little each day is when his books go out of print.

10839.author: William Goldman
10839.quote: Yes, I am a failed playwright. I had three shows on Broadway by the time I was 30. They all flopped, and I fled.

10840.author: William Goldman
10840.quote: There is one crucial rule that must be followed in all creative meetings. Never speak first. At least at the start, your job is to shut up.

10841.author: William Goldman
10841.quote: You can never trust what you read.

10842.author: William Goldman
10842.quote: Never argue with your wife about hostility when she's a certified Freudian.

10843.author: William James
10843.quote: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.

10844.author: William James
10844.quote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.

10845.author: William James
10845.quote: Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.

10846.author: William James
10846.quote: Pessimism leads to weakness, optimism to power.

10847.author: William James
10847.quote: Acceptance of what has happened is the first step to overcoming the consequences of any misfortune.

10848.author: William James
10848.quote: The deepest principle in human nature is the craving to be appreciated.

10849.author: William James
10849.quote: The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes.

10851.author: William James
10851.quote: Begin to be now what you will be hereafter.

10852.author: William James
10852.quote: We are all ready to be savage in some cause. The difference between a good man and a bad one is the choice of the cause.

10853.author: William James
10853.quote: Success or failure depends more upon attitude than upon capacity successful men act as though they have accomplished or are enjoying something. Soon it becomes a reality. Act, look, feel successful, conduct yourself accordingly, and you will be amazed at the positive results.

10854.author: William James
10854.quote: Whenever you're in conflict with someone, there is one factor that can make the difference between damaging your relationship and deepening it. That factor is attitude.

10855.author: William James
10855.quote: The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.

10856.author: William James
10856.quote: It is our attitude at the beginning of a difficult task which, more than anything else, will affect its successful outcome.

10857.author: William James
10857.quote: If you care enough for a result, you will most certainly attain it.

10858.author: William James
10858.quote: The aim of a college education is to teach you to know a good man when you see one.

10859.author: William James
10859.quote: The world we see that seems so insane is the result of a belief system that is not working. To perceive the world differently, we must be willing to change our belief system, let the past slip away, expand our sense of now, and dissolve the fear in our minds.

10860.author: William James
10860.quote: If you want a quality, act as if you already had it.

10861.author: William James
10861.quote: This life is worth living, we can say, since it is what we make it.

10863.author: William James
10863.quote: There is but one cause of human failure. And that is man's lack of faith in his true Self.

10864.author: William James
10864.quote: To change ones life: Start immediately. Do it flamboyantly.

10865.author: William James
10865.quote: Is life worth living? It all depends on the liver.

10866.author: William James
10866.quote: The greatest use of a life is to spend it on something that will outlast it.

10867.author: William James
10867.quote: Many people think they are thinking when they are merely rearranging their prejudices.

10868.author: William James
10868.quote: The sway of alcohol over mankind is unquestionably due to its power to stimulate the mystical faculties of human nature, usually crushed to earth by the cold facts and dry criticisms of the sober hour.

10869.author: William Shakespeare
10869.quote: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.

10870.author: William Shakespeare
10870.quote: A fool thinks himself to be wise, but a wise man knows himself to be a fool.

10871.author: William Shakespeare
10871.quote: It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.

10872.author: William Shakespeare
10872.quote: No legacy is so rich as honesty.

10873.author: William Shakespeare
10873.quote: One touch of nature makes the whole world kin.

10874.author: William Shakespeare
10874.quote: We know what we are, but know not what we may be.

10875.author: William Shakespeare
10875.quote: If music be the food of love, play on.

10876.author: William Shakespeare
10876.quote: There is nothing either good or bad but thinking makes it so.

10877.author: William Shakespeare
10877.quote: Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them.

10878.author: William Shakespeare
10878.quote: Hell is empty and all the devils are here.

10879.author: William Shakespeare
10879.quote: Good night, good night! Parting is such sweet sorrow, that I shall say good night till it be morrow.

10880.author: William Shakespeare
10880.quote: The course of true love never did run smooth.

10881.author: William Shakespeare
10881.quote: Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind.

10882.author: William Shakespeare
10882.quote: Cowards die many times before their deaths; the valiant never taste of death but once.

10883.author: William Shakespeare
10883.quote: Listen to many, speak to a few.

10884.author: William Shakespeare
10884.quote: Doubt thou the stars are fire, Doubt that the sun doth move. Doubt truth to be a liar, But never doubt I love.

10885.author: William Shakespeare
10885.quote: What's in a name? That which we call a rose by any other name would smell as sweet.

10886.author: William Shakespeare
10886.quote: Love is a smoke made with the fume of sighs.

10887.author: William Shakespeare
10887.quote: There is no darkness but ignorance.

10888.author: William Shakespeare
10888.quote: How far that little candle throws its beams! So shines a good deed in a naughty world.

10889.author: William Shakespeare
10889.quote: Better three hours too soon than a minute too late.

10890.author: William Shakespeare
10890.quote: Now is the winter of our discontent.

10891.author: William Shakespeare
10891.quote: The very substance of the ambitious is merely the shadow of a dream.

10892.author: William Shakespeare
10892.quote: Our peace shall stand as firm as rocky mountains.

10893.author: William Shakespeare
10893.quote: This above all; to thine own self be true.

10894.author: William Shakespeare
10894.quote: All the world's a stage, and all the men and women merely players: they have their exits and their entrances; and one man in his time plays many parts, his acts being seven ages.

10895.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10895.quote: War is cruelty. There is no use trying to reform it. The crueler it is, the sooner it will be over.

10896.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10896.quote: I am tired and sick of war. Its glory is all moonshine. It is only those who have neither fired a shot nor heard the shrieks and groans of the wounded who cry aloud for blood, for vengeance, for desolation. War is hell.

10897.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10897.quote: I make up my opinions from facts and reasoning, and not to suit any body but myself. If people don't like my opinions, it makes little difference as I don't solicit their opinions or votes.

10898.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10898.quote: If I had my choice I would kill every reporter in the world, but I am sure we would be getting reports from Hell before breakfast.

10899.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10899.quote: My aim, then, was to whip the rebels, to humble their pride, to follow them to their inmost recesses, and make them fear and dread us. Fear is the beginning of wisdom.

10900.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10900.quote: War is the remedy that our enemies have chosen, and I say let us give them all they want.

10901.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10901.quote: An Army is a collection of armed men obliged to obey one man. Every change in the rules which impairs the principle weakens the army.

10902.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10902.quote: Courage - a perfect sensibility of the measure of danger, and a mental willingness to endure it.

10903.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10903.quote: I intend to make Georgia howl.

10904.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10904.quote: Grant stood by me when I was crazy, and I stood by him when he was drunk, and now we stand by each other.

10905.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10905.quote: If the people raise a great howl against my barbarity and cruelty, I will answer that war is war, and not popularity seeking.

10906.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10906.quote: I think I understand what military fame is; to be killed on the field of battle and have your name misspelled in the newspapers.

10907.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10907.quote: If forced to choose between the penitentiary and the White House for four years, I would say the penitentiary, thank you.

10908.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10908.quote: I beg to present you as a Christmas gift the city of Savannah.

10909.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10909.quote: There will soon come an armed contest between capital and labor. They will oppose each other, not with words and arguments, but with shot and shell, gun-powder and cannon. The better classes are tired of the insane howling of the lower strata and they mean to stop them.

10910.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10910.quote: This war differs from other wars, in this particular. We are not fighting armies but a hostile people, and must make old and young, rich and poor, feel the hard hand of war.

10911.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10911.quote: In our Country... one class of men makes war and leaves another to fight it out.

10912.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10912.quote: A battery of field artillery is worth a thousand muskets.

10913.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10913.quote: You may as well say, 'That's a valiant flea that dare eat his breakfast on the lip of a lion.

10914.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10914.quote: The scenes on this field would have cured anybody of war.

10915.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10915.quote: I will accept no commission that would tend to create a rivalry with Grant. I want him to hold what he has earned and got. I have all the rank I want.

10916.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10916.quote: I would make this war as severe as possible, and show no symptoms of tiring till the South begs for mercy.

10917.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10917.quote: There's many a boy here today who looks on war as all glory but it is all hell.

10918.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10918.quote: It is only those who have neither fired a shot nor heard the shrieks and groans of the wounded who cry aloud for blood, more vengeance, more desolation. War is hell.

10919.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10919.quote: If nominated, I will not run; if elected, I will not serve.

10920.author: William Tecumseh Sherman
10920.quote: He belonged to that army known as invincible in peace, invisible in war.

10921.author: William Wordsworth
10921.quote: The flower that smells the sweetest is shy and lowly.

10922.author: William Wordsworth
10922.quote: Come forth into the light of things, let nature be your teacher.

10923.author: William Wordsworth
10923.quote: The ocean is a mighty harmonist.

10924.author: William Wordsworth
10924.quote: Fill your paper with the breathings of your heart.

10925.author: William Wordsworth
10925.quote: What is pride? A rocket that emulates the stars.

10926.author: William Wordsworth
10926.quote: That though the radiance which was once so bright be now forever taken from my sight. Though nothing can bring back the hour of splendor in the grass, glory in the flower. We will grieve not, rather find strength in what remains behind.

10927.author: William Wordsworth
10927.quote: Nature never did betray the heart that loved her.

10928.author: William Wordsworth
10928.quote: The best portion of a good man's life is his little, nameless, unremembered acts of kindness and of love.

10930.author: William Wordsworth
10930.quote: With an eye made quiet by the power of harmony, and the deep power of joy, we see into the life of things.

10931.author: William Wordsworth
10931.quote: Poetry is the spontaneous overflow of powerful feelings: it takes its origin from emotion recollected in tranquility.

10932.author: William Wordsworth
10932.quote: I listened, motionless and still; And, as I mounted up the hill, The music in my heart I bore, Long after it was heard no more.

10933.author: William Wordsworth
10933.quote: That best portion of a man's life, his little, nameless, unremembered acts of kindness and love.

10934.author: William Wordsworth
10934.quote: What we need is not the will to believe, but the wish to find out.

10936.author: William Wordsworth
10936.quote: How does the Meadow flower its bloom unfold? Because the lovely little flower is free down to its root, and in that freedom bold.

10937.author: William Wordsworth
10937.quote: Life is divided into three terms - that which was, which is, and which will be. Let us learn from the past to profit by the present, and from the present, to live better in the future.

10938.author: William Wordsworth
10938.quote: Golf is a day spent in a round of strenuous idleness.

10939.author: William Wordsworth
10939.quote: To me the meanest flower that blows can give thoughts that do often lie too deep for tears.

10940.author: William Wordsworth
10940.quote: The child is father of the man.

10941.author: William Wordsworth
10941.quote: Not without hope we suffer and we mourn.

10942.author: William Wordsworth
10942.quote: Wisdom is oftentimes nearer when we stoop than when we soar.

10943.author: William Wordsworth
10943.quote: When from our better selves we have too long been parted by the hurrying world, and droop. Sick of its business, of its pleasures tired, how gracious, how benign is solitude.

10944.author: William Wordsworth
10944.quote: One impulse from a vernal wood May teach you more of man, Of moral evil and of good, Than all the sages can.

10945.author: William Wordsworth
10945.quote: Suffering is permanent, obscure and dark, And shares the nature of infinity.

10946.author: William Wordsworth
10946.quote: For I have learned to look on nature, not as in the hour of thoughtless youth, but hearing oftentimes the still, sad music of humanity.

10947.author: Willie Nelson
10947.quote: Once you replace negative thoughts with positive ones, you'll start having positive results.

10948.author: Willie Nelson
10948.quote: When I started counting my blessings, my whole life turned around.

10949.author: Willie Nelson
10949.quote: Anybody can be unhappy. We can all be hurt. You don't have to be poor to need something or somebody. Rednecks, hippies, misfits - we're all the same. Gay or straight? So what? It doesn't matter to me. We have to be concerned about other people, regardless.

10950.author: Willie Nelson
10950.quote: I believe that all roads lead to the same place - and that is wherever all roads lead to.

10951.author: Willie Nelson
10951.quote: Cruelty is all out of ignorance. If you knew what was in store for you, you wouldn't hurt anybody, because whatever you do comes back much more forceful than you send it out.

10952.author: Willie Nelson
10952.quote: A lot of country music is sad. I think most art comes out of poverty and hard times. It applies to music. Three chords and the truth - that's what a country song is. There is a lot of heartache in the world.

10953.author: Willie Nelson
10953.quote: I been a long time leaving but I'm going to be a long time gone.

10954.author: Willie Nelson
10954.quote: Don't try to change anybody. And they should let you be yourself, 'You loved me when you met me, so let's keep going!'

10955.author: Willie Nelson
10955.quote: We create our own unhappiness. The purpose of suffering is to help us understand we are the ones who cause it.

10956.author: Willie Nelson
10956.quote: I think people need to be educated to the fact that marijuana is not a drug. Marijuana is an herb and a flower. God put it here. If He put it here and He wants it to grow, what gives the government the right to say that God is wrong?

10957.author: Willie Nelson
10957.quote: I am not a pig farmer. The pigs had a great time, but I didn't make any money.

10958.author: Willie Nelson
10958.quote: If you really want to get along with somebody, let them be themselves.

10959.author: Willie Nelson
10959.quote: I'm from Texas, and one of the reasons I like Texas is because there's no one in control.

10960.author: Willie Nelson
10960.quote: When you're singing, you're using extra muscles, and it requires a lot of exercise and breathing. You can't do that if you're a sissy. If I have any fitness advice for people, I'd tell them to sing more. It's good therapy, too.

10961.author: Willie Nelson
10961.quote: You want to be a good parent and you want to be a friend, and it's hard to be both. You have to balance it as well as you can.

10962.author: Willie Nelson
10962.quote: I was influenced a lot by those around me - there was a lot of singing that went on in the cotton fields.

10963.author: Willie Nelson
10963.quote: Ninety-nine percent of the world's lovers are not with their first choice. That's what makes the jukebox play.

10964.author: Willie Nelson
10964.quote: There are only so many notes so there must be only so many melodies.

10965.author: Willie Nelson
10965.quote: You know why divorces are so expensive? They're worth it.

10966.author: Willie Nelson
10966.quote: Three chords and the truth - that's what a country song is.

10967.author: Willie Nelson
10967.quote: I used to work in the cotton fields a lot when I was young. There were a lot of African Americans working out there. A lot of Mexicans - the blacks and the whites and the Mexicans, all out there singing, and it was like an opera in the cotton fields, and I can still hear it in the music that I write and play today.

10968.author: Willie Nelson
10968.quote: I grew up across the street from, you know, the Villarias, which was a great Mexican family there. In fact, there was three houses right across the street from me. So, day and night, I listened to Mexican music, and I'm sure, you know, my guitar playing, singing, writing, whatever, has a lot of Mexican flavor there, but it comes natural.

10969.author: Willie Nelson
10969.quote: I text and email my friends and family a lot, but that's about the extent of my high-tech-etude.

10970.author: Willie Nelson
10970.quote: I just enjoy both working and not working.

10971.author: Willie Nelson
10971.quote: Well the country songs themselves are three-chord stories, ballads which are mostly sad. If you are already feeling sorry for yourself when you listen to them they will take you to an even sadder place.

10972.author: Willie Nelson
10972.quote: Freedom is control in your own life. I have more control now than in the past, and I'm learning the value of saying no. That's very important.

10973.author: Winston Churchill
10973.quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.

10974.author: Winston Churchill
10974.quote: Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference.

10975.author: Winston Churchill
10975.quote: If you're going through hell, keep going.

10976.author: Winston Churchill
10976.quote: I may be drunk, Miss, but in the morning I will be sober and you will still be ugly.

10978.author: Winston Churchill
10978.quote: Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.

10979.author: Winston Churchill
10979.quote: The best argument against democracy is a five-minute conversation with the average voter.

10980.author: Winston Churchill
10980.quote: My most brilliant achievement was my ability to be able to persuade my wife to marry me.

10981.author: Winston Churchill
10981.quote: We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.

10982.author: Winston Churchill
10982.quote: Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.

10983.author: Winston Churchill
10983.quote: Kites rise highest against the wind - not with it.

10984.author: Winston Churchill
10984.quote: The price of greatness is responsibility.

10985.author: Winston Churchill
10985.quote: The truth is incontrovertible. Malice may attack it, ignorance may deride it, but in the end, there it is.

10986.author: Winston Churchill
10986.quote: We shape our buildings; thereafter they shape us.

10987.author: Winston Churchill
10987.quote: All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.

10988.author: Winston Churchill
10988.quote: Christmas is a season not only of rejoicing but of reflection.

10989.author: Winston Churchill
10989.quote: Socialism is a philosophy of failure, the creed of ignorance, and the gospel of envy, its inherent virtue is the equal sharing of misery.

10990.author: Winston Churchill
10990.quote: This is no time for ease and comfort. It is time to dare and endure.

10991.author: Winston Churchill
10991.quote: You have enemies? Good. That means you've stood up for something, sometime in your life.

10992.author: Winston Churchill
10992.quote: The inherent vice of capitalism is the unequal sharing of blessings; the inherent virtue of socialism is the equal sharing of miseries.

10993.author: Winston Churchill
10993.quote: The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.

10994.author: Winston Churchill
10994.quote: Without tradition, art is a flock of sheep without a shepherd. Without innovation, it is a corpse.

10995.author: Winston Churchill
10995.quote: I am fond of pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals.

10996.author: Winston Churchill
10996.quote: Criticism may not be agreeable, but it is necessary. It fulfils the same function as pain in the human body. It calls attention to an unhealthy state of things.

10997.author: Winston Churchill
10997.quote: It is no use saying, 'We are doing our best.' You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary.

10998.author: Winston Churchill
10998.quote: Russia is a riddle wrapped in a mystery inside an enigma.

10999.author: Woodrow Wilson
10999.quote: You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.

11000.author: Woodrow Wilson
11000.quote: The man who is swimming against the stream knows the strength of it.

11001.author: Woodrow Wilson
11001.quote: The ear of the leader must ring with the voices of the people.

11002.author: Woodrow Wilson
11002.quote: There is no higher religion than human service. To work for the common good is the greatest creed.

11003.author: Woodrow Wilson
11003.quote: The only use of an obstacle is to be overcome. All that an obstacle does with brave men is, not to frighten them, but to challenge them.

11004.author: Woodrow Wilson
11004.quote: The world must be made safe for democracy. Its peace must be planted upon the tested foundations of political liberty.

11005.author: Woodrow Wilson
11005.quote: In the Lord's Prayer, the first petition is for daily bread. No one can worship God or love his neighbor on an empty stomach.

11006.author: Woodrow Wilson
11006.quote: I not only use all the brains that I have, but all that I can borrow.

11007.author: Woodrow Wilson
11007.quote: If a dog will not come to you after having looked you in the face, you should go home and examine your conscience.

11008.author: Woodrow Wilson
11008.quote: Neutrality is a negative word. It does not express what America ought to feel. We are not trying to keep out of trouble; we are trying to preserve the foundations on which peace may be rebuilt.

11009.author: Woodrow Wilson
11009.quote: The history of liberty is a history of resistance.

11010.author: Woodrow Wilson
11010.quote: Interest does not tie nations together; it sometimes separates them. But sympathy and understanding does unite them.

11011.author: Woodrow Wilson
11011.quote: There is little for the great part of the history of the world except the bitter tears of pity and the hot tears of wrath.

11012.author: Woodrow Wilson
11012.quote: If you want to make enemies, try to change something.

11013.author: Woodrow Wilson
11013.quote: Democracy is not so much a form of government as a set of principles.

11014.author: Woodrow Wilson
11014.quote: Never attempt to murder a man who is committing suicide.

11015.author: Woodrow Wilson
11015.quote: A conservative is someone who makes no changes and consults his grandmother when in doubt.

11016.author: Woodrow Wilson
11016.quote: I have long enjoyed the friendship and companionship of Republicans because I am by instinct a teacher, and I would like to teach them something.

11017.author: Woodrow Wilson
11017.quote: By 'radical,' I understand one who goes too far; by 'conservative', one who does not go far enough; by 'reactionary', one who won't go at all.

11018.author: Woodrow Wilson
11018.quote: The government, which was designed for the people, has got into the hands of the bosses and their employers, the special interests. An invisible empire has been set up above the forms of democracy.

11019.author: Woodrow Wilson
11019.quote: You cannot, in human experience, rush into the light. You have to go through the twilight into the broadening day before the noon comes and the full sun is upon the landscape.

11020.author: Woodrow Wilson
11020.quote: The method of political science is the interpretation of life; its instrument is insight, a nice understanding of subtle, unformulated conditions.

11021.author: Woodrow Wilson
11021.quote: Prosperity is necessarily the first theme of a political campaign.

11022.author: Woodrow Wilson
11022.quote: I would rather belong to a poor nation that was free than to a rich nation that had ceased to be in love with liberty.

11023.author: Woodrow Wilson
11023.quote: Politics I conceive to be nothing more than the science of the ordered progress of society along the lines of greatest usefulness and convenience to itself.

11024.author: Woodrow Wilson
11024.quote: Liberty has never come from Government. Liberty has always come from the subjects of it. The history of liberty is a history of limitations of governmental power, not the increase of it.

11025.author: Woody Allen
11025.quote: Life is full of misery, loneliness, and suffering - and it's all over much too soon.

11026.author: Woody Allen
11026.quote: I am thankful for laughter, except when milk comes out of my nose.

11027.author: Woody Allen
11027.quote: Tradition is the illusion of permanance.

11028.author: Woody Allen
11028.quote: Eighty percent of success is showing up.

11029.author: Woody Allen
11029.quote: My one regret in life is that I am not someone else.

11030.author: Woody Allen
11030.quote: What if nothing exists and we're all in somebody's dream?

11031.author: Woody Allen
11031.quote: Bisexuality immediately doubles your chances for a date on Saturday night.

11032.author: Woody Allen
11032.quote: Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.

11033.author: Woody Allen
11033.quote: It seemed the world was divided into good and bad people. The good ones slept better while the bad ones seemed to enjoy the waking hours much more.

11034.author: Woody Allen
11034.quote: Seventy percent of success in life is showing up.

11035.author: Woody Allen
11035.quote: To you I'm an atheist; to God, I'm the Loyal Opposition.

11036.author: Woody Allen
11036.quote: There are worse things in life than death. Have you ever spent an evening with an insurance salesman?

11037.author: Woody Allen
11037.quote: In my house I'm the boss, my wife is just the decision maker.

11038.author: Woody Allen
11038.quote: You can live to be a hundred if you give up all the things that make you want to live to be a hundred.

11039.author: Woody Allen
11039.quote: I'm not afraid to die, I just don't want to be there when it happens.

11040.author: Woody Allen
11040.quote: I failed to make the chess team because of my height.

11041.author: Woody Allen
11041.quote: I believe there is something out there watching us. Unfortunately, it's the government.

11042.author: Woody Allen
11042.quote: His lack of education is more than compensated for by his keenly developed moral bankruptcy.

11043.author: Woody Allen
11043.quote: In California, they don't throw their garbage away - they make it into TV shows.

11044.author: Woody Allen
11044.quote: The talent for being happy is appreciating and liking what you have, instead of what you don't have.

11045.author: Woody Allen
11045.quote: If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans.

11046.author: Woody Allen
11046.quote: Comedy just pokes at problems, rarely confronts them squarely. Drama is like a plate of meat and potatoes, comedy is rather the dessert, a bit like meringue.

11047.author: Woody Allen
11047.quote: I don't think my parents liked me. They put a live teddy bear in my crib.

11048.author: Woody Allen
11048.quote: In Beverly Hills... they don't throw their garbage away. They make it into television shows.

11049.author: Woody Allen
11049.quote: I ran into Isosceles. He had a great idea for a new triangle!

11050.author: Woody Allen
11050.quote: Eternal nothingness is fine if you happen to be dressed for it.

11051.author: Yayoi Kusama
11051.quote: I think I will be able to, in the end, rise above the clouds and climb the stairs to Heaven, and I will look down on my beautiful life.

11052.author: Yayoi Kusama
11052.quote: With just one polka dot, nothing can be achieved. In the universe, there is the sun, the moon, the earth, and hundreds of millions of stars. All of us live in the unfathomable mystery and infinitude of the universe. Pursuing 'philosophy of the universe' through art under such circumstances has led me to what I call 'stereotypical repetition.'

11053.author: Yayoi Kusama
11053.quote: Forget yourself. Become one with eternity. Become part of your environment.

11054.author: Yayoi Kusama
11054.quote: I hope royalty continues forever. This is the thing that can contribute to peace throughout the world.

11055.author: Yayoi Kusama
11055.quote: It doesn't matter at all for me that I work in hospital or anywhere with limited space. Every day, I'm creating new works with all my might.

11056.author: Yayoi Kusama
11056.quote: Polka dots can't stay alone. When we obliterate nature and our bodies with polka dots, we become part of the unity of our environments.

11057.author: Yayoi Kusama
11057.quote: Since my childhood, I have always made works with polka dots. Earth, moon, sun and human beings all represent dots; a single particle among billions.

11058.author: Yayoi Kusama
11058.quote: More and more, I think about the role of the arts, and as an artist, I think that it's important that I share the love and peace.

11059.author: Yayoi Kusama
11059.quote: I wanted to start a revolution, using art to build the sort of society I myself envisioned.

11060.author: Yayoi Kusama
11060.quote: I love painting so much that nothing else matters.

11061.author: Yayoi Kusama
11061.quote: I love Damien Hirst. I respect his work a great deal, and I am happy that the polka dots I started using have become a symbol of love and peace around the world with everybody joining hands to use them in this way.

11062.author: Yayoi Kusama
11062.quote: I have a flood of ideas in my mind. I just follow my vision.

11063.author: Yayoi Kusama
11063.quote: My art originates from hallucinations only I can see. I translate the hallucinations and obsessional images that plague me into sculptures and paintings.

11064.author: Yayoi Kusama
11064.quote: I would like to try harder to establish my thought and philosophy strongly and to go back to the universe with my love.

11065.author: Yayoi Kusama
11065.quote: I believe that eyes are very important motifs. That's something that can discern the peace and love.

11066.author: Yayoi Kusama
11066.quote: I, Kusama, am the modern Alice in Wonderland.

11067.author: Yayoi Kusama
11067.quote: If there's a cat, I obliterate it by putting polka dot stickers on it. I obliterate a horse by putting polka dot stickers on it. And I obliterated myself by putting the same polka dot stickers on myself.

11068.author: Yayoi Kusama
11068.quote: When I was a child, I used to paint intently. The older I become, and the closer death approaches, the brighter my life gets day by day.

11069.author: Yayoi Kusama
11069.quote: I have done all the work myself, not assistants. That's why I'm in a wheelchair: I've been doing it physically - it's hard labour - throughout my life.

11070.author: Yayoi Kusama
11070.quote: My mother was against me being an artist. She just wanted me to marry a rich man.

11071.author: Yayoi Kusama
11071.quote: I want to become more famous, even more famous.

11072.author: Yayoi Kusama
11072.quote: Suppose I put polka dots all over my body and then cover my background completely with polka dots. The polka dots on my body, merging with those in the background, create an optically strange scene.

11073.author: Yayoi Kusama
11073.quote: I am putting every effort toward creating my works from morning till night on every single day.

11075.author: Yayoi Kusama
11075.quote: Certainly, I devote my energy to both telling my personal life story and seeking self- obliteration. However, I will not destroy myself through art.

11076.author: Yayoi Kusama
11076.quote: I never have a plan of what I am going to draw.

11077.author: Yogi Berra
11077.quote: You better cut the pizza in four pieces because I'm not hungry enough to eat six.

11078.author: Yogi Berra
11078.quote: If you don't know where you are going, you might wind up someplace else.

11079.author: Yogi Berra
11079.quote: Love is the most important thing in the world, but baseball is pretty good, too.

11080.author: Yogi Berra
11080.quote: If you come to a fork in the road, take it.

11081.author: Yogi Berra
11081.quote: The future ain't what it used to be.

11082.author: Yogi Berra
11082.quote: Baseball is ninety percent mental and the other half is physical.

11083.author: Yogi Berra
11083.quote: I wish I had an answer to that because I'm tired of answering that question.

11084.author: Yogi Berra
11084.quote: You wouldn't have won if we'd beaten you.

11085.author: Yogi Berra
11085.quote: I enjoy now doing what I do... playing golf, relaxing a little, enjoying life.

11086.author: Yogi Berra
11086.quote: So I'm ugly. So what? I never saw anyone hit with his face.

11087.author: Yogi Berra
11087.quote: Little League baseball is a very good thing because it keeps the parents off the streets.

11088.author: Yogi Berra
11088.quote: It's like deja-vu, all over again.

11089.author: Yogi Berra
11089.quote: I never figured I'd go into the Hall of Fame. A kid from the Hill.

11090.author: Yogi Berra
11090.quote: In theory there is no difference between theory and practice. In practice there is.

11091.author: Yogi Berra
11091.quote: It ain't over till it's over.

11092.author: Yogi Berra
11092.quote: Congratulations. I knew the record would stand until it was broken.

11093.author: Yogi Berra
11093.quote: You can observe a lot by just watching.

11094.author: Yogi Berra
11094.quote: You don't have to swing hard to hit a home run. If you got the timing, it'll go.

11095.author: Yogi Berra
11095.quote: You can observe a lot by watching.

11096.author: Yogi Berra
11096.quote: I'm glad I was in the Navy.

11097.author: Yogi Berra
11097.quote: Half the lies they tell about me aren't true.

11098.author: Yogi Berra
11098.quote: When you come to a fork in the road, take it.

11099.author: Yogi Berra
11099.quote: Baseball is 90 percent mental and the other half is physical.

11100.author: Yogi Berra
11100.quote: There are some people who, if they don't already know, you can't tell 'em.

11101.author: Yogi Berra
11101.quote: Nobody goes there anymore. It's too crowded.

11102.author: Yogi Berra
11102.quote: If the world were perfect, it wouldn't be.

11103.author: Yoko Ono
11103.quote: Smile in the mirror. Do that every morning and you'll start to see a big difference in your life.

11104.author: Yoko Ono
11104.quote: A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.

11105.author: Yoko Ono
11105.quote: I realized that if my thoughts immediately affect my body, I should be careful about what I think. Now if I get angry, I ask myself why I feel that way. If I can find the source of my anger, I can turn that negative energy into something positive.

11106.author: Yoko Ono
11106.quote: Every moment in our lives is a miracle we should enjoy instead of ignoring.

11107.author: Yoko Ono
11107.quote: The regret of my life is that I have not said 'I love you' often enough.

11109.author: Yoko Ono
11109.quote: The sky is always there for me, while my life has been going through many, many changes. When I look up the sky, it gives me a nice feeling, like looking at an old friend.

11110.author: Yoko Ono
11110.quote: You change the world by being yourself.

11111.author: Yoko Ono
11111.quote: Healing yourself is connected with healing others.

11112.author: Yoko Ono
11112.quote: When you go through a negative situation, don't think about it. Make it positive.

11113.author: Yoko Ono
11113.quote: Sometimes I am happy and sometimes not. I am, after all, a human being, you know. And I am glad that we are sometimes happy and sometimes not. You get your wisdom working by having different emotions.

11114.author: Yoko Ono
11114.quote: Every drop in the ocean counts.

11115.author: Yoko Ono
11115.quote: Experiencing sadness and anger can make you feel more creative, and by being creative, you can get beyond your pain or negativity.

11116.author: Yoko Ono
11116.quote: Nobody's life is a bed of roses. We all have crosses to bear, and we all just do our best. I would never claim to have the worst situation. There are many widows, and many people dying of AIDS, many people killed in Lebanon, people starving all over the planet. So we have to count our lucky stars.

11117.author: Yoko Ono
11117.quote: You can be very wild and still be very wise.

11118.author: Yoko Ono
11118.quote: This society is driven by neurotic speed and force accelerated by greed and frustration of not being able to live up to the image of men and woman we have created for ourselves; the image has nothing to do with the reality of people.

11119.author: Yoko Ono
11119.quote: The human race is a very, very magical race. We have a magic power of witches and wizards. We're here on this earth to unravel the mystery of this planet. The planet is asking for it.

11120.author: Yoko Ono
11120.quote: There's a long life ahead of you and it's going to be beautiful, as long as you keep loving and hugging each other.

11121.author: Yoko Ono
11121.quote: I'm very thankful that I can make people happy just by signing my name.

11122.author: Yoko Ono
11122.quote: Words are power. And a book is full of words. Be careful what power you get from it. But know that you do.

11123.author: Yoko Ono
11123.quote: If you have too many quotes from other people in your head, you can't create. You have to keep your head empty. That's why I am constantly enjoying the sky, the park, the walk.

11124.author: Yoko Ono
11124.quote: Energy is so important. If you don't have it, don't bother with rock and roll.

11125.author: Yoko Ono
11125.quote: People just love to be entertained, and in order to entertain them, you have to do things in a way that they understand.

11126.author: Yoko Ono
11126.quote: Women are very intelligent and not appreciated. We try to pretend that we are not clever, and it's such a pity that we can't show how clever we are.

11127.author: Yoko Ono
11127.quote: DJs are in incredible competition, musically. And they are the most musically creative and sensitive people in all the music charts. I am amazed how they are.

11128.author: Yoko Ono
11128.quote: A lot of things have been thrown at me in life, and I've got through it all without a rule book, taking it one day at a time.

11129.author: Young Thug
11129.quote: We need money. We need hits. Hits bring money, money bring power, power bring fame, fame change the game.

11130.author: Young Thug
11130.quote: When it comes to swag, there's no gender involved.

11131.author: Young Thug
11131.quote: In my world, of course, it don't matter. You could be a gangster with a dress, you could be a gangster with baggy pants.

11132.author: Young Thug
11132.quote: When I was 12, my feet were so small, I wore my sisters' glitter shoes. My dad would whoop me: 'You're not going to school now, you'll embarrass us!'

11134.author: Young Thug
11134.quote: I hope to be like Bill Gates, bro. With all the money in the world.

11135.author: Young Thug
11135.quote: I don't do my own Instagram.

11136.author: Young Thug
11136.quote: I feel like the phone was in my way. So I got rid of the phone to focus.

11137.author: Young Thug
11137.quote: When I was in high school, I had a gambling problem.

11138.author: Young Thug
11138.quote: The reason why I moved from Young Thug to Jeffery was because I felt like I did a wrong turn.

11139.author: Young Thug
11139.quote: It's dangerous to be anybody popular.

11140.author: Young Thug
11140.quote: I was in the streets at eight, nine years old.

11141.author: Young Thug
11141.quote: He's so sophisticated... Kanye is like 'Fifty Shades of Grey,' he's interesting, so you want to be around him.

11142.author: Young Thug
11142.quote: Fabo is a real rock star, but people look over it, so I'll try to bring it to the light if I can.

11143.author: Young Thug
11143.quote: I ain't just collab-ing with anybody. Because I don't care about making friends. I got enough friends.

11144.author: Young Thug
11144.quote: I don't want to rap forever. But I want to be rich forever.

11145.author: Young Thug
11145.quote: I ain't want my kids to grow up and call me Thug. I don't want anybody to kind of look at me like that. So I'm gonna just use my real name.

11146.author: Young Thug
11146.quote: Anyone can rap if you've got brains. So I just went with it.

11147.author: Young Thug
11147.quote: Atlanta is the number one place to live. You live better, you eat better, the rides are better, vehicles is better deals. It's better people. More mean people, but at my level you want it to be about business, so it's perfect for me.

11148.author: Young Thug
11148.quote: I'm the type of person to put myself in everybody else's shoes.

11149.author: Young Thug
11149.quote: You gotta understand, you can't look at no pictures and look at the media and the critics and what they saying on no Internet.

11150.author: Young Thug
11150.quote: Ninety percent of my clothes are women's.

11151.author: Young Thug
11151.quote: I stayed in the ghetto. Then I stayed in condos, then I stayed in penthouses, and then I stayed in mansions.

11152.author: Young Thug
11152.quote: I only listen to Lil Wayne.

11153.author: Young Thug
11153.quote: I've got a condo in Miami, but I don't live in it.

11154.author: Young Thug
11154.quote: If you feel that you can just come in the studio and freestyle on my song, then I'm ready to rap battle you. That's just how I feel about it because I know I'm way harder than another rapper freestyling on my song.

11155.author: Zig Ziglar
11155.quote: Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.

11156.author: Zig Ziglar
11156.quote: Be grateful for what you have and stop complaining - it bores everybody else, does you no good, and doesn't solve any problems.

11157.author: Zig Ziglar
11157.quote: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.

11158.author: Zig Ziglar
11158.quote: You were born to win, but to be a winner, you must plan to win, prepare to win, and expect to win.

11159.author: Zig Ziglar
11159.quote: Try to look at your weakness and convert it into your strength. That's success.

11160.author: Zig Ziglar
11160.quote: The foundation stones for a balanced success are honesty, character, integrity, faith, love and loyalty.

11161.author: Zig Ziglar
11161.quote: With integrity, you have nothing to fear, since you have nothing to hide. With integrity, you will do the right thing, so you will have no guilt.

11162.author: Zig Ziglar
11162.quote: Positive thinking will let you do everything better than negative thinking will.

11163.author: Zig Ziglar
11163.quote: Gratitude is the healthiest of all human emotions. The more you express gratitude for what you have, the more likely you will have even more to express gratitude for.

11164.author: Zig Ziglar
11164.quote: When you catch a glimpse of your potential, that's when passion is born.

11165.author: Zig Ziglar
11165.quote: People often say that motivation doesn't last. Well, neither does bathing - that's why we recommend it daily.

11166.author: Zig Ziglar
11166.quote: You were designed for accomplishment, engineered for success, and endowed with the seeds of greatness.

11167.author: Zig Ziglar
11167.quote: Honesty and integrity are by far the most important assets of an entrepreneur.

11168.author: Zig Ziglar
11168.quote: If you don't see yourself as a winner, then you cannot perform as a winner.

11169.author: Zig Ziglar
11169.quote: Take time to be kind and to say 'thank you.'

11170.author: Zig Ziglar
11170.quote: Positive thinking will let you use the ability which you have, and that is awesome.

11171.author: Zig Ziglar
11171.quote: Many people spend more time in planning the wedding than they do in planning the marriage.

11172.author: Zig Ziglar
11172.quote: Outstanding people have one thing in common: An absolute sense of mission.

11173.author: Zig Ziglar
11173.quote: When you encourage others, you in the process are encouraged because you're making a commitment and difference in that person's life. Encouragement really does make a difference.

11174.author: Zig Ziglar
11174.quote: It is true that integrity alone won't make you a leader, but without integrity you will never be one.

11175.author: Zig Ziglar
11175.quote: It's not the situation, but whether we react negative or respond positive to the situation that is important.

11176.author: Zig Ziglar
11176.quote: Yesterday ended last night. Today is a brand-new day.

11177.author: Zig Ziglar
11177.quote: You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.

11178.author: Zig Ziglar
11178.quote: The first step in solving a problem is to recognize that it does exist.

11179.author: Zig Ziglar
11179.quote: You cannot climb the ladder of success dressed in the costume of failure.

11180.author: Zig Ziglar
11180.quote: Isn't it amazing how much stuff we get done the day before vacation?

11181.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11181.quote: Research is formalized curiosity. It is poking and prying with a purpose.

11182.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11182.quote: Trees and plants always look like the people they live with, somehow.

11183.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11183.quote: Sometimes, I feel discriminated against, but it does not make me angry. It merely astonishes me. How can any deny themselves the pleasure of my company? It's beyond me.

11184.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11184.quote: The present was an egg laid by the past that had the future inside its shell.

11185.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11185.quote: No matter how far a person can go the horizon is still way beyond you.

11186.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11186.quote: A thing is mighty big when time and distance cannot shrink it.

11187.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11187.quote: Grab the broom of anger and drive off the beast of fear.

11188.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11188.quote: Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.

11189.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11189.quote: There are years that ask questions and years that answer.

11190.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11190.quote: Those that don't got it, can't show it. Those that got it, can't hide it.

11191.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11191.quote: It's no use of talking unless people understand what you say.

11192.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11192.quote: If you want that good feeling that comes from doing things for other folks then you have to pay for it in abuse and misunderstanding.

11193.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11193.quote: I do not weep at the world I am too busy sharpening my oyster knife.

11194.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11194.quote: I regret all of my books.

11195.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11195.quote: Anybody depending on somebody else's gods is depending on a fox not to eat chickens.

11196.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11196.quote: The man who interprets Nature is always held in great honor.

11197.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11197.quote: Ships at a distance have every man's wish on board.

11198.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11198.quote: I did not just fall in love. I made a parachute jump.

11199.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11199.quote: It would be against all nature for all the Negroes to be either at the bottom, top, or in between. We will go where the internal drive carries us like everybody else. It is up to the individual.

11200.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11200.quote: No man may make another free.

11201.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11201.quote: Love, I find, is like singing. Everybody can do enough to satisfy themselves, though it may not impress the neighbors as being very much.

11202.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11202.quote: So the brother in black offers to these United States the source of courage that endures, and laughter.

11203.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11203.quote: I have been in Sorrow's kitchen and licked out all the pots. Then I have stood on the peaky mountain wrapped in rainbows, with a harp and sword in my hands.

11204.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11204.quote: It is one of the blessings of this world that few people see visions and dream dreams.

11205.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11205.quote: Gods always behave like the people who make them.

11206.author: Zora Neale Hurston
11206.quote: Mama exhorted her children at every opportunity to 'jump at the sun.' We might not land on the sun, but at least we would get off the ground.
